reviews.author: Suzanne P.
reviews.description: Amber Ale is amazing! IPA is good.  Very friendly staff and customers.  Price is now $5 per pour - 16 oz pours. The place is very small and in a warehouse area, hard to find. Hope they make more stouts and porters. Great place to stop.

reviews.author: Teresa B.
reviews.description: We had heard about Bluebonnet for a while and finally decided to check them out on a Friday evening. We were shocked to find a packed house! The picnic tables outside are plentiful but were all full when we arrived. Luckily two guys let us join them. I had the Raspberry Berliner Weisse and it quickly became my new favorite. It is sweet and crisp without being overly sweet. Our friends both got the Cream Ale and loved it. We all walked out with growlers. Everyone there is super friendly and very welcoming. We had the baby with us which was fine (there were a few kids there)...but every time a car was exiting we would have to wrangle him down (minor downfall of basically sitting alongside the parking lot). We are looking forward to visiting again.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Nice little brewery in a warehouse. Seating is all outside in the parking lot. Regulars bring lawn chairs. Beer was okay. Food was meh. Plastic cups are a turn off. I'd stop in again if thirsty and in the area, but wouldn't go out of my way to get here...

reviews.author: Eric C.
reviews.description: Bluebonnet Beer Company is simply amazing. They are a little difficult to find, look for the side street behind the post office and you should notice it on the right.  Their beers are super delicious, I had the wit, pecan brown ale , cream ale and hef. Out of all of them, the cream ale and wit come highly recommended. They are so smooth and drinkable.  There is a schnitzel food trailer that serves some pretty decent food. The place is small but all of the employees I encountered were nice and friendly. For seating, there is only plastic benches avaliable located in the front of the brewery. Not really any kind  of shade or landacaping but this is expected since it is such a small brewery.  It may not have all of the amenities and backyard space that other larger breweries in Austin have. But if you love beer and want to interact with some awesome, friendly people then Bluebonnet Beer Company is the way to go. Everything is tasty and pints are currently at $5 each, you can't beat that price.

reviews.author: John R.
reviews.description: Good variety of tasty beers on tap, and they run true to form. We prefer a selection like this vs say five different IPAs. Good seasonal beers. Food truck on site. Decent seating for a smaller brewery. Lots of parking. The Tap Room is only open Thur-Saturday, so if we find ourselves on a Sunday beer drive, we have to pass.

reviews.author: Isabel R.
reviews.description: If there was a zero I would not give this establishment any stars. We go when it's raining and all tables are outside for the exception of the owners table that was inside. We asked if we could move our table in and was rejected instantly because "there was no room" (there was enough). Hospitality was at a negative and we were highly considering the beer mug club but the lost a customer and a loyaled customer.  Bluebonnet Brewery you all need to focus on customer Hospitality and not just your sales.

reviews.author: Sereena J.
reviews.description: Great little brewery in my hometown of Round Rock!  My family and I came here on a Friday around 6:30 to grab a few beers and relax. If it's cold outside, I highly recommend bringing a layer or two as there is only a bit of seating inside but about four picnic tables outside. Also, wait to grab dinner at the brewery as they have rotating food trucks Thursday-Saturdays. When we went, they had a lobster roll truck that served amazing rolls.   I started out with their Oktoberfest beer, which was very good! My mom, who is not a big beer drinker, got their shandy and thought it would be great for a hot day. The beers are $5 a pint, and I thought it was really cool they have a series related to the Immortal 10.   Parking is not a hassle, the beer is very good, the people are friendly, and your hardest job will be finding a seat. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Shannon B.
reviews.description: Hello there, Bluebonnet Beer Company! Delighted to make your acquaintance! I don't know why I am just now discovering this treasure trove of highest quality local craft brews, but I'm so glad I'm educated now. Brewmaster David Hulama and his partner Clare have something special going on here, and yes, dirty hippies, it's up in Wilco off a toll road - don't worry, you'll love it!  Opening up special to host a local running group for #globalrunningday? + 1 star Serving 10 different varieties of delicious beer for all palates and ABV levels? + 1 star Evening shade to cool the outdoor picnic table seating? +1 star Friendly and knowledgeable staff taking orders/payments and serving patrons? + 1 star Discounts for American Homebrewers Association members + 1 star  During my visit on a Wednesday evening for a special event, the available beers (from highest to lowest ABV) were: Immortal Ten Castellaw Quadrupel (10%) Immortal Ten Kelley Imperial Stout (10%) India Pale Ale (7%) American Amber Ale (6.5%) Vienna Lager (5.5%) Cream Ale (5.5%) Texas Pecan Brown (5.5%) Bluebonnet Wit (5.4%) German Pilsner American Amber Ale (5.3%) Texas Summer Blonde Ale (5.2%)  Other good stuff to know: + Pints are just $4. Flights (4x 6oz pours of your choice) $10. + Located just east of Cedar Ridge High School in an industrial park behind a post office. Waze knows the way. + Tap room generally open only Fri-Sat 5-8p, but check Twitter and FB for special events. + Rotating variety of food trucks usually parked during open hours + Single stall restroom is in the back, next to the small air-conditioned tasting room + Venue available for parties + Kegs available for purchase + Find their beers served at area restaurants and bars, including The Dig Pub, Cover 3 RR, Greenhouse Craft Food, and more.

reviews.author: Chad T.
reviews.description: This is the best beer in Texas!  I've been coming to Bluebonnet since 2103 and its amazing!

reviews.author: Alexis B.
reviews.description: We love blue bonnet. It's really the only brewery in the area and we are used to living in the domain where there are like a million options.   Beer is tasteful and I don't always love IPA. Their indoor seating is limited by this isn't normally a problem in Texas. They have plenty of tables outside and also have tents in the summer. No food but there is always a food truck - if you follow them on Facebook you can see what it is ahead of time.   Staff is always friendly and accommodating. Plenty of space for puppies here too.   They are only open Friday evenings and Saturday! I wish they had some openings on Sunday.

reviews.author: Doug K.
reviews.description: Try the Amber, pecan brown or Irish dry stout Fantastic beer. Great off track location.

reviews.author: Eric J.
reviews.description: Prior to coming here, had heard consistent HIGH positives on this place...  Firstly, Marga (aka the Beer Snob), and I checked out a Pale...and their Pale was Very Good...asked for a sample of their IPA,...and before even drinking it....getting the nose of the beer -- already knew that it was -- Spot On and the-way-it-should-be!  Their Cream Ale was a new beer idea to me...tried that and WOW, creamy and light...Very Good.  What a Great Place and Team!!!  Thank You soo Much!!!  Eric and Marga  p.s., when it finally gets a bit cooler, we will be by with Kodiak, "The WunderMutt"

reviews.author: Samuel B.
reviews.description: Middle of the road Brewery. Simple and plan. Nothing crazy. Probably following German Purity Laws. If you're looking for basic styles of beers here is your spot. The IPA is nice classic take. $4 all pints. Can't beat that

reviews.author: Jason M.
reviews.description: Great beer and great people. I only wish they had more seating. They have a loyal customer base which speaks to the way they treat there patrons but also means the little seating they have is always full. If this place would just expand, they could run the Round Rock beer scene!

reviews.author: Jay N.
reviews.description: This a Hidden event pastors please have a new brewery was there Oktoberfest was a good idea the Oktoberfest was fun Had a chance to experience great good different types of German beers and bratwursts it was a lot of fun for family and friends

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: I'm rating Blue Bonnet 3 stars because while we love their beer and have enjoyed it the very much during their Oktoberfest, we were pretty bummed when we went on a Saturday night. We know that they are popular and were even excited to try Jimmy Vega's Smokehouse but when we arrived half of the available tables were set as reserved. There was literally no where to sit. Every table was packed. We had our 3 yr old son with us, so standing wasn't an option, especially since we wanted to eat too. We asked anyway if any of the tables were available and was told no, they are all reserved for 5pm, but you could squeeze in anywhere else. In the end, we left irritated and disappointed, while I understand reserving tables, but when you only have 10 tables and you reserve 5 of them, that doesn't leave much room for anyone else.

reviews.author: Britt J.
reviews.description: Bluebonnet is a great craft brewery with an outstanding lineup of ales, seasonal lagers, and wheat beers. I really enjoyed the Vienna lager. The owners run a hands on, customer friendly business that is a real pleasure to visit. The perfect place to relax with friends and enjoy some really good beer!

reviews.author: Katie K.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed the beer here. My favorites were the Hefeweizen and the Summer Wit.   The guy at the counter was very friendly and went through a description of all the beers. Good place to get a flight to try multiple beers.  There was a food truck present, too. I didn't get any food, but maybe next time!

reviews.author: Melody B.
reviews.description: Beer is good. Great to sit outside and have conversation but the noise from the food truck generator made it hard to have hear.

reviews.author: Nicole G.
reviews.description: Locally owned family run business that has delicious beer. They always have at least 6-8 beers on tap and a couple seasonal favorites. They have a solid line up across a wide style of beers. The summer wit is a favorite along with the Kolsch styles they release during the fall. I would love to see them expand to a new location  with a climate controlled tasting room which I think would bring in a lot more clientele.

name: The Brass Tap - Round Rock
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Mandy W.
reviews.description: Staff is always nice and chill, food is great and there are so many beer and cocktail choices to choose from! I wouldn't say come starving here but for a snack and drink this place is perfect! They have inside and outside seating. Love that they have flights for beer, I am a picky beer drinker and love flights to try new types to see if I like the beer! They have live music and trivia nights check it out to see what days they have stuff to do.

reviews.author: Raven I.
reviews.description: What a great place in downtown Round Rock! We met a friend here for drinks late, and the wait staff was wonderful! I don't think I've ever been in a bar with such nice and professional staff. They have an epic beer selection. Though beer isn't my thing, the selection still impressed me! They helped me select a beer, as I said, beer isn't my thing. They were patient and actually found me an option to "get me through the night". I did move on to margaritas though, and were these delicious! So why the 4 starts, well, they kept running out of things. For instance, my margarita went skinny when they ran out of the regular mix they use. Then, they ran out of limes! The margaritas, even the skinny ones, were fantastic! They use A LOT of ice, but still tasted delicious. Decor was wonderful for Christmas. It was just a warm and inviting space. We will definitely go back if we are ever back in that area! Parking was sufficient, as it was a weeknight. I'm sure that helped for it not to be too crowded. Everything was very clean also. Just a great place to go and meet with friends over drinks. If you're expecting tapas, call ahead to see when the kitchen closes. The kitchen had closed shortly after we got there, which was a bummer. Regardless, check this place out if you're in the area!

reviews.author: Julie G.
reviews.description: This is a great place for a drink and to reconnect. Recently went out with my husband for date night here and were pleasantly surprised with all the outdoor seating options. Beautiful outdoor space, great drinks and waiter was amazing and attentive. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: My husband and I stopped in for a drink or two and a bite to eat. We ordered chips and salsa as an appetizer. It was meh but it filled our bellies so in that aspect it got the job done.   The drinks are where it is at here. My husband ordered a flight of beer. Tons of options to choose from. I ordered Bishop cider on draft. I got the strawberry (my favorite) and also the apple pineapple. All the drinks were good.  We noticed that staff attention to customers had been a little lacking and very slow. I think this has more to do with our crappy country and COVID. But who am I to judge? We just made sure to grab our check before I was even close to being done with my second glass.

reviews.author: Kacey C.
reviews.description: I've been coming to The Brass Tap for a few years now and love it! The back courtyard has giant Jenga and other games and there are plenty of seating options both indoors and outdoors. Just recently tried their food and the loaded fries were pretty good! I was looking around at surrounding tables and their food all looked great. Can't wait to try more here in the future. Tons of beer on tap and very knowledgeable bartenders who make great recommendations. I will say that their cocktail availability is slim but definitely a good spot for beer.

reviews.author: Susan S.
reviews.description: Jeff is the bomb!!!  You are always know  what we want or what to recommend before we do!  I'm so glad you joined the Brass Tap team!!!!

reviews.author: Jordan P.
reviews.description: This place is a rip off! Three chicken fingers for 14.00 and a very small plate of nachos for 18.00 add a 10.00 app and one beer and you have 70.00 down the toilet. Stay clear away!! Many better places to go that if they charge high for a plate you at least get a fair portion. Never again

reviews.author: Alicia A.
reviews.description: This is our second time trying this restaurant chain. Our first one was on South Congress in Austin and was a terrible experience. We thought would give the round rock location of try. Came in happy hour and were pleased with the bartenders from the friendlyness and helpfulness. Our food met our expectation in time and quality as well as the drinks. However when I went to pay for our $40 bill with $100 cash we were told "we don't take cash". Number one, probably should tell someone that before they eat and drink your food and beverage, and number two, why? Is cash dirtier than a credit card you've never sanitized? I don't understand businesses that say "I don't want your cash". And I don't plan on patronizing them again either.

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Thankful that the brass tap is open and serving food and drink. Service is outstanding, they always have A great selection of beer on tap and if you are confused or just can't decide, ask, staff is great and matching your preferences to their current selections. Over the last couple weeks my friends and I have enjoyed flatbreads and sandwiches - Tasty and fresh. The options these days in this area, post Covid, are rather slim - But it is definitely worth you stopping in and staying for a while... They have a nice sitting area out back when it's not too warm outside.

reviews.author: Kevin S.
reviews.description: Monday 4pm.  Only 4 people inside the bar.  Again had to walk down to actually request a beer from the tender.

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: I have been to this bar many times and every time I am here, I forget to write a review because I get too hammered after the visits there.   The highlights of the establishment are as follows:   1- Conveniently located close to a lot of parking in downtown Round Rock that is free  2- Mixed drinks are on-point  3- Bartenders are friendly and knowledgeable about beer  4- This establishment is dog-friendly  5- The Brasstap uses toast for their Brew Crew "Drink Beer. Earn Rewards. Become a Beer Guru."

reviews.author: Sterling P.
reviews.description: Came with my best friend tonight and seriously amazing  Michael and Sarah did a PHENOMENAL JOB. They checked on us numerous times, made the drinks to perfection, and were a pleasure to talk to!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND. THEY ARE THE BEST EVER!

reviews.author: Mary D.
reviews.description: Dropped by late and Elvis was in the building. A lot of fun. Great atmosphere. Had some tasty treats from the late menu: pretzels and mustard and chips and queso. Selected our own drinks for the first round, then went with our server, Tanya's, recommendations for our 2nd round. Particularly enjoyed The Princess Kiss.  Hadn't been there in awhile. Happy we stopped by. Great selection of drinks. Great service. Will be back soon!

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: I was looking forward to returning to the Brass Tap because I have had a good experience on a prior visit. There were a couple of mistakes by our server at first, but I chalked it up to him possibly being new or simply having an off night. Unfortunately, the service progressively got worse throughout the dinner. From spilling a drink on the table, to telling us he wasn't focused, to the bartender remaking the drink and under pouring it, and it taking almost 20 minutes to receive our check after we asked three times for it, you can't blame it on anything but a lack of effort. Continuous poor service can truly ruin an evening if you let it.

reviews.author: Joey G.
reviews.description: Great place in downtown Round Rock. Always great service, no matter how busy the strip is. I didn't play the trivia tonight, but it sounded like everybody was having a blast. I don't know how many beers they have on tap, but there's something for everyone. Great outdoor section. And there's a smoking section outside and with cigars on sale.

reviews.author: Christina G.
reviews.description: My Fiancee' and two friends of ours visiting from Dallas area decided to check this place out on Friday night.  I read the reviews on Yelp (as I always do before going), and suggested this place to them.  I am sorry for doing so. We got there, in what seems to be happening area of downtown Round Rock, which I did not know existed.  There are several bars in this same stretch of road.  Parking was easy on the street.  Once we got in, it has the bar and lot of the front area filled (no social distancing here).  Sign at the front read, "Seat yourself, and we will find ya".  We sat at a table/booth section across from the bar near the back.  Our waiter, seems like he did not know much.  We asked him questions, and he was not sure.  We found out though, if you don't want beer, they are limited on other alcohol.  I wanted a Grey Goose and tonic.  They did not have Grey Goose.  I asked for Ketel One.  They did not have.  They said they only have local vodkas, "Dripping Springs" and "Titos".  I went with "Titos" and waiter asked three times, what I wanted with the vodka.  My friend got a "Apple-tini".  It came in a very small v-shapped glass, that looked like not much more then a shot...and it had ice chips floating in her drink.  She used to be a bartender, and knew that is not what you are supposed to have there.  Also, her boyfriend had a Long Island Ice tea.  He sipped it, and it was not tasting right.  So, she walked up to the bar to get it fixed.  They told her to go back and get her mask and come back (*mind you, no patrons at bar were wearing a mask).  She did so, and ask if they could remake it.  They did so, and brought to our table by different waitress person, and he tasted it, and still not right.  So, my friend asked the waitress if they knew what they put in it.  They went thru all the ingredients and found out they use "lemonade" instead of  "sweet and sour" , which made it taste really sweet.  The food was just ok.  My friend got a salad, and looked like left over pieces of lettuce they had lying around. The nachos were just ok, and the reuben and cuban were ok.  It took us about 15 min or more just to get our waiter to come back to get bill.  They pay attention to bar area, but not much in area around it.  Sorry, won't be back.

reviews.author: Steve S.
reviews.description: After enjoying delicious food and well poured drinks from my favorite bartender Tanya, I was blindsided for having a political opinion. I was shushed and shunned by the staff for having any kind of point of view. I decided to move to the main bar to be by myself and was then questioned by the staff, who blew the whole thing out of proportion. I was told that I needed to leave the premises by some screening bartender because I was "disturbing other people"; all while never raising my voice. If the staff had not perpetuated drama, it would have been dropped. I would not suggest this bar unless you're absolutely certain that you're going to be quiet and pay for over price drinks for underwhelming service from the newer waitstaff. Weak management.

reviews.author: Summer M.
reviews.description: I had never been to Round Rock! What an awesome treat. We happened into the Brass Tap and had a really great time. Fun atmosphere with an incredibly friendly staff. The bar back, Matt, was very helpful and made some delicious suggestions for us. Go for the brisket grilled cheese and stay for the warm, friendly, and fun atmosphere. I will definitely make this a destination must stop on my way through town!

reviews.author: Ryan S.
reviews.description: Great pretzels. They charge $89 for an ounce of a bottle that costs $350 (Macallan 18). The math works out to that being less than $15 an ounce. I fully understand markup and a business making a profit, but come on. Could still make a killing at $40, and I wouldve actually bought it. Need to take a calculus class at ACC to learn about price optimization.   Good beers on tap, too.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: So, as a visitor to the Austin/Round Rock area, I do have to say that I did enjoy the ambiance and home town feel of this local pub. As per the service, the blue haired bartender/server was THE WORST best bartender that I have ever had! ;) Real talk, if you enjoy good drinks, good atmosphere, good people and great service, please stop in and check it out!

name: Cork and Barrel Craft Kitchen and Microbrewery

reviews.author: Amber E.
reviews.description: Amazing outdoor space. The cocktails and food were great. Definitely my new favorite place for outdoor dining.

reviews.author: Mark S.
reviews.description: Homer made this visit special. What a great guy. Knew the tricks of holding off on ordering everything at the same time so the courses would come out properly. Always a smile an great attitude. Oh, and the food is good to.  Come here and ask for Homer. And no I'm not his brother. Haha

reviews.author: Dana T.
reviews.description: Very disappointed.  The restaurant is beautiful inside and out. It all goes downhill from there.  The service is sub-par. I'll never understand why a server would bring the appetizer with the entree. I also heard complaints from adjacent tables about incorrect orders.  The food is overpriced. It's pub grub. It's not even good pub grub. The chicken was over cooked and dry. The house made chips were stale and greasy.  The beer/wine list is average at best. The two "house brews" I tried weren't bad but nothing to overcome everything else.  Overall it's just overpriced bad service and food in a beautiful setting.

reviews.author: Stephany G.
reviews.description: Super friendly staff. Artichoke dip, and flaming bacon appetizers were tasty.  I had the Chicken pesto sandwich. Flavors were on point. Nice atmosphere.  Didn't like that we were uncharged when we were offered more "crostini" for our spinach dip. Would definitely add this to the rotation if I lived nearby.

reviews.author: Bee B.
reviews.description: Checked out this Irish microbrewery today and enjoyed the live music they had out on their patio. Large patio with some green space to play corn hole and they're dog friendly. We ordered the burger, garlic pretzels, fish and chips, and the charcuterie Nosh board. The drinks we ordered were the white sangria and blueberry wheat beer. The garlic pretzels and charcuterie were delicious. Interesting, cool place

reviews.author: Kiva C.
reviews.description: This place never disappoints. They have ample indoor seating with standard and bar height options. Their outdoor area is massive. They have covered seating under a pavilion which is equipped with heaters and fans for any time of year. They have some uncovered seating as well and a mini amphitheater vibe for live music. They also have picnic tables on the grass and a ton of room for kids to run wild and free. They are dog friendly outside. Today we opted for the back patio and had the pleasure of being helped by Aniya. She has such a kind, gentle, and engaging energy. She impressed me with her knowledge of both the bar and food menu down to knowing the size of the pours. Aniya also had some killer recommendations! If you're in the area, you've got to try them out and ask for Aniya!

reviews.author: Mike N.
reviews.description: Two out of four meals were poorly executed.  The first, a Lemon-Thyme Petite Poussin was ordered and they delivered Lemon-Thyme chicken wings instead.  The other, my meal was a Reuben and it NEVER showed up.  I ate my side of Mac and Cheese, the rest of the Charcuterie board and waited.  Eventually, the server who has worked here since the place opened asked me how I enjoyed my meal.  LOL!  Is getting 50% of an order correct good for table service?  The place is nice, crowded, blah, blah, blah.  I wish it was better so I could come back more often, but they just don't have it together.

reviews.author: Alyssa R.
reviews.description: I've gone twice so far.  First time was terrible. They have us a terrible table when the restaurant was empty. Service was terrible. Out of almost everything we wanted. Food was average and took forever coming out. Second time was a lot better. Nice table on the counter patio. Food was available and came in a timely manner.  I really enjoyed the Pear and Fig Pizza and Wings. As well as the burrata

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: Such a fun new spot! Met a bunch of girls for lunch. Ciara was the sweet host that was so accommodating. We had reservations but switcheroooed on her with the table and she was super nice. Found us the perfect spot.  Angel was our waitress and she was just as great! Larger group... kept her cool... recommended great choices for us.. I had half arugula salad and sandwich and 2 glasses of Sauv Blanc ... the managers came by and checked on us... one lady and one man...  Great service, great outdoors... good filtered water... yes I can tell...  I will be back to try out patio and bar in the very near future!  Would love to try more items on the menu. And I did tell Angel I would be back to see her... I love that it's dog friendly and the outdoor seating is amazing... love the string lights... good ambiance... clean bathrooms...  Great for lunch date, happy hours or large groups!

reviews.author: Katie M.
reviews.description: I really like this place. Its interior is beautiful and thoughtfully designed. There a large yard with plenty of space for the kiddos to roam as well.   We had an excellent server and really liked the "Snug" we sat in.  The seating options are pretty and a unique feature actually.   Seating: Large tables, small tables, "Snugs"(private little cubby with plenty of room), bar seating, outdoor tables and cozy seating around a fireplace outside.   The food: Pretzel w/ dipping trio. Yes! These are excellent w/ an awesome sourdough flavor.  The fish and chips was pretty good. Great batter with a ton of flavor in it. The pizza (ordered without the pepperoni). The dough was under proved and under cooked. Ok at best.  The irish stew was pretty to look at but had none of the heart or depth of flavor that you'd expect from a stew. My soul was craving a hot heart stew, no luck. Disappointing.   Drinks: No wells here!! Just a quality selection of excellent wines and spirits.   We'll definitely be back and try a new selection of foods! If you're looking for a place to visit/meet up, this is a great venue. Plentyyyyyy of room!!

reviews.author: Sam B.
reviews.description: Can honestly say I look forward to coming back here. I want to start off by saying I hadn't eaten breakfast, lunch, or dinner prior to arriving there which you could only imagine I was hangry(hungry + angry)    So I park my car and Soon as I step on the curb to make my way towards the door the hostess had already opened the door and was greeting my wife and I with a warm and friendly greeting.   As a manager myself, I always preached that our customers should never have to touch the door and I was so glad to see this establishment have the same values about it as I do.   We sat down and in no time our waiter Homer was at our table greeting us. I must say he was very personable. He truly grasp the concept of building rapport with his customers.   The food came out pretty quick which was a huge plus because a I stayed before I was "Hangry"  My fries were cold, but then again they're fries so I just asked for some fresh ones that had some heat to it lol.  My wife order the 8HR Braised Short Rib and she stated it was just ok.  I asked for lemon pepper wings, My receipt shows that's what I got, but I can tell you that want what came in my plate. Was I made about it NO, why you ask? Because whatever the heck it was taste pretty darn good. I should have asked what was I given because I wouldn't mind ordering it again.  My fish and chips was freaking AMAZING and whatever little SAUCE they give you to dip you food into.... AMAZING!!! make sure you ask for extra so you get enough to dip your fries in it to lol. My wife tried my fish and chips and said she couldn't wait to come back to get that next time.   On our way out the door the host struck again with grabbing the door for us and she did it with a smile. As I was walking my way to the car another employee told me how much they appreciated our business and I'm thinking to myself write your done working your on your way to your own car to head home and you still take the time out to make is feel special. I feel that the friendly service has us excited to come back and eat here again and we are looking forward to it.

reviews.author: Andrea B.
reviews.description: Beautiful restaurant!!! Service was awful! Food just ok!  The fish and chip is flavorless! The carrot cake was strange!  The lemon pepper was was good!

reviews.author: Tamara R.
reviews.description: Beautiful restaurant with pretty good food as well! Have been a few times in both large and small groups, and there's always such a great atmosphere indoors and outdoors. Everyone's always been happy with their food, and I can't stop thinking about their fish dish that's sadly no longer on the menu.

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: Cool spot for inside and outside dining. The outside patio has strings of lights everywhere and a cute "whiskey barrel" table for a couple to sit at.   We had their lemon thyme wings and there so awesome. So crunchy and flavorful. We also had their special pizza and it was good! A little too greasy for us but you can tell everything was extremely fresh.  Our server was super friendly and she even let me sample the Bloody Mary mix that I asked about.  The charcuterie board looked tasty, we definitely want to go back and try it!

reviews.author: Mariel V.
reviews.description: They brew their own beer and have a massive selection of good wines and provisions. It wouldn't be an Irish pub without these yummy fish and chips, now would it?!  It's the only time I'm down to go to a pub - I'm not a beer person but I love a good beer battered Irish fish and chips. The only way I'd take beer.  The place is gorgeous, spacious (big groups are welcome!)  We wished we didn't have to leave. Their back patio is beautifully by a creek. They also control the mosquitoes which could ruin any patio dining experience for me. It's a win all around!  I can't wait to come back to this piece of Ireland in Round Rock, the managers told us that a lot of their restaurant decor are from Ireland shipped here. That's pretty personal and lovely in my book.

reviews.author: Kim N.
reviews.description: Was very excited to try this place because of the pictures we saw online. Coming into it, it actually looked very casual like a sports bar almost. We meant to come in for quick lunch. However, quick it was not. We waited 45 minutes before we said anything. The server kept coming to us and saying "your food will be right out" every 10 minutes but nothing more. We saw people getting food after us which raised concerns so we asked our waiter who just said "its coming"  and finally asked to see to a manager. Manager came and explained that the cook dropped the food and had to remake it.  In conclusion, we told them that we would have wanted them communicate that to us from the start so we knew why others got their food first. The manager just shrugged it off and we were so upset that we couldn't even finish our food. Thumbs down on service and management.

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: This place has so much potential but on my visit it was a total and complete disaster.    Parking - Small parking lot for the size of the venue, saw a sign that said additional parking at Dell diamond which is a good ways up the street.  They do not have any valet parking. I ended up parking at the R Bank lot (about 1/2 between the two spots) that had a sign that said towing was enforced from 5p - 8A but we were assured they had an arrangement and that we would not be towed. It worked out but still was quite a hike.  Atmosphere and decor  The architecture and furnishings are outstanding and really are enticing.  Round Rock does not have many restaurants of this style. The place is packed and you need to make a reservation.  We sat by the window in the bar, a little after 630 and we were baking because of the heat. The air conditioning was not working well enough to keep everyone comfortable, several in our party were visibly sweating.  Adding ceiling fans and putting some type of treatment on the windows would help considerably, this is only going to get worse as summer temperatures begin to return to the 100 +.  The windows face the west,  Service  They are terribly understaffed. Typically for a new restaurant, owners over staff and make sure that the service is beyond good. The service here was beyond bad. Our server was working her tail off and trying to maintain her very large group of tables.  Everything was taking too much time.  There were large gaps of time between ordering and receiving, especially on the drinks.  Two of our rounds were forgotten and upon reminding our server, she quickly darted to the bar and then returned in short order.  Sadly, some of the drinks were no longer chilled and cold  but warm - obviously has been sitting unattended for some period of time.  Drinks  The drinks were overpriced. For example, a vodka martini (Tito's) small demanded a $15 price tag. As mentioned above, the drink was warm and did not taste good at all.  The typical turnaround from placing an order for drinks to receiving them was at least 10 minutes.  On the positive side they have some unique drinks on the menu, an old fashion that comes to the table actually smoking, when they remove the cover. A neighboring table ordered one and it was quite the sight.  Again, some great potential, but because of under staffing and other issues they fall short.  Food  Several of my dining companions had been here before and strongly recommended the Reuben sandwich, saying when they had it a few weeks ago it was fantastic and perhaps one of the best they had ever had eaten. Well, for me, not so much.  The meat was not sliced well, was chunky and tough, the Reuben arrived luke warm and did not taste all that great.    Others in my dining party, ordered the pretzel appetizer and the pepperoni pizza.  The food met expectations, but nothing spectacular.  The dipping sauces for he pretzel were unique - beer cheese, red wine tarragon butter and a garlic cream cheese.  They asked for some small plates, everyone of the plates had to be wiped clean.     One dining companion ordered the charred vegetables.  We were all surprised at the how small the serving was for the $14 price tag - and the comment was they were over charred.    They do have a patio that does not take reservations and seating is first come first serve.  The bar and food are different from the indoor main venue.  Interestingly, they have a food truck that is serving a different menu from what is inside.

reviews.author: Lanie M.
reviews.description: We've been here on multiple occasions and every time it's been wonderful!  The food is great and the drinks are just as good. I love the huge outdoor area for the kids and dogs to play! Today we had Aniya as our server, and she was terrific! Super friendly and very knowledgeable on everything. She had great suggestions for us on both the food and drinks.

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: First of all, the place is beautiful inside and out. That's the main sell 100%. The food is good and so are the drinks but a little overpriced for their outdoor menu. A guiness draught at any type of irish pub shouldn't go for $9 nor any bar for that matter in my opinion. All food and drink prices could be $1-2 less, especially if it's a limited outdoor menu. If we were dining in (and it's beautiful inside + full menu offered), I could see those prices being fair. If the drinks were to be $1-2 less in the future, we could see ourselves being regulars, but definitely not until then.  Two of our friends ordered the wagyu burger, when asked on how it compares to a non-wagyu burger, they said they wouldn't have noticed anything especially different to a regular burger in comparison if they had not read the menu.  Nonetheless, they seemed to enjoy it.   I would order the reuben sandwich again with the kimchi slaw. I thought the kimchi slaw was very creative and it added nice flavor contrast to the otherwise classical meaty cheesy aspects of the reuben. The kimchi by itself was good, they use older more fermented kimchi, which gave the sandwich a bit of sourness to it.   My wife ordered the fish n' chips, one of her favorite barfoods. The fish itself was very moist and tender and it appears much larger in portion size than what we were expecting when looking at other user's yelp photos. The chile-lime tartar sauce wasn't very 'chile-limey' at all, it tasted just like regular tartar sauce, don't get me wrong - we LOVE any tartar sauce, but they could dial up the chile and lime all the way to the moon if that's what they're advertising.   Lastly, the staff was nice, although our waitress basically dissappeared for the second half of our stay and kept forgetting/taking an unquestionably and questionably long time to get our drinks and takeout box. Service was just OK, there is always next time.   Bonus points for the restrooms, very neat, clean and well decorated.

reviews.author: Elvira A.
reviews.description: Having brunch here isn't simply eating a meal, it is a complete experience. Yes, the food is AMAZING! The Fish and Chips  and Reuben Sandwich are delicious and portions generous. The craft beer is also the best (Huckleberry wheat).  Plus the place is filled with great atmosphere, and plenty of history. Our server (Jewels) pointed out the wall plaques located all along the restaurant filled with tidbits of information. This contributes to the experience. The music is great and staff friendly. A very happy place! We drove from South Austin to visit, definitely retuning soon!

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: Awesome place, good drink selection w/ a cool atmosphere. Definitely coming back when I'm in the area'

reviews.author: Bill M.
reviews.description: Stopped by to watch an Austin FC game and was pleasantly surprised to find that they offer a 10% discount to anyone wearing AFC gear on game day, two thumbs up. The space is large and the beer is good. I tried an IPA and a pilsner. There are a few arcades in the back and enough TVs throughout to keep everyone interested. My only complaint is that the game sound was not turned on, so I was distracted by people talking, dogs barking, etc.

reviews.author: Travis C.
reviews.description: I had been wanting to visit this place for a while. It was worth the wait! Everyone there was very nice and knowledgeable about beer. Two things that I always look for in a brewery. The Chocolate Bourbon Pecan Porter was amazing! Bold, chocolately, crafted beautifully! My wife had the Blackberry Mead which was also a treat! Definitely is going to be a place I visit more often!

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: Awesome brewery with a cool indoor/outdoor space. Staff and service were excellent, friendly and efficient on a busy afternoon. Beers are solid, with a good selection to choose from. Wine also if you dislike beer (lame). Food truck schedule is easily accessible on their website. Drink local!

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: Great local brewery with excellent beers. They also have a selection of wine for the non beer drinkers. Very friendly and welcoming staff. They have live music and guest food trucks. Follow them on Facebook as they post the food truck lineup for the entire month.

reviews.author: Mildred A.
reviews.description: Great staff and very helpful if you don't know the type of beer you like! They fo have mead and wine for non beer drinkers   The taco food truck was great!! Food was yummy and the the staff were friendly and helpful.  All in all a great place to stop by in Georgetown!  I promise to take pictures next time! :)

reviews.author: Leticia G.
reviews.description: After a long morning hike Colorado Bend SP, I hit the road to this small, craft-beer brewery. With rotating food trucks, and an avid-unorganized-extrovert that enjoys surprises, I found this idea pretty cool. With their seasonal beer specials, I never get bored of visiting this amazing brewery! Highly recommend it

reviews.author: Sarah F.
reviews.description: I love that Georgetown has a brewery on the West side of 1-35!!! This place is great!  Service is five stars Atmosphere is five stars + a happy dog paw for being dog-friendly Cleanliness is five stars Selection is 4.5 stars but that's probably on me...  I am a picky beer drinker so I didn't quite find one I liked this time, but the flight and tasting options are great so I'm sure I'll get there eventually. Just need to try some more beer!   They had a food truck on the day we went, with giant tacos and nachos, which made for a perfect Sunday Funday with my partner. Can't wait to do it again.

reviews.author: old d.
reviews.description: Nice family atmosphere, very good beers!  ButNobody wore masks 8/30/21.  Friendly folks , the schnitzel food truck was authentic German fare.   They shouldn't say they practice masks if they don't.

reviews.author: Teresa B.
reviews.description: My fiance and I visited this brewery on a Sunday afternoon and it was just perfect! They have a great patio area with comfy chairs and tables. I had the Hefeweizen and my fiance had the strawberry famadillo. Both were fantastic. Service was amazing. The bartender was extremely attentive and intelligently spoke of all their offerings. He even allowed my fiance to sample some before choosing. They also had a taco truck there which was just perfect for a snack. We will certainly be returning.

reviews.author: Kimberly S.
reviews.description: I absolutely loved the Barking Armadillo! They had a wonderful assortment on tap. The Meridian Hive Blackberry Mead was my favorite, but the other three choices in the flight including Hefeweizen, Strawberry Limeade Ale, and Magonada with a tajin rim were delicious as well! The seating area was comfortable and well shaded. The on-site food truck served up an amazing chipotle steak quesadilla; it had the right blend of savory and spice. Together, the beverages at BA and the lineup at the food truck were a great pairing! We are on vacation here in Texas and we're hoping to return to the Barking Armadillo before we head home!

reviews.author: Simon S.
reviews.description: Lots of seating. Knowledgeable and friendly staff. Trivia night is a blast esp w the food trucks. Beer is above average esp the red ale. I would like to see more wheatier options but that's not a knock against this wonderful local spot.

reviews.author: Jennifer K.
reviews.description: 4 very solid stars for a new brewery in Georgetown. We visited 9/5 and enjoyed the beers we had there. Husband had the Witbier (one of his go to styles) and I had the Hefe and (limited) strawberry farmadillo.  We ordered chips and queso and tacos from the taco truck onsite. We enjoyed those as well. Very solid meat in those tacos and very filling!  We will return, but try to come earlier so we can sit on the patio instead of inside. Some of the guests inside were not vigilant about masking when leaving their table. I would suggest some signage on the interior tables (at least) reminding them of this request.  There are dogs allowed inside which did not bother us at all (we have 2 at home). But, some people are not as comfortable with dogs inside so I feel it needs to be mentioned.  Looking forward to trying more beers in the future!

reviews.author: Heath N.
reviews.description: Great little space just off Williams Drive. They have different food trucks, last time it was a pie truck, Takovron is often there.   There is nice shaded outdoor seating. Inside has a few video games and pinball. There is plenty of seating insight with high tops and tables. There is a nice couch and a couple of comfy chairs.   The bartenders are great. The beer selection changes with a handful or regular lagers and IPAs. The stout is coffee based. The Belgian heavy is fantastic, better than Devil's Backbone. Prices are fair. People might argue about the single kind of glassware, but I'm unbothered.  Would be good to have a few more interesting board games their for more of a social atmosphere, but hard to argue with success.

reviews.author: Rigo G.
reviews.description: New Brewery in Gtown and just down the road from our house... excellent choice of brews, including one guest tap. To top it off, they have an on-site taco truck "Takavron - Tacos Regios" Irish Red is rich and tasty Hefeweizen is delicious and smooth (wife favorite) Add a Gringa from the taco truck and BOOM!!!

reviews.author: A. J.
reviews.description: Excellent local brewery.   Decent selection of beers and some wine.   They have a large indoor area with multiple rooms for seating.   Outdoor seating is pretty big as well.  This place is dog friendly and kid friendly.    Staff were nice and knowledgeable of the beers, they were very accommodating in trying their different beers.   It's clean and everyone seemed to be adhering to the COVID guidelines etc.      I will definitely be going back and would certainly recommend this place to anyone.  Cheers!!

reviews.author: Sammy B.
reviews.description: All of their beers are great. If you don't find one you like,  you might want to stop drinking!  The owners and crew are even better!!

reviews.author: Ally H.
reviews.description: Amazing brewery when I went. Dog friendly. Great live music. Food truck out back. Beer is delicious and they have great staff. Definitely will be back when I can

reviews.author: Terry M.
reviews.description: First time visiting BAB great tasting beer. Service was outstanding. Outdoor seating with string lights

reviews.author: Anna B.
reviews.description: Wear your mask and come safely have some of the better beer around. We particularly enjoyed this brewery and we visit breweries quite regularly. The beer was nicely fizzy, not flat, and there was spaces out seating. The DDH IPA and Hefeweizen here were my favorites. Everything tasted fresh, not flat. It was pretty great. We will be back!

reviews.author: J.J. B.
reviews.description: Phenomenal food, service, and authenticity.   I was impressed with the full English breakfast, especially since they had real black pudding. Also the English breakfast tea tray was on point. The service was friendly and attentive. Authentic and laid back pub atmosphere.   Highly recommend for an authentic English Pub experience in the Austin TX metro area. Head on up to Round Rock for Kenny Fort Pub.

reviews.author: Sam P.
reviews.description: I was working in Round Rock and we were looking for somewhere for lunch - spotted place on Yelp and bring British and sporting some old faves on the menu, decided to give it a try ! Very glad we did.  Full of cool British decor, we were met by the owner ( Tim?), really nice bloke and super friendly! It made me feel like I was at the local ( pub) back home.  Went with the curry and being vegetarian, was excited they had a cauliflower version which was great and very authentic! Loved the naan bread too.  My colleague got a burger but after spotting the fish and chips wanted to rest that - so we tried that and it was crazy authentic. Loved the mushy peas, curry sauce and the delicious tarter sauce . The dish is huge so easily enough for 2 !  Lovely place , great owner and fabulous food

reviews.author: Robin C.
reviews.description: Anything short of amazing would be doing this pub an injustice! A colleague of mine recommended Kenney Fort Pub for their brews and food. We finally got over there today for lunch to try it out and holy cow were we impressed! The location is tucked away in a commercial development and their frontage faces interior to the subdivision. When you get to the entrance you can feel the attention to detail and hospitality the second you walk in. The owner immediately greeted us and seated us right away. The dining area was spacious and airy. The  bar had a nice open feel, with visibility to all the brews on tap. We accessed the menu on our phones and were able to quickly place our order. We enjoyed vanilla beers which were full of flavor, just thought they might be a porter which they weren't. Only recommendation I would make to the owners is to list their beers by category on their menu so folks will gavitate to what they like. The names by themselves of the beers can be a hair unclear on whether they are a stout versus a pilsner kinda thing.   We enjoyed the hot pretzels with beer cheese that was super flavorful. For entrees we had the Kenney Fort Burger which was served on a warm pretzel bun with string fries and an amazing chargrilled burger which was super juicy. My husband has the fish and chips which came with fantastic wedge fries (I would sub for those with my burger next time) and several different dips for the crispy flaky fish. What we found most amazing was that this all happened with the owner running the entire restaurant and bar. He was on point the entire time and we had an amazing experience.  Lastly (and my personal favor), when he brought us the check, it had an RFID to pay on our phones using Toast. For anyone during this pandemic who has eaten out and either had to wait forever for a server to process your payment...or worse, had a server standing over you awkwardly handing you a device for you to pay your bill and put their tip in, you will appreciate this user-friendly and easy option to complete your check and close out your meal. LOVE LOVE LOVED THIS!  Enjoyed our entire experience and most definitely this is our go-to place going forward. Can't wait to try more beer selections and other menu items!

reviews.author: Jack K.
reviews.description: I just took a trip across "the pond" for my first visit here. Not really across the pond but 15 minutes away. This definitely brought me back to my Navy days of Portsmouth and London Pub style fish and chips! Perfectly battered and fried with that nice light crunch when you bite into it. The buffalo cauliflower bites was a first time try for me also. All vegetables need too be made this way. Not too spicy but just right.  This was a takeout order and everything was still hot and crispy when I got home. Perfect spot for any occasion.

reviews.author: Mandy W.
reviews.description: Best fish and chips around! I have to do the small entree the full order is HUGGEE! Everything is delicious and definitely a great spot to try some new foods like the Scotch eggs! They have a great selection of beers and cocktails as well. Staff is always awesome and never have had a bad experience.

reviews.author: Christian C.
reviews.description: I've always been told that British food is boring and bland.  After eating it for the first time at The Kenney Fort British Pub, I can undoubtedly tell you, that is not the case.  The first British food item I had become really curious of is a Scotch Egg and I was finally able to get my hands on one here.  A Scotch Egg is a boiled egg wrapped in sausage, coated in bread crumbs and then deep fried or baked.  Simple enough, but Kenney Fort serves it on top of chopped and pickled veggies that takes it to another level.  I would come back here just for the Scotch Egg alone.  My wife ordered Fish and Chips which was battered and fried to perfection.  I'm not big on fish, but I asked for more than just one bite and enjoyed it very much.  It came with a side of tartar, curry, as well as mushy peas, which were delicious.  I ordered Bangers and Mash, which came with three sausage links, mashed potatoes, and peas in a tasty, tasty gravy.  This dish was top notch and surpassed my expectations.  Every bite was packed with flavor and very enjoyable.  The beer options here are plentiful, which also contains many local brewery selections.  Unfortunately, it was noon when we came, and a bit too early for me to crack one open.  However, we are both very excited to try them out as well as some of Kenney Fort's other food items.

reviews.author: Christina M.
reviews.description: Nice courtyard! Greta selection of cold beers on tap. Had the Masala there and it was very good!

reviews.author: Samuel T.
reviews.description: Was there about 9 pm last night. My companion wanted a really good burger and Yelp gave us this place.   We were the only patrons eating at tables. There were a few guys at the bar. Since I wasn't really hungry, we decided to order their signature burger which is made with ground brisket and ground meat from short ribs. I asked for it to not be overcooked. We talked about the cooking temperature with the waitress and she assured us it would be cooked medium. When it came out it was more like well-done. Pretty dry meat and not all that tasty. The bun seemed like it was homemade and was good, as were all the veggies they put on it. Fries were nothing special.   We will be back and I will try their fish and chips.   Service was good and the prices for what we had were consistent with 2021 inflation prices. I am sure this would be the place to be when a soccer game was on.   Music playing on their sound system was very good too.

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: Very nice atmosphere. Plenty of parking spaces. Friendly attentive staff. Delicious food. Great beer selection.

reviews.author: Susan B.
reviews.description: Fish and chips reminiscent of London's open market stalls, and you don't want to miss the squishy peas. Thank you Kenney Fort.

reviews.author: Jeremy A.
reviews.description: Great pub with great food.   Been here 6 times so far.   Just super loud inside.   Very hard to hear each other while dining.    Great beer selection and good cocktails too.   Can't beat the fish and chips and their burger

reviews.author: Taylor A.
reviews.description: As a Brit in Austin, after moving here and finally settling in, naturally the next step was the go on a hunt for good British grub in search of a slice of home. I came across the Fort Kenney Pub in Yelp and knew that the following Saturday would start with a fry up!  When we walked in, the staff were all super friendly and welcoming. It wasn't busy as it was still early but there was plenty of seating and the football could be seen from most of them.  The food was great and everything I had hoped for! I subbed black pudding for an extra sausage which our server was more than happy to do. The sausages were really delicious!  Really enjoyed spending my Saturday morning here eating a yummy breakfast. I would love to come back to try some of the other meals on the menu!

reviews.author: Adam L.
reviews.description: A word to the wise, the Sunday dinner is insane for a mere mortal.  My wife was definitely a victim of eyes bigger than tummy!  I got a burger that was actually pretty remarkable, tho I couldn't enjoy the pretzel bun thanks to this stupid diet!    The bathrooms are clean and the entire facility is well kept.    The staff was outstanding and everyone was super.on the ball.

reviews.author: Michael T.
reviews.description: Dirty floor dirty menu dirty silverware and who ever works there looked like kitchen help walking back to the kitchen with his pants sagging last thing I wanted to see was his butt and underwear food was cold and bland and had to ask for beverage refills and the ticket seems the bar area and those around are more important then dinners

reviews.author: Natalie K.
reviews.description: Today, on this lazy, rainy, gloomy, post-#AustinBlizzard2021 Sunday, Hubs and I were on the hunt for some true comfort food! Thus, we knew that crossing the proverbial pond was a must! This is how we found ourselves at Kenney Fort Pub. Can I just say, y'all, that what we had here was just what we needed? This is true English pub food, and it warmed the very cockles of our very recently frigid hearts!   Hubby went with the English Breakfast! As he was wolfing it down, he looked up at me with an actual sparkle in his eyes, and he said, "Do you know what this reminds me of most recently, honey?", and I said, "Yep!"! I knew right away that he was referring to that Irish Breakfast that he got at the military part of the airport in Shannon, Ireland, on the way to his too long deployment in Afghanistan in 2018! The picture that he sent me on WhatsApp of that breakfast in that airport is burned in my memory forever!   I went with the Sunday Roast, and it was bloody fantastic, as well! The picture tells the whole story! So good! Chris ate 3/4ths of it, which is our usual division of restaurant food, but I just loved everything about it! The horseradish sauce was MAGIC! I could bathe in it!   We ended with the Sticky Toffee Pudding, and damn, y'all! Just damn!  Bottom line: if you've never tasted either of these traditional plates across the pond, but you're the sort that likes little tastes of many things, both of these dishes will be RIGHT up your alley!   And, even if you're not down for little tastes of many things, you'll absolutely wax poetic about that pudding!   What a fantastic find!   p.s. Our server was Noah, and he was a gem!

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: A solid 4 star experience!  I loved the fish (the chips were ok!). The burger was smokey and the meat was fresh. The fries that came with the burger were tasty. Everything was well seasoned. The kids fish and chips was great and my 5 year old ate it up.   I did not like the tikka masala. It was not creamy and felt heavy on the cumin. It was a smaller portion and not very much sauce. This was the only dish I didn't care for.     Also, when you pack up a to go order, please package the naan separate from thee sauce. It was packed together and the naan was all covered in the sauce that I didn't like so I didn't eat that either.    They need clearer instructions on what their pickup curbside process is. It was a little confusing but we just called and the man who answered brought our food out.  Maybe we were supposed to go get it inside?  I don't know.    I'm glad Kenney Fort Pub is in our neighborhood. I am sure  that we will be ordering curbside from them frequently.

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: Cool neighborhood British pub with proper fish and chips. Come with an appetite because the large was the size of my forearm. Loved the tarter sauce and Indian curry style sauce which accompanied the fish. The Mr. had the cheeseburger on a pretzel bun with British style bacon. Happy hour drink prices are $2.00 off. Very friendly and attentive service. We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Netta K.
reviews.description: I had really high hopes but I left disappointed.  I have had British food in a many locations and this left me wanting.  I feel they either put an Texas flare or their own take on what British food taste like.    The burger was good, you  can't really mess up a burger.. well, maybe. The banger and mash, yall.... no. It tasted like a warmed up Slim Jim, the mashed potatoes had an odd flavor that none of could place. Maybe the mustard?  The staff was very helpful but it kinda sucked I couldn't even get a paper menu, my QR reader wasn't working on my phone.   I'll give it another try but will definitely not get B and M again!

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: The food is fantastic! We've been to the UK several times and this is authentic to what we get there.  The restaurant itself is a bit warehouse ish. I feel like they could have done better to give it a pub feel. It feels nothing like a pub which was disappointing.  I'm docking one star for the Pimm's Cup. It's made with that awful soda machine Minute Laud Lemonade. It was horrendous! That was all I could taste. Simple syrup and Minute Made Lemonade.  I also docked a star for the music. It was SO LOUD. My husband and I couldn't talk. Literally. Couldn't hear each other. We were starting to question whether we're hitting an age where we say things like "the music is too loud", but no. No no no. This was freaking ridiculous! They had a lady there playing it for an hour before she started what I think was a quiz or game. Music should add ambiance. This felt like we were sitting front row at a concert. It was insanity. To the point I'm totally okay removing a star because of it.  We'll probably go back for the food, but if we're in the mood for a cocktail, or conversation, it won't be high on our list.

reviews.author: Nancy P.
reviews.description: Can't believe I haven't written a review here yet.  I went out of my way to get here. Was so looking forward to eating real British food.   I was going to be out this way during my first vaccine shot at Dell Diamond.  It was around lunch that I arrived here.  Waited a short time until they opened. Yes, I was the first one there.  First stop was to the loo.  Yes, it was labeled Loo. Started off with an order of iced tea.  Sorry, Brits no hot tea on a hot day. I asked the server if I could possible try the Black pudding they serve with breakfast. Turns out the server was one of the owner. So I got a slice. Ordered up a Scottish Egg and a plate of Bangers and mash.  I have had Scottish eggs before. These were a bit different because they used British sausage.   British sausage is very much leaner than US sausage.  The sausage meat surrounding the soft boiled egg was denser.  And it was served with picalilli (British salsa).  Loved these starters. Next up the bangers and mash and a slice of black pudding. Had to try the black pudding first.  Trust me it is not a pudding but a blood, oatmeal, pork fat, spices sausage. Before you turn your nose up, try it. A little nibble and interesting flavor. Bigger bite and it was good, before I knew it I finished it off and wish I had more. The banger was a Cumberland made sausage.  Lean pork shoulder meat makes it different than US sausages. Once you get over the difference, It is really good. But the mash potatoes, oh wow. They add mustard and cheddar cheese to theirs. Next batch of mash, I plan on adding mustard to mine. Now if that isn't enough, Red Onion gravy.  Take a slice of sausage, dip into the mash and make sure you have the gravy on it.... Prefect bite. I keep thinking the next time I go, I will get the fish and chips. But as I am writing this, all I can think about is the Bangers and Mash.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: I wish I had discovered Rentsch brewery sooner. This is a great place to sit outside and enjoy the weather while sampling one of their many craft beers. They also have different visiting food trucks which makes it fun and interesting. We went for Oktoberfest and really enjoyed the German food truck and had BBQ another day. Rentsch has plenty of outdoor, shaded seating and the beer selection is impressive with lots of interesting seasonal offerings - I really enjoyed the apple streusel seasonal beer. We'll absolutely be back.

reviews.author: Randall R.
reviews.description: Great place to hang out; lots of good beers, music and a variety of food trucks throughout the week. Bar tenders know their stuff; friendly and do everything they can to make your time there an enjoyable experience.

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: Great local craft beer. Super friendly and knowledgeable staff. The grounds are family friendly with plenty of covered outdoor seating. There is usually a guest food truck and if you follow their Facebook page they post who's coming.

reviews.author: Mando D.
reviews.description: Probably one of my new favorite spots. Friendly and professional staff, great ambiance, and family friendly; but most importantly they have GREAT beer! Very unique seasonal selection and a solid selection over all. Two thumbs up!

reviews.author: Haley F.
reviews.description: The BEST place ever. Husband and I are here every week having beers and eating from the different food trucks. We always bring games to play or invite friends to spend a few hours with. They have great seating inside and outside, with covered areas and fans. A beautiful garden with trees and a nice country view surrounding the brewery. Husband and I even had a small, intimate wedding here last fall! The staff are also very kind and always put a smile on our faces. 10/10 recommend if you're just visiting or a local looking for a new spot.

reviews.author: Mary B.
reviews.description: We love visiting local breweries and can't believe that we overlooked this gem in Georgetown for so long!  They have a good variety of beer on the menu and have a really nice, relaxing outdoor space. the service is fast and friendly. They rotate food trucks so there is always something available to munch on.  We had such a good experience that we decided to join the 2021 mug club. Ask about it!

reviews.author: Monica W.
reviews.description: We came here on  Sunday to try some German beers. They have some really great beers! My favorite was the Hefeweizen. The blonde was really good also and my husband had the one up from the Hefeweizen, "hef's  big brother", and it was also tasty but too heavy for me. I'm more of a wine drinker but if you like beer you'd love it. We took our two kids and they had fun being outdoors with us. We ate at the food truck and had a family Sunday funday. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Brittany N.
reviews.description: I can't believe it took us this long to head out to Rentsch! It's a great spot for a family outing. Recommend it!

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Cool little brewpub in Georgetown. They have two IPAs that caught my attention. Their Rentsch IPA is quite malty east coast style. Plus one had her usual lite Blonde ale and she was OK with it. She was not thrilled with the crisp finish but she did empty her pint. There is a cozy bar area with TVs and with the Temps reaching 100 degrees we chilled out there. There is also a nice beer garden with fans on the deck but even with the abundance of shade trees, it was too darn hot to be outside.  Lastly, the bartenders are pleasant and knowledgeable and will provide excellent guidance if you are a newbie. They do have some interesting specialty/seasonal beers that I must go back and try. Solid 4 stars!

reviews.author: Ally H.
reviews.description: This place would be PERFECT on a nice day! unfortunately we went on a bit of a Rainey day, but it was still great outside (they turned the heaters on for us). Staff was helpful in picking a beer that suited our taste, and it was delicious! Wish they had their own food, but there are food trucks during certain hours!

reviews.author: Clayton S.
reviews.description: I will preface this review with three biases.  1. I love beer 2. I love outdoor setups in Texas rural areas 3. I am a Red Raider  This is was our first trip out and loved it!  The beers were delicious.  I had the IPA, the double IPA, and the Amber.  Wife had the blonde and the Hefe.    My favorite was the IPA then the Hefe and then the Double.  Can't wait to go back and try more.  I missed the details on the mug club,  but like the concept and will have to check it out.  A little far from my house so not sure if the bang is worth the buck based on my frequency.  The atmosphere was fantastic.  Great patio and open space areas.  There was a Youngman playing cover music but there was enough space to where he didn't seem loud.  There was plenty of games and we brought some toys and our kid and others had a blast running around.  It was beautiful and spacious, yet plenty of space inside for when it it gets to crazy Texas temps in the summer.  Only bummer was the food truck was broke down so we just ordered Dominos instead! How easy is that?!  Looking forward to the next visit and recommend you check it out too

reviews.author: Melanie J.
reviews.description: Beautiful hill country views and delicious beer. I love the outdoor space here! The patio is dog friendly.

reviews.author: Chris D.
reviews.description: First time at the tap room. I got turned on to this brewery at Hopdoddys with their Heffe. They don't have it anymore. I was able to get a six pack at specs. Had a great time, mother's day specials. Tried the Poppy Fest Red Ale. Right down my alley. Great place, great beer. I was a little disappointed w Pat's BBQ. Seemed to be over cooked. It was later in day and they were running out. I would give them another go. Can't  bash Rentsch for food truck.

reviews.author: Terry M.
reviews.description: Beer was very cold and tasted well. Nice outdoor setting. Seemed to be practicing social distancing well.

reviews.author: Megan P.
reviews.description: Beer and board games are the catch here . Our bartender was knowledgeable and helpful with selecting beer choices. Especially since I'm not the biggest "craft-beer drinker" he suggested the blonde which was just what I was looking for.  My friends had the doublerumtoberfest and rate it 10/10!!  I love the open concept that makes the space seem larger than it is. We came at 1pm on A Saturday, not too many people just A few family's enjoying their day. Their patio area looks super cozy but it's too cold today so I'll be back!

reviews.author: Babs G.
reviews.description: Great way to spend some time with a terrific cold beer, relaxing on the patio with friends.  Predictably enjoyable opportunity to just "be".

reviews.author: Chuck G.
reviews.description: Great beer and even greater staff.  Kid friendly and even have snacks and drinks for the kids.  What more could you want!!  Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Jim B.
reviews.description: I was recently in Georgetown for the 20th Anniversary Annual Meeting of the Texas Master Naturalists. I stayed in my camper at Cedar Breaks and commuted daily to the conference at the Sheraton. I was at the Sheraton from dark to dark attending classes every day but the last. The conference ended at noon, and I headed straight to Rentsch.  I got a flight of beers and went outside to drink them. I was the only one there for the first twenty minutes or so. That gave me the freedom to move around from place to place. The outside area is really nice. I tried full sun areas and shaded areas. There were several bees in the area that pestered me, adding to my moves. The wind chimes were also a nice touch.  I liked all of the beers I tried. But two of them were amazing. They were the Bourbon Barrel Double Oktoberfest (2017) and the Double Rumtoberfest. Believe me, if I weren't alone and responsible for my own transportation back to camp, I would have stayed and had a few more Rumtoberfests. It was everything I like in a craft beer.  Georgetown was such a great to visit. I know I will be back to camp at Cedar Breaks. That obviously means that I will be back to the brewery. I only hope they have another beer as awesome as the Oktoberfest and Rumtoberfest. I am sure they are seasonal, and probably won't be on tap next time.

reviews.author: Lee B.
reviews.description: We love this place. The people are very friendly. However, we will not be going back. It is a dog friendly place which we are very supportive of. When you are going to have a dog friendly place then the establishment should make sure that dog poop is not laying around.  We went there when it opened on a Wednesday at 4 pm and when we went to sit down there were 3 Piles of dog poop and the flies were terrible.

reviews.author: Matt D.
reviews.description: Beer: Amazing! Location: Beautiful! Staff: Knowledgeable! Food: Different food trucks on various days of the week giving you fantastic variety.  Overall, a very impressive place!

reviews.author: Karen K.
reviews.description: Great place. They are in the same building as Rentsch. So yes pull into Rentach parking lot. Inside is big but with a bigger outside. Really great outdoor space with a big tree to shade and plenty of seating. Their food truck hadn't opened yet so I got a taco. My husband liked the beer here but the boys and I liked the pop and taco. It was just like a beef and bean md cheese burrito.

reviews.author: Anu S.
reviews.description: Super cute place, dog friendly. When we went there was a delicious Korean food truck. Met some very nice people. Can't wait to visit again!

reviews.author: Adam B.
reviews.description: We were here for an Austin FC watch party and the vibe was awesome. The band was there, they had a huge screen for the game, and the energy was through the roof.   I tried their special beer release, Mikalla Mist, and it was a beautiful, bright, crisp Pilsner! I also had their Belgian style Gold Fist. It was nice and hoppy and perfectly sour. My final beer was a stout and it was something about the Simpsons. It was also really good.  Great place, awesome tacos, fantastic beer.

reviews.author: Steven C.
reviews.description: Beer is great and reasonably-priced with good variety. The food truck out back is far better than it has any right to be, with delicious mexican food at a reasonable price.   I highly recommend the fish and barbacoa tacos, as well as the burrito+quesadilla. The chips/salsa aren't too shabby either.   Haven't tried the burgers so can't comment on those.   If you want an affordable spot to come eat, drink, and be merry in the Austin area, look no further!   Plenty of space to sit inside, or if the weather is nicer, even more space out back! You order everything at the bar, get your beer immediately, and pick up your food from the truck out back if you ordered that.

reviews.author: Junus A.
reviews.description: Megaflora has reinvigorated my love for IPAs, which waned heavily after I hit the quarter century mark. I think it's the hazy kind, and they mix it up with melony goodness (love melons - all kinds of melons). Your palate ends up fielding a fruity punch; no getting your jaw kicked in by puckering hops. Great shit. They made it year round too, with the badass stylized can design and all (most of those ones are seasonal only).  With that being said, please offer La Verdad year round. Please  These dudes' merch game is on point, they really need to take their little stylized logo print for the cans and sell it on more apparel. Whoever does their art is a fucking genius. I love my Cold Glory shirt and my Megaflora mask. I love my Lazer Salad pint glass cup thing. They have a bunch of badass koozie designs. Basically, their merch game is next level already, but I see so much potential. I guess they are keeping their operation relatively small scale, and there are only so many ppl who are going to buy brewery merchandise in central Texas, but I dunno. Love the art.   At the end of the day, though, nobody is going to buy any merchandise if the beer sucks. Beerworks' beer does not suck. The new Eastern Philosophy beer they came out with is a great example of Austin Beerworks' beer not sucking. When I read it was a jasmine tea infused lager (I love jasmine tea) I had to check it out. Super solid, 7.5% but doesn't taste like it. You're supposed to drink it over ice. So novel, so well thought out, and so well executed. ABW's motto (I think) is "Hellbent on Excellence" and they are certainly living up to that standard. I'm so fortunate to live here in Austin with great breweries like ABW. I'll be even more fortunate when I can walk into HEB and buy La Verdad year round, but that'll come in time. Thanks, Austin Beerworks.

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: I  came here the other day with a friend to have a chat and really get ready to center ourselves for the week ahead. I ordered a Lazer Salad which is a double IPA.   Here is the breakdown:   The beer appears as a golden amber color with a one finger head of white  foam. The aroma of the brew gives a tropical fruit vibe with hints of tangerine and mango mixed with some  undertones of a grapefruit hop and a little bit of pine. The taste begins with a tropical fruit sweetness mixed with a  doughy taste. As the taste lingers, more and more hop comes to the  tongue starting out with grapefruit followed by some flavors of an herbal and pine hop. The body of the brew is average in thickness and creaminess  with a carbonation level that is lighter. Overall this is a well-balanced fruity IPA that if you are not careful can put you on your ass!  #supportlocal

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Excellent brewery, parking can be a challenge during the weekend. They have some the finest craft brews on tap in Austin. I have enjoyed their Mexican style lager and other Pilsner style brews. They have some nice tropical IPA to satisfy even the most discerning of beer drinking palates. At least 8 tables outside that have shade, which provide a nice social gathering space to enjoy a sunny Austin afternoon with a beer and some fresh air as you contemplate the mysteries of the Universe.
