There is also a food truck that serves some decent fish tacos.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: I visited Austin Beerworks over the weekend for a benefit/fundraiser event and had a blast! The beer was refreshing and my frozen drink was delicious! I had 2 of the cranberry frozen mimosas, which I could have sipped on all day. I was glad to see they offered other things besides just their beer. The space was perfect for our fundraiser. My kid enjoyed the play area with the hill/tunnel and there were plenty of other kids for her to play with. I'd definitely come back here to hang out with friends or family.

reviews.author: Vanessa S.
reviews.description: A local staple. Everyone knows about this place so don't expect any one on one experiences. Great outdoor area, family friendly, and be on the lookout for events! Don't forget to walk on the right side of the bar for stickers and other treasures

reviews.author: Mina P.
reviews.description: I'm surprised I haven't been here sooner because I love their beer. There's ample seating indoors and outdoor, and they have a great selection of beer.   There was also a food truck that sold burgers, where you had to order at the bar. I would definitely come here again :)

reviews.author: Kasey F.
reviews.description: Visiting on a Sunday afternoon. Plenty of outdoor space. Nice and sunny with umbrellas and patio tables. I ordered a 4beer flight from the 25 or so they offered. They're all good so far. (My only disappointment is that they don't offer a sour. Please, make a sour!!)  Currently waiting on my food order. There's a taco truck here today.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Love this place and love that they have food trucks. Great indoor and outdoor seating as welll

reviews.author: Tristan B.
reviews.description: Solid beers, cool space. Bartenders are a little cold and the tap list while usually varied, can sometimes be a bit lacking.   That aside, still a solid vibe and a good place to meet up with friends.

reviews.author: Lisa C.
reviews.description: Kudos to the staff at Austin Beerworks -- class acts all the way. We were in your original taproom Saturday (March 5) for a Celebration of Life for a friend. Your staff was amazing. It was a perfect way to pay tribute to our friend, and y'all were so great as everyone struggled to leave on time. You could have been rigid about shooing us out the door on the dot, but your staff showed great generosity of spirit toward a grieving group, many of whom were in from out of state. Thanks for creating such a warm, welcoming space for this event. You demonstrated the best of Austin, Texas hospitality and friendliness.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: I feel conflicted giving a fairly low rating given I consistently think of ABW as one of the top handful of breweries in Austin, but I'm giving this as a rating of the taproom experience moreso than a rating of their beers. I've also only gone during Covid, so I'm looking forward to giving them a try in the future when I can comfortably get the full experience.   Compared to other patios in the area I find theirs to be pretty lacking. There were no fans in the summer and no heat lamps in the winter. Their space isn't particularly large so there are fewer tables than other locations. This leads it to be uncomfortably packed on weekends, both in terms of how close tables are and the lack of distancing enforced in lines.   One weird thing working against them is just how available their beer is around town. Every HEB and bar will have at least a couple of ABW's beers available, so they lose out on the necessity of going to the taproom to try their beers. Even their seasonals get around town pretty well both in stores and on tap elsewhere.   On that note, and to not make this review totally negative, their beer is absolutely phenomenal. All their flagships are good to great examples of the style, my personal favorites are the Sun Shovel (think blue moon but with some hop prescence) and Fire Eagle (leans more towards West Coast IPA, but has enough juiciness to be really refreshing in the summer time).   Their seasonals also absolutely knock it out of the park. Sputnik (Coffee Oatmeal Stout) is an absolute must if you're in Austin in December and is probably the best beer I've had since moving here. The Heisenberg (a combination of a Pilsner and Hef) and Black Thunder (Black Lager) are two other stand outs to me.  The food truck is good enough that if you need something to snack on while you're there you won't be totally dissatisfied, but I've usually felt compelled to go elsewhere for food.  Overall, can't recommend their beer enough, but you don't need to visit the taproom to get the full experience.

reviews.author: Scott S.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a couple in the tent on a recent chilly Saturday afternoon. The beer is great and the variety of experimental beers makes for a fun beer day. Good beer people!

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: After three months of sheltering at home, Austin Beer Works was a first outing.  They did an excellent job with social distancing, wiping down each table after guests left, and mask enforcement (when not seated at table) in a firm but polite way.    No inside seating right now and the outdoor tables are shaded and a good distance apart. It is reservations only. depending on the time you make the reservation for, you will either get an hour to enjoy your table or two hours.  They go over all the rules with you when you arrive.  They have some great beers, both on tap and in cans. You can purchase some to take home with you as well!  I ordered a sour raspberry-lemon Einhorn.  So summery and refreshing!  I ended up drinking two.  My husband had an Essential IPA and the Small Spoon session IPA.   We didn't care for the Heisenberg Heff-lager (a bit too banana-ish).  The only thing that would have made the difference from 4 stars to 5 would have been some kind of food! Even a bag of chips or pretzels to go with the beer would have been awesome! We saw a food truck parked there but unfortunately it was not open.

reviews.author: Sherry P.
reviews.description: I like the set up and idea. Inside brewery and seating tables. Outside food truck. Order everything inside.  Comfortable atmosphere, good inside music, and great variety of beers. The tacos and burger are fantastic!   Get you a cold one!

reviews.author: Cameron N.
reviews.description: I don't have anything negative to say about Austin Beerworks other than the occasional difficulty with parking. I've only had that issue a few times though. The staff is incredibly helpful and knowledgable, but I think the best part of the experience (other than the drinks) is the atmosphere. The interior is very spacious which makes it a perfect space for a casual happy hour with coworkers while the exterior has an abundance of seating. I'll definitely be returning if I am ever up that direction!

reviews.author: heather g.
reviews.description: Austin Beer Works doesn't always have Spurs, but when they do, they are THE BEST!! If you haven't tried a Tropical Einhorn and you like spurs, you're missing out!  The staff are AMAZING and the set up both inside and outside are fun. Totally family friendly and they have an awesome food truck on site (permanently)

reviews.author: Novalina N.
reviews.description: Cool that they're open now!  Arrived around 4 and it was busy so waited around 20 minutes before we could be seated  There's no markers on the ground so lines seemed to form in different places when I was there. Didn't particularly like it when people were right behind me (thanks covid). Hope they add these markers soon!

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: I really want to love this place but their service is just terrible. Every single time I come, they make it feel like it's an inconvenience to them that I need a minute to order or if I have a question, they make it seem like I should have their menu memorized.   They do have a larger beer selection for local breweries, parking is hit and miss, outdoor seating is mostly shaded. Inside is picnic seating. There's a food truck here if you get hungry. I feel ok bringing my dogs here.   The service is just that bad that I can't recommend them as much as their beer gives them credit for.

reviews.author: Anthony T.
reviews.description: Chain pizza spot in Austin! Decided to check out their other location since it was actually closer to us vs the one on Burnet rd!  This place is so beautiful and spacious inside! Was pretty crowded since I went during rush hour. Also, parking was a bit difficult to get. There are 3 other big restaurants near by and it gets packed to where people park on the sides.   Same exact menu as what I could remember from the one on Burnet rd. Their service was pretty fast for all the food we got. Started off with the appetizer - Beer mates, basically a cheesy bread. Nothing too special but a good starter if everyone wants more food. Had two medium sized pizza for the 3 of us. Ordered "The Works" "Ohh Lala". The works is basically their deluxe pizza, can't go wrong with that! The Ohh lala was on the sweeter side with the delicious arugula.   There were plenty of beer choices to choose from. Grabbed an IPA (completely forgot the name). Would definitely come back again! ;)

reviews.author: Kevin W.
reviews.description: This place is FANTASTIC!    I had a Caesar salad to start and the dressing was very good.   My choice of pizza was the Honey Pear!  DELICIOUS!!  The crust was a thinner hand tossed/rolled and then topped with:  Extra virgin olive oil, house cheese blend, sliced pears, caramelized onions, prosciutto, basil and local honey. (I had them leave the blue cheese off).   The BEST pizza I've have in ages!!!

reviews.author: Paula P.
reviews.description: Always a go-to for great pizza and microbrew.  Lunch special has some excellent choices to try out different pizzas/salad/pizza roll combinations.  Expect a bit of an adventure trying to find a seat at this location during busy hours. It's a chill place to sit, eat and watch sports or hang out with friends and have a couple of drinks.   Long bench style seating will make it so you may have to sit closer to another group than you may be comfortable with if you are trying to social distance.  Place gets sort of loud so don't expect to be able to have the deep meaningful conversation here.

reviews.author: Hima V.
reviews.description: Loved their pizza! I went to pick up pizza here on my birthday. I ordered the 14' Texas ranch and Margherita and loved the former. Unfortunately, I felt the Margherita was a lil underwhelming. I also noticed how the portion felt smaller than it should be. However, I would recommend to check out this spot for sure.

reviews.author: Doretta W.
reviews.description: Door is around the side towards the back. It is a very convenient walk from several hotels in the area.  If you want to eat... Walk in and turn left to place your order at the counter.  If you want to drink .. walk in and go straight to the bar.  They have salads, apps and several speciality pizzas ... sized from individual to family. You get soda from the fountain (cherry, cream, cola, etc) or beer from the tap (too many to cover here).   There are a few booths and tables but mainly it is community seating at 20' long tables. Kind of cool I think.  TVs everywhere ... watched baseball and ESPN. I bet this place is lit on Sat and Sun for football.  So the food? I really liked the beer mates .. garlic cheese bread. Good size and flavor for just $5. I had the pear honey pizza .. add blue cheese, basil and pancetta. I really liked the way the flavors all stuck out .. sweet, herby, salty ... love it!!

reviews.author: Rosalind A.
reviews.description: Amazing and Fresh!! The taste is pretty close to perfect from the sauce, ingredients, to the bread! First time here, and it's so Delicious! Friendly staff, and great customer service! Yuuuummmmmeeeee!

reviews.author: Susan S.
reviews.description: Very disappointing with the management and owner.  During my visit there, there were two separate tabs so that each of us could use a token. We paid separate bills. The bartender, without my consent, reversed those charges and put them all on a new single charge. Without honoring our tokens. I saw all this once I had gone home and saw my bank account. I only asked to either give us two tokens or refund us the price of two drinks. I reached out twice to management with hearing only crickets. At this point my entire tab should be refunded for lack of consideration and loyalty of a company.

reviews.author: Heather D.
reviews.description: Phenomenal!   The pizza is crafted with fresh ingredients, made quick to order, and absolutely delicious! There is an excellent beer selection, and the staff is super friendly and very helpful. We had a couple of pizzas, garlic cheese bread, a side Caesar salad and 2 beers. Great atmosphere for all ages. Zero complaints. They know what they're doing. We will be back!

reviews.author: Edgar S.
reviews.description: I have ordered pizza for carry out a few times from here and sprinkle in a couple of times eating pizza at their bar with a beer. The pizza is the only thing I have had from here besides beer and I enjoyed it. It has a large dining area and a roomy bar.  The only service I can vouch for is the bar service which was excellent.

reviews.author: Beth R.
reviews.description: The best pizza ever. Pepperoni w/Basil and of course The Armadillo  The salads are fresh and well made; and the BEER! Try the place, you'll see. The service for to-go and eat-in is consistently great. The people that work at the RR location look like they love being there. That's refreshing.

reviews.author: Bob F.
reviews.description: We had a great lunch at Pinthouse Pizza in Round Rock. The pizza was seasoned to perfection and served piping hot. I tried their Electric Jellyfish Beer and recommend it highly. My wife ordered the gluten free crust and said it was the best gluten free pizza she has had. If you are retired and looking for a great place for a long lunch go after 1:30 to avoid the  lunch crowd.

reviews.author: Kim O.
reviews.description: Pinthouse Pizza is the BEST!! Fresh salads, yummy pizza and the best ranch dressing I've ever eaten. Give it a try!

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: Best pizza dough period.  Wings are really good also.  Great selection of beer and you can get them to go if you choose.

reviews.author: Victor D.
reviews.description: Cool spot with lot of choices ! I go here if I want to go with my boys and order my food -  You definitely need to plan ahead for TNF and MNF -/

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: Cool pizza and beer spot (they also have wine too).   Very urban vibes and very popular.  You order your food and drinks at the window and then it is brought to your table. The pizzas are unique and HUGE!   The armadillo was our favorite - sausage and goat cheese?! Yes please!

reviews.author: Adam L.
reviews.description: How can I possibly express how awesome this place is.  The food is outstanding and the crew is such a wonderful family.  Every time we stop in we are welcomed like regulars even tho we are (currently) new.  The cannonball is dope!  The tap selection is on point.    Please don't go tho, it's already so popular I can't find a seat at the bar! :)  J/k. I wouldn't belong in the family if I didn't welcome y'all in to join too!

reviews.author: Diana B.
reviews.description: I'm staying at a hotel next door and ordered take out from here. They have vegan and gluten free options which is great for me! I got a large pint house salad and a small gf cheese. Both were tasty. Customer service was good!

reviews.author: Cynthia V.
reviews.description: This is a good spot to come hang and catch a game on the TV while you enjoy some craft pizzas and beers. You order the food and beer separately, food from a walkup counter and beer from the bar in the middle of the restaurant. You get a buzzer puck when you order food so the servers can locate you and bring it to your table. We ordered the Beer Mates and Pizza Roll appetizers to start and two pizzas, the Oo La La and the Shroomin' Goat. Food timing was staggered and the only real hiccup was that the Beer Mates appetizer order seemed to have gotten lost because we had to ask for it after all the rest of our order had trickled out, and it then took about 15min more for it to finally arrive. But, when it did, it was piping hot and fresh, so that's good. Food quality was very good and we enjoyed everything we ordered.

reviews.author: Pedro R.
reviews.description: Solid Brewery with good pizzas, plenty of options on tap and a new can release every week.

reviews.author: Jonathon S.
reviews.description: I thought the name referred to the beers they serve and while that is probably the inspiration, I find it sad that it also refers to the amount of grease in their pizza (about a pint).  If you love pepperoni or sausage  grease then this is the place for you.   If you don't then don't get these meats on your pizza.  I hope the kitchen learns about skimming  fat off their more flavor proteins to prevent the crust from being a fatty sponge.  Happy Sunday everyone.

reviews.author: Dana T.
reviews.description: Love this place. Lots of good options. I think 8.5 minutes abs is even better than electric jellyfish.  The people that work there are great! Also they host watch parties for Austin FC. Go Verde!

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: I'm writing this review solely based on their Cedrela Hefeweizen. I love Hefeweizen and have drank my fair share while stationed in Germany for four years as well as here in the USA. This was the worst glass of Hefeweizen that I've ever had. It was very disappointing, tasted watered down, and had very little flavor. The Live Oak Brewing Company Hefeweizen is much better, and it's the best I've had in the Austin area. Other than that, the place was clean and the staff was friendly. Again, this review is solely based on their Cedrela Hefeweizen.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Whitestone Brewery is a great place to grab a beer and relax after work or watch an Austin FC game. They have a large patio for all their events like trivia and bingo and plenty of seating inside. Head here for some great Texas beers.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: Great patio that's dog and kid friendly, complete with the Austin Steam Train behind it.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Wow I can't believe I've forgotten to review here. I LOVE their beer and location. Always great beers on rotation and the flight tray is cool.  Only reason for the 4 starts is today we came for what had to be the 6th or 7th  time and got kicked to the outside patio for having a dog. This is ALWAYS the brewery I go to when it's hot because they allowed dogs inside. I've had every other bartender let my dog in, love on him and have had zero problem sitting inside with him. Even their Facebook has a picture of a dog inside. Today we were told that was never allowed and should have been told to go outside. We have also seen many other dogs inside during past visits. I hate inconsistent rules. Also, super sad that we'll have to find a new brewery this summer. It's too hot to be outside and my dogs nickname is the the brewery dog.  I'll still support them during cooler months-- but dog owners should know the rules have changed. Very sad. Wish they would have posted something about this change.

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: Great beer vibe. Plenty of seating inside and outside. Parking kinda sucks.  The menu has a really good range of beers that I haven't seen anywhere else. Beer is cold and food options are good too. We had nachos and loaded tots. The Austin FC bold game was on. They had green beer and if you wore green you got a $1 off

reviews.author: Ryan D.
reviews.description: A nice flight of light non IPA beers. No food. Only a food truck but nice atmosphere indoor/outdoor.

reviews.author: Nancy Z.
reviews.description: Always a great time here! They have Meade, to hop water to yummy Lovely Day IPA.  Clean place and clean toilets.   Don't forget to check out their food truck!

reviews.author: Alexandra P.
reviews.description: Pretty good ambiance. Spaced out seating inside and outdoor seating available. Place was visibly clean and also smelled very clean! We got loaded tots from the food truck outside that were yummy. All the beers that we tried were good but the mango one was my favorite!

reviews.author: Jim R.
reviews.description: Awesome brewery!, excellent selection. Amazing atmosphere!, great service and the food from Van Dams is Awesome with great prices. Just became a Pub Member for these reasons!!!

reviews.author: Ellie B.
reviews.description: Phenomenal - amazing brewery atmosphere. Came on a Christmas holiday Friday night they had name that tune bingo going, was so fun to watch! Wish I had known would've joined ASAP  God I love Texas

reviews.author: Joyce L.
reviews.description: I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Whitestone Brewery. The environment felt very relaxed and casual and I loved the outside patio area. We got a selection of beers, I personally really enjoyed the Mango Crazy wheat beer and the Keyboard Gansta IPA. The service was also very friendly and they offered some samples if you are in between choices.   The taco truck outside was also very good! I highly recommend one of their loaded fries. The fries were perfectly crispy and tender in the middle, and super flavorful toppings. The tacos were also yummy and I'm a huge corn lover so the elote bowl was perfect.   I will definitely be back to try more of their seasonal beers!

reviews.author: Julie Q.
reviews.description: This brewery was so fancy and so nice. The bartender was friendly and patient with us when deciding on what type of beers we wanted to try. I got a flight of various beers which most of them were suggested by the bartenders. They were GOOD. If I get the chance, I WILL be coming back here again. It is also kid friendly. Again, super friendly/nice atmosphere!

reviews.author: Nicolette M.
reviews.description: Ambiance - 9/10 Pricing - 10/10 Staff - 10/10 Food - 10/10   Overall, the service is great! The ladies behind the counter are very nice and loaded with insights about the beers. There's a food truck outside that was delish!! (Tacos and burgers) the al pastor tacos were amazing. We did not try the burgers but from what I've seen/heard it's also very yummy! Whitestone is in a great location in Cedar Park, TX. We are heading to Balcones state park to go hiking but saw this along the way and had to stop in. I'm glad we did!

reviews.author: Manasa D.
reviews.description: It's been a hot minute since I visited Whitestone- I think the last time I was here was in 2016, when it was quieter and a lot more laid back.  Fast forward to 2021 - the city of cedar park and Leander are booming.  There is a huge influx of population. The tables at Whitestone are full, there is a food truck (which is awesome) as a permanent fixture BUT the overall customer experience has left me disappointed.  Maybe because it's a Sunday with lovely weather, the guy behind the bar is done with people, or, he isn't a people person , or, he just didn't like the way I looked? But man was it hard to get him to give me an effing beer without getting hateful glances. Yeesh. Im kinda scared of coming back here now!  That aside, im not really a fan of their beer selection either - the kolsch is OK but I've had better. I guess the biggest advantage is the proximity to both CP and Leander and for the people who live around here.  So, this isn't much of a review rather than a semi rant ?   Also guys- kids have a tendency to move around from one side of the table to the other. They're not capable of sitting still and neither are you. If you'd rather than families stay away, just tell us to our faces.

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Huge covered patio! We stopped by while we were in the area and what a nice brewery to grab a beer at. I had the Blonde beer and it was light and crisp. They had a Food truck hanging outside so if you wanted to partake that was great.   Suggestions- In the guys bathroom the keg should be a little bit higher. Pretty tough for tall guys lol. But, I love the concept.   Moose Out

reviews.author: Chris E.
reviews.description: Very nice place, I came from California to try. Staff was nice, bathrooms were clean and the beer was great!

reviews.author: Sarah D.
reviews.description: Friendly, on top of it staff and great variety in beer. Love the hop water too! We've been coming here since the opening and it just keeps getting better! Love our Whitestone Family!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Great local brewery!  Friendly and helpful staff, great tasting beers and a food truck out back - what else do you need?

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: This is a fun place to hang out in Cedar Park but it is in a busy strip mall. The service is good and you can get some beer flights and the prices are very reasonable. My fianc and I had a good time here and the live music was awesome!  I would definitely go back!

reviews.author: Carlson Z.
reviews.description: What a delightfully quirky brewery! Places like this are in woefully short supply these days. They have a beer it forward board where you can pay in advance to give people you nominate free beers. I hope to see Matthew McConaughey and the three-legged dog to come and collect their free beers one day.

reviews.author: Bob L.
reviews.description: Austin is rich with craft breweries and 4th Tap is an excellent addition to the mix. I went there recently with my son and DIL to enjoy their beer and treat ourselves to some outstanding Laotian street for from the SXSE food truck. My favorite was the coffee stout but the amber ale was worthy of another taste.   Located in the obligatory warehouse area the facilities encourage family and pet attendance. Inside seating has a wide variety of games for those at  a loss for words. Outside seating is ample with umbrellaed picnic tables.   Also, it's within walking distance of Q2 Stadium.   Will I be back?  Youbetcha.

reviews.author: David D.
reviews.description: 4th Tap perfectly brewed beers definitely helped me get through this past year. Now that businesses are starting to reopen they've begun reintroducing some of their staple events like Good Set. Love seeing local comedians while enjoying a delicious flight. Happy that they still have a great food truck available. 4th Tap is such a wonderful addition to our community.

reviews.author: Sasa S.
reviews.description: This was our favorite of the breweries in the area. We tried a handful of their beers across the spectrum of styles (everything from a pumpkin beer to a porter to a sour). They hit the mark in every category. We loved every beer we tried and the staff were super friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Melanie H.
reviews.description: Not only does it have good beer, friendly staff, and a good vibe, 4th Tap also has the most well-supplied (and clean) women's bathrooms of any of the Austin breweries. It may be random, but I'm just so appreciative of any business that thoughtfully provides quality sanitary supplies and handy stuff like hair ties and bobby pins. It's the little things.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: First, I must profess.  As much as I love my hometown of San Antonio, Austin really has it going on regarding the microbrewery/brewpub scene.   There are so many options in the ATX and 4th Tap Brewing should NOT be overlooked. From their awesome craft beers, to their homemade pizzas, this place has it going on!  Beer - they have precanned beers, crowlers and growlers to go, as well as a handful of fresh beer on tap if you want to hang out in this cool joint/  On my visit, they had nine beers on tap, and I settled on the "Can You Dig It" amber ale.  It was definitely good, and I would get it again the next time I visit, but it was pretty similar to an amber ale you can find anywhere else. A little sweet, a little caramel taste to it, and just the right amount of hops - but not too much!  I didn't sample them, but they also have a could of IPAs, a sour, and a couple of different stout types.  Now, let's talk about the food! The pizza is SUPERB! They have several pizzas geared toward carnivores and herbivores alike.  If you don't see a prebuilt pizza that appeals to you, you can always build your own custom pizza.  They also have a handful of salads.  My friends from the ATX shared the 12" "Backdraft" pizza for $12.99 with me.  It was LOADED with huge slices of pepperoni, jalapenos, and house made spicy Italian style sausage. The crust was thin and crispy.  Even if you don't like beer, I recommend stopping by here for a pizza - it.was.that.good!

reviews.author: Eric C.
reviews.description: Wow 4th Tap was amazing tonight.  I love craft beer but was skeptical with covid. I was so surprised when I saw that I could book an outdoor seating table in advance. We booked a table a couple hours before we were planning to meet up.  Staff was super friendly. Beer was great...loved the Running Man, didn't really care for the gingerbread. Outdoor space was nice and spacious. Definitely felt safe during covid times. Food from the truck was delicious. Props to SXSE because their food is absolutely delicious. I had the beef skewers and upgraded to crispy rice. It was so flavorful and delicious.  Thanks 4th tap for the ease of booking a table, keeping things safe during covid, serving delicious beer and having such a great food truck.

reviews.author: Alysa L.
reviews.description: Here's why I luv 4th Tap  1.) Great drinkable, delicious beer!  My current favs are: ALL OF THEM!  haha I'm kidding.  Try Stay Gold and Kung Fu Robot.  They're so good you will want more.    2.) Great staff.  Really nice, accommodating, and they keep everyone's safety in mind by wearing masks and sanitizing ALL THE TIME!  So no CardiB, I won't get Corona virus here!   3.) Great vibe.  As a woman, I often think of, "is it safe for me to drink here alone?"  when out at bars.  I've never had this concern at 4th Tap.  4th Tap is open and bright and has lots of space to be alone or hang with guests.   As I mentioned the staff are great and wear masks and they look out for their guests in other ways, too.    4.) Great bar seats. Great bar seats are an unrated variable and let me tell y'all, I don't slide off these seats!  They're comfy and allow me to drink more beer.  Cause it's all about the beer!

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Pretty basic tap room and smallish brewery, but LOVE the fact they're a co-op! Putting out some decent IPAs and stouts. Offering eight taps to choose from at any given time, including their four core beers and four orbitals. Can order by pint, half pint, and/or flight. Very reasonably priced... and several little options for self entertainment including board games, a TV, and a piano. A must stop if visiting the now named "Austin Craft Beer Corridor" (i.e., there are several breweries in the adjacent area). Support local! Cheers to the shared love of good beers!

reviews.author: Monica D.
reviews.description: I typically like IPAs but 4th Tap has a great blonde ale! The tap room has long tables with a large assortment of board games available. You can also sit in the production area as long as you follow the rules such as "1. Be Cool" and of course, others like don't touch the equipment. The parking area is very limited but the location can be accessed by public transportation. Outside they also had a pizza food truck.    Fun place to hang out!

reviews.author: Lanie L.
reviews.description: Solid brewery, but I wish there was more varieties of beer offered.  I opted for the flight, which is 5 for $12, but you have to go for the 3 core and can only choose 2 orbitals. It's a shame because I didn't care for 1 of the core items, a really fruity gluten-free beer. (I had a sample and didn't really like it).  Fortunately, I asked really nicely if I could swap it out for an orbital, and the employee said she could. But when my cousin tried the same, she was denied.  +2 Vitality (Core): Spring Ale-and their lightest beer they offer. Smooth and good flavor. Perfect for if you're looking for a light beer.  Zephyr (Core): American Pale Ale-A little more hop to it, but still a smooth and light option.   Long Walk-Grapefruit IPA-Light notes of citrus, hoppy, and refreshing. But in an increasingly crowded market of grapefruit beers, this one gets lost.  Mega-Citrus One-Double IPA-Basically a stronger version of Long Walk. To me, it tasted almost identical, which makes me wonder with such a limited menu, this one is offered. (But then again, why did I choose to sample it? Not too sure myself.)  Brick Top-Robust Porter. I'm not a porter drinker. At all. But once I started sipping, I really enjoyed it. This is a popular and enjoyable one.  Sample cup pours are generous and the prices are really good for the amount you get. (I couldn't finish my entire sample flight!). There indoor seating as well as seating 'outside' in the brewery area. There is a ping-pong table, plenty of board games, and apparently, rambunctious wrestling matches that happening quarterly that brings the whole neighborhood out.  I didn't get to see any wrestling happen this time around, so all in all 4th Tap offers good beer at good prices, but I'm looking for something more to wow.

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: 4th Tap? Well it happened to be the 4th brewery I went to on this lovely Friday Evening. Lots of seating area with lots of great beers to sample. They had quite a few decent beers. But for me, what made 4th two truly memorable was the little gaming area they had. Truly unique and super awesome

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: I'm not a beer drinker at all but I love and appreciate this brewery!! They are a part of our Divine Canine "Barks for Beers" and with their wonderful support we are able to provide free therapy dog service in Central Texas. Purchase a pint glass and get free pours at many Austin and area breweries!  The general manager, Erin, is amazing and strongly supports us. Look for us here every May for the entire month. We bring our amazing therapy pups to the brewery to love on everyone.

reviews.author: Scyenna B.
reviews.description: Got this place confused with another.  There are so many Breweries in Austin, it is too much fun. The 4th tap offered a quaint space that wasn't too busy but offered plenty of seating and a great menu.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: Was happy to discover this place so close to where I live. Came here on a Sunday afternoon and it was moderately full. The space is nice and the AC was turned up, so it was a great respite from the heat. Got a flight of their beers and not a bad one in the bunch! The bartenders were very friendly and knowledgeable and were able to make some solid and informed beer recs for my date who had no idea what beer he wanted.   There is even a piano randomly sitting amongst the tables and a random patron got up from his table, chugged the rest of his pint, waltzed over the piano, took a seat and then started playing and belting out Billy's Joel's "Pianoman". A pint w/free entertainment is always a plus!   Can see myself coming back in periodically to check out the new stuff on the rotation

reviews.author: Doug B.
reviews.description: The beers are well crafted. The IPA is fantastic. Kung Fu Robot is a well-balanced and sophisticated IPA. Great afternoon.Oh yeah and they're totally kid friendly.

reviews.author: Angie W.
reviews.description: Great little brewery tucked away from the crowds up north.  Beer was on point.  Service was stellar with friendly bartenders and servers.  We at around playing games, drinking beer, and enjoying the company.  Food truck out front if you want something to nosh on.  Check this place out!

reviews.author: Sam V.
reviews.description: Another unassuming microbrewery in a warehouse that opens into a glorious playground for adults. I wish I had gotten the names of the bartenders because they were so sweet to my mother, who is a lightweight and does not drink alcohol, but was feeling adventurous :) They even went out of their way to grab a beer they were out of on tap, but had a can of it in the back for her to try. She loved it, so she got it on the house. Incredible customer service.   There are plenty of large picnic tables in the taproom, and a whole shelf of board games to keep you and guests entertained. There is a grand piano off to the side of the room, so you know fun times are had here.   In the brew house, there is more seating, a wrestling ring (not sure I get it?), and a ping pong table! Game on.   I really enjoyed the grapefruit hints of the Longwalk as well as the tamarind acidity of the Renewal. Tasting is highly encouraged here as well. My family and I enjoyed ourselves immensely. At the end of the night, I paid a $12 tab! Great drinkin' to do on a budget!  Thanks for taking care of us and for being awesome at life!   -xoxo

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: My first time at this spot. You walk in and it's an open space well developed. Bench seating isn't comfy but allows large groups to fit together. You get to taste before you buy. Then there is the back area where they brew. Ping pong, bean bag toss and a wrestling ring. Yep. We ordered pizza and they brought it right in.

reviews.author: Jennifer J.
reviews.description: Great beer and a different vibe/scene than most other places! Hoping to come back the next time we're in town!

reviews.author: Brad D.
reviews.description: Great patio, beers, seltzers and food in NE Austin industrial space. Family friendly! B

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Finally made it to trying out the infamous Cuban Quesadilla and some local craft beer. Both did not disappoint, very tasty and satisfying. The Verde salsa and the guacamole were nice addition to the flavor profile of my appetizer smorgasbord.  It's a little off the beaten path but worth the journey. Check them out.

reviews.author: George D.
reviews.description: Update?  There's nothing to update, just get here it's awesome! Tonight is "Burger Night"!

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Such a cute spot!!! Indoor and outdoor seating that's dog friendly. There's a gravel area with some games. Tables over a shaded grassy area are also available. Mostly hard seltzer's on tap, but fun flavors. Beer selection was small but covered all the bases. The food they have is small portions but soooo good! Not your traditional pupusa or cortido, but I still enjoyed it. The flour tortillas were really good. Cubano is the perfect beer food though. Such a great brewery and I love that it's in Pflugerville. TVs with sports  and a projector playing a movie we're on the inside.

reviews.author: Gary H.
reviews.description: Great beers, great hard seltzer, and burger night is phenomenal. Cool staff, decent prices, what more do you want? I will be back on the regular.

reviews.author: Travis P.
reviews.description: Great place! Outdoor area is a lot of nice space. Food is a little pricey for how much you get.   Beer is tasty with a nice variety.   A perfect small brewery vibe.

reviews.author: Erin P.
reviews.description: We wanted to check out one of the new breweries in town. The atmosphere here was awesome. Open air tasting room with projector plus great beer garden area. Lots of little games and lighting. I love a place that offers 4oz pours so you can buy ole your own flights. The food was good and fast. Will be back!

reviews.author: Caroline M.
reviews.description: Great environment, welcoming (and mask wearing) staff, dog friendly, delicious food, great assortment of beverages (beers and tasty seltzer's-- like coconut papaya). Plenty of tables and areas to social distance, while supporting a local business!   While we only visited during the soft opening, we know that Willards will be a fantastic addition to the Pflugerville area!   Willards Brewery features the Mojo Austin Food Truck!! (Separate IG accounts by the way) The Cubano Quesadilla, Braised Beef Taco, and Beef and Cheese Pupusa are allllll a must have!!  I recommend the green salsa since it's nice and hot, as well!

reviews.author: Melissa B.
reviews.description: Willards is my new favorite neighborhood brewery. Their beers are all solid and the taproom is a great place to get out of the house safely during covid. I really appreciate that they have a menu that caters to everyone, not just beer drinkers. I love their hard seltzer cocktails and they also have mead and a few guest taps from other breweries. The Mojo food truck is amazing - their pork tacos are to die for!  As far as the physical space goes, the patio is gorgeous and they have campfires going at night to keep you cozy. Everything is very well spaced out, too.

reviews.author: Sierra R.
reviews.description: Willard's is right around the corner from our home, but we tried it for the first time last night (it won't be the last). The first thing you notice as you walk into the beer garden is the nice outdoor space with a pleasant ambiance. They have picnic style tables in and outside, they keep the indoor space very open (making us feel safer during COVID era). The lights outside provide a nice touch, as well as the music- played at a low enough volume that we don't have to raise our voices to hear one another.   Now as for the drinks: their stout is amazing and smooth and very chocolatey. Their seltzers all have such unique taste combinations and are NOT overly sweet, like some of the big name brands. The strawberry tangerine reminded me of a Haribo gummy bear! The coconut papaya was delicious and I went back and forth between tasting the coconut and the papaya most. They even have cocktail like drinks that are good for those who don't enjoy beer or seltzer. My partner ordered the Hazy IPA and liked it enough to buy a six-pack to take home. George was our bartender. He has such a calm and respectful demeanor. He was really great and made the experience of tasting some of the drinks for the first time so pleasant.   The food truck is so reasonable in price and was delicious! It was so nice to have something other than typical bar food. Austin (chef) brings out the orders so quickly and is super kind! Their guacamole is really interesting and we all devoured it, their salsas are spicy and fresh, and they even have a mushroom taco with a black bean puree for those of us who don't eat meat. Everyone at our table enjoyed the food (other items ordered were pork nachos, Cuban quesadilla, and the pupusa).   Overall we loved our experience, and will definitely be back to visit this hidden treasure.

reviews.author: TD C.
reviews.description: We had never been and had been looking for pooch friendly places and that sealed our decision. Tried the place on a Sunday afternoon and expected more patrons there were only 3 other tables. Great service from the employees offering tasting of different beers and seltzer's and you've got to try the Mojo Cuban food truck - can recommend the quesadilla for sure. Look for us on a Sunday with our Am Staf puppy named Daisy.

reviews.author: Jerry H.
reviews.description: I love this place nice  and layed back and my dog she loves it there good brew good food great scene  and great service !

reviews.author: Tara D.
reviews.description: Willard's Brewery has some of the best beer I've ever had! Right now they're selling 3 beers that you can order online or in the brewery for pick-up - a Helles lager, pale ale and hazy IPA. They are absolutely delicious and the can designs are awesome too. The brewery will be opening up their taproom and beer garden in September...can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Zane Z.
reviews.description: Super cool place in an upcoming area. Great drink selections and a really good happy hour. Had the Fistfull of Fury and October Fest while my wife had the Jenny Lane Seltzer. We both really enjoyed our drinks. They have food too which is an added bonus. Definitely check this neighborhood brewery out!

reviews.author: Dave L.
reviews.description: The little brewery I'll definitely go back wonderful stouts and porters  just waiting on barley wine

reviews.author: Wendy B.
reviews.description: We love Willards! Latest: Come out to watch games on the projector screen. Soccer, basketball, etc. We want to make sure this great option for watching sports is supported and sticks around! Call ahead if you like to make sure your game is on, and invite lots of friends! Long haul: We started going as a covid-friendly option and came to love everything about it. I can't speak to the beer, but I drink the small but good selection of wine and eat the food. The food is really special, honestly. Small but perfect menu. Elevated cuisine for a casual setting. The space outside is so cute. It's thoughtfully landscaped to feel like a getaway whether you're at a picnic table or sitting around the fire. The dog watching is ON POINT too. The people make the place, as everyone that works there has been so kind to us during covid and now beyond. It was nice to have a home away from home in unexpected times, and we are still going! It's a fun place to be, so get a group together for HH or dinner!

reviews.author: Kaitlyn A.
reviews.description: Great new brewery in north Austin!  Had a sneak peak at their offerings and all three beer styles were amazing.  Very excited to try the food truck - Mojo, which is opening for business this weekend.  Can't go wrong with great beer and tacos along with a beautiful beer garden. I'm in!

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: If you have never tried Adelbert's, what are you waiting for? Adelbert's is located in a prime location near Burnet and more predominately, the Domain. Skip the crowd at Rock Rose Ave and come to Adlbert's instead. Not a single thing I would change about Adelbert's!    Adelbert's serves more than just brews, they also serve ciders, meads, wines, and non-alcoholic beverages. If you have never had meads, I'd start slow with a sample, as it's very potent in flavor! The Dale was refreshing, while the Sauvignon Blanc was a crisp white wine.   If you are wanting to host events of any kind, Adelbert's is here for it. Scott, the owner and Sean, the manager are incredibly accommodating!! They were so sweet to open early and to even allow the food truck on site to help cater to us. If you are looking for a quick tour, you can ask them as well to check out their facilities.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: I really like the beer here. I love the $18 flight and the pint glass you get to take home at the end is the coolest pint glass I've ever owned. Unfortunately, they do not allow dogs inside. As a dog owner who lives in the brewery district, this establishment is simply off my list anytime I go out with my little gal.   I do love this place but it's hard to give a perfect score to a place I can't frequent. Especially when they have ~10 competitors in a 5 minute radius and none of them share the same policy. As a result, I am updating my review from 5 to 4 stars.

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: Cool Staff, great beer, really good vibes all around.

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: This place is on my Covid-19 safe list. They will continue to require masks.

reviews.author: Cynthia L.
reviews.description: I sampled a flight of their Belgian style beers and enjoyed them all. The staff was polite, and the food from the Emoji food truck was tasty and reasonably priced.

reviews.author: Dan P.
reviews.description: Overall vibe: relaxed, quirky Austin  Service: good beer knowledge. Hillary was very nice at the counter.  Beer: excellent quality. Great Friday from raspberry wheat beer to Belgian style ale  Overall cleanliness: above average  Price: average for good craft beer

reviews.author: Chris T.
reviews.description: This is a nice stop. The entryway can get a slight bottleneck, just be patient. The beer is worth the wait. I got the seasonal raspberry beer that was brewed for owner daughter wedding, oh my gosh! Delicious and refreshing. I ended up buying a 6 pack to take home. I think it is gone now, but so good!

reviews.author: Rishi R.
reviews.description: Great people. Great drinks. An awesome time. My fav is the mald wine. Darts in the back food truck out front

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Large spacious venue with plenty of outdoor seating as well. I love that have arcade games and foosball, fun spot for a group. Come thristy.

reviews.author: Alex C.
reviews.description: I'm a fan of dark Belgian style beer that's not too sweet so Adalbert's gets five stars right away.  I love the Philosophizer and the October Rust.  There seems to be good social distancing. There's hand sanitizer on the counter. Growlers are a possibility as are CDB sodas. The people are friendly and seem to know about the beer. I only discovered this place after the pandemic it started so I've never really spent time inside. But I've been sitting on my own porch enjoying it quite a bit and when things get back to normal I hope to spend a few hours at Adelbert's.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: This brewery is a 10/10 if Yelp let give this opinion I would. The bartender was absolutely amazing giving me amazing recommendations. The GM proceeded to stay late with us and show us the absolute best of the best mead I have ever had. He was amazing the bartender was amazing and if I ever re-vist Austin this is a must have on the to do list. Do NOT miss out on this amazing experience. Do not go to Austin beer works this place is literally 10x better if not more.

reviews.author: Saunya O.
reviews.description: This was a great brewery to go to after work for drinks with friends or coworkers. I love the idea that's you are actually in the brewery itself.   The neat thing is that they have artwork that's for sale on the walls. The art adds character and is a large variety of different themes all from local artists.   No good is served inside the brewery but there is a really good food truck on the outside.   The beers are amazing and you can sample before you buy.  Liked this brewery and beers are very creative.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Love coming here and just hanging out. The bartenders are always very sweet and willing to let you try things before you get a whole glass. I always enjoy their IPAs. They have a food truck outside with I think chicken I usually just get the fresh popped popcorn it's delicious and great to snack on while drinking beer. They have a Nintendo Wii with Mario kart and two old-school arcade games they also have a Foos ball table and darts. There's also boardgames that you can check out with giving them your ID, an awesome place to hang out with friends, kids and dogs!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: I had my first Adelbert's beer through HEB, with their Naked Nun witbier. I have been hooked since then and finally made it into their tasting room.   It. Was. Heaven. They have an outdoors area that's shaded for those with doggos or who want to enjoy the heat and eat from their food truck. I had the Triple B, which was surprisingly crisp and floral for a belgian. They had a variety of beers which I wanted to taste, but we arrived late with one hour to spare before closing. That just means I need to pay another visit to truly enjoy the place.  They have a private parking area shared with neighboring businesses and strong wifi. The best part is the indoors games like 4-player Mario Kart (WHAT!), darts, and a bunch of board games. They also give free stickers, plus our lady taptender that day was so kind and welcoming.

reviews.author: Tisha T.
reviews.description: Met up with some work peeps for a happy hour of sorts. I originally didn't plan to attend since it's a brewery and I hate beer with a passion. However I checked out their site, saw they had some wine options and a food truck--so I happily tagged along. The bartender who greeted us gave us the rundown of everything. Served us with a smile and was very informative about the beers, of course. I had a great bottle of pinot grigio while my friends enjoyed the various beers available. I had a great time checking out the art that they have on the walls for sale. We also played a game of jumbo sized connect four and Mario Kart on the big screen. A large collection of board games are also available to borrow while hanging out enjoying your drink in the taproom. Very cool place, warm vibes. Great food truck on site as well.  Definitely will return soon and bring my beer drinking friends.

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: Really good beer at Adebert's. Lots of cool wood barrels and lots of people around for a fun Friday Night. At certain times you can challenge the bartender to a game of Mario Kart which is truly unique but just add the the overall great experience at Adelbert's

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: This place is great! Get the wristband if you're a first timer- only $15 for six "half pours" which are definitely more like 3/4 pours haha  The mango wit, naked nun, and hibiscus saison are AMAZINGGG.   Cool art, live music, food truck (although they left early, which sucked).  The only real disappointment? The brewery closes at 10- we coulda stayed all night!

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Three words: Belgium style brews! Oh my goodness, where have you been hiding from me Adelbert's?! This is by far one of my most favorite craft breweries in all of Austin, if not in the United States. For those of you that really know me, you know that I L.O.V.E. Belgian beers...so much so that, yes, I traveled to Belgium JUST for the beers (okay, I ate some mussels and saw some pretty cool stuff too, but...). For those of you not in the know (no insult meant for those who are), Belgian style beers are pretty high in ABV, so amateurs enter gently. Just looking out for my Yeeps! :D  Adelbert's doesn't look like much at all from the outside. Tucked away in a warehouse district, it can a tad difficult to find, particularly at night - just look for the little white lights and the picnic tables outside. Park, walk through the plastic flat "doors" and you will discover a beautiful huge space with stacks and stacks of barrels, merchandise for sale, lots of local art hanging on the walls to purchase adds to the ambiance; plus games to play such as giant Jenga, foosball, and darts and that's one fine outing.   But the beer! Oh my gosh - the beer. Handcrafted at its best. So amazingly fantastic and such a great deal. On your first visit be certain to buy the 6 half pour (really close to full pours - yay) tastings for $13. You get to keep the glass and get $2 off beers when you bring it back on your next visit. Regular prices range from $4-6 a glass, which is phenominal in the first place for such high quality ale.   ALL great, two personal standouts for me were: *Flyin' Monks Quadrupel: 10.9%ABV, aged in rum barrels with hints of spice, deep, dark, and lovely. *Philosophizer Saison: An easy choice. 7.8% ABV, very mild carbonation with a hint of pepper. Fantastic.     To add some icing to this already oh so sweet find, the founder and brewmaster Scott and staff cannot be any more friendly or knowledgeable about the beers and brewery.   Highly highly highly recommend. Simply doesn't get better than this IMHO. Cheers!  TIPS:  *The brewery has a license so you can take a large bottle home for a reasonable price of about $9 to $12, which is average. They also sell retail at area Austin locations (visit their website for exact locations).  *Tours are available (see website for details).   *They typically have a food truck on site on Saturdays.  *Fido friendly pergola area - not allowed inside.

reviews.author: Sam V.
reviews.description: Ya'll are probably already aware of my latest and greatest obsession with collecting pint glasses from assorted breweries. For our first stop in Austin, we stopped by this unassuming warehouse. As we walked in, the live jazz band was jammin' and the beer taps were flowin'.   Michael and his bearded friend were fantastic bartenders. I really appreciated their hospitality. Michael instantly could tell I was new to this particular brewery and proceeded to explain the process to tasting their beer samples. He even noted that I had a minor with me and offered a brewed hibiscus tea for him. They really cater to all ages! We paid $13 for six half poured samples from a souvenir Belgian tasting glass. One yellow wristband later, my siblings and I were playing ping-pong and giant Jenga in the back of the warehouse.  The stringed lights on the ceiling made it feel welcome and homey. They had a wall of local art for sale ranging from $30-$300! I had my eye on a Sinatra painting, and as luck would have it, it was indeed the $300 piece lol. I stared at it longingly for most of the night, but couldn't bring myself to throw down on it. My favorite craft brews of the night were the Naked Nun and the Philosophizer. Brilliant names and great hoppy flavors.  Once it got too muggy in the taproom, we ventured out to get some grub. The food truck of the night was Emoji Grilled Cheese. (See their yelp site for my review) It was mouthwatering and delicious. We visited a couple other breweries throughout our trip, but Adelbert's was my all-time favorite.   Thanks for a great time!   -xoxoxo

reviews.author: James R.
reviews.description: Great place to spend an afternoon. This another place where you pay a fee, get a glass and then you get 6 pours of whatever they have on tap. I could only do 4 pours due to a time constraint but what I had was very tasty. The mango wit was a standout for me as I could actually taste the mango unlike some other brews which lose that flavor in the process. Black Rhino was also very tasty. Besides the good beers the place has TVs and games and most importantly art to sell! If I hadn't been flying on that trip there were a couple of pieces I was interested in. Overall a worthy stop in Austin instead of having to drive to Dripping Springs for good beer.

name: The Growler Bar and Kitchen
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jose H.
reviews.description: Recommend: Yes! You'll appreciate the experience ("We've been there." Stripes) Location and Parking: small strip mall (around three businesses). Small parking lot... We went during the weekday so it wasn't too busy. Seating: its a small location, best estimate is (six tables inside and three tables outside with umbrellas) 50ish. Not including bar seating (several stools). Drinks options: more of a beer location (great options). Food: Pizza and Wings. Star ratings on the food experience...? Four. Why did i give the Yelp rating five stars, you ask? For the overall experience and result of trying a new place.--I hope this rating contributes to your dining decision. :-)

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: A revisit to one of my favorite spots in Texas, the Growler Bar - 2022 review.   I love coming here when it's not busy, which I'm finding is becoming more and more difficult as time passes. The place has built up a solid base of loyal customers that seem to return week after week and I can't blame them. There is consistency at work here, the staff is always excellent - they make great recommendations to the ever-changing list of beers on tap, the selection of beers is constantly rotating, and best of all - the food is delicious. We often consider ordering take-out for only the pizza/pizza rolls here.   This place has adapted to changing times, they have more outdoor seating so we're able to socially distance ourselves most of the time and feel safe during our visit. I'm happy to see this place thrive.

reviews.author: B T.
reviews.description: Very disappointing.    Phone order was ready 20 minutes early, so by the time I got there the pizzas had been waiting. BUT, the wings were not ready and had to wait longer. By the time I got the phone order home, the pizza and pizza rolls were cold, tasted very average and doughy.   I hope the high rating is for the beer, because the pizza and service was far below any one else....

reviews.author: Mary B.
reviews.description: I was in the Pflugerville area and craving pizza. I checked Yelp and this place had great reviews so I headed that way. So first, for some reason, my GPS kept taking me across the street where the Zaxbys and Arbys are located. I finally had the sense to check across the street and there it was! Hard to see from the street, but it's there. Anyways, this is a cool neighborhood pizza and beer bar. Apparently, they change the drafts all the time so you can try different types of beer. Brett at the counter helped me and was very nice. I ordered a pizza to go (pepperoni, Canadian bacon, bacon bits, mushrooms), lemon pepper wings and two Live Oak Hefenweizen beers (yes! You can get two beers to go!). While I waited, I enjoyed yuengling on tap and Brett also let me sample a few beers. The pizza and wings were delicious! I was so hungry that I forgot to take pics, but just trust me, it looked as good as it tasted! I will definitely be back when I'm in the area again.

reviews.author: Jen B.
reviews.description: Popped in on a Sat around noon. Inside seating was nearly full but we managed to snag the last table. There's also plenty of tables outside with umbrellas for those with dogs or don't mind the scorching Texas heat.  The pizza is delicious. I can't remember the name of it but it had Canadian bacon, bacon and a sriracha bbq drizzle on it. Crust was delicious, the bottom wasn't soggy near the center.  Also tried the pretzels with beer cheese. Mmmmmm.   A really big beer selection available as well.   Service was great. You order at the bar, get a number and they bring to your table.   Def worth a visit if you're nearby.

reviews.author: Steve W.
reviews.description: In my previous review, I neglected to mention something important. This is one of those businesses which require you to pay first and they hit you with the gratuity percentage upfront before you receive your food and service.  The gratuity should come at the end of the meal and service, not at the beginning and I have found this practice puts more money in the business' pocket at your expense.  Now with that said, their pizza, wings and pizza rolls are quite exceptional. they have an extensive beer selection which is always changing around to keep up with the seasons. So if paying upfront along with the gratuity doesn't bother you then we do recommend the fare, however I find it a turn off. Especially since they forgot half of our order and didn't get it to us until we were ready to leave. So basically, one star for the payment practice, but four stars for the food and beer.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: The pizza here was fabulous! It reminded us of a place we go in college. The system to get the menu up on my phone hated me so had to get a paper menu from them.  We had a beer called Nola- next time we go I'll get a growler but since we weren't going straight home and forgot a cooler that had to wait. Their beer cheese looks like gravy.. it doesn't taste like gravy though- highly suggest! We will definitely be back next time he visits. Nice large patio and clean bathrooms as well.

reviews.author: Eva S.
reviews.description: Oh where do I begin... GREAT PIZZA!!! Also great for beer fans, clearly. Amazing number of choices. The environment is loud but in the good way that makes you feel comfortable and relaxed. I saw numerous kids here as well so I guess if you have children you don't have to leave them at home for this one. I have to point out, staff wears no masks and they aren't required if you're into that thing.

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Decent selection of craft beers, but one thing unique about this bar is that they do not allow customers to sample any beers, unlike most of their competitors.  I undetstand the policy to a certain extent, especially if you had very knowledgeable bartenders, but that is not the case here.  During my most recent visit, one person I was with asked for an IPA that was very hoppy, But instead got something but was very sour and totally did not like the taste of the beer. She was stuck with paying for the pint, despite the bartender's error.  The pizza (bbq chicken) was decent, but pretty bready - took away from the tasty toppings - left me feeling like we were served a glorified frozen pizza - we were hungry so we devoured the pizza, but we were disappointed and will thing twice before  ordering it again.  They had some live music, a young man with the guitar singing cover songs, did a very decent job. It helped make the dying experience enjoyable.  It was a great night to sit on the patio, with a nice breeze, some decent music being played, and the company of good friends.  Perhaps they could think about modifying their policy so that you're entitled to one beer sample, as long as you order a full beer.  The bartender stated the reason for the no sample policy was because of Covid... I just do not buy it, given the fact that None of the bars/restaurants that I have gone to the last couple of months have this type of policy.

reviews.author: Jonathan R.
reviews.description: Fun local watering hole with an incredible beer selection.   Their pizzas are good, albeit a bit on the doughy side. Wings and other bar food options are surprisingly good as well.   Very popular local spot so this place can get packed. Decent amount of indoor and outdoor seating.   No happy hour which is a bummer.

reviews.author: Laura B.
reviews.description: We got take out and it was exceptional.  So happy to find quality pizza and salad in Pflugerville on par with a couple of premium pizza places in Austin.  Very delicious, black olive and artichoke toppings were generous. The balsamic dressing was good, too.  Check it out!

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: So found this pizza joint in Pflugerville and it did not let me down. Unfortunately I didn't get a pic of the wall of beers since I ate outside to enjoy the cool Texas breeze. The pretzel sticks were hot from the oven. The carnivore pizza had enough meat for four pizzas so come ready to eat. I must say the Hefeweizen was very good and close enough to remind you of Germany if you've been. They have have local bands playing nightly so there's also entertainment. The locals know and if you ever take a trip to the area now you do too.

reviews.author: Wendy T.
reviews.description: Great pizza and bar! Lots of outside seating and lots of options on tap for beers and ciders. I really enjoy their pepperoni rolls.   First time coming here - you order at the bar, they give you a number, and then you take it to whatever table is available and that you choose. Look at the food menu before you come because the food menu is only visible at the counter/bar that you order from. The only bummer to the whole experience was that the number they gave us was not the number they gave the kitchen so the food got lost for a little bit because they were looking for a different number. We got it figured out and it was still delicious!

reviews.author: Evan B.
reviews.description: Service was awesome. Beers were delicious. We ordered Hawaiian pizza rolls and a carnivore calzone. They split the calzone so it was two separate smaller calzones instead which was awesome. The only thing we recommend is the calzone and pizza rolls might have been slightly over cooked as the top of the crusts were very dark and tough. Probably because they cooked it in the same oven and temperature as the pizzas which makes sense. But this wasn't an issue and the food was still great. Loved our experience

reviews.author: Ryan C.
reviews.description: Lots of brews on tap. Food is okay, nothing special. Staff is usually great. I personally wouldn't let kids in a bar/kitchen, but that's me. They have video games for the kids.

reviews.author: Janice J.
reviews.description: The beer selection here is unmatched in the area....and they have tons of cider, seltzer, wine, and non-alcoholic selections too! The pizza is actually quite good (and I'm a midwestern pizza snob) and the service honestly really makes it. Their servers are so friendly and all throughout the COVID restrictions, they followed the protocols and managed to still make it a fun place to go to. We even hit up a couple of Trivia nights with friends on accident and scored some gift cards and had a blast. My only reason for taking a star off were the wings. We tried them a couple of times but the thick, rubbery fat and lack of crispiness were big turnoffs - seemed like they weren't fried but maybe baked? In any case not good. We've got plenty of other deliciousness there, though, so we just order everything else!

reviews.author: Kyle B.
reviews.description: Definitely a great spot to sample any type of beer you can think of. They also have ciders and some wine as well. I've only had the pizza there once and it was great as well.

reviews.author: Lauren M.
reviews.description: The pizza here is so good. It's always a hit with the family. This is visit #2 for us and we'll be back again.    During CoVid, you can opt for curbside contactless pickup to make things easy.   You can get 32 or 64 oz growlers along with some delicious food. Pizza and wings were a hit for the family tonight.

reviews.author: Jennifer K.
reviews.description: We visited here 3 times before posting this review. Underwhelmed is my best description. All times, the beertenders have not been very friendly. This last time, the beertender sat taking our order (yes, he was sitting behind the bar) and had no suggestions or enthusiasm.  There is no way to order without going inside the bar. During covid, there should be options for this!  The pizza is okay. If you are looking for pepperoni rolls, Pinthouse are much better in my opinion.  We may return for specific beers, but it won't be on our regular rotation with other options in the area.

reviews.author: Selena V.
reviews.description: LET ME START THIS OFF BY SAYING I AM A FOODIE and HAVE EXPECTATIONS THAT I AM NOT PROUD OF BUT I COME FROM A CULINARY BACKGROUND...  This is my favorite place to come with my fianc. We bring all of our friends here. Holly is a delightful bartender who has gone above and beyond for us.   Wonderful selections of beer, cider, wine, kombucha, etc..  For food, go with any flavor the wings (lemon pepper and garlic parm are my favorite). The pizza rolls are divine and freshly made. You also can't go wrong with the pizza.   They also have live music and outside seating. Perfect place for date night or to chill with friends. I HIGHLY recommend it.

name: Red Horn Coffee House and Brewing Company
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: A.J. T.
reviews.description: Stumbled upon this place while walking the area as my car was being worked on across the way. Walking in gave me comforting coffeeshop vibes, with mostly tables of small parties 2-3 drinking beer and socializing.  Having no idea what to order, staff made some recommendations for a flight that were all fantastic. My favorites were the Cuerno Rojo (lightly carbonated and very smooth) and the Continental Breakfast (heavier stout but tastes just like French Toast and Maple syrup). I had to do a double take that I wasn't just drinking syrup but the flavors were spot on!  I'll be back again with friends/family and hopefully get to enjoy the great coffee I was smelling as well!

reviews.author: Eric N.
reviews.description: Excellent spot! Great beer made in house! Love the new menu items! Very cool vibe. Need a place to enjoy good coffee or beer this is it!

reviews.author: Amberly F.
reviews.description: Met the girls for some high noon drinks. Definitely a busy place. We were excited to actually get a spot to sit with only 4 of us. The options here were so amazing and such a fun mix. I did enjoy that even when I ordered coffee they asked if I wanted to start a tab as if I was at a bar. This place was loud and seemed like a great place to enjoy some fun. They do have outdoor seating with heaters and covered. All in all I'd say I will go back again but maybe not on a weekend next time.

reviews.author: Isac F.
reviews.description: Amazing coffee.  They definitely dont let down here.  Always something solid and bold.  Atmosphere is great for the right person. I wear hearing aids and its a little loud for me.  For some peeps this would be great ambiance.   I recommend this play to anyone looking for a good hangout place.

reviews.author: Corey W.
reviews.description: Solid place to work remote, good coffee, great beer, tasty tacos, and friendly staff. I like to come up here on fridays and work from the bar.

reviews.author: Elissa S.
reviews.description: Nice little spot in Cedar Park! I met up with a friend here; it was my first time. It was surprisingly busy for a Thursday mid-morning but we scored the plushy chairs near the window. Food and drink were both great, as was the customer service. I thought it was interesting that they served both coffee and beer.

reviews.author: Jennifer L.
reviews.description: Fall in love with this hidden gem in Cedar Park. The place is clean, cozy with outstanding services. The hot panini is the bomb.

reviews.author: Crystal Z.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere, you can get work done here, great spot to meet up with friends and have a drink, they do have a good menu  all round chill spot to hang out at. Definitely stop by to check it out with friends or cool remote work / study spot!

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: Just wanted to update this one. Red Horn just gets better and better with age and has really turned into a community institution - especially during the pandemic when they switched to "to go" beers that we could all take out to the parking lot and drink while socially distanced. Fortunately those days are past us but I think I will always have a soft spot in my heart for this place that was a little bit of sanity amidst all the insanity.   As for the fare itself? The beers rotate and you can't  go wrong because they will always let you sample (I'm a strawberry pop-tart ravioli fan - and yes that's a beer). Pair that beer (or wine) with a meat and cheese tray or maybe a panini and you have absolutely nothing to complain about. They even have food trucks on most days...  Thanks for being here Red Horn.

reviews.author: Michelle J.
reviews.description: Another great coffee and more place. They serve food and alcoholic. Live music sometimes. Great ambience for working or date night.

reviews.author: Kevin P.
reviews.description: Both locations offer good coffee and craft beer brewed locally. Simple earthy laid back environment great for quick social gatherings or transitional business engagements. This isn't Starbucks or a. ar so adjust your expectations. Unique and fairly priced.

reviews.author: Garrett N.
reviews.description: Love me some Red Horn coffee!   The atmosphere and service are both outstanding.  Any questions I had about coffee were answered, the help was super helpful.  Really appreciate the indoor and outdoor seating.  Really live the tables and decor, rustic hand built feel but comfortable.  Snack food is overpriced but everything else is top notch.

reviews.author: Shari M.
reviews.description: Excellent beer and coffee with friendly service. Nice atmosphere inside and outside. Only complaint is that as someone with dietary restrictions, there is no food on the menu I can eat. But my husband lives the food, so...

reviews.author: Gerald C.
reviews.description: very cool atmosphere with both a brewery and coffee shop vibe mashed together without clashing. I got the Gordon Ramsey coffee and it was obviously made by someone who knows how to craft a latte. I do wish the flavor complimented the espresso more or punched above the espresso. It was too balanced, if that's even a thing. I will definitely return next time i'm in town to see what pieces of coffee art they come up with next!

reviews.author: Milton C.
reviews.description: We chose Red Horn Coffee after perusing local coffee spots for some good coffee. Red Horn was very highly rated and the photos looked like they offered genuine espresso beverages. Red Horn offered a number of non-dairy options so I would not destroy my stomach on my pending road trip. We ordered Americans with a half inch of steamed oat milk. The coffee was very smooth. The espresso taste was still solid enough that I knew I was drinking espresso. I.e. Not watered down at all. All-in-all a great cup of coffee that hit the spot.

reviews.author: LisaK B.
reviews.description: This is a neat place and my friend loves it -- but she likes beer and Ales, and I just -- don't.  There was a choice of 3-4 red wines, and white wine, too. But I don't believe in spending $12 a glass for wine -- especially at a coffee/brew  pub.  While they listed an $8 or $9 red wine (on a menu in front of register), they conveniently only had the $12  wine.  It is a neat place, I "get" that people like it, but I don't plan to return.  I can go across the street, get good food and drinks at happy hour, or lunch.  And not feel ripped off.  (the serving size seemed less than average, too).

reviews.author: Anna C.
reviews.description: Not sure where to fault this place, honestly. First time here and the three beers we tried were excellent: a nitro double IPA, an black ale, and a Czech pilz. The interior ambiance was dark, cozy, and perfect for an intimate convo, remote work, or even games with friends. I have two small children so helped myself to the outdoor covered and heated patio. The kids enjoyed the chips and salsa while we sipped our stellar brews. Excited to try the Leander location that is actually closer to us. 10/10 plan to come back, especially to try the coffee.

reviews.author: Jenny K.
reviews.description: I'll be back soon!! One of the best coffees I've had, so good I had two during my short stay here. It's hard to find decaf that isn't boring and the decaf here is strong and full of flavor! I even purchased a pound of decaf beans to take home.   I pulled up and my first thought was that the vibe was more brewery than coffee shop and I was right, but I was wrong that the coffee would just be an afterthought. When I went on a Saturday early afternoon, there was a taco truck and people hanging out in the beer garden. Lots of bicyclists and not sure if it's a popular rest stop or because there's a bike shop in the same parking lot or both or something else. Once you step inside there is a giant section of beer taps and beer menu, and a small coffee and pastry menu. They also sell ice cream here which was tempting but I stuck to my americano and later a vanilla latte.   The inside has plenty of socially distanced seating as does the outside and I lucked out with a parking spot right out front. There's a large lot of shared parking for the businesses.   I want to come back to check out their beers!!

reviews.author: Mel B.
