reviews.description: One of our favorite places to grab a few beer. They always excellent elections, we love the space and the people. So beer....good; but man their roasted coffee! We love using their Roadhouse in our French press.

reviews.author: Carrie J.
reviews.description: Sometime I struggle to decide if I want coffee or beer here, and at happy hour I am definitely know to order both! You will not be disappointed. An excellent coffee shop in the morning to meet with co-workers to do some brainstorming with excellent coffee or a wonder patio for a chill evening and great beer or wine. They have a great menu to pick from too, so you not stuck with just pretzels. I personally like the vegetable panini, and my husband like the cheese board.

reviews.author: Jason M.
reviews.description: This place puts every other beer store in ATX to shame. The variety of options here seems endless. The dude behind the counter knows more about beer than most sommeliers know about wine. That's just icing on the cake. They get every limited release and seasonal that drops. Prices can be a little steep but hella worth it.

reviews.author: Josh P.
reviews.description: If you haven't been to The Brewtique in Cedar Park, you definitely should check it out.   Anytime you stop by, you'll meet either the owner or his wife and they are both nice and very helpful. You can pretty much buy anything they have in singles and they always have their inventory listed online along with the untapped rating for each beer, which I find very useful. They have a solid selection of local stuff and occasionally some more rare stuff as well. If you're immunocompromised, you can call your order in and they'll bring it to your car; they also have a very sanitary setup inside and require masks (of course) and make everyone use the hand sanitizer when you come in. We've been there about 5 times mixing that in with buying direct from breweries but I really love the diversity you can get while supporting local at the Brewtique

reviews.author: Greg M.
reviews.description: Great place to try out a new beer then buy a six-pack or two. We had a couple beers each (they sell singles if you are hanging out) and then bought some to take home. Taco Truck pilsner was great, Mama Pisner, and there was a pickle beer that was probably a tad too pickley for me (go figure).  Great/fun selection, good prices, knowledgeable staff, and lots of picnic tables out to keep you spread out and safe. You can get snacks too, or play Starship Troopers pinball (Do You Want To Know More?!?). We had  a good time just chilling there on a Sunday afternoon.  Oh, and they recycle those plastic can holders that craft breweries use. Bring yours back to help out the brewers in town!

reviews.author: Philip J.
reviews.description: Really impressive beer bar and shop in Cedar Park. If you're a bit of a beer geek, head over here and you're sure to find some new stuff you haven't tried before. If you're more beer curious, head over and chat with these friendly folks. They know their stuff and helped me to pick out some new beers.  There's a good range of price points here too so you could find a good gift here.   Website is also really useful and lists out everything they have if you like to head in with some ideas of what to grab.   Good atmosphere in there too if you're drinking in.   Overall highly recommend and glad they are here.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: A craft beer lover's nirvana. Come here peruse their extensive inventory pick out a beer and enjoy either on site or grab a few brews to go. I could go on but that's it. Come here and drink good beer, but.  These guys got it goin (sic) on where else can you find a Maine Brewing Co beers or a selection of IPAs that will blow your mind.   Folks here are friendly and of course knowledgable and provide a high level of customer service. Case in point I was out of town and a pal informed me that they had a very hard to find beer available. These nice folks held my order until I arrived, almost at closing time.  Nice folks and righteous brews!

reviews.author: Meg K.
reviews.description: Such a cool spot. I don't live in Cedar Park but I'll be making regular trips here to check out the cool beverages!

reviews.author: Greg W.
reviews.description: Review time kids!! So the bride is out of town for business, what does any good husband do???? He meets some buds for suds!!   We all met at another place for happy hour when bud 1 recommend this place for some take home treats. I mean,come on, we know a beer-n-burger nut like me can't say no.  This place is totally chill with a few picnic tables to relax and converse with friends. There is also a couple of other chairs if that's your thing. Sampling on sight is totally cool too.  On to the selection of beers. All I can say is,if you can't find something here that you would like, go home,empty handed and admit you have no taste. That's right, I threw the blame squarely on you! Why? Because they must have better than 300-400 different beers to choose from!  Now go, prove me wrong and try that chocolate oatmeal stout or triple ipa !!

reviews.author: Whitney B.
reviews.description: I really can't say enough good things about the Brewtique.  They have an amazing variety of drinks and they're always bringing in new items. The team is incredibly helpful, very knowledgeable about their products, and all around just a couple of really cool folks.  Just tell them what you're in the mood for, and you'll absolutely receive a satisfying recommendation.  They're dog-friendly both in and outside, and are super welcoming to well-behaved pooches. They also do some really cool charity events on behalf of some great organizations. There's almost always something going on in the evenings -- live music, comedy shows, football games, game night, beer tastings.  They also have some neat retro arcade games and board games on hand to entertain.  There's always a reason to pop in and have a drinks!

reviews.author: Dan S.
reviews.description: Great place. Owner always remembers you and knows what you like. They keep an amazing selection that is always changing. If you want to try some beers they have tables inside and outside. Personally love the selection of Texas beers and sours they have.

reviews.author: Short Fuse S.
reviews.description: Just a fantastic place. I had a friend come in from San Antonio and he kept saying he wished there was a place like The Brewtique in his neighborhood. There's a great beer selection, and the owner is a really cool dude. Plus, they carry my favorite beer even though I'm the only one who buys it. That's dedication to customers!

reviews.author: Javier A.
reviews.description: What can I say about Brewtique that hasn't already been said? Great and various beers available here keep me coming back and back. Mgmt is top notch, friendly, and above all knowledgeable. I am always impressed with the ambiance. It feels like a great big community. Service with a smile and a laugh makes my trip there memorable. Also they have great events, live music, and  board games to boot! 3 cheers and a beer for Brewtique.

reviews.author: Jarod P.
reviews.description: Love this place. Great selection. Knowledgeable owners.  Fair prices.  If you remember this location when it was under previous owners, you'll find it's been nicely updated, more tables, chairs and such, even arcade games.  Keep up the good work Brewtique.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: Cool little place, glad to see that the old bottle shop here was replaced by another. Owner(s?) seem to care a bunch, and have been available to point out new releases/limited beers, make recommendations, and take pics of my dog.   Prices slightly higher than other big retailers, but selection is much better (tip: check their Instagram for limited beers and new stock). Also, a good selection of CBD products for those interested. I have never hung around to drink there, but you can for a small per-beer charge if you want.   Hope this place keeps getting tasty limited beverages and doesn't turn into a vape emporium like the last one!

reviews.author: Catalina M.
reviews.description: Welcome to cedar park the brewtique! Had the absolute pleasure of coming here today. Great atmosphere, awesome beer selection and such a friendly welcoming owner.  The bottle shop that lived here prior (RIP) was great, but the new layout and even better beer selection really sets this place apart! Such a plethora of great beers and a cool little shop you can crack one open and enjoy it right there! Looking forward to my next visit!

reviews.author: kenneth m.
reviews.description: The Brewtique has the best selection of fresh beer in the area. Prices are more than fare, and the staff tends to go above and beyond to answer questions.  Bathroom is always clean and stocked with soft and plush 2-ply charmin, they don't skimp on the good stuff! The owner was quite nice and helped me carry my order to my car, even sent me a nice wink and a smile while I was pulling out.

reviews.author: Matthew M.
reviews.description: Need a beer? I mean a great beer? Do you want to enjoy it while killer music played? How about suggested by avid beer enthusiasts. Well, you're home. Enough said. This place hits all the check boxes. Fast WiFi for work, big tables for games. Endless beer.

reviews.author: Luis P.
reviews.description: Craft Beer. Wine. Cider. A great neighborhood little store that always has something that the big stores don't carry. All you have to do is to ask, and they'll give a great recommendation. It's probably the thing you'll always want to do as they carry seemingly hundreds of brands of beer.   And it seems like they are trying to bring more cool events to the Cedar Park area like Comedy nights and Movie nights. Check it out and check out their vintage pinball machines!

reviews.author: Justin C.
reviews.description: If you haven't been here, please stop by. This place is absolutely wonderful. Every time I go in, always greeted and asked if I need anything. There is always something special for a random night of the week. The price to pop a top is great, individual cans or packs is really nice. Exactly what a bottle shop should be. Looking forward to the future of this place. Best of luck.

reviews.author: Marion W.
reviews.description: Absolutely amazing. Great selection of beers. Really fun to pick out singles and drink them there or take them home for later. They have a lot of fun events throughout the week like game night, comedy night, and brewer educational events. The passion is obvious with the owners, and they're super friendly to boot. They're building a great community in a cool location. We love coming here and are so thrilled to have such a cool place so close to home!!

reviews.author: Christy B.
reviews.description: I love this place!  The beer selection is amazing, and the owners are above and beyond welcoming!  Every time I walk through the front door to grab one of their new arrivals, Scott and Jana greet me like an old friend.  Also it has so much more to offer than just beer, everything from game night to comedy shows and little bit everything else in between.

name: Tony C's Pizza and Beer Garden

reviews.author: Haley Z.
reviews.description: Great place to watch sporting events! Lots of places to sit and be able to view the many televisions. The area inside is very open and spacious. Outside there are a few tables around the side of the building. We are transplants from WI and we asked for a tv to be changed to a Packer game and the beer tenders were happy to oblige. Wonderful, attentive service and conversation. All staff keeps busy even on slow days and makes sure everything looks spotless and that everyone is helped.   Decent craft beer selections on draft and they run affordable specials. Food is fairly average in flavor, but comes out hot and fresh. The atmosphere, service, and prices have us coming back often.

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: First of all, we like the location of this restaurant, it's close by to us and we see ourselves coming in to grab a quick bite and drink at the bar area. They have a small but decent selection of beer on tap that we're bound to revisit.   All the food we ordered was very average -  we could find better pizza, fries, fried mushrooms,10 minutes in any direction. However, it's very spacious inside and even during lunch time on a weekend, the mood felt pretty relaxed (maybe it was an off-day?). A good spot to bring friends for having a few drinks and a conversation.

reviews.author: James M.
reviews.description: Strike 1 - Maybe I have a donato pizza, sub olives add jalapeos. Cashier: There is an up charge to sub ingredients. Me: Do you subtract the cost if I remove an ingredient . Cashier : no.   Me: whatever let me get jalapeos  Cashier : we don't have jalapeos EVER.  Me: walks out.

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: First timer and I was not impressed at all. First of all they don't offer jalapeos on their pizzas which is a unpardonable sin in Texas, and an instant turn off for me. I guess they do realize they're doing business in Texas ?!?! I had the Carnivore which was alright at best. It has Salami, Pepperoni, Sausage, Meatballs, Pizza Sauce, Mozzarella, and Calabrian Peppers. I did add several shakes of the red pepper flakes to at least give it some kick. The fried mushrooms were good as was the Hefeweizen. My son had the Bianco which has Cream, Olive Oil, Fresh Mozzarella, Ricotta, Roasted Garlic, and Basil. He said it was very good. He also had the Sublimely Self-Righteous beer. They offer several menu choices for food as well as several beers. The staff was very friendly and the place was very clean. We might return but it won't be anytime soon as we won't be rushing to return.

reviews.author: Shauna S.
reviews.description: Rather underwhelmed with today's order. Do better guys...  It was on time and I appreciated that

reviews.author: Paulo C.
reviews.description: Go Tony go go Go Tony go go Tony C Goode  He used to carry his flour in a gunny sack To bake his favorit garlic knot snack  The customers would come to eat the pizza he made Delighting with the flavor that deserves a parade  The people passing by they would stop and say "oh my this pizza is all I want for my birthday"   Go go Go Tony go go Go Tony go go Tony C. Goode

reviews.author: Keith P.
reviews.description: This place is pretty good. The pizza has decent pull and taste. We got cheese pizza, a muffuletta pizza, and a garlic knots. I would say I preferred the cheese pizza. The specialty was a bit salty from the tapenade. The knots were wrapped like cinnamon rolls... cute! The were just a bit tough though. The marinara that came with it was good too. I am gonna try the margherita next time.

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: We have eaten here a few times and always an excellent dining experience at Tony C's Pizza and Beer Garden. Super friendly staff, fresh ingredients, and all public areas are spotlessly clean! This visit The Mr. ordered a small house side salad, which was was a very generous size. He ordered Build Your Own Pizza: pepperoni, salami, mushrooms, and red onions. I ordered the meat lasagna...large enough portion to feed two people. Love the marinara used in the lasagna. It was very light, fresh, and not sweet. (Some places add a lot of sugar to their pasta sauce not Tony C's). Not ordered this visit, but make sure you get the mozzarella sticks, made fresh in house, not Sysco Foods frozen. Photos of those beauties are in my previous review.

reviews.author: Rey B.
reviews.description: Pizza is not easy to get right. Sure, you will always enjoy a pizza because it's freakin pizza. But getting that right formula that keeps you coming back is rare. That's why, up until now, I only have two favorite pizza places (Home Slice and Slap box). But now Tony C's is added to that very small list.   Really good pizza slices with the right balance of meat, cheese and crust. And really great flavor throughout.   Sorry I haven't tried the other menu items ( I'll get to them eventually) but the pizza is so damn good, that it's hard to deviate.   The Round Rock locations is huge with plenty of places to sit and a nice bar area. Highly recommended to pizza lovers.   Oh, and I cleared out an entire Cesar salad. Which is saying a lot for me.

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: We used Door Dash. I added a note to modify my order and they did it exactly the way I asked. Excellent customer service.   The pizza was very different than anything I've had in Austin. Excellent crust, quality toppings and definitely all fresh ingredients. The Carnivore was just spicy enough to make you want to keep going back for more and the Truffle was not your average fake truffle oil flavored pizza. The mild hints of blue cheese and fontina took this over the top!    Support local and eat their pizza - it's delicious!

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: This place is a ton bigger than I expected! Picnic style seating on the inside and a great, comfortable bar area. There's TVs all around the restaurant, so you can catch all the football games! Beer selection covers something for everyone and they had frozen wine drinks that looked good. Half off beer pitchers on Thursday's and half off sangria on sundays.   I've never been one to rave about a salad, but omg the dressing on the Greek salad was out of this world. Even my man was in love and ended up hogging it from me.   I was there to kill time before a baseball, but will most definitely be back for pizza and game watching!

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: Loved popping in to this spot for a quick drink at the bar while we waited for out of town family to arrive. We're from Houston, but have been here to visit several times and...THEIR PIZZA IS BOMB!   Great family place-covers all bases and tastes. Friendly, fun atmosphere with 50's and 69's music playing often. Pizza is even good for takeout, which is quite popular, as well! They also offer salads and LASAGNA! (Marinara or Alfredo sauces) - see my photo of the menu for details!  TONS of seating - long tables for large groups. Nearby, newly-opened LaQuinta Hotel's guests , including sports teams, families, conference attendees, and other large parties, will love coming here, not just for the seating and atmosphere, BUT FOR THE PIZZA!!!  We visit Austin regularly, and always make it a point to visit-whether we dine in, or bring it back with us-that is, provided it makes it back...whole, lol.

reviews.author: Ambie S.
reviews.description: Service is always great and if there is a delay for any reason, they are apologetic and have great attitudes about it. Great experience and we've been here many times.

reviews.author: Oscar R.
reviews.description: Absolutely phenomenal pizza!!! The wifey and I arrived 30 minutes after they opened, we were the second customers there. We ordered the chicken Parmesan pizza as recommended by our cashier and an order of garlic knots. It was a great recommendation.   The garlic knots came out first. They were so warm, soft and garlic buttery! They came with their house made marinara, which was sooo good! Those poor garlic knots were gone just as quick as they arrived.  When the pizza came out, it looked amazing but I was a little concerned the chicken Parmesan might be a bit dry because it kind of looked that way. Let me tell you, the pizza was spot on! The chicken was well seasoned and cooked, definitely not dry. The crust on the pizza was amazing!!! I'm craving it again as I write this review!  The atmosphere was also laid back. They had beautiful wood bench seating, which could accommodate a large party/gathering if the place is not to busy. Service was also excellent.  Honestly, the best pizza I've had in a while! I highly recommend this place if you're in the mood for delicious pizza!

reviews.author: Michelle W.
reviews.description: Delicious!!! We finally got a chance to try this place out. It definitely looks nice from the outside. Beer garden in Round Rock? Yes please! Ordering online and pick up is easy! I scheduled my pick up order in advance so I wouldn't forget.  Food was delicious. No complaints. Really enjoyed the sauce that came with the garlic knots and calamari. Gelato was satisfying. Looking forward to trying another pizza soon!

reviews.author: Ciera D.
reviews.description: Every single person that I encountered was extremely kind and courteous, they treated me very well! They made me feel valued at every turn,  I knew that they wanted me to be there, and that it was a pleasure to serve me. The food was very fresh and flavorful, I'm excited to return!

reviews.author: Elizabeth B.
reviews.description: The garlic rolls were burnt. I threw the Pizza away it was RAW!  Called manager for a refund she said I had to deal with Uber Eats.  It's was Tony's Pizza that burnt the rolls ( tasted like rubber) and served up raw Pizza.   Will never go back!!!

reviews.author: Rhea S.
reviews.description: We were starving so the pizza isn't full and a picture of the fried ravioli is absent. My boyfriend and I had a great time at the the new local pizza joint. We shared the largest size pizza, split a fried ravioli app, and gelato. We also enjoyed a few drinks on HH.  We usually go to slapbox for local pizza, but dare I say it, this place has better pizza in my opinion! Not as greasy and it's closer to us. Their HH runs from 5-7. My boyfriend got 2 October fest beers and I had a glass of PG, a frozen bellini and a sangria, which were all $2-3 off depending on the drink. The frozen bellini was very good and I don't normally drink frozen drinks. I did not care for the sangria at all, though.   Everyone was very friendly. In regards to COVID, everything was very clean from what I saw.   Shoutout to the manager, Catalina! She was very genuine in her table checks and we both believe she's a great asset to their team in QC.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Stopped for lunch here today. This has kind of a Pinthouse Pizza vibe (but more sterile/family oriented and less Austin-ie). Service was great, place was clean, and they seem to be taking COVID restrictions seriously.   The pizza was pretty good. Not as good as Slapbox/600 Degrees but just a notch below (on par with Pinthouse). Came out quick and was hot. Beer selection was pretty good - had a local brewery Oktoberfest.   All in all, worth returning and will try to nudge my kids into agreeing to go here instead of Hat Creek next door.

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: Made our way in last weekend to give this place a try. The restaurant was extremely clean and nicely decorated.   Food: we tried the toasted ravioli, garlic knots, Italian chopped salad and pizza. The food came out quickly and was very tasty. While the prices were not cheap, I do think you get a good value for what you pay for.   The only improvement we'd suggest is letting customers open a tab and be able to order both food and drinks on it. We were told they're already working on this though!

name: URBAN Eat.Drink
accommodations: Good for Breakfast, Brunch, Lunch, Dinner
Best nights on Wednesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Hunter L.
reviews.description: Best whiskey and bourbon selection I've seen in my few years here in Austin, best chicken sandwich of my life, and Darun provided us the BEST service I've ever experienced. He was friendly, he knew the menu, and best of all he helped make our first trip to Urban Eat.Drink a wonderful experience. Will definitely be back! Side note, the truffle fries are also 10/10.

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: I met some business colleagues for dinner at Urban as a couple of us knew this to be a great little place. Since it was cold weather, we ate inside but they have great patio seating for warmer weather.  Decor is modern, not fancy but nice. Owners source from local vendors which I respect and highly support. Service is always good as well.  We all ordered the double cut pork chops and they were flippin' fantastic!! Haven't had them that good in years (Perry's Downtown Austin.) This is an easy to get to hidden gem in downtown Round Rock and definitely worth the drive and absolutely a repeater in my book.  Cheers!

reviews.author: Amy F.
reviews.description: Extraordinarily bad service.   Our server never voluntarily came over to us, we had to flag him down even to order. We ran out of coffee and water several times and had to wait 10+ min, even with asking other servers. The table decided to order a round of drinks but couldn't get him to take our order before we were done with our food. He bodily ran into my mothers wheelchair twice and didn't apologize or say anything - she has bone cancer and it really hurt.  The food was alright, but when you have to ask three people for syrup for pancakes it doesn't really matter because they will be cold by the time you eat.  My husband and I used to really like this place, seems to have really gone downhill.

reviews.author: Scott T.
reviews.description: Nope.   This Croque monsieur was atrocious. $14  It's just a hot ham and cheese sandwich, nothing complicated about that, ingredients + proper execution is all that's needed.  Instead.... I received soggy, barely toasted bread with cold cheese. (Pictured)   Quaint environment. Tasty sausage link. $4

reviews.author: Christina M.
reviews.description: Love coming here for weekend brunch and sitting on the patio! They have great mimosas and love their migas! During the week, love going for lunch or dinner and getting the chicken sandwich!

reviews.author: Kelsy P.
reviews.description: Such a great little spot! Round Rock is full of adorable local restaurants and shops and this is definitely a must if you're settling down or just passing through. I placed an order to go but sat at the bar to wait for a little while. Smallish inside with a great patio space, nice staff, and amazing food! I got the sweet and spicy burger with sweet potato fries and it was exactly what I needed on a Friday. Beware of the habanero paste! My lips were on fire but in a good way. Wish I took a picture but trust me, it was a beautiful burger. My only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 was waiting longer than expected for my food. I placed my order at 4:45, before the dinner rush, and they said about 20 minutes. I got a text saying my order was ready after 20 minutes, arrived, and they said it would be a couple more minutes... or rather another 20 minutes. But I was still very pleased with the quality for the price!

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: Saw really great reviews for this place so we decided to check it out for brunch! They had live music in the outside area.  The brunch food was just average, I think this might be a better spot for dinner. I had a Bloody Mary and it tasted like watery tomato juice with no spice or horseradish. My boyfriend had the shrimp and grits - he really liked the shrimp on it but the grits didn't have much flavor. The best item that we had was the appetizer of chips and queso but we subbed fries instead of chips - SO yummy. The queso was spicy and the fries were so crispy.   We would probably go back for dinner and drinks to see if it's better!

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: This place was okay. Had live music which was the best part. This location is only on the ground, no cool rooftop view. The food was okay. The service was slow, I assume understaffed. The drinks were overpriced.

reviews.author: Hannah B.
reviews.description: This place is cool! The vibe is fun and they have a fair selection of foods. The bacon wrapped quail is to die for!   Our service was a little slow when we ate here. My BLT also had a weird herb flavor to it that I wasn't fond of, others may enjoy it. I personally felt it was a little overpowering.   I recommend eating outdoors as it is in a nice part of downtown round rock

reviews.author: Diane H.
reviews.description: This place is fabulous. Cool little Place tucked away in the corner. The food comes out fresh and very flavourful ... yummmm

reviews.author: Sandra B.
reviews.description: Came here for a quick Sunday brunch with some girl friends! We made a reservation and the put our name on the table which made it feel personalized.   Everyone got pitchers of mimosas but I'm pregnant so not drinking. They all enjoyed them!   All the food that came out looked amazing. I wasn't really feeling anything crazy but the items i got were delicious! The biscuit was fluffy and flakey and everything i wanted.   The sausages were actually huge and so filling. There was a nice flakey crunch to the outside of them which i wasn't expecting but enjoyed. The service was great and so were the portion to cost ratios! Well worth it!

reviews.author: Gary C.
reviews.description: Food was good, cocktails were a little hit and miss.  Appetizers were fantastic, as was the service.

reviews.author: Kevin E.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and our sever was amazing! That's were the good in this breakfast putting with my daughter ends.  Highly disappointed in our actual meal. I ordered Shrimp and Grits and she ordered the Full Monty (American sampler)  Our food was all cold nothing hot or remotely warm. They didn't seem too busy so maybe they are working out some expediting issues. My grits were mediocre at best maybe if they were warm that would be different and the shrimp was fishy and rubbery. I've never had grits that were like a smear on the bottom of the bowl/plate but that's exactly what this was.  My daughter said her eggs tasted off and her fruit was clearly on the brink of, if not already spoiled. The best thing on the plate was the potatoes  I'd give them another shot just maybe not for brunch this time.

reviews.author: Ramimi T.
reviews.description: I went here only once before and it wasn't too too great. I decided to give it another try and I am amazed! One of the best burgers that I've had in a while! The fries paired perfectly with the ranch and the sweet tea was so good! I only had to wait 17 minutes for my food to get out. I will definitely be coming back!

reviews.author: John W.
reviews.description: We hadn't been by here in a little while and we're looking to go somewhere different than "the usual".   The good: We were seated quickly and there were quite a few staff in the restaurant to help so we didn't have to really wait that long for anything. In fact, once's we're done my wife said, "we should start looking for the bill" and here comes the waitress with the bill. This is really surprising in light of the challenges that other restaurants are having with staffing.   I like that this place is in downtown round rock and I like the overall aesthetic with wood beams on the ceilings and the house converted to restaurant feel.   I got a special off of their hatch chili menu and it was very tasty and a pretty decent sized piece of fish.   The not so good: While the food was tasty, I was missing some of the expected hatch chili flavor that I would expect to find when ordering something off a hatch chili menu  My wife's fish was a little tough, but again the flavor was good  If you get cold easily, make sure to bring a sweater. The temperature was pretty frigid and because of the small floor for the restaurant there wasn't really a way to find a spot where the you don't get blown on by the AC.   Wrap-up: All in all the food and service were good. A few tweaks and I think this could be a 5-star review.

reviews.author: Bijal P.
reviews.description: I've been here a few times now I really like the atmosphere it's really calming every time I come.  The customer service to outstanding food and let me not forget the drinks yum.  - happy hour here is a must I paid $6 for my tequila ole fashion yes you heard me right.  It was the most unique drink I've had by far I really appreciate the bar tender going out of her way to make the most delicious drink. FYI I had to have two lmao the ice cube was crystal clear made the drink even more interesting to drink  - overall I always have a great time here whether it's brunch , lunch or a date night great place to a have a good time ( no I did not get drunk lmao )

reviews.author: Paulette A.
reviews.description: Charmingly rustic interior and good food but overpriced for the portion size and mediocre service.    Staff were friendly but noticeably uninterested as some were preoccupied scrolling on their phones and others even hanging out at the bar. Our waitress was at least attentive.   For food I ordered the salmon frittata, and the hubs got the pork belly hash and a $5 orange juice that was clearly brand made and from a bottle that probably cost just as much as the charge of the 8oz we were served. Flavor wise, my food was delicious tho slightly salty. However upon arriving to the table, the pork belly hash looked smaller than my entree. For $16 you'd expect strips of pork belly on top of the sweet potato hash - what you really get is 10% protein, 20% dry biscuit, 30% hash, and 40% arugula garnish. Redeeming quality was the perfectly poached egg.   Definitely a happy hour/small bites spot but wouldn't recommend for brunch or a full meal. For $50, much left to be desired

reviews.author: Adam L.
reviews.description: The folks on staff were all quite nice, but that's about the extent of the good for our experience.  I got a chicken sandwich and my wife got the ribs.  Both were pretty much flavorless and dry, even with sauce.  All in with 2 drinks, soups and meals it was $100 before tip.  The fries were great, but otherwise I don't think I'll bother visiting again.  I wish them the best and may make a trip again just to check in and see if they've sorted stuff out.

reviews.author: Teresa B.
reviews.description: My fianc, baby and I came here for a nice Friday night on the town. We had heard how great it was and was anxious to check it out for ourselves. Upon checking in we were told there was a 45 minute wait...fair enough. We walked to Finley's to grab a quick drink. We were both surprised when we got a text only within 20 mins! When we came back we were greeted by the hostess who was an absolute doll and showed to our table up front. Let me just say - customer service was top notch. Exactly was we hoped for. Our waiter Chandler was amazing! For an appetizer we ordered the bacon wrapped quail. It was superb. We both enjoyed it very much. For our entrees I had a side Caesar salad and the Dry Aged Ribeye (with asparagus and a cheddar potato cake), my fianc had the Pecan Smoked Pork Chop (with asparagus and a cheddar potato cake) and for our 2 year old we ordered a kids meal with Mac and Cheese and Fries.  Let's start with the Pecan Smoked Pork Chop. While it was the tastiest of our entrees it was just a bit slightly overcooked...but delicious despite that. Okay on to the ribeye. I get this is not a steakhouse so I probably shouldn't have ordered it, but I had a craving. For the $45 price tag we were very disappointed. The thin cut steak very under-seasoned. The "cheddar potato cake" was just okay...its basically a mound of mashed potatoes with a cheddar crisp on top. The asparagus was okay but I like the small asparagus better and these were ginormous.  I noticed the baby wasn't eating his mac and cheese and wondered why. It looked like it came from a generic box and once I tasted it I learned why. Oddly enough the dish tasted like it had vinegar in it!! My fianc tasted it and said the same thing. We even let Chandler know when we were leaving.

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: We were Celebrating my daughters both getting new great jobs this week. We wanted a special dinner and we selected this great place. Reservations for 10 were easy as we called first thing today. They save a great table for us. Very nice touch.   We started with a few apps that was great. The chips and dip was perfect. Everyone loved the main courses and the plates were cleared.   We ate inside but went outside after to listen to the singer for a few songs. We love live music and it is so great to have it back.   Great night with family.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Such a cute spot to enjoy the outside, have a drink, and eat some food truck goodness! We got here right when it opened on a Sunday and it quickly filled up. Come early! It was pretty cold, but they had little gas fireplaces all over to keep warm. There is a half indoor area that had heaters. Big area for kids to do their thing. My dogs enjoyed the turf to sun bathe. Beer, wine, and seltzer selection were decent. Unisex restrooms. No TVs! Simply a good spot to chill  Service was great! Can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Patrick J.
reviews.description: I've probably been to the Good Lot at least 5 times since moving out to the Cedar Park area. It's an awesome beer garden with stellar staff and food trucks that are great for any occasion.   The bar area has tons of local beers that they do let you sample. The staff have typically made some great drink suggestions that I always attempt to look out for when buying larger packs at my nearest liquor store.   At this point, I think I've had food from each of their more permanent  food trucks and will say that you really can't go wrong with what you choose. My top favs are the arepas from Four Brothers and the 50/50 burger from the Oink Mobile...in case you have an issue deciding!

reviews.author: Rich_kids_of_yelp Z.
reviews.description: Always a fun time at TGL. Definitely bring your own chair. If children annoy you, this is not the place for you. Children annoy me so this is not my favorite place ATM, but we'll be back during the school day or later on at night.   Glad to have something like this in CP.   To the owner: please discourage remote control cars and soccer balls. Pretty annoying to have my beer knocked over by some kid who thinks he's at the park. Plus the remote control cars are just obnoxious.

reviews.author: David M.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere, live music that's welcoming for everyone. 10/10 beers on tap. Food trucks offers diverse menu for  any mood you're in. Management and bar staff was great

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: Sunday was another really enjoyable afternoon at the good lot with family. Lots of really beautiful, adorable kids with lots of well behaved pets. They have astro turfed the big outdoor area and added more fire pits and tables and it is so freakin beautiful. Another good selection of food trucks , I had shrimp tacos from Redfin and two different draft beers (Again, served in glasses, not paper or plastic. The vibes were very relaxed. I have only one suggestion; Considering the number of little people and the traffic on New Hope, Some sort of a fence along New Hope is in order. I suggest simple metal poles and the green, plastic stuff that comes in rolls that you can get from Lowes or HD. there is a hedge row but there are spaces between. At least until the bushes grow up.

reviews.author: Ted C.
reviews.description: I made the drive up to Cedar Park and my friend was excited to take me here as it had just opened up and seemed to add a streak of cool to my friend's new neighborhood. So, it was midweek around 8pm and while the patio had plenty of folks and there was music going the food trucks were done and they weren't too courteous about letting it be known they were closed or out of food or closing up.   So, the taps were open which allowed me to try out a beer. The staff pouring were definitely friendly, letting me know some of their personal favorites on tap as well as letting me try some out. I did also appreciate that they had some NA options as well and I liked the kombucha they had on tap so much I had two more of those instead of the more adult beverage options they had.  If there was a way to have some of the bar staff cross train with the food truck staff it would make a huge improvement.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: The Good Lot is a wonderful addition to the CP area. Bring your kiddos and your hounds sit outside under the shade or on their covered patio.    Cocktails anyone? I was surprised at their expansive craft beer options. Check out their rotating taps at: https://thegoodlotcp.com/beergarden/drinks/  There are wine, seltzer, and non-acholohol options as well.  When we visited there were 3 food truck options; Yard Bird, Oink, and our favorite The Rice is Right.    Be aware on weekends and when there is live music parking will be a challenge. This has been a point of contention with the neighbors and according to the Good Lot, they are looking to expand the parking area.    Pro tip: Don't park in the adjoining neighborhood park 5 minutes away at the Veterans Memorial Park. Stretch your legs on the way there and work off that beer on the way back.

reviews.author: Oak Z.
reviews.description: As far as I can tell, The Good Lot only has 5 star reviews and for good reason.  It is a great beer garden with plenty of non-beer options as well.  I have always passed by the place and noticed how busy it is most weeknights and especially weekends, but I am certainly pleased with what it brings to the community.  Generally it gets pretty busy after 6PM until close, and parking can be difficult to find.  Carpooling or taking a rideshare would be the best way to do it in my opinion as I would hate to park in front of someone else's house in the nice neighborhoods nearby.  Certainly a parking lot expansion is something the owners are considering as that is my only issue with the place especially when it gets busy.  That being said, it is always a great atmosphere with a variety of food and drink options.  There are also always lots of dogs in the grassy area by the patio and it is nice to see how family-friendly the place is.  I will certainly be back and bring some friends in the future!

reviews.author: Julia G.
reviews.description: This is such a cool place! I planned an outing in Cedar Park with a group of my girlfriends. After our outing at the Ecuadorian chocolate factory, we needed a place that could accommodate a fairly large group of friends during lunch time on a Friday (a task that seemed.... yikes). I am very thankful I stumbled across The Good Lot on Yelp! I reached out to make sure The Good Lot could accommodate us, and they said "Of Course" and let me know that all of the trucks would be out on Friday.    When we arrived, we were pleasantly surprised to find several open food trucks and a large building (see, beer bar). People had their dogs outside and everyone seemed to be having a good time.   Between all of us, we tried every food truck. I personally got Four Brothers Venezuelan Kitchen. I am a sucker for good Venezuelan food. I got a Pulled pork Bowl with extra garlic sauce, black beans, avocado, sweet plantains, and all the fixings. I would definitely eat here again. I tried a few samples from other food trucks as well.   Everyone left super happy. This is a great place to go if you have a casual group looking for a quick bite and place to hang out.    The next day (Saturday), I swung by the dog park across the street and stopped by again for lunch on my way home. They have trivia nights, live music over the weekends, and happy hour all day on Monday. Please build another location close to Fort Hood. A copy and paste of exactly what you already created would be great. ;). I promise to stop by weekly.

reviews.author: Joe B.
reviews.description: Jesse is a rude person, don't recommend ever coming here . Waste of time. We had 7 people with us, and he wanted it

reviews.author: john g.
reviews.description: This place is pretty cool.   They have a partial circle of food trucks about 5 or 5.  Various choices of food trucks that all serve really damn good food.  We ordered from 3 of the trucks and everything was awesome. Each trucks menu is limited but they do it well!  Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: What a fun local spot here in the CP! Been wanting to come check out for awhile now and finally drive out last night and closed the place down!!! (sorry guys, we were the last ones to leave)  Parking is nuts so plan ahead and maybe carpool... We drive a jeep so we had no issues ... live music and plenty of smiling faces.. service was great, bathrooms were clean... dogs welcome! Plenty of good beers, wines and ciders... gals were so nice behind the bar.. offered samples and were super sweet... good folks, good music and good grub.... my son joined us and grabbed some food from the food trucks... cauliflower wings, shrimp fried rice and macaroni and cheese... so so good.... bring your chairs/ blanket to sit on because tables and chairs are hard to snag... the lines are long for drinks but they go fast.... We will be back for sure! We feel right at home here. If you like fresh air and freedom... come here.. if you are afraid of fresh air and human contact, probably should go to Austin and be amongst others who feel that way... Merica!

reviews.author: Dane S.
reviews.description: My daughter and I visited The Good Lot yesterday (8/8/21).  It's the new and hot food truck and bar spot in Cedar Park TX (2500 W New Hope). The Good Lot has a main building with a large dining area enclosed by glass garage doors that open and a bar that has numerous beers, ales, ciders, and craft sodas.  It's nestled among the oak trees. There is a nice amount of paved parking and gravel lot parking.   The Good Lot also has dining areas under the oaks along with a game area (corn hole) and a playground for the kids with a large wooden teepee for climbing.  They are dog friendly.   The Good Lot had 4 food trucks.  We chose The Rice Is Right that serves Korean inspired rice boxes and other items.  We ordered the crispy chicken box and the cauliflower box.  Both items were perfectly fried and coated in a sweet and spicy Korean sauce.  Flavor was amazing.  The boxes came with steamed white rice and a purple cabbage slaw.  The portions were large and more than enough food for us. There were other food trucks that served Mediterranean, Pork, and Chicken.  The menus look good and I will explore those in the future.  The Good Lot and The Rice Is Right are on 'My Keepers List'.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: The Good Lot is the new spot to hit up in Cedar Park off New Hope. Food trailers here, beer on tap, covered patio, great outdoor seats and space, place for kids and pets. It has only been open for 3 weeks and the word is getting out. As we were leaving tonight, the park lot was pretty full. Great place to relax with buddies after work or with the family with a wooden teepee for the kids to climb and corn hole. Head over to The Good Lot and get some food from The Rice is Right and Oink Mobile.

reviews.author: Rain S.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed this place and plan on visiting more in the future. They have a great beer selection, multiple food trucks and decent amount of seating! I happened to visit on a Tuesday and to my delight, they had trivia. I think this place is a great option if you are hoping to grab a beer and chill!

reviews.author: Nick P.
reviews.description: After we took our dogs to the dog park nearby, we noticed that the Good Lot had finally opened! The beer selection was great, lots of locals including Whitestone, Hedgehog, Red Horn, Family Brewing and (of course) some lovely PHP Jellyfish on tap.  We decided to tried Yaadbird, since we hadn't had any fried chicken in a while. The lemon pepper chicken was on point, crispy, juicy, peppery, a 'lil salty, and everything you need in your fried chicken!  The property is beautiful and well landscaped. The lawn was amazing! It was so fluffy! When we first arrived we just admired the live oak trees and the quality of the grass.. Lawn lovers, you will understand...  The bartenders were very nice and very excited to introduce so many new people to the Good Lot. The owner was all over the bar, pouring drinks, helping staff, and checking with guests, seeming to have time for everyone.  We are looking forward to coming back here and trying the 3 other food trucks, along with the rotating beer menu. Hope they are planning to host more events, as we would love to do an anniversary party here at some point!

reviews.author: Ben F.
reviews.description: Finally, a really great beer garden in Cedar Park. I came on their first "soft public open" day and I'm so glad I did. I've been to about 20 pubs and bars in CP and this one stands head and shoulders above the rest. It's an open air (no AC but there is heat in the winter) with big garage doors that were open and a huge ceiling fan so it was comfortable. There were about 20 taps and 3 of them were not filled yet. I chatted with the owner and she said she was looking for ideas so my friend Greg gave her some. :)  There is plenty of indoor seating. Plus, there is a huge grassy area with picnic tables and even a fire pit. It's family-friendly so no smoking.  There is a playground for the kids and spots for four food trucks although only two were filled.   Beer was about $6 on average so not cheap but not expensive either. $1 off all day on Mondays.   It was an enjoyable experience and a really great ambience. I'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Lauren R.
reviews.description: I have been dying to go since this place opened and we finally got the chance today. No disappointments here! This place is non-smoking, dog-friendly (leashed) and kid-friendly, with a unique play area, six sets of cornhole, and plenty of shaded grassy area to run around in. Tables are wide and comfortable, and the entire patio was open-air, so social distancing is a breeze. We ate at the Oinkmobile truck (delicious) and grabbed local beers and ciders at the patio desk. We walked the fifteen minutes from our house, but it looks like they have a decent-sized parking lot and are working on creating more space. The only downside is that there's no ramp down to the grass/play area, but hopefully they'll make it more accessible in the future. Staff was super friendly, and I can't wait to come back for open mic night. Because yes, we'll be back!!

reviews.author: Ashley H.
reviews.description: Food trucks are delicious. Wish there was one or two more but that will come with time. The beer selection is great, mimosas as well. Outside area is clean, and safe for kids. Glad this place opened up! It's a little gem!!

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: Found out The Good Lot opened last Saturday so we had to head over. We arrived and got in line to get a beer (lots of local options which you love to see!). Once we got a drink, we were lucky enough to snag a table under the fans and the breeze was so nice. They had live music while we were there, which I believe will continue on weekends so that's fun. The lawn looked so nice, chairs to sit in, trees for shade, lawn games for entertainment! There were 4 or 5 food truck options while we were there and while we didn't get any food, all the food we saw coming out looked so good! Definitely recommend stopping by and checking it out!

name: Salt Traders Coastal Cooking
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Thursday, Saturday

reviews.author: Gill S.
reviews.description: Round Rock struck gold with having this place open their second location here. In a sea of mediocrity surrounding this business ground, lies a place that offers not only fresh seafood, but actually chef driven concoctions that taste good! The environment has the ability to feel casual and formal at the same time. We couldn't score a table as a walk in, but they do have community tables which we ended up having to ourselves as a group of four. Our server had the memory of an elephant and had a way of elegantly displaying all the ingredients and preparations of any dish in question without feeling like he's reading a script. I ordered quite a bit and got to sample a generous variety of items.   They have a modest selection of raw oysters, with almost all of them being from the east coast and residing from PEI. I imagine this has to do more with what their distributors can get their hands on, but I'm gonna guess they mostly stick to east coast oysters.   The crab fried rice doesn't look like anything special, but goddamn is this good! They use huge chunks of crab meat! The rice was fluffy, buttery, and the black garlic was a nice touch. I like that this isnt a mountain of a dish but rather an appetizer. Absolutely worth getting.   The Tuna tartare stack was much better than anything I imagined! Avocado slices on the bottom are aesthetically pleasing, but are an annoyance when your sharing among friends and don't want to destroy the structure of the stack to divide up the slices.  The peel and eat shrimp were my least favorite part of the meal. I really couldn't taste much of a shrimp flavor. You had to use the cocktail sauce in order to taste anything. Perhaps they didn't get the best batch in from their distributor, but I expect fresh shrimp to have more flavor than my ice water.   The Snapper collard was not exactly what I was expecting, so removing my expectations, it was good for what it was. I thought I was getting Hamachi Kama. What they serve is the whole collar of a snapper, breaded and deep fried. The meat off the jowls (if you can classify it as that) was flaky soft and juicy. The breading is reminiscing of a typical fish fry. It was good, but for my personal preference, its not something Id go out of my way to order.  They offer some good guacamole. They give you what seems like three whole avocados worth in the bowl. The chips they provide do taste good, but they have terrible structure for the thick guacamole you're attempting to scoop up. I ended up having to use a spoon to distribute the guac on any chip I ate.   Bbq shrimp was not at all what I was expecting. Yes the shrimp itself was good, but the sauce they use in it was a umami explosion of flavor. I could drank a gallon of that stuff. I keep the plate and sopped up as much sauce as I could with the grilled bread they provided.   Ceviche tostada was excellent. Well dressed, plenty of meat, plenty of veggies, and full of flavor. They give you two small tostadas, rather than one large chip.    The bread and butter was ok, but I personally think the bread was a little tough. I do like that it was sourdough and could smell it. The whipped butter is standard and nothing to comment on.   I didn't order any of their cocktails, since none of them interested me, but my friends told me they make well concocted drinks.  While the experience itself had some tiny missteps, it would be a misrepresentation not to give this place glowing accolades, especially considering the other options nearby.

reviews.author: Patrick J.
reviews.description: I came across Salt Traders while looking for some good eats in the Round Rock area and after eating there I felt the experience was underwhelming. The food wasn't bad, but not as good as I was expecting. My fish and shrimp platter had pretty decent flavor but barely had much shrimp or fries.   The grilled oysters were the biggest highlight of my experience here. I enjoyed those more than I thought I would and would recommend ordering them as a starter. I am assuming they don't use the gulf oysters that they serve for these because the texture, size, and flavor felt pretty different.

reviews.author: Priscila M.
reviews.description: We were headed to IKEA and decided to have lunch nearby. I was able to convince my husband to try something new and he is very thankful for that  It was past 1pm on a Friday and this place was already packed. The decor is pretty nice. It has this coastal vibe that immediately transports you to the shore.  I asked for a gluten free menu and they do have one! Win!  Right away our server brought us the smoked salmon sampler. For my husband with chips, for me with a cucumber as I'm gf. I ordered the clam chowda and it was simply AMAZING. The best one I have eva had! It is very creamy, a bit on the salty side which is never a problem for me, the clam wasn't chewy and the bacon was a great addition. The leeks just added a bit more flavor to that. It's perfect. I would highly recommend you try it.  For mains my husband went with the fried shrimp , fish and fries and he said it was phenomenal. I could only take a picture when he had already had all the shrimp. As you can see the fish fillet is very thick, therefore it's really moist inside. He also said the tartar sauce was outstanding with the perfect addition of lime to break the fat of the mayo.  I had the pan seared scallops with butternut squash pure, roasted sweet corn and bacon bits. The flavor profile was really interesting. Scallops were very fresh and with that awesome sear on the outside, but still very moist on the inside. The butternut squash brings some sweetness to play which goes very well with the corn and we have the crispy bacon to add some saltiness and also some more texture to the plate. Just wish there was a bit more food.  For dessert we had the flourless chocolate cherry pie. Thank God for gf options!!! And also some decaf coffee. The towelettes just add that additional care to the whole service and more charm to the place.  I highly recommend this place!

reviews.author: Lakisha T.
reviews.description: Each time I come here, it's always pretty busy and crowded. Today, it was quite the opposite. I guess Texas folks ain't about this cold life (me either, truth be told). Anyways, we had reservations for 3:30 but arrived like 2:45 and was seated immediately. If you know me, then you know I love my seafood. And I literally come and binge on the appetizers.   Well nothing have changed, seafood is still amazing, drinks are great and services is outstanding!

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Salt Traders Coastal Cooking is so good! I don't know why I haven't written a review since now. I love this place. This time I got the lobster Mac n Cheese and asparagus with ceviche tostadas as an app. I've never had something I didn't like. If you haven't been, now is the time. There is a Round Rock and Zilker location. Yum.

reviews.author: Krasti Q.
reviews.description: This restaurant is a 5 out of 5 for me. I absolutely enjoy eating here. The raw oysters are always my favorite to snack on (tip: on Mondays, their gulf oysters are only $1). I've also tried their chowda fries which are delicious. It's everything you would expect with chowder but better because you also get fries (this dish itself can be heavy and filling). Definitely one to try if you're looking for something to warm your soul. Their lobster roll is good too. I love the lobster meat but I wish they served it as a warm, hot sandwich rather than the chilled one. Nonetheless, still delicious!   Now don't get me started on their dessert which is also worth noting here. All their desserts are made in-house but there is one that really hits the spot. This dessert has a warm chocolate brownie topped with a scoop of Vanilla ice cream and drizzled with caramel. If heaven was a dish, that would be it because it just transports you into another world. Worth saving some room in your stomach for!

reviews.author: Brian O.
reviews.description: We've been a fan of Salt Trader's Costal Cooking in RR since their opening five years ago and not surprisingly we dine there 2-1 over Jack Allen's, our previous go-to place. We've never had a less than wonderful experience there with the diverse menu and bold bright flavors and textures of amazingly prepared seafood and American cuisine and wonderful drinks.  The newly transformed Flat Top Fish Tacos are unbelievably good as the two hearty tacos are prepared Birria style with caramelized cheese crust on the flour tortilla and with substantial amount of grilled black drum with a street corn filling along with the cup of aromatic tomato-shrimp soppin broth and tomatillo-lime rice with pickled chilis.   Other favorites include Grilled Oysters and Fried Oyster Lettuce Wraps for Starters and the  Fish Enchiladas and of course fresh Oysters and Daily Specials and Seasonal Deserts.  FLAT TOP FISH TACOS 17 crispy cheese flour tortilla, street corn,  tomatillo lime rice, pickled chilis,  charred tomato-shrimp soppin' broth

reviews.author: Jacob C.
reviews.description: We've now been here a few times, even brought friends and family and have never been disappointed. Tonight, Jacob was our server and he brought all the positive vibes this places gives off. Food was great, drinks were A+, and we appreciate this chain and the owner more and more every-time we come. Can't go wrong stopping by and exploring this place.

reviews.author: Shauna S.
reviews.description: Sliding into this spot we had no clue what to expect. We loved everything we had. From the yummy and yes ma'am potent Margaritas to the apps we all shared. The service was on point and the food was plated beautifully. It felt very decadent and I don't even care for seafood. I personally recommend the hush puppies. The dessert pictured was coconut mousse with a pineapple sorbet. Everything we ate left us happy and ready to head in back here ASAP. Yes please and thank you...

reviews.author: Edgar S.
reviews.description: This restaurant has been on my todo list since it opened. I stopped by a few times before but it was just too busy and I didn't want to wait. Finally I decided to get smart and make a reservation. Arrived and was seated almost immediately. The waiter (Skylar) was very professional and made good recommendations. He stopped by often to make sure we were ok. The food is amazing and is not over seasoned.

reviews.author: Jill L.
reviews.description: Consistent, excellent service and food. I've eaten here probably a dozen times, sometimes with a group and other times with my husband, at busy times and relaxed times, weekends and during the week. My favorite dishes are: ceviche, lobster roll, and for a lighter day, the trout waldorf salad. Cocktails are exceptional and this place is always spotless.

reviews.author: Amanda D.
reviews.description: The poached shrimp is majestic. Smoked salmon dip. Oysters and champagne! I loved they closed one eye on my bringing my pup in a bag.

reviews.author: Lydia P.
reviews.description: Solid seafood place. We ordered a couple of apps and oysters, and they were good. The oysters were fresh but nothing outstanding. I also wish they had a stronger horseradish. Their horseradish came shredded instead of as a sauce, and it barely had a taste. The ceviche was great and so were the hush puppies, but I personally wish the hush puppies had more corn. We also ordered drinks- The Rum Around and Frozen Grapefruit Rita- which were really good and strong.

reviews.author: Teresa K.
reviews.description: Yum!!! This place is awesome and I'll definitely be back. Loved the lobster roll..check it out!

reviews.author: Jim N.
reviews.description: We found ourselves in Round Rock, TX on a recent Saturday, early evening, so we decided to stop by Salt Traders Costal Cooking on IH 35.  We found a couple of open seats at the bar.  Our first orders were a couple of craft cocktails, the Gin and Housemaid Tonic and The Rum Around.  Both were good, but upon reflection, for the price, regular cocktails would have sufficed.    We kind of went crazy on appetizers, having Gulf oysters, grilled oysters, crab fingers, and the crudo plate, which was yellowfin.  All of those dishes were "off the chart" crazy good, with the exception of the crudo ... the white sauce used was way too sweet for the awesome fish.    When we finally ended up at the main section of the menu, we ordered the fried oyster lettuce wraps and the simply grilled fish of the day, which was redfish.  The tartar sauce served with the lettuce wraps was delicious, but a bit too much was slathered on the wraps.  IMHO put a dash on the lettuce leaves and let the patron add as desired from the small cup of tartar sauce that comes with the dish.  The redfish was terrific, but no one knew why the place would have farm-raised redfish from the Indian Ocean when we have fresh redfish 200 miles away in the Gulf of Mexico?    Keeping it local, we ordered the Becker Vineyard Reserve Viognier, and it was delicious.  In closing, a special shout out to our waiter Nathan behind the bar, service was attentive but not intrusive, so nice to have a great waiter with a great attitude!

reviews.author: Mildred A.
reviews.description: Hannah made my experience great! She went above and beyond to make sure I was satisfied during my time here!  Parking: there is a parking lot Reservations: im not sure if you can make reservations but I would suggest it. Although, the wait isn't too bad  Food: I got a very basic meal( lol), I got the the fried fish and shrimp and was not disappointed  Honorable mention: tried the New Orleans bbq shrimp and the pasta- i wasn't a huge fan- my taste buds said it was too salty foe me- but my friend enjoyed them  Drinks: i really wanted a spicy margarita and Hannah made sure that she got it to my liking, which I truly appreciated!

reviews.author: Dylan K.
reviews.description: Really high end modern cuisine in an unexpected area. North Round Rock really isn't the place you'd think of for high quality seafood and a great classy bar scene, but that's exactly what this place had.  My wife had the scallops and they were seared perfectly and tender in the middle. Couldn't ask for better.  I had a fish sandwich, but I'm picky so I did it without the slaw, which was a mistake because it needed the crunch and the sauce. I'm sure it would be a 10/10 with that.  Definitely go to this place. We were treated like gold and the food was excellent!

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: We love everything about Salt Trader's.  First and foremost the 512 Cocktail. It is perfection. Sometimes I crave it and we go just so I can grab that drink. Haha! The food is outstanding. Every single thing. We've never made a bad selection. Their crudo of the day is always a favorite.  Dang now I'm craving Salt Trader's again. Haha!

reviews.author: Angela M.
reviews.description: Always a great visit! The chowda fries are one of my favorite things on the menu. That has a crispy shrimp bowl as a special and I hope they bring it back! The shrimp were luscious and delicious and it was a huge portion. Service is always amazing and they've upgraded their HVAC system so I feel comfortable dining here.

reviews.author: Susan E.
reviews.description: For my birthday, I chose to visit Salt Traders. We hadn't been there in a little while, and good seafood is always a treat.   My husband and I arrived in the early side, during happy hour (3:30-6:30 on a Thursday), so we could enjoy a leisurely meal. We started with drinks. I had the frozen grapefruit margarita, which tasted like a regular margarita. I loved that the salt on the glass also had citrus peel.  Our appetizer ($5 off during happy hour) was pot stickers. They were excellent, and the portion size (6) just right for sharing. The sauce was wonderful.   I ordered one of the day's specials for dinner, seared monkfish. It was served over fingerling potatoes and topped with a great salsa. The monkfish was tasty  but a bit on the chewy side... and the potatoes were barely undercooked. My husband had fish and chips, always a good choice at Salt Traders.  Dessert was vanilla creme brulee topped with peach sorbet. Excellent!   Service was excellent. We enjoyed Patrick's sense of humor and the stories he told.   We will be back again, without a doubt!

name: Slap Box Pizzicheria
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Private Lot Parking

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: Best pizza in Round Rock.  Huge beer selection (on tap) and a great location.  Love this place.

reviews.author: J. F.
reviews.description: Mediocre food and service.  Lukewarm pizza slice,  wilted cucumbers on the salad and had to get up to get silverware.  Watched others have to get up to get their silverware too.  What's so hard about bringing a knife and fork when the busboy drops off a salad?  Half of the tables were empty.  The pizza was barely warm. The flavor was good.  Kinda like microwaved reheat pizza that needed another 45 seconds.   Still trying to figure out why I left anything for a tip?   Please train your employees and quit hiding behind "covid."

reviews.author: Liz Z.
reviews.description: Bought some wings this weekend.  Tried out the:  Kentucky Bourbon - Amazing! Right level of heat, smoke, and sweetness  Teriyaki- Sweet and tasted exactly how teriyaki sauce should taste. Deep notes of ginger which was amazing  Lemon pepper- could have been a lot better. It was almost as if they just sprinkled a little bit of essence of the seasoning.  Honestly couldn't tell the difference between the lemon pepper and the following wings.  Taco- I could see the seasoning but they were basically naked wings. The only flavor I could sort of taste was cumin, which was kinda blah. I wouldn't call these Taco Flavor. A good idea to market these as taco flavor would be to market the as "carnita wings" fry them up until they are super crunchy like chicharrn crunchy then serve them with side of salsa. If you use this please credit me! Lol free wings with a year would be nice too lol ;)

reviews.author: Eric C.
reviews.description: Perhaps one of the best local pizza places in Round Rock.  Their menu is definitely creative, they have a lot of amazing pizza combinations or you can always create your own.  You can also order a whole pizza or order by the slice which my wife loved since she usually doesn't eat too much.   We ordered the Orig Mama Gallo and it came with sliced meatballs and pepperoni. The combination of meats were great. The crust and dough were amazing and so soft. Their beer selection is quite extensive, I found a local beer from a small brewery I had never heard of before. I loved it so much that I ended up visiting the local brewery in Pflugerville.  Definitely give it a shot if you are a pizza lover like I am.

reviews.author: Davidm A.
reviews.description: I highly enjoyed this pizza and the atmosphere of this place. I have been around so much I hadn't left a review for them. If you cone her and eat make sure and try there Thai hotwings... OMG so delicious I had to order another round of them. High fluffy crust and just walked out completely satisfied with this place. All around great. T.vs and games playing full bar and delicious food!

reviews.author: Jameela P.
reviews.description: This place has great pizza but they could work on their online order service to show better time expectancy. This wasn't the first time or else I wouldn't post. Expect 20-25 from when they say it would be ready. Still love their pizza so giving 3.

reviews.author: John C.
reviews.description: I honestly do not know where to begin with this review......I get it, possibly short staffed, since I did see a sign out front, but management should adjust how many patrons are seated if that's the case. 1. We signed up for space available seating for six people, mind you, two were planning to order single slices. We get to the restaurant and the first thing that strikes four of us as odd is the fact that the "greeter" had the emotions of Wednesday Addams...zero expressions nor cordiality. Did not see a smile one from this person. She should reconsider her position, but I'd suggest she work BOH the way she appeared.  2. Our waiter/order taker person, whatever the pronoun is today was flat out.....Terrible! His name was AJ, AJ was not attentive, didn't write ANYTHING down, did not take our drink orders(he was reminded by the bar staff). After he "mental" took our order down l noticed the "I got you look", AJ did not have us. Nope, ordered sweet tea, got unsweetened, came back with an excuse, we brushed it off. Ten minutes later, came back and asked my wife and I what pizza we ordered(again, he wrote it down mentally), I asked him to guess...when I told him a number 12 he replied, "I knew it, was just checking." I honestly could keep going on number two, as the service was just that....shit.  3. Nothing, I mean nothing arrived on time. My Brother received his pizza before ANY of the the reheat and serve slices came out. My wife and I got ours after he'd finished half of the pizza. After the complete shit show for service, as soon as our pizza came out we got a to-go box. I could expound on every one of these points, but I won't.   All in all the bill was $145, only one beer was ordered. I was "fine" with leaving a $20 tip for the service we received, but was talked into being generous. My old self would not have been so nice. Maybe folks are used to this service at this establishment, but for the money we paid I would have been happier with a PJ pizza and some good garlic butter sauce! Oh, I attached a pic of my pizza from last night....

reviews.author: Seon B.
reviews.description: Slap Box is an interesting name for a Pizzaria with an included drafthouse. I stumbled upon this spot after Google searching "pizza near me". I was sawyer by the 4 star Yelp reviews, I had detour from my original plan to visit Pinthouse Pizza.   There's plenty of parking in fact there's an indoor covered parking lot on the same block around the corner. Upon entry the ambiance is well wonderful. There's enough tables and an ample amount of TV's to watch any of your heart's desire for sports.  I proceeded directly to the bar to order my pizza and beer to go.  When I sat down at the bar I ordered a pepperoni pizza and some water. After the pizza arrived after about 15 minutes or so I decided to sample a couple of ciders. I tried the Meridian Hive Cherry and the Meridian Hive Rhapsody. I ended up buying the Meridian Hive Cherry. It was on the sweeter side think like a wine.  When I finally tried the pizza it was pretty good. It was above average and I would try it again. The wings were really good. The sauce was flavorful and robust. The chicken was very good too. I definitely recommend Slap Box!

reviews.author: Glenn L.
reviews.description: Everything was great, the service was top notch - honestly the waitstaff was on top of their game!  First time in and can't wait to go back to try some different t combinations. We had the hot wings, by the slice and the garlic parmesan fries.

reviews.author: Lauren M.
reviews.description: Located in downtown Round Rock, this pizza place is right next to the Main Street plaza.  During CoVid times, we ordered to-go and ate in the plaza next door since it was a lovely afternoon.   Be forewarned, if you get a slice... it is a BIG slice!  See the La Jolla slice picture. It's huge!  The kids loved their pizza. Not a surprise there since it was your typical pepperoni.   I had a GF, vegan pizza for the first time and it was pretty good. I'm so glad they had this option on the menu so I didn't have to order a salad.   They had lots of beer options on tap but we didn't partake this time. Next time, we will. Give them a try!

reviews.author: Natalie R.
reviews.description: The pizza is delicious and my husband agrees. The parking is awful. One time we ordered it for delivery and were charged mega bucks by the delivery service, so we'll never do that again.  Another time I placed an order over the phone to go and had to wait outside for about 15-20 minutes past the pickup time because there were so many people in line.

reviews.author: Grey P.
reviews.description: Elijah was fantastic. One of the best service I've ever had. Put the customers first, be on his own recompense. We will be coming again because of Elijah. 10/10

reviews.author: Diana L.
reviews.description: Hands down the best pizza I've had. The Pirate pizza is a family favorite in our house! We also enjoy the chicken wings.

reviews.author: Tracy N.
reviews.description: Awesome place to hang out and enjoy delicious pizza! The slices are HUGE! We had a great experience and our server was awesome!

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: One of the best pizza restaurants around. I've been to Slapbox a number of times and it never disappoints. The menu is basically the same as 600 degrees in Georgetown. HUGE slices! Lots of variety and interesting toppings. AND this is a pizza restaurant but do not overlook the wings. They are sooo good. I love the dry rub ranch and recently tried the bourbon glaze which was super tasty. They have a great variety of beers on tap and attentive service. Also, a great place for take away. Slapbox is a fantastic addition to downtown Round Rock.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: Good spot for a slice of pizza, drinks, watch a game, with a cool sports bar atmosphere. This joint is family friendly too. I ordered a slice of Canadian bacon and pineapple. This slice was huge!!! Good chew and flavor in the crust. The toppings, cheese, and sauce were good. I like a little more sauce but it is good pizza. I recommend stopping by this joint for some good pizza.

reviews.author: Mallori B.
reviews.description: Seems like a neat place to hang out. Pretty good pizza... which is HUGE by the way. 2 people could definitely eat on one slice! Service was fast and friendly. Pizza could've had more toppings and cheese. Cheese bread was good. Ranch was homemade and very good.

reviews.author: Shashikala P.
reviews.description: We like 600 degrees pizza at Georgetown but until recently we dint know slap box too belongs to them. We ordered garlic knots and cheese pizza with pesto. Ordering online was easy, we reached there early before the specified time but still our order was done already. Garlic knots was not good, no flavors, it dint even feel fresh, could taste garlic but not even a hint of butter but the sauce it came with was so good. Pesto cheese pizza was awesome, pesto was so fresh and flavorful. crust, cheese, everything was just delicious. Will be back again soon for more pizza!

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Same menu/food as 600 degrees in Georgetown. This is some of the best pizza in the area. The wings are also legit and there's an extensive beer selection. What's not to like?

reviews.author: B T.
reviews.description: Don't ever order delivery pizza from Slap box. Great in the restaurant, terrible delivered. 45 min delivery became 2 hours.

reviews.author: Dave P.
reviews.description: Great Pizza and on my doorstep !  I go down there to order and grab a beer or two whilst I wait rather than phone ahead.

reviews.author: Matthew C.
reviews.description: It was quite chaotic when I went on a Sunday around 3:30. The bartender said the service was slow because they were short staffed but he spent quite a bit of time talking about March Madness games with some guys who were either regulars or his friends. I also saw 3 or 4 wait staff/bartenders doing side duties while people sat at the bar and tables who hadn't been greeted. There were 2 hostesses that never moved from the door, yet it wasn't that busy.   Their beer selection was great. I asked the bartender if their pizza by the slice was pretty good or should I just order a whole pizza. He assured me the slices were very fresh and just as delicious. It was just ok. They bake it as cheese pizza then add the toppings by the order. The pepperoni was very salty. Luckily the caprese salad was delicious.   It just seems like they need better procedures and staff awareness so that customers aren't being ignored as they enter. Maybe I'll try it again someday.

reviews.author: Corey A.
