reviews.description: I've heard many good things about this place, but I honestly wasn't that impressed. I know there's not much more you can do with Pizza but I was expecting a little more flavor and seasoning. It felt lacking in that category.  However, the pizza wasn't bad at all... I just thought it was pretty average.   I ordered a Margherita Pizza and a Pepperoni and Canadian Bacon to try to have a varied selection.   Overall, it was good but wasn't great. If I was in the area, I'd possibly give it another chance.

reviews.author: Denise D.
reviews.description: This is my second visit, and I've really tried to like this place.  The service is friendly and good, so that isn't the problem.  My food was overly salty both times.  When you're pay $7-8 for a slice of pizza, that's a big deal.  My Caesar salad was good, the garlic knots were average.  My friend also said her meatballs were too salty.  I'm still on the hunt for a go to pizza place!

reviews.author: Joel T.
reviews.description: It wasn't pizza.  It was something very surprising and I had to share.  I don't know what happened.  I went downtown to pay my tax bill.  I thought about a nearby place that has a great beer selection and pizza.  So, I went there.  But I went in a different direction. Hot wings.  I asked about them.  The servers were attentive and described everything.  Even the bartender came over to check and make sure I was OK after I ordered and suggested beers and said it will be worth the wait.    Then the wings came to my table. They glistened in sauce and fat and were luscious.  Even the shiny foil underneath made them look like a gift   And then I ate.    Tender, juicy, the perfect spice.  The heat and meat!  Sooo good!!  The perfect chili/orange/Buffalo sauce color was gorgeous but tasted even better.  My palate was singing! My hands were messy. But, I ignored napkins, my friends!  I licked my fingers instead.  I don't regret it!   I thought at first the size of the wings order would be too much. It. Was. Not.   The server asked if I wanted a pizza. But, no, I ordered another beer and wings.  I don't want the pizza. I want the wings!!!!

reviews.author: Tim L.
reviews.description: Drove up to Georgetown with my girlfriend to take some pictures with the Christmas lights and explore the square. We popped in to 600 degrees after talking about needing to try it for months and it did NOT disappoint.  We were going to try a traditional pie, but ended up branching out to try the Royale with Cheese and we are so glad we did! The pizza was incredible, we split it and still had a few slices left over. We did it with the additional mustard and pickles, which is an absolute must.  The crust was to die for, and I say this as a person who normally throws crust away. It was so fluffy and soft, truly a 10/10 dough experience.  They had Maine Root soda on the fountain and a ton of beers on tap that they are more than willing to let you sample.   It isn't a big place and it can get pretty packed. There was a 25 minute wait when we arrived, but we ended up just sitting at the bar.  The service was great, the food was phenomenal, and the atmosphere was fun and friendly.

reviews.author: Braden J.
reviews.description: That's not a slice..This is a slice! References aside if you want giant slices of pizza this is the place. Think as large a slice that you have to fold like a sandwich to eat. Perfect for any pizza or cheese cravings.   Atmosphere: Had the chance to dine outside of here. Given the location within Georgetown, you get the feeling of a family pizzeria. A place one would bring their friends for a casual dine out. Complete with patio.  Food: As mentioned above, big big slices. Perfect for any pizza lover of all sorts. I ended up going with the Pirate which is one of their speciality slices that comes as pictured below with a pickle too. The only complaint I'd have is that since the pizza's come out so fresh they also come out very hot. I unashamedly had to eat the pizza with a knife and fork as I just couldn't wait for such a prize to just sit there.   Service: Friendly service, given the significant amount of speciality slices I had a few questions and the server was happily able to answer any I had. Especially if you are unsure of what pizza slice you may want.  Overall: Now that I've tasted whenever I have pizza cravings I just want to return here to try all their other speciality slices. Give this place a try, and have a slice day!

reviews.author: Lori V.
reviews.description: Best pizza in town. The Georgetown and the City Pie are my favorites. You also can't go wrong with plain pepperoni, the slices are giant with thin crust.  They have really good gluten-free crust options on." certain pies. The dry ranch rubbed wings are really good too. They are a little pricey but it's worth it.

reviews.author: Courtney T.
reviews.description: Eating my way through Austin and the suburbs.  Pizza I love it.  My go to.    Interesting spot!   You can do pizza by the slice and customize it with your own toppings much like a whole pizza except it's a slice, a slice that is the size of a small pizza or Texas? Go figure.   Everything is bigger.   Just cheese pizza would be rather bland here add your toppings and go with it.  Everyone gets what they want and it's fast.   Good stuff.  The garlic knots need some more garlic too them that's just me.   Definite unique spot to get that pizza fix.

reviews.author: Hilary S.
reviews.description: Tried out for a later lunch/early dinner so got here about 330.  (Passing through to San Antonio but was starving)   It's in downtown/on the square so has the old build vibe. The side we sat on was little and faced the bar.   Definitely has the college town feel.   ***Didn't see any actual menus so be prepared to use your camera on your phone to look at the menu.   Service: Food was slow to come out. I didn't time it but we were there about an hour.  Our waitress was nice and did come by and check on us a couple times.   Food: Ordered the Caesar salad to start and it was tasty. The size for the salad was big enough you could share if you are looking for a smaller side salad.   I will say if the time it took to get our slices it was worth no sharing.  We ordered #6 pirate and #23 number 23 as slices and shared them.  Oh my!! They were both delicious and honestly for us worth the wait.   Even with the little bit of the wait I think still worth the 5 stars.   ** please forgive my pictures, I got so excited about them I ate the point of the slices. And we sliced them in half after we got them so they would be entire piece if when you get them.    ENJOY

reviews.author: Kenny G.
reviews.description: You wait 20 minutes plus for a single slice. Can it really be that good??? I think not keep it. I'll pay for my drink and leave.

reviews.author: Natalie R.
reviews.description: Best pizza ever!  If they weren't always so busy and if parking was easier, we'd probably make the trek from Round Rock to eat there more often.   I always get a slice of the basil pesto and it is absolutely delicious. And very filling. My husband and daughter like the pepperoni, and we usually get a side salad that's good too.

reviews.author: Brandi W.
reviews.description: I ordered online for pickup and was sent down the street to 600 Degrees "marketplace". They have 2 buildings due to minimal space in their sitdown location. The pizza was good along with my Greek salad. I've been looking for a replacement for Austin's Pizza since moving to Georgetown in December. This may be my new pizza place. Friendly staff although the young lady who greeted me at the main restaurant couldn't tell me the address to where my food was located.

reviews.author: Owen W.
reviews.description: Being many of the pizza's are named after the bay area, I thought this is going to be interesting. Some family here said to try this place so we ordered 3 pizzas' to go and tried to order the garlic knots but they were out.  I am pretty picky growing up with pizzas places, old school ones, so crust, sauce and cheese blends and topping stand out...  Before I add my review here is another really good pizza combo from the bay area; Large Gilroy Special: White garlic Sauce, Garlic, Pepperoni, Mushroom, Italian Sausage, Fresh Green Onion, Fresh Tomatoes.  Now for the 2 other pizza I didn't try them, my copart did and she wasn't all fired up, so I gave her my feedback for my go to pizza, Pepperoni and Pineapple pizza, it's pretty simple combo of hopefully sweet and spicy, if they use the right pepperoni. In this case I liked the crust, the sauce just didn't cut it and the cheese was OK, but nothing that fired me up, the part I hated besides the taste was the topping, I paid a good amount of money for the pizza and the topping were almost non existence, I mean really missing, everyone looked at my pizza and said did you ask them for light toppings or something..  Ahh No of course, so not happy, needless to say I wasn't happy with the product.

reviews.author: Sunil G.
reviews.description: Perfect pizza crust. Some of the best wings I've ever had. Awesome tap list. Not much more to say! Go visit this Georgetown gem (but be prepared for a wait at peak times)!

reviews.author: James M.
reviews.description: Best chicken wings I have ever had. We got the Hot and also the Dry Rub Ranch and I liked the dry rub ones the most. They were just perfect, I've never had better! We also got gluten free pizza, regular pizza and the Greek salad. It was the best gluten free pizza I have had so far but I think I've only had like 3 of them. Greek salad was BOMB! Check my photos.

reviews.author: Spen R.
reviews.description: I don't really have any big knocks to give this place. The pizza was great. Make sure you find out how big the singles are before you order multiple! Our first time here, we were obviously newbies. We looked over the menu for a while, and both wanted to try different things, so we decided to get two slices each. Big mistake, because these slices are absolutely massive. Way bigger than anything I've ever seen. I expected big, but not massive. Our server didn't prepare us or warn us about the size when we ordered two each, so we each left with a whole slice. That part was disappointing. Also quite greasy.  (The royale/hamburger pizza is not good)

reviews.author: Mark C.
reviews.description: This place was recommended by a family member. The interior was small And packed so we sat outside on a brisk night. They should have some outdoor heaters and covering from the on/off drizzle.  We ordered a pizza and wings. The pizza names were curious as I'm from the area these towns are located in. I ordered my birthplace pizza (San Jose). The Lemmon pepper wings came out about 20 minutes before the pizza. The wings were PERFECT! I mean damn they were good! The pizza came out and it's a spicy one. The pizza was bigger than I expected and is made for at least two people. Flavor was good but it had a bit too much of some sort of creamy white sauce on top. The beers were on point as I tried out several local ones.  I will definitely come back and try more of their delicious menu!

reviews.author: Anu S.
reviews.description: The short: good pizza but definitely get the excellent wings; excellent service!  The long: we visited 600 as a last minute whim and were greeted with excellent service. We sat on their small cute patio outside with our pup; took a little while to get a spot but it moved surprisingly quick while we explored downtown georgetown. We had a pie (split in half with 2 flavors since we are indecisive) which were great, but the wings.... The wings were amazing. They were spicy, perfectly cooked. And they gave us the spicy rub on the side which may kill you but totally worth dying over.

reviews.author: Christian P.
reviews.description: I've liked the pizza and Thai Chili Wings at 600 degrees, but I just can't justify the wait times on everything. If the space was more open and inviting, but it's so crammed that you're almost a part of everyone's conversation if you're sitting inside. Service is always great though, if you can get in without having to wait and you have the time to kill, give it a try at least once.

reviews.author: Jenny G.
reviews.description: Amazing owners and interesting setting ranging from rocking camping chairs to couches, ha! It's a bar, gift shop, and lounge in one! There is indoor and outdoor seating, and it's in the square. The owners are big on giving back to the community and also work with Veterans. Support this business!

reviews.author: Jacob C.
reviews.description: We became members here about four months ago. It's perfect because my wife and I will grab two beers to go, drop a tip, and walk the square/walking trail up the street to get our steps in on our Fitbit. It's always exciting because the beers change daily to weekly. We've hung out inside on occasion which is perfect for card games and relaxing. The apparel for sale is typical of a REI/Bass Pro Shop. Expensive but quality.   Bar: rotating beer, wine, white claws  Bonus: Very dog friendly! And one of the only places open late.

reviews.author: Justine R.
reviews.description: I have had mostly positive experiences here. I like the beer selection and the bartenders are always happy to suggest something that fits the profile I want.  I have been here about 5 times and am likely to return.

reviews.author: Adriana L.
reviews.description: So I'm just leaving this place. I tried to exchange a shirt that had a defective snap in button and the owner wouldn't even give me store credit. The sweet girl behind the counter was left to be the "burden of bad news." The owner didn't even bother to come out to apologize. So because I lost the receipt (it had the tags on it) I'm stuck with a defective $40 shirt that I ended up just GIVING back to them because what am I going to do with it?!?! Needless to say, I will not be shopping here again.  Side note: This is where I get my fiancs clothes since they carry Howler (my favorite), Duck Camp, and the lovely Sendero Provisions. I've probably spent over $1,000 in clothing because of the brands they carry, not to mention I spent $300 the day I purchased the shirt. Seriously do better. If your going to carry higher end outdoor gear maybe realize that you're dealing with customers who actually appreciate that.

reviews.author: Kiva C.
reviews.description: This place has a great atmosphere. They are family and dog friendly. The merchandise is high quality (outdoor gear) and they are open late. They usually have sports on their TVs. Whether you're shopping during the day or stopping in for a drink in the evening. The crowd range is vast. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and the taps are rotating. They even have water bowls outside for your dog. They serve beer, wine, and select seltzer's in cans. It's a great place to kill a few hours in the heart of downtown Georgetown.

reviews.author: Kacey C.
reviews.description: This place is always SUPER packed on weekends, it can be near impossible to find a seat. Luckily there are a few outdoor tables and chairs for overflow but even the sidewalks get crowded with people just standing around drinking. One evening we managed to make it in and see what all the excitement was about and it's a cute little beer and wine bar/outdoors gear store. Cute merchandise but pretty pricey. The bartender told us occasionally a food truck will park behind their store so you can enjoy yummy eats with your drinks, otherwise no food menu. I liked the atmosphere of this place... cute little date night drink spot on the square. But I am a little confused by why it's so crowded all the time. The beer and wine list is good, but not anything spectacular. I don't get it. I'm sure we'll be back at some point if we can find a place to sit.

reviews.author: Jamie W.
reviews.description: Had a great time here. Beer and atmosphere was great. Would love to come back to shop around sometime.

reviews.author: Thomas C.
reviews.description: I went to this Gastro pub while visiting a friend in the Austin Texas area. I think it's really cool that they have merchandise and a fully running bar and restaurant in the same space. I felt it was very cozy and interesting aesthetically with all of the taxidermy on the walls. I really enjoyed grabbing a drink here with a friend and I would definitely come back to shop or drink in the future.

reviews.author: Mike S.
reviews.description: Always great beer, great service, great people watching outside. A favorite.  Also check out the fine sportswear.

reviews.author: Shannon H.
reviews.description: Awesome little place in the square! Very knowledgeable and friendly staff! They have some great beers on tap, some that I would have otherwise never tried! The Eastciders blood orange is awesome! They also have great apparel and accessories. Also, we got a small hint that they love our military and veterans!

reviews.author: Sarah F.
reviews.description: While many businesses have found ways to make shopping, eating, and drinking safer and in line with state guidelines, there are places that have found their niche catering to the denial or anti-mask crowd. You can make up your own mind based on the trolling I've received from their clientele from my previous review, and the continued crowding on their sidewalk outside with unmasked folks not socially distanced.

reviews.author: John M.
reviews.description: I never feel welcomed at MSO. The workers are borderline rude and  act put out with each order. I'll spend my dough elsewhere.

reviews.author: Mark D.
reviews.description: Good selection of outdoor/fishing clothes combined with a great selection of beer. Live music  on certain nights. Very nice staff.  Excellent place to go on the square.

reviews.author: Archie L.
reviews.description: Spent the Sunday afternoon on the square. This is a must stop when visiting the shops on the square in Georgetown. Great selection of beer, wine, cider. Nice clothing. The selection is somewhat limited but quality. Friendly staff!

reviews.author: Greg W.
reviews.description: Short review time kids!  A close friend and local resident dragged us here and promised we would enjoy ourselves! He was so spot on the get a coveted 5 star review!   Atmosphere is casual, relaxed and inviting. Great selection of beers on tap.  Go for a brew,meet some cool people, and get a shirt before you depart!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Sunday night in the  square. Strolled in and got a tasty brew and some pimento cheese. Then bought a shirt and some shoes. What a great space and friendly service. Thanks!

reviews.author: Joey G.
reviews.description: Went there on Saturday to watch the UT game. Not a sports bar, but they did have it on one TV. Lots of fans watching, so the atmosphere was great. They have a good selection of draft beer that changes from time to time. Mostly local. I went back the very next day for the Dallas Cowboys game. Very friendly staff. The next day I sat in a comfortable leather chair. They also have a lot of nice clothing for men. A little too pricey for me, but I understand they have some deals from time to time. I will definitely be going there every time I'm in downtown Georgetown.

reviews.author: MICHELE V.
reviews.description: Love this place!! So, for food offerings, you can order online. The dudes 2doors down will deliver. Lots of awesome beers and wine available here. Those of you who  follow the mask rules (which effectiveness is anecdotal at best....and not scientific), you will be comfortable here. High ceilings, fans, etc.  Tables far apart.  Or drink outside. I'm here for the beer. The people are cool and the staff AWESOME!!

reviews.author: Chris W.
reviews.description: Great place in Georgetown TX! Cool old building updated on the square near the courthouse. Nice combination of Shopping, food and beer with the beers being local and always rotating. Great variety complimented by pizzas and snacks for a great experience after before and during shopping. Nice line of outdoor clothing.

reviews.author: Zoe T.
reviews.description: Stopped in yesterday to buy a hat for me and walked out with a hat and two shirts for my teenage sons. I didn't try the beer, so I can't comment on that, but the clothing selection was good. They carry Howler Brothers apparel, which is a company out of Austin that my fisherman husband likes, and Texas Standard clothing, which is a TX-based brand with cool (not kitschy) Texas-themed clothing that gives back to Texas non-profs. They also carry another local brand - Kermode Outdoors - which is new to me, but evidently founded by Georgetown residents. The store has a great vibe and the bar is a place I could see spending a few hours on a Saturday afternoon. Stores like this are what I look for whenever I shop local - a place that sells unique, cool stuff that someone has spent time thinking about.   4 not 5 stars because I didn't try the beer. Next time....

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: first of all the food truck on site Bonita Los 3 Reyes is delicious as all tacos I've come to love, I can put this truck on the top favorite spots. get food for sure. next the brewery- huge open space outside with plenty of seating. I wont lie to you yelp, I am not much for drinking beers but for this brewery, I might knock one beer out and enjoy the patio more than anything. shout out to the staff for being awesome and helping me find the right beer for me.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Like the space like the amenities like the food trucks like the peeps. The beer not so much. We did two flights. Eight beers. A couple were good. A couple were bad. The rest were just mediocre.  Dog friendly. Plenty of seating inside and out. Good prices. What does this place do for parking?

reviews.author: Tara K.
reviews.description: What a cute brewery!  They have a decent selection of brews and plenty of indoor and outdoor seating.  They have a big screen tv good for watching sporting games, and they have a food truck for munchies.   I was impressed by the women's restrooms as it had tampons, pads, and lotion.  How thoughtful!  Good mix of clientele too.

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: My friend's band was playing for free here as a pre Austin FC party. I was the only person here not wearing green, it seemed. Had 2 beers, 1 was really good and 1 was eh. They had a Mexican food truck in the back and it was meh, I wouldn't recommend. Line inside to get a beer was ridiculous... I would have had more if it wasn't such a wait. Seems they could use a bit of logistical help.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: This is a very wide-open brewery with plenty of places to sit, stand, chill out, hang out, etc.  I had the Cowboy Bevo (which is a brown ale).  I usually love the sweet, malty taste of a brown ale, but the IBU rating on this one was a little high for my tastes.  Not terrible, mind you, and I would consider it again. Just a little hoppy for my tastes.    It's in an industrial park, like many breweries are, but it was a nice, spacious, and clean set up. Service was quick too - so was parking.  On my last visit, they even had a local band playing from within one of the loading dock doors.   Bottom line, great tastes, services, parking easy, and some good live tunes.  Check them out!

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: My dog hopped up on the counter to demand a winter porter, but was immediately met with a dog biscuit.  Meanehile, my wife ordered a dunkelweizen whilI ste thw winterbrew and proceeded to a Murcielago.  I loved the later on nitro.  Friendly staff, counter service, plenty of room inside open to air and outside in the sun.  It's my 2nd visit.  We enjoyed the food from Tsuke Hoten and there's a pizza truck too.  We'll be back for more.

reviews.author: Christa S.
reviews.description: Went here on a sunny afternoon with Kelly L. She had been, but it was my first time - although I'd been eyeing Hopsquad as it was building up and it had been on my list to visit. The parking is limited, so plan ahead. The space is bigger than it looks from the outside - as it has an indoor bar as well as an outdoor picnic table area. I tried two beers (can't remember which ones) and they were both very good. The menu had good variety, so I feel like it's a good spot to bring a group that could have diverse beer tastes. The staff was friendly and seemed to be happy working there. I would definitely visit again!

reviews.author: Mr. S.
reviews.description: The beer was not good. 2 of the flight beers were offensively bad. And a couple were okay...Would not return under any circumstances.

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Huge open inside area where you can see the e brewing section. Also large screens for watching sports. Great place to work or for a large gathering. Plenty of tasty brews for any of your tastes.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Design aesthetic on fleek. Open ro ALL customers--dog and kid-friendly! Strong wifi and food truck supported, Hopsquad is going places.  We walked in excited to try their beers. We heard about this spot and it was so easy to find off the main road. It's connected to Circle Brewing and separated by an easily-crossed chain fence. UGH! How convenient. Beer nerds unite! The mural art is very instagrammable and the interior is even more of a design paradise. The chairs, tables, succulents, artwork and all-around ambiance is so calming, zen and open. It's the perfect place to get work done or enjoy a sunny day with your furry friends. We were a group of four, and all of us loved the space. They also have strong wifi, so y'all know this girl would rather get studying/work done with a beer over cafe drinks any day.  The restrooms are also very clean and GET THIS...they have tampons, pads and AVEENO LOTION IN THE WOMENS' RESTROOM. Yee-haw! They have flights of four for the typical Austin price of $10. Everything is wonderful about this place. They also have a little strip of grass for dogs to do their business--and they have a poop bag station too. The food truck looks like omakase (I'm not entirely sure), but they have so many outdoor games/picnic tables as well as indoor activities like fooseball and dog treats.  The aspects that could be improved are parking. Yes, they have additional parking that's a few lots away...but immediate parking is a drag. We got lucky and squeezed in on the side by the large trash receptacles. The beers also weren't everybody's favorites. They did have a selection, but they only have a few beers on tap. However, Hopsquad is so very green still...that variety will take time. GREAT new brewery providing a hip space for all folks!

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: Really chill place with cool murals, lots of natural light, nice summer selection (the only hazy was fantastic), lots of good dogs.

reviews.author: Kasy S.
reviews.description: I stopped in this past Friday for some crowlers to-go. As this was my first visit, I tried three different offerings. First off, their online ordering is slick and seamless. Secondly, they seem to have adapted well to the pandemic with adequate spacing between their outdoor tables. I would definitely feel comfortable having some pints in their beer-garden. If you are as excited about Austin FC (soon-to-be season ticket holder) these guys are within easy walking distance to the gorgeous new stadium. I can see myself having pre-match beers here before taking the short walk to the stadium.  Now on to the important stuff: the beer!  I opted for their Kate la Quimica SMaSH IPA, Professor Pleasant pale ale, and my personal favorite style Sir Winsor ESB. I found the SMaSH to be my favorite, it was a fantastic representation of the style, 9/10. My second favorite was the ESB, major kudos for carrying this style that is far too rare state-side. It was delicious and my second favorite of that style in town 8/10 (bonus point for a well-done obscure style). I thought the pale ale was fair, I found it to be a bit one-note. Though pleasant on the nose, it lacked a similar nuance on the palate 6/10. All said, I will definitely be back to try their extensive and varied roster of brews. As a bonus, the staff I spoke with were extremely friendly and happy to talk about both their brews and Austin FC. Keep up the great work!

reviews.author: Scott G.
reviews.description: Came here on a trip to Austin. After going to a couple breweries prior to this and I was suggested to come here based on the quality of beers. As the name suggests they are very much hops forward. I am not. I came in and asked the woman about non-hop forward beers. She suggested one and I tried it. It was very hop forward. The bar, if you call it that, is very pretentious. Would not come here again if traveling through Austin.

reviews.author: Sasa S.
reviews.description: Great beer, great atmosphere, nice outdoor seating as well as open air "indoor" seating (which is key these days with covid), and they had food trucks available for nosh. Will be going back!

reviews.author: N S.
reviews.description: Open, bright, colourful, not too loud, outdoor seating and 2 food trucks, fantastic Pennybacker if you like hazies. Tropical fruity deliciousness, the perfect summer bevvy. Love this spot

reviews.author: Beth E.
reviews.description: They have great beers! They have a great selection from lagers to ipa's. It is right across the street from the soccer stadium so in game days it's crazy busy. They have a couple of food trucks in the back and just FYI they have no AC.

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: From the second we walked in I liked the vibes of this place. It is very open and clean, but still warm and cozy. There is a decent amount of space both indoors and out, but I could still see how this place could get packed.   We went around 5 on a Friday and it wasn't empty but also wasn't too crowded. It was nice out so we sat outside. I got a flight which was only $10 for 4 smaller beers and I could pick any of the options on tap.   I'm not a big beer drinker so I don't know that it's fair for me to detailed review each beer, but from the variety I'm sure any one that likes beer could find something they enjoy.   Great place to bring a group! They also have a little food truck/ restaurant out back that looked really good but I haven't tried yet.

reviews.author: TheoHuxtable X.
reviews.description: A decent brewery very similar to all the others in the area. The problem is that it takes longer to get a beer here on Austin FC game days than any of the other places. I know there's a big crowd on game day, but how dumb not to anticipate that and bring in more staff. A brewery exists to sell beer. And you'll wait 45 minutes in line to get one here. Hopsquad just hasn't figured out how to serve beer at a reasonable speed so they are selling half as many as they could while inconveniencing everyone.

reviews.author: Manasa D.
reviews.description: We chanced upon Hopsquad recently, and I don't think I've ever been more comfortable at any other brewery in Austin. I do agree that their beer is still probably finding its footing (Austin does have a competitive craft beer scene, after all), but I don't think other places can hold a candle to Hopsquad's absolutely chilled out homey vibes.   I'll do a pros and cons list.   Pros:  - I can bring my human +canine children and seat them indoors.  - the staff actually don't mind human children.  -cider and wine available for non-beer drinkers   -the staff like my canine child (and there are plenty of other dog parents who visit which means you can play "I pet that dog!")  - board games  - foosball table  - plenty of space   Cons  - I truly believe there are better beers out there.  - cider portions are small - from a can and a little steep , price wise  So when you weigh the two, the pros beat the cons by a mile. As for the beer- give them time. I mean, no one really cared about a few other noted breweries 5 years ago but look how popular they've become now ! Here's to Hopsquad becoming Austin's next too brewery.   - food truck outside  - plenty of parking

reviews.author: Lyndsay W.
reviews.description: This place has a huge outdoor space. Lively crowd but not overly crowded. A couple of food trucks on site. Very dog friendly. Good beer and some wine, which is nice considering a lot of breweries around town don't have wine. Indoor space is large, and there are garage-like doors that stay open in nice weather, so it's as if you're outdoors but get the benefit of shade.

reviews.author: Bijal P.
reviews.description: First time here and am impressed we were sat down right away considering it was really busy.  The restaurant itself is pretty new they have a really simple menu and a great selection of beer on tap I should mention margarita on tap so good really craving one of those right now  Our server Ethan was very friendly gave us really great service.  We ordered a few drink I really liked my old fashion is was really good.  We really enjoyed our good everything was perfect especially my steak it was cooked to perfection. My husband also enjoyed his burger he said it was the best burger he's had.  I am definitely coming back to try something else thank you for the great service and being so hospitable

reviews.author: Kat B.
reviews.description: What a great restaurant! I was in town visiting my brother in law and he said he really enjoys this place so we went. Our waiter was friendly and patient. We started with the chips and queso, which were absolutely fantastic. We grabbed more chips because they're delicious and homemade. Highly recommend them. My husband and BiL got the patty melt and I ordered the chicken sandwich. I was very pleased with my sandwich and tots as were the boys.  My BiL and I both got the sangria-rita our waiter recommended and I loved it. Wish it was bigger, but absolutely no other complaints.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: We came during peak time on a Saturday evening. This means we are seeing them at their most challenged time. And I was a little "hangey" having to wait a half hour to be seated. But it was worth it. The waiter checked back with us every few minutes (mandatory for a good restaurant). And our order was delivered hot and fresh in a reasonable amount of time (a little slow because they were very busy - but in a reasonable amount of time).  We had chips and queso as an appetizer. The chips were the thick, homemade type. And the queso was their own recipe with ancho cili drizzle, crema, some sort of pico de gallo, etc. Really good - exceptional.  I had a chicken sandwich. It had a lot going on (in a good way). It was not just a run of the mill chicken sandwich. And the sidewinder fries are fresh and homemade.   My wife had the watermelon, which she also said was really good.  Overall, some creative foods that were well executed, and on point service  Definitely give this place a try.

reviews.author: Nick D.
reviews.description: Seriously, the best Sunday brunch north of Austin! And quite an impressive bourbon collection.

reviews.author: Linda P.
reviews.description: First visit. Very impressed. Quick service at the bar. Beer served in ice cold glass and well made mixed drink. Friendly server. We ordered Texas on Horseback, Queso Blanco, and The Republic Rustler. All so delicious! Great atmosphere. County music playing. Family friendly crowd. We'll be back.

reviews.author: Vandesha L.
reviews.description: I've had take out and dine in. After 3 consistent visits I can truly say this is my new favorite neighborhood bar. Eliana has been my bartender every time. She is amazing at referring a menu item or drink. All of the staff are pleasant and the vibe is definitely upbeat and happy. They are inclusive and go above and beyond to make sure each guest has a pleasant experience. I hade a Hell or High Water cocktail followed by a Pineapple Express. The drinks are fairly priced and worth the price. For food I had a Wrangler Patty Melt that knocked my socks off. I did substitute the Texas Toast for a regular toasted bun. The Jalapeo mousse gives me all of the feels and the carmelized onion gave the burger a sweet smokey taste. I'm not a french fry fan so I opted for the Mesquite-Sriracha Tater Tots. All I can say is ORDER THE TOTS! Even the side house salad was delicious. They toss the salad in a sweet and tangy dressing that's just enough. I love that this place is so close to home and does takeout. I will become a regular!

reviews.author: Jeff B.
reviews.description: Sorry this is a little late but I wanted to give a review. I stopped by here a couple weeks ago for dinner. The place was full, but they squeezed me in at the bar. I asked for a menu and a beer. The bar tender let me sample one of the beers on tap. I liked it so I ordered one to drink. I also ordered a patty melt with tater tots. The burger was think and made to order. I had to cut the burger because I did not want a big mess from trying to get a bite into my mouth. The burger was juicy since I ordered it medium and very tasty. I can say it filled me up. The beer was cold, nothing better than a cold beer, well almost nothing.  The atmosphere was as most sports bars are, a little noisy but people seems to know each other and they were friendly. The bartenders were busy but kept getting those drinks. The servers were also busy taking food and refilling cups of the patrons. There is outdoor seating but it was one of those HOT Days so I was glad I was inside. The parking is decent but they share with several other businesses. It was not too far away from the entrance so no need to wear the sneakers unless you want to.  Thank you Republic Kitchen + Bar for being a good neighbor and giving us another option to dine in Leander, Texas.

reviews.author: Polina W.
reviews.description: It was easy to grab a spot indoors. I had the salmon dish- it was spicy and salty for my tastebuds. I must not have read the description very well.  The Kids corn dog was tasty. The chicken steak dish was devoured, as was the watermelon salad.  All in all it was a good afternoon lunch.

reviews.author: Meagan H.
reviews.description: My family and I ate here on Friday. The food was good. I had the special which was a fish. My husband had a shrimp po boy. The kids had chicken strips and mac n cheese. The beers were good and cold. I love how they bring the beer in icy glasses.   We chose to sit outside but soon discovered the flies were way too many to be able to eat in peace. We couldn't stop waving our hands or the flies would land on the food. I'll go back, but sit inside next time.

reviews.author: Sasha R.
reviews.description: Decided to try a new place tonight, and glad we did! I had the patty melt, it was good. The only complaint I have about it is that they put the bread on the grill to get grill marks, but all I tasted was burnt toast. They do the top if the burger bun the same but it's not as grill marked. So next time I will ask for them not to do that, I hate black charred burnt toast. My husbands burger was good as well and both the tots and fries were tasty and perfect portion. They have a big bar with a good variety. I had a Hell or High Water to drink, and will definitely order that again. Delish! And last but def not least the service was great! Our server Kelsey was attentive and very sweet. Definitely looking forward to the next visit...word is they have a good weekend brunch, so we'll be checking that out.

reviews.author: Kate R.
reviews.description: Great food, great service, great atmosphere, love this place! Been here many times and have never once been disappointed. Great outdoor and indoor seating. Love sitting at the bar!  One recommendation only: maybe put chive tv or something else on just one (of 7'ish) tv instead of just sports

reviews.author: Ashley R.
reviews.description: The chicken fried steak needs seasoning. It was missing some salt and the sauce over it was so much it took off the breading. But the mash and veggies had great flavor and tasted good!  Texas Smash is good if you like a honey whiskey, I don't.  But the old fashion was just how I like it!  Overall good place to try, the service was good. They have tvs on but I'd recommend that they put subtitles on all of them so since we can't hear them we can at least read and know what is going on.

reviews.author: Jacque M.
reviews.description: Ordered the chicken sandwich and honestly it was great until I got to the bottom of the second piece of chicken and it was completely raw. I almost threw up because I was worried how much raw chicken I had eaten. I wish I would've take a picture but I got so grossed out I tossed it immediately. I understand sometimes cooks can be rushed and I'm sure this rarely ever happens. Everything else was great but I couldn't get over the meat being raw.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: Great food. Great drinks. What more do you need? I absolutely love the barnyard fowl chicken sandwich. It's seriously delicious. All of the drinks I've tried are solid and they have a great beer and wine selection. Republic is a great option for anyone in the Leander area looking for a nice, trendy restaurant without driving all the way in to Austin. They also have a solid kids menu. We'll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Tara M.
reviews.description: The atmosphere here is great. Everything seemed good at the start. Then we went to order food. Out of steak. Out of salmon. Out of wings. Out of shrimp. Out of some Cabernets. They were out of everything we went to order. The server could not have been more kind and sweet. She said it was because they run out of a lot of things on Saturday nights so Sundays they're just out. Well, I did a quick review of the comments on this restaurant and this is apparently a running theme. 1. Shame on me for not checking the comments before we came, 2. Shame on them for not resolving this clearly on-going issue. I know times are tough, but just close on Sunday nights if you cannot have more product delivered. We finished our drinks and left without ordering dinner at all.

reviews.author: Andrew S.
reviews.description: First time visiting. The drinks and location drew us in. The 3 okra dish ( it's Okra prepared 3 ways) was an instant hit. This was a quick first review and I want to come back for a meal. The Drinks are interesting and a good mix.  Pro tip - parking can get challenging in the evening. This strip mall has a lot of customers, early helps or enjoy the walk :-)

reviews.author: Lora O.
reviews.description: First time here. Ethan, our server, was excellent. He did the best he could with working with so many items out of stock. I mean you're  out of Jack Daniels? And steak? And Salmon? Yikes! We had chicken fried steak and the chicken sandwich. Both very good! Pictured is a yummy dessert! A brownie on top of graham cracker crumbs topped with a toasted marshmallow. Along side comes vanilla ice cream drizzled with caramel and dark chocolate with a drizzle of raspberry coulis and fresh raspberries.  We will try you again.

reviews.author: Leena N.
reviews.description: I didn't love this place. I totally understand that with COVID, many restaurants have had to cut back their menus.   With that being said, it seemed like breakfast-y food definitely prevailed during our Sunday afternoon visit. Seeing that they do a Sunday brunch, I get it, but always pictured that included a few other options not focused around eggs or waffles.   My husband ended up ordering their burger (which isn't even obviously advertised as a burger), and said it wasn't anything to write home about. My mother-in-law had their chicken sandwich and seemed to be okay with it. Not much fanfare from my husband's stepfather or his girls.  I ended up ordering the chili and didn't have any major complaints. I would've loved to see more in the "siesta" part of the menu that wasn't a salad.   My other complaint was the noise. The music was so loud that we could barely hear each other across the table, which pretty much awkwardly split our party in half. At first, we tried to get past it by borderline yelling, but that got old.   In between waiting for condiments, I asked our waitress if there was any way to knock the volume down by a click or two. She mentioned that she would see what she could do, but that it wasn't guaranteed since "people pay for it". My brother in law ended up seeing the jukebox in the corner, and while that's fantastic, I don't think it's too much to ask to keep music at a reasonable level in a place where you'd expect your guests to socialize at their table.

reviews.author: T N.
reviews.description: Came here for the first time and was ecstatic about visit. Ordered a salad and asked for ranch. Said salad arrived drenched in something I thought was ranch. Tasted said salad and immediately my mouth was on fire. Asked waitress to verify if it was ranch and she says... "oh we don't have regular ranch, just a spicy one..." that would've been nice to know. I CANT EAT SPICY FOOD!! She proceeded to suggest I use another dressing to bring down the heat. Word of advice to owner... put the dressing on the side. I was sick all day from this incident.   Partner got French toast and it was amazing. Sadly we won't be back..

reviews.author: Donna C.
reviews.description: This was one of the worst experiences we've had in a restaurant in a long time.  The server was rude, the manager condescending (strangely, I don't remember him being so rude at Texican) and the place was dirty.  The table was sticky, and they knew it, even said there was nothing they could do about it because it was "resin"...it wasn't.  We ordered four entrees, and they came out in stages. The first ones to hit the table were cold.  The third followed five minutes later, and mine didn't show up for another five minutes, at which time I told them to just keep it.  The "hash" was runny and not at all hash, the scrambled eggs cold, bacon underdone, and no condiments available; when we asked for them, they acted like it was an imposition.    $92 worth of bad food and crap service.  Very disappointing considering the executive chef was wearing a Fox Hole chef's coat, and Fox Hole is one of my favorite places in this area; I assumed from the get it would be extraordinary after seeing that...I guess not.  Oh, and word of caution, when the server handed my fianc the mobile payment device, she selected the 20% tip option.  Make sure you watch out for that...there is no signage indicating there is an automatic gratuity so the servers have NO business choosing their own tip amount.  Update: while we were out of town, we discovered my fianc's debit card had been hacked.  Oddly, the odd charges started AFTER using the mobile payment device, which was WiFi powered.  I cannot stress this enough...BEWARE!

reviews.author: Danielle G.
reviews.description: Dog friendly  Good brews  Delicious paninis, I recommend the turkey one.  Great service

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: We waited until Slackers released their own brews to visit. It's great to have another brewpub open in the CP area. Slackers is located hard off 620 in the same strip mall as Interstellar BBQ.Hmmmm BBQ and beer, OK.  Slackers currently have 3 Slacker brews available and a slew of local and not so local taps. Their Belgium lager is a perfect beer to sip on a sunny day.  Round 2 was a Brooklyn amber lager. This brought back memories of our NYC trip and discovering the Brooklyn Brewery. This is a great representation of what an amber beer should be.   There are alternatives to beer such as wine. Got the munchies they have you covered. Check out their menu online.  The brewpub is very welcoming with a bar area and plenty of seating. Games are available and even a foosball table. Outside there are a few picnic benches where you can enjoy the sunshine and bring your mutt. Folks on both sides of the bar are friendly and if you are there for more than 10 minutes you are engaged in a conversation with a fellow pubster (sic)  One nit servers should be able to answer questions regarding their guest taps.   A solid 4 plus stars and Slackers is now in our brewpub rotation. Support Local!

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: Live use music. Yay.   Brand new. Can't wait to try the brews.  Great neighbors friendly    Great place.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Went there last night, the place is awesome! Currently they don't have their own beer, supply issues but they have some amazing Austin, Texas and other craft beers. Family friendly spot (a kids play area with kitchen and all!!),good music playlist and eventually some live music. They just have snacks right now but eventually said they'll have a menu. Oh yah and coffee too. We got to meet Derek and his wife, the owners. This is such a great spot to go and work or to relax at after work! Will definitely be back and can't wait to watch this business grow.  We were having so much fun I forgot to take pictures! I'll update with pictures next time I go.

reviews.author: AL S.
reviews.description: Loved the beers! Had a great time there! Friendly owner and great service! New brewery with good number of ale options! Eager to try their new brews. I'll definitely recommend this place!

reviews.author: Alexis C.
reviews.description: Came here today and loved the vibe.  Chill atmosphere and they had live music on Saturday night. Also a great variety of beer! There's a little kids section for parents who want a drink and a place for the kids to play too. Overall a nice little brewery tucked in 620. Will be coming here more!!

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Love getting a pizza from here while enjoying some craft beer at Celis. You do have to order thru the app, you can't just walk up and order. I've had a few different pizzas from them, and they are all good. Definitely one of my go to's.

reviews.author: Virginia R.
reviews.description: We really wanted to like this place... we live really close by. I didn't want to make dinner and my husband suggested that we try BackDraft.  It took over an hour to get our order. The brewery was having trivia night so maybe they were swamped with orders? Regardless, while the food tasted great, the portions (pizza and pizza rolls) were pricey for what we got. Paid over $50 for dinner (one salad, one small pizza, 3 very small pizza rolls and one dessert.)

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: BackDraft Pizzeria would have gotten 5 stars for the flavors of the pizza and pizza rolls but the timing was so slow, it left me wondering if I was just starving when the pizza was finally ready. They were so busy that they ran out of cheese and took about 40 minutes to prep the ingredients. I did enjoy the dough and the selections of pizza.

reviews.author: Thomas O.
reviews.description: On a slow afternoon trying to use their app. Asked the guy if he could help and he is every kind of rude. Place the order wait 40 minutes. No text so I go check and get snapped at. At 1 hour I go back to tell him to forget it. OH its ready now. All I ordered was pizza rolls. They were burned on the outside and cold in the middle. Terrible just terrible.

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: Terrific pizza, but painful service.  BackDraft Pizza is wonderful pizza.  But, ordering it, customizing it, and paying for it is a pure pain in the ass.   I've gotten their pizza on at least three or four times over the past year.  And each time, the ordering process is a bad joke.    For example, last night, with a windchill of about 20 degrees, I stood in the ordering window for roughly 10 minutes, because the ordering app would not work.   After entering my debit card info including cell number and email address, there was no "submit" button on the app.  I handed my phone to the clerk and asked him to show me where to click it.    After getting my phone, he squinted at the screen, stating he didn't have his glasses, and couldn't read it.   We fumble with the app for another five minutes, with no success.  Meanwhile, I'm freezing my ass off.   Finally, after almost 15 minutes, the guy grabs the iPad, takes my card and enters the order manually, and then has to re-insert my debit card. Once they finally get the order, I ask how long it will be.  "About 20 minutes" he answers.  I look at my watch and it's 7:15.   At 7:40, 25 minutes later, I had not gotten a text yet.  Since I had waited more than 25 minutes, I went out to check on it.    I figured they'd have it ready by then.   Oh no!  It'd be another 5 minutes.  This was like the Seinfeld episode at the Chinese Restaurant.  "Another 5 minutes."  I had to duck around the corner, to get out of the wind.  I had left my coat inside, as they had led me to expect the pie to be ready.   These as**holes  kept me waiting another 15 minutes, before they finally delivered the pizza, about 40 minutes after I first ordered it.  I thought I would freeze to death before they handed over the pizza.   It was terrific, as usual, but I won't be subjecting myself this type of suffering, because the Company can't get its app to work--and then subjects the customer to a consistent routine of misery, just to order one of their pizzas.  It's great pizza, but definitely NOT worth the labor required to simply ORDER ONE ONLINE.  The pandemic's nearly over. Perhaps it's time to junk the app, and TRAIN THEIR STAFF HOW ACCEPT ORDERS MANUALLY.

reviews.author: Olivia H.
reviews.description: BackDraft keeps switching up their home on us, but we will follow them all over Metric. Our favorites are the Shrooms to the Moon (Mushrooms, Caramelized Onions, Sausage) and the Backdraft (Sausage, Pepperoni, Jalapeos) pizzas.   They are the perfect accompaniment to a pint of draft beer from whichever brewery is housing them at the moment. But if you're looking to just bring their pizza home, you can also order online ahead of time to skip that 20 min wait on site.

reviews.author: Ashlynd B.
reviews.description: The food itself was really good. My only gripe is that the photo for the pizza rolls shows 6 of them, and there's nothing in the description to tell you otherwise, but you only get 3. I was quite disappointed to pay almost $8 for 3 pizza rolls.

reviews.author: Marcia L.
reviews.description: This is the 3rd time they canceled!!!!! Horrible service. Don't act like you're taking orders when you can't! Total BS!!!! I will never again try here.

reviews.author: Justin H.
reviews.description: Ordered a few pizzas over the weekend, and thoroughly enjoyed them!  If you like pizzas that are lighter and refreshing, then this is a place to try. My favorites were the Twisted Rita and Sweet Sow. The Shrooms to the Moon had some good umami to it -- it's the most flavorful, but a bit heavier than the first two. Also -- if you like pizza rolls, then I would definitely try the Rollin' Ronies.  I will definitely be ordering these again in the near future.  Note about ordering: I ordered online and picked up the food. I will say, however, that the order was not ready by the estimated time. Instead, you can wait for a text notification to pick up the order. I didn't know that, but now I do!

reviews.author: Abby T.
reviews.description: The pizza and garlic bread was good but they didn't deliver my dessert. More sauce is needed but overall, ok

reviews.author: Sam G.
reviews.description: I ordered using Yelp grub hub for my very first time , apparently they never got my the order. I went to them and made me pizza  on the spot I ordered around 6:30 finally getting my pizza at 9:16 and had to pick it up myself  tried to cancel my order and they never picked up the phone . I dnt know where there was a disconnect but it needs to be fixed . Delivery was trash but also no communication with the customers.

reviews.author: Joe I.
reviews.description: I know this review will never make it on the board. The pizza was average at best with no significant flavors, crust or sauce components.  Maybe I have Covid (been vaccinated), but can't agree with all the great reviews about this place.

reviews.author: Olivia V.
reviews.description: Looking at recent Yelp reviews, I was nervous about how this place would turn out. BackDraft did NOT disappoint.   First off, where is it? There is conflicting info on Yelp and their website. I called ahead because going to the wrong pickup spot would turn me into a hangry rage. They did not answer the phone but the host breweries did. CONFIRMED: They are currently located at Celis brewery.   We ordered 2 pizzas for pickup on Grubhub on a Friday night. BackDraft and pepperoni. They were ready in about 30 minutes. CONFIRMED: The pizzas were AMAZING. Like... hands down some of the best pizza I've ever had. Their homemade sausage and humongous thin pepperoni slices were phenomenal.  I can't speak for anyone else's experiences recently. It sounds like delivery may be questionable? But as of April 2021, if you can drive to pick up a pie, this is the place you need to go.

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: Really nice Naples style pizza with quality mozzarella. Nice crust and supplied parmesan and red pepper. Cute lil baby in the truck.

reviews.author: Christian C.
reviews.description: Oh man.  The pizza here is fire.    It's located right in front of 4th Tap Brewing Co-Op  which is a perfect pair.  We ordered their signature pizza, The Backdraft.  It's topped with House Made Spicy Sausage, Pepperoni, Fresh Jalapeos, but we also added mushrooms on ours.  It's a thin crust style pizza that is PACKED with flavor.  Our buddy ordered the Kale Yeah Caesar salad which he was very pleased with.  The guys that run this truck are really cool and definitely dedicated to their craft.  Backdraft Pizzeria is definitely up there on the short list of Austin's best pizza.  I'd be surprised if they didn't branch out and open up another location in the near future, especially in the downtown Austin area.  I would highly recommend giving them a visit and try their food.  How can you say no to a fantastic pizza and a frothy craft beer to go with it?

reviews.author: Britt C.
reviews.description: Had a craving for "real" pizza and BackDraft was in the top 3 when I did a search but it was the great reviews and photos that sealed the deal. We quickly ordered the Backdraft pizza, a pepperoni pizza, and wings. The order was delivered contactless and on time, hot and ready to eat. We've lived in Austin for almost 2 years and I've been disappointed by all the Austin favorite pizza spots but my days of yearning for good pizza are DONE. My husband and I are both now completely obsessed with Backdraft and I'm sure will be ordering it again very, very soon.

reviews.author: Danny H.
reviews.description: I ordered on Yelp App to delivery.  2 pizza and a salad, but I just got 2 pizza. where is the salad.  I called to the restaurant but didn't answer.

reviews.author: Brooke B.
reviews.description: I'm a sucker for a good cheese pizza, and this place has it. I was super impressed by the dough, tangy sauce, and the perfect amount of cheese. I do wish there were a few more options to kick off the meal but hey, when I'm craving cheese pizza, this is the only place to curve that craving.

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: TLDR: BackDraft is back, and they're better than ev-VAH!  I'm a longtime fan of BackDraft, even once calling it 'the best pizza you can get off a truck'.  That's damning with faint praise, as this is some of the best pizza in all of Austin.    Back when I first tried them, the food truck was parked down on 360 near Bee Cave.  But now that both I and they have moved to the north quadrant of Austin, and they're attached to an excellent brewery to boot!  By far, my favorite is a slightly altered 'Shrooms to the Moon', which is a triple-whammy combo of homemade spicy sausage, mushrooms, and carmelized onion. If you look at the picture, you'll see that the crust has the  right amount of 'char' or 'leoparding' as some call it.   Whoever's doing the pizza-slinging at BackDraft knows their stuff. Get down here when they're open, grab a brewski, and you're in for one of the best lunch combos that Austin can serve up!  Some Tips:  1) I said 'best lunch', but be sure to check their hours before you come. I'm pretty sure they just do lunch Friday and Saturday.  Otherwise, they follow brewery peak hours and just do evenings.  2) Try the Shrooms to the Moon but ask them to hold the caramelized onions.  Without the onions, you get a spicier, hotter pizza which goes perfectly with a pale ale beer to wash it down.  You'll end up with a pizza-nirvana feeling of a warm glow in your tummy.  This place scores a 5 out of 5 on the 'CTJ Scale', as noted below.  5 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Jesus good. Would be OK passing away after finishing a plate here. 4 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Mary good. Would be OK being seen eating here by Mother Mary. 3 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Joseph good. Would be OK having a beer here with Jesus' Dad. 2 out of 5 stars: Come-to-the-Apostles good. Meh. Wouldn't have my last supper here. 1 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Nobody good. I wouldn't have my penultimate supper here, either.

reviews.author: Jeannie L.
reviews.description: At noon on a Friday, it only took 13 minutes to get my food. I got pizza and wings to go. This is one of the best pizzas I have had in Austin so far. The crust was very thin and had a good crunch to it. The sauce for the wings had a slight sweetness and wasn't too hot. I also appreciate that they put the buffalo sauce for my wings on the side, so that they wouldn't get soggy before I got home.

name: Oz. Tap House
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Katy D.
reviews.description: Always a 12/10 experience, the owners are amazing. The place is clean and family friendly, excellent drinks and even better food. We will be lifelong fans of this awesome spot.

reviews.author: Nicole W.
reviews.description: My husband and I were in town for the weekend and found this place a short walk from our hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The Bourbon Berry Cocktail was my favorite! We also enjoyed sampling many different beers and wines on tap. Their crispy chicken sandwich was delicious! Very crispy on the outside and moist on in the inside.   They have crowlers and growlers for 25% off everyday. I really wish they had a smaller to go container as I would've loved to have taken some of the Berry cocktail home - I can't justify the cost of it to take home a crowler or growler. We would definitely go back if we were in the area again.

reviews.author: Dhuel F.
reviews.description: Had a good experience with friends. There was a Foosball table and se v eral games to keep you entertained  the food also came out pretty quickly. Definitely worth a go

reviews.author: Leah R.
reviews.description: Great for family and boozers! Very very pleased with service and options. Also playground and huge grass area for little ones to run around

reviews.author: Melissa S.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed this place which was an accidental find on our way back from one of our activities in Austin. It is a self-serve concept, so basically you are given a card to scan anytime you want to order a wine, beer, or a cocktail from one of their many taps. You also place your food order at the counter and they bring it out to you.   The fried avocado tacos were amazing and my significant other really enjoyed whatever tacos he had, which I believe were the Carnitas. Why four stars then? Two reasons. One is I was really confused on how much I should tip. I usually don't struggle with this being a bartender, but since we had to pour our own drinks and order food at the counter , I wasn't comfortable leaving a full 20%. Second, when you are pouring your beer, the price adds up very quick. There was one point my boyfriend poured a pint glass and the beer ended up being $22. That was a bit of a letdown. Otherwise the staff is VERY friendly and welcoming -they run a very tight ship. The bathrooms were exceptionally clean and the layout with a big outdoor patio is a bonus. Highly recommend, just watch the higher ABV beers because they add up fast!

reviews.author: priya r.
reviews.description: Awesome bar food! Wings, fish and chips, quesadillas, house tacos and sweet potato fries were all amazing!!!!!!!!

reviews.author: Chanele R.
reviews.description: The uniqueness of this place really sets it apart. You are given a card to pour any of the beers on top yourself, which I had seen before and always love. What I hadn't seen was also you can pour wine or cocktails! This experience is perfect for all of those people crawling out of quarantine and not knowing what to do when they cant pour their own drinks. But now you can! And despite the setup involving many hands, Oz. keeps the place sparkling clean.  I can't speak much to the food menu. It's mostly a meat-forward fare. They have a vegan burger patty, but I was told neither of the buns are vegan. Since the patty was really soft, I am not sure it would work as a lettuce wrap. It seems weird to have a vegan patty when you can't have a full vegan burger, but at least there is a vegetarian option.  My mom liked her fish and chips.   I am really just here for the taps though!

reviews.author: Juliana S.
reviews.description: How lucky are we to arrive in Texas and meet this amazing place! It was like stepping in paradise. Delicious food and a whole variety of beers.   We tried a few of the beers and had some Tex-Mex.   I tried the sangria beer. I believe it was number 32 on the panel. If you like sangria and bubbles go for it, It's like sangria with bubbles (GF)  Husband had a few other kinds of beers which I tried and oh Man, It was very good! Nothing like I ever had before.   I also had the house tacos (3) with chicken, steak and fried avocado. The fried avocado was definitely a hit for me. It was full of flavor, creamy and crunchy at the same time.   If you are visiting Austin like us and want to drive away from the city you won't regret going to Oz Tap House.   Also, one of the owners is supper friendly we had the pleasure to speak with Sean briefly. Staff is also very nice, patiently explained to us how tap works.   Thanks Oz Tap House for such a memorable welcome!   I recommend this place to everyone!!

reviews.author: Sofa G.
reviews.description: The food is pretty good, but before get in I saw the reviews and the people says the service is excellent, so I was expecting that, when I walked in the cashier was unfriendly, it feels like she just don't want to work or talk, we asked about the process but still confused, it was our first time there, and don't feel like I can come back just because we saw the cashier were nice with other people but not with us, GREAT FOOD i can't say the same with the service.

reviews.author: Marlene Z.
reviews.description: The whole process is confusing. I don't like pouring beer since it can get messy. They messed up my order. The burger then quickly fell apart. Disappointing. Probably won't visit again since there's other better burger places that pour beer for you.

reviews.author: Kerri A.
reviews.description: I just ordered lunch from Oz tap house. We got fish and chips, fried pickles,  a baked pretzel, a Caesar salad and a cheesesteak.   The pro's: The ranch dressing that came with the fried pickles was pretty good, As was the coleslaw.   The cons:  The fish and chips portion was small and soggy. It was two pieces of greasy fish, that iterally had no flavor. Fish and Chips is one of my favorite foods and I've had it all over the world. Never had I gotten it without flavor. How do you make something taste like nothing? Granted. I asked that the fish and chips have no hot pepper on it. Unfortunately, Hot pepper is the only spice Oz uses.  The fries were cold inside - clearly not hand-cut. The Caesar salad, was spicy in a weird way. It was not good.  The Philly Cheesesteak was very very spicy and greasy.  The Baked Pretzel - Auntie Ann's does a better job, this was a VERY basic, previously frozen pretzel. Nothing special and not worth the price.  The fried pickles - under seasoned and instead of crisp, they were chewy. Again not good.    Everything was extremely spicy, from the fish and chips to the Caesar salad. Food items that traditionally aren't spicy, were all grossly over spiced with hot peppers. Oz Tap House needs to learn how to use spices without making things spicy. Go back to cooking school - Spiced and Spicy! There is a difference! One more thing,  Read dietary notes. There's a reason why people write them.

reviews.author: Sara O.
reviews.description: Ya know what, I loved this place. We came for the patio,but it was kind of crowded so we sat inside. We were greeted when we walked in,had the process explained etc.  Beers, a couple of ciders,and wines on tap. Pretty cool. I did semi accidentally pour myself 9 oz of wine, so it was a $12 glass, not what I'd typically spend on a glass of wine, but I also typically wouldn't be served 9 oz.  Our food came out quickly and it was really good!  I don't know much it was (folks mentioned auomatic gratuity) bc my husband paid, but it was great and we will definitely come back. They had a playground in the back that we saw,which would be great to come to with our lil people.

reviews.author: Jim N.
reviews.description: Stopped by Oz. Tap House for the first time after a Vandegrift H.S. football game, recommended to us by a family member.  "Go to Oz (pronounced Oz, like wizard of Oz) Tap House, is great.  First things first, we realized later it's not Oz it's Oz.  Notice the period after the z.  Oz. = ounce!  Makes perfect sense when you see the concept.  Dozens of self-serve taps, pouring cocktails, beer, wine, etc.  Way cool!  We couldn't tell how much vodka was actually in the Cosmos we had, but they were tasty!  The Community brand ice tea off the charts too.  Any place serving Community products knows their stuff ... oh yeah, the food.  Definitely "gotta go back for more" fare.  Fried cauliflower and jalapeos, nice ranch sauce.  Our server, unprompted, brought some buffalo wing sauce, "dip a little in here, then the ranch."  Awesomeness!  House tacos and cod tacos were delicious, depths of sublime flavors layered into top shelf flour tortillas.  Our only observation was using the house taco slaw on the cod tacos may be a better pairing than the sauted cabbage... at any rate, the tacos were outstanding.  We'll definitely be back, lots more on the menu to explore.  And a special shout out to James working the register.  Explained the concept, led us through the process, and answered quite a few "newbie" questions.  He was great, no need to hire more employees, clone James!

reviews.author: Michaela M.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed this place being so close to home and having a huge selection of beers with some wine. The food was average but the outdoor area was super fun for my kiddos.

reviews.author: Rafael G.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a Sunday patio meal at oz Taphouse. They have a very clean, really cool indoor and outdoor patio. They are also dog friendly outside as long as they're leashed. I had a half order of carnitas nachos which was pretty good sized. Some of the chips were a little stale so that was my only nagative feedback. We also tried a house burger with fries which was solid. Overall they have good food and the patio is nice. Try it out!

reviews.author: Allison R.
reviews.description: I got the Brie berry burger. Everything tasted really good and I was so impressed that the burger was actually medium rare and was very pink and juicy! The onion rings were just okay. The breading wasn't very flavorful and kept falling off and the onions were not crispy. We also got the house tacos and the beef was good, and the fried avocado was amazing! Really liked the sauce they used!

reviews.author: John P.
reviews.description: Great place to hang and have drinks with friends while the kiddos go to town on the playset.  The card drinking system is fun and the drink selection is outstanding.    Taking 2 stars off because the food is sub par.  We've been here a few times and yet to have anything that impresses.  Tacos are dry, nachos inedible, and the chicken sandwich was such a disappointment.

reviews.author: Beth L.
reviews.description: Fun atmosphere. Good food. Variety of options.  What really stuck out to us last night was customer service - from the front order person to the in-house table bussers, and the "tap Bosses" or so to speak.  They pay attention to what's going on. They make you feel like you are the most important person that has come in all day... and it was great to see lots of customers supporting this small business.  Plus, of course, there are MANY drink choices to sample and enjoy!!

reviews.author: Rosaura A.
reviews.description: Looooved it, absolutely!  Taking my California family there, when they come out for a visit, from Santa Barbara.    Great concept with "brew tastings."  Food was scrumptious!!!  Going back for date night soon!

reviews.author: John D.
reviews.description: Great review for Oz. Tap House. Veteran owned. I came with no expectation, but was blown away by the food and drink, and most importantly the customer service. I had no idea the owner himself took my drink order, I had a berry stubborn vodka. They were expert in explaining all the options. For dinner, I had the Oz. House Burger and fries, it was very good. Would recommend.

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: One of the closest breweries, in North Austin, to the Austin FC Q Stadium Oskar Blues Brewery is the best spots to stop and have some pre-game beers all in the air conditioning!  Plenty of space to come in with a large group of peeps and even catch some live music on a fantastic and great sounding stage!   My best friend and I came in on a busy Saturday afternoon on a game day so there were plenty of people enjoying beer by the pints and all dressed up in their verde gear. We ended up finding a cool spot near the stage to partake in the flight of beers we ordered.  I couldn't decide on what to get so we opted for the flights to get us started.    Beers - boy oh boy I have never had a smoothie hard seltzer beer ever and Oskar Blues knocked my socks off when I tried their L.A.B. Juice which was super refreshing and looked like a smoothie I make at home. Unsure what was in it but I bet strawberries, banana, and maybe some seltzer apple juice? Either way do not sleep on any of the beers they have on tap that are special to Austin as I am finding out that the beers on tap here differ from their other taprooms in Colorado!  What a special thing for Austin!  One of the biggest perks of Oskar Blues is the space, the live music, and the air conditioning! Texas has at least 9 months out of the year where it is consistently over 89 degrees even in the Fall. Oskar Blues has the air pumping on hot days like when we visited and had plenty of games and shade outside for us to hang under.   We will definitely be back especially to see some live music again. The stage is super professional, large, and the sound man was doing an excellent job for the acoustic performer we saw play that day. I am sure they have epic great shows here.

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: TLDR: decent beer options with a relaxed atmosphere.  I came through here this past weekend. First thing that stood out to me was how quiet everything was. it was early afternoon, and the place was relatively empty. it does have an extremely large open room, which lends itself to this. if you are looking for a more laid back experience, this place is probably a good bet. the beer itself was good. there wasn't anything that really stood out as fantastic, but nothing that really stood out as bad either. Overall, 3/5.

reviews.author: Alex D.
reviews.description: Recently stopped in for a farewell party for a coworker. The atmosphere is relaxed - open and large, with lots of space both indoors and out. I wouldn't personally choose to revisit. I didn't really feel they had a large selection of beer, especially for a brewery that really only serves beer. Water is self-serve from a sink, into tiny cups, and they don't have ice. If you're the DD, they don't have many options to drink besides tap water in very small cups (I think someone in our group got a bottled root beer). If you aren't a big drinker or enjoy your water cold, you won't enjoy your time here. One of our group had to essentially beg for a normal sized cup to serve herself water from the sink, and when a different girl asked, she was told she couldn't have a bigger cup.  The thing that really sealed the deal and added this place to our company blacklist is that at the end of the night, after our VP paid the tab (which included a 20% gratuity), a bartender came out and intentionally tried to shame her for not tipping more by making two very snarky comments to embarrass her in front of everyone. A different person in our group spoke to the manager about this and the bartender came out and pretended to apologize, while continuing to tell our VP that she didn't tip enough "because we busted our a**es for you guys".  At a brewery where the only things you serve are beer on tap and hard seltzer in a can, and every patron is responsible for going up to the bar and getting their own drinks. You don't have to mix drinks or serve food (or ice) or bring drinks out to the table... 20% seems fair for pouring beers and nothing else.  The reason I gave 2 stars instead of 1 is the manager (owner?) did really try to make it right after the non-apology, and offered gift cards and free drinks cards, which was appreciated (and they were given to the person who chose this place and left before the rudeness). I honestly don't think any of us who were there when it happened would ever go back.

reviews.author: Cheyenne H.
reviews.description: Oskar Blues is a great brewery in North Austin. Located close to the Domain, they offer a wide variety of beers. As a first timer, the bar tender gave me several samples to try. I went with the Dallas Blonde Ale and was not disappointed... it was actually very good.   There were plenty of hightops indoors for seating and the place was packed on a Thursday afternoon (5pm happy hour). I chose to sit on the patio outside where there were more picnic tables, tents, and even cornhole!   Fair warning, the parking lot is a bunch of rocks and dirt, so expect your car to be dirty when you leave. It also looks like a giant warehouse from the outside, but the entrance is along the far right side.  Definitely try Oskar Blues if you're in the area. One of my favorite breweries so far!

reviews.author: Bechor B.
reviews.description: Was at Oskar Blues a few nights ago with a few friends, and I experienced the absolute worst service I've ever had in my life. 15 minutes after last call (which is at 9pm) a waitress yelled at us and 5 other tables that we "...have to get the f*** out of here". She came back out 3 minutes later and repeated herself, claiming that she had a baby dog she had to get back to. Don't think I'll ever go back there, plenty of other places where I can enjoy my beer in peace and not get yelled at. Only reason I gave it 2 stars is because the beer was good.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
