reviews.description: This regional brewery has a spacious indoor area with a formidable stage space for local talent to perform on and a projector screen for game nights. They have an outdoor space as well with minimal shade. They are pet friendly outdoors. Friendly staff and average Untapped rated brews. I enjoyed my flight here, everything was OK. With all the other spots in town, this is not top of my list, but wouldn't refuse to go here either. If they opened up the fences between properties they could build a direct walking path to the stadium.

reviews.author: Traci C.
reviews.description: Had so much fun celebrating a birthday here! We wanted to stay somewhere outside due to omicron, and this place was perfect. Plenty of space, and they have heaters. Also plenty of parking spots. And also the employees are just so nice. A woman who must be the manager gave the birthday boy some surprise gifts, and our bartender Scott patiently helped us explore their beer options, which were great btw. Lovely afternoon here!

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Compared to other breweries in the area I feel like Oskar Blues doesn't get a ton of love but I've really enjoyed my experiences when coming here! They do a great job of utilizing their massive space, they're one of the few breweries with tvs (when indoor dining/drinking is available) and they have a massive stage for live music (again when indoor is a viable option).   I recommend trying more of their seasonal or offshoot beers if you visit than their staples. For one, their flagship beers are available nationwide and I haven't found any of them to be particularly noteworthy.   The seasonal beers cast a really wide net and have had more hits than misses in my experience. Their Death by Coconut Porter and Slow Chill Dunkel were both fantastic and they do a pretty good job with their various juicy IPAs.   The food truck has some really tasty tacos and I like that they've partnered with the brewery to give 4$ off a food order for every full pour of beer you order. This does come with the caveat that the prices are kind of outrageous if you don't utilize this option, but it becomes a pretty good deal with it. The tacos are more traditional street taco style, so if that's not your thing they do have some more typical bar fare like burgers, fries, and nachos.   Overall, I think it's a great hang out spot. They are reliably not super packed, they have a wide variety of mostly good beers, and have a food truck that will keep you satisfied while you hang out. I don't think any of the other breweries in this part of Austin can boast all three of those, so I highly recommend!

reviews.author: Jingyan Y.
reviews.description: Nice brewery with plenty of outdoor seating. Staff wearing masks and seating all far apart - def covid friendly! Hand sanitizer for use available. Dog friendly outdoors. Lots of beer choices available for ~$5 per pint. Because of COVID they added an extra $5 charge to our tab, but we could use that credit at the food truck. Gives free bag of chips with the beer. Good music. Would recommend!

reviews.author: Dan P.
reviews.description: Stopped in April 2021. Love Oskar Blues. Had a taster of a new sour, guava sour- excellent. Bought a crawler of barrel aged Ten Fidy- not cheap but god stuff. Great brew, nice staff.

reviews.author: Chris T.
reviews.description: You can never go wrong here, but it was PAcKEd! With the pandemic decided to do To go order. I did try sample if Guava Rodeo, wow delicious! But ended up taking bourbon barrel aged beer home. That is even better!

reviews.author: Justyna B.
reviews.description: Love this place!  My only 'complaint' if you can even call it that is they don't have a fenced in playground.  Most of the breweries coming up are realizing that fenced in playground help bring in us family people who can't afford sitters all the time.   Lol.

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: This is a fun Brewery that we go to frequently.  Not only is the beer tasty but they have a large stage with live music throughout the week.  There are plenty of tables and even a few very comfy high-backed vinyl booths.   Also, the typical beer garden area outside with strung lights, roomy tables and corn hole games.   The bands that play are varied with an emphasis to blues and rock. We have discovered a few local bands we like just from going for a beer on a Friday evening.  For certain bands, they will clear a small area in front of the stage for dancing.  The beers they offer are good, but its a smaller selection than some breweries. They stick to a few classics like several IPAs, a couple stouts, a pilsner. Have yet to seen any kind of sours offered. Would love to see a specialty sour.  There is a Wunderpig barbecue truck on site with very tasty sandwiches. Be sure and grab napkins!  Large clean bathrooms, friendly bartenders, and plenty of parking too. Can't go wrong here.

reviews.author: Keay A.
reviews.description: I've officially been to Oscar Blues a handful of times and I love it! Out of the 3 or 4 Breweries that I've been to in the area, this one is my favorite!   They have free, live music very frequently with a great stage and sound set up.   The staff is awesome and to say that they are friendly would be an understatement. A couple of occasions I've been here with my boyfriend's band and they treated the members and their guests with top notch service.   Last but not least, their beer is awesome! My go-to is always the Rose for Dayz just because I'm a fruity/citrusy kind of girl haha.   This has definitely turned into a regular hangout place.

reviews.author: Gabriel G.
reviews.description: Looking for a local brewery to grab a drink and have good barbecue, I picked this place because it was close to the office and hotel and it had a decent ranking on everyone's favorite food app, "Yelp".  Arriving to the site, I was a little concerned that I may have read the Yelp review wrong. The opening is a driveway to a parking lot behind an industrial warehouse. So you might find it a little disconcerting as you drive over 100 feet of driveway and then cross into a chain-link surrounded dirt parking lot.   What hit me in the face was the taproom essence, which smelled of old beer and sanitizer fluid. Not a big fan of the smell. Then the dcor of the taproom reminded me of a mix of a 1970's New Year's party and a crushed velvet weekend band cave. (Lol, I don't know how good the bands are that play there but they had it set up like it.) What I thought was strange was the noise level which was almost whisper-like and the lack of any music playing over the speakers. I may have gone at an off time but still, there should have been some music playing in the background.  The beer was tasty. I had the Can-O-Bliss Citra and the G-Knight. The bouquet off the Can-O-Bliss was amazing but lamentably, the flavor wasn't there to back it up. I preferred the G-Knight much more. It was good go-to IPA.   Sitting there I was hungry and asked to see the menu. They handed me a short menu and told me that I had to order outside at a food truck that was parked in the parking lot. It was raining and I wasn't too keen on ordering outside but I was hungry so I sucked it up and did it. You can see my review at Wunder Pig Barbecue - Yelp. But the long and short of it is the food was a big disappointment. And there was no bar food available. No finger foods! Bummer.   I realize you aren't a restaurant but please kick that food truck off the parking lot and get one that serves bar/finger food and better barbecue.

reviews.author: Angel D.
reviews.description: Oskar Blues Brewery is located in Austin, TX right next to Caliber Collision on Metric Blvd. Luckily-- my father in law works right next door to this Brewery. He was the very one that introduced us to this place. I love craft beer and I must say I love Oskar Blue's beers!!! What I enjoy the most about this place is that they offer beer-flights! My top favs has got to be Mamas Little Yella Pils and Can-O-Bliss IPA!  I love that they also have live music here. I believe when a band is performing, that's the only time they won't be able to sell you a beer flight.. Music could get super loud so luckily they have outside seating as well. It's crazy how busy they could get! Lol. All the tables inside fill up super quickly because of the live music.  Overall experience: fantastic. I love the atmosphere, also this brewery is clean and spacious. The workers are very friendly and I always have a good time conversing with them. Great music and even better beers! Until next time

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: This place is a great place to hang out! My girlfriend and I came here on a Saturday and it was really nice outside and they have inside and outside seating. They have a stage for music and a wide variety of beers to choose from. The service was great and they sell some cool swag as well. I will definitely be going back!

reviews.author: Lyndsay W.
reviews.description: Beer is tasty and the place is huge. Indoors looks kind of like an intimate concert venue--they have a stage so I assume they have some events. Lots of outdoor space with corn hole. Shaded picnic tables so you're not roasting in the sun.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: Out of the handful of breweries I've visited in the ATX, this one is hands down my favorite!  It's VERY spacious, and has plenty of room to sit at the large bar, or one of the many tables in the venue.    They have a decent size stage for live music, but I was there on an early evening, so nothing was going on at that time.  There was a decent sized crowd in the place, but it wasn't too loud and it didn't make you feel cramped.  I mentioned the spacious seating area - they have quite a few long tables that are great for group get togethers.   Nice apparel shop with brewery t-shirts, hats, koozies, stickers, and more.  They have 16 beers on tap.  You can get a sampler flight of four beers for eight bucks - you just can't beat that with a stick!  They have six choices of non alcoholic soda and a sparkling water option.  Nice sized patio with a covered tarp to keep the sun off of you and keep you out of the rain.  Giant Jenga and other games to play out on the patio - it's really a fun place to hang out.''  There's usually a food truck parked outside - I was told it's a permanent fixture and their "home base", so check them out.  It's called  "Cluck n Burger" and it was awesome.  Look for my review for that one coming soon.  The beers I had inside were Mama's Little Yella Pils (I've had it before and it's OK).  But the one that blew my socks off was the the Old Chub Scotch Ale.  This really surprised me, because I'm not usually into the heavier flavored beers.  But this one was just so divine and delectable.  I'm gonna have to begin a search for this one in my local beer joints in SA.  They're open from noon to 8pm Sunday and Monday and from noon to 10pm every other day of the week.  Wi-Fi password is Oskarblues

reviews.author: Saunya O.
reviews.description: This was a great find! Driving there at night, you might think you are driving into a forbidden, industrial area but turning on the street where the brewery is, you will see the lights.  I happened to come on a night where there was live music. The stage is in a great location and there are table and chairs for people to sit and enjoy the show. The decor is very unique and you can tell you are in a brewery.   The staff was very nice and I truly enjoyed talking to the friendly bartenders. The outside area has long picnic type tables were a large party or group of friends can come and hang.  I went alone, but a cute programmer by the name of Daniel came and chat to keep me company!  I will definitely visit this location again for a beer!

reviews.author: Marcus R.
reviews.description: This place is totally awesome for food! And do they serve you a lot for food. Definitely a place you want to empty stomach on! We had quail and guacamole for appetizers. It was my first time ever eating quail and oh man it was delicious! Very flavorful! The guacamole was okay but needed more salt to it.  I ordered the double angus beef burger. I was full from the quail, quac, along with chips and salsa. However, I did attempt to eat most of my burger! The patties on these burgers we are juicy and delicious!  The staff were very friendly and the manager would check on us periodically. Our waiter kept up with us and would make sure we had our drink consistently filled and not empty.  I also learned they have happy hour and heard it's worth coming to.  Parking can be a pain in the area but is a parking garage by the hotel across from this place. So not too bad.

reviews.author: Kayla I.
reviews.description: It was good, it wasn't bad... I need a 3.5.  We stayed at the Sheraton right there for a GALA and hit up Hard Count both for late night drinks and again for brunch. It wasn't exactly what I expected. I'll admit I didn't look into it too much but we have eaten at the sushi place there a few times and I'd seen pictures of HC's food, I just assumed it was a nice restaurant. It's not, it's a sports bar....which is fine, just not what I was hoping for. Anyways our server Friday night was fantastic, we chose to sit outside to escape the bar, it was freezing but with the heaters and cute outdoor space it was great. We ordered the Cuban nachos and they got mixed reviews. Half of us LOVED them and half did not care for them. Even though I didn't exactly care for them I loved that they were different, made with house potato chips rather than tortilla chips.   We had serval drinks and ended with some green tea shots our server suggested, they must have been good since we ordered another round. We closed our tab and walked back to the hotel when they closed at 11pm. Georgetown is still up and coming, hopefully someday a sports bar can stay open until 12/1am but for now I can see why they have to close as there were only a handful of people inside.    Brunch, at brunch, after asking the hostess what her favorite was she told us she'd honestly never tried the food, we sampled several things. We LOVE calamari, so of course went with that after our servers' recommendation. I'm shocked to say I did not care for it, they come with a warm red sauce with sort of an applesauce texture that wasn't for me. I asked for a side of Serrano ranch and ate their house friend pickle slices that were mixed in with the calamari instead. I had the French onion soup that was my favorite! It was outstanding, super buttery not just salty like most places. Their hash browns were described on the menu as crispy (that's how we love them) and they weren't lying they were crisp-E! My husband absolutely LOVED the chicken and waffles! We also got 3 kids meals to go: macaroni and cheese looked amazing but no one cared for it was basically cheese fondue with noodles of that makes sense, not a creamy sauce more just melted cheese that doesn't stay on the noodles so it was too fancy for my kids and myself so that went to waste. Grilled cheese with fries went over okay with our son, he didn't care for the Texas toast he said it was too thick for his mouth he said it hurt to eat (kids, lol) and the fries are seasoned waffle fries which I loved but not so much the kids, lastly the chicken fingers those they fought over!  Our bill for brunch with tip was $85 and I didn't even order a real meal. We won't be back for the ambiance, if this were a nice restaurant with a warm, cozy welcoming atmosphere maybe just for the French onion soup and chicken and waffles or to sit outside.  Bloody Mary Calamari French onion soup Side of bacon Side of hash browns Chicken and waffles 3 kids meals (no drinks)  Overall I'll still recommend it to friends! It's a great little area over there with a cute waiting area with games and such for all the restaurants. I hope to see that area flourish and survive for decades.

reviews.author: Wanda C.
reviews.description: I spent my Christmas Eve here. I did not feel lonely for one moment because Yvonne was my bartender and she was so much fun to talk with! Hi Yvonne! She helped me with the menu and was very knowledgeable on all the choices.  I had the Cuban Nachos and Mionetto Prosecco during the 3pm to 6pm happy hour and both were absolutely delish at a great price! I will be going back.

reviews.author: Delia S.
reviews.description: On a particularly busy day at another nearby restaurant, we opted to forego the hour long wait and wound up at Hard Count. My boyfriend was pleased with the abundance of sports on the many large screen TVs.   The food was good, especially his chicken enchiladas, which had a nice little bite. I opted for the seared salmon Caesar which was recommended by our server. The salmon was fresh, they have seafood shipped in fresh never frozen, but was a little bland. I enjoyed the salad all the same. It was a nice alternative on a day where we were unwilling to wait.

reviews.author: Dre C.
reviews.description: Great place to eat, had the monte cristo with Serrano ranch, definitely recommend the place.

reviews.author: Blackmoorbz ..
reviews.description: I have been to this restaurant twice and it is my new favorite and I'm very picky the steak special is delicious  and the fried shrooms are Amazing!! I wouldn't order the burger again it was nothing special but everything else has been delicious

reviews.author: Sarah D.
reviews.description: Stopped in after a walk down the San Gabriel River trail. It was late afternoon. We didn't want a full meal but we were munchy. Just in time for happy hour.  Worth their happy hour! Great way to try their app-i-teasers (teehee)! Not too much on tap but decent beer either way. Loved our waitress! We got the guacamole and battered buttons (these are not abused belly buttons they are beer battered mushrooms).  Genuinely loved the mushrooms. Guac was typical not to exciting but good flavor. We will be back to try other menu options.

reviews.author: Se G.
reviews.description: Nothing special, just OK.  Servers do well.  Great location if your in Rivery area.  Not impressed with this one or the 2020 Marketplace. Waiting for a great restaurant to move in

reviews.author: Lisa M.
reviews.description: An up and coming place in The Rivery, I really like the concept and others' in the vicinity. The valet parking is a nice option, although we prefer not to use it since we really have no reason to. I like that there are casual outdoor recreational areas for kids and adults alike! Now, onto the restaurant itself. It's a really nice place and presents an open atmosphere. It is family-friendly and although we have not been at night, I am most sure it's more for adults at that time. Our server was great and checked on us regularly. The food was really good and offers atypical flavors. For instance, their salsa is not Tex-Mex, but more tomato-like and on the sweeter side...there's really no spice to it at all. The queso was tasty, but don't let it sit too long or it will harden and break a chip while trying to give it a dip! Again, not Tex-Mex, so don't expect it, especially if you're a Tex-Mex snob like me. Ha! We'll give it another shot in the evening to compare with our afternoon experience. Give it a try yourself!

reviews.author: Jason C.
reviews.description: Never been to this location before but let me just say it is worth a visit.  I enjoy fish and chips and found that they do it just right here!  In my opinion the only thing I did not like was the waffle fries were crunchy, mainly because there's some weird additives they added to them, looks like some kind of sesame seeds or something.  Waffle fries are just fine by themselves with great seasoning no need to add weird crunchy stuff, I literally thought I was going to check my teeth only reason why I didn't go five stars here.  My wife got the blackened salmon Caesar salad which I must say was above and beyond with a ton of flavor! I will probably get this next time.  On another note their coleslaw is unlike anything I've had before some kind of a cilantro vinaigrette highbred but I must say I do anything to learn this recipe!  Decent draft beer selection and a handful of wines this place is worth a visit especially if it's game day and you're looking for a good game there's TVs in every direction you look pretty good sports bar especially at an upscale level I would recommend it definitely give this place a shot!

reviews.author: Mary O.
reviews.description: This is one of the newer Georgetown spots and we finally made it out for a late lunch. I've been craving fish and chips - which I've heard is one of their specialties.    We started with the Calamari Diablo - it wasn't as spicy as I expected, but it was delish! The calamari pieces were sliced thinner and crispy.  Peppered thru the dish were fried pickles and shaved Parmesan that complemented the appetizer nicely!  The dip was "marinara-ish" with sliced onions - Yummy!   The menu had plenty of great options but we both got fish and chips.  The plate was loaded with 3 large battered/fried cod pieces.   The crunch to fish ratio was on point!  The dish came with a unique slaw made from cabbage, apple slices and apple cider Vinegar- I couldn't place my finger on the spices but it was very tasty!  The thin sliced apples popped in the slaw.   The waffle fries were crunchy (I normally don't like waffle fries but these were thinner and possibly light battered/double fried with perfect seasoning.   We will definitely return ~ looking forward to trying more options from the menu and bringing friends with us next time.

reviews.author: Sara B.
reviews.description: Billy.  Hands down best server ever!!! Food was amazing!!  Shrimp tacos Fish and chips Quail appetizer Fresh oysters on half shell   All the servers are amazing ! Food was the best well.  Cocktails perfect every-time

reviews.author: Nichole E.
reviews.description: This is a true hidden gem in Georgetown and I'm so glad we found it! We came here for a late lunch today. I got the Joey's el Classico margarita and my fianc got the roadrunner. Unfortunately my margarita was way too sour for me and I hate to be this person, but I asked if I could trade it out. Our waitress said yes and I got the jalapeo martini which was way more enjoyable. For an appetizer we got the Cuban nachos, which was basically the fillings of a Cuban sandwich served over a bed of homemade chips with a swiss queso. I'm salivating just writing this because it was so good we cleaned the plate!  For my meal I ordered the chicken fried steak that came with mashed potatoes, bacon green beans and Texas toast. Y'all....as a southern girl I consider myself a chicken fried steak aficionado, and they know what they're doing. The serving was huge, the breading  flavorful and crispy, and the gravy was so good I wanted to dip everything in it. You can also really tell that their sides are not an afterthought because the green beans were so good I couldn't stop eating them even well after I was full. My fianc got the fish and chips and while I didn't personally try it he said it was delicious, and again, the portions were huge! You definitely get your money's worth here. Along with the great food we also had great service so next time we're in Georgetown we will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Martina H.
reviews.description: Great vibe great food great drinks I had the fish and chips and we hade the strong delicious margaritas. Food is very well seasoned omg very impressed. Keep up the great service and great food.

reviews.author: Josh J.
reviews.description: Wow. Amazing spot, really. Server Gaby was wonderful. We were at the bar of 2020 Scratch and saw this place across the street so searched it. I would HIGHLY recommend to management to change your classification to include restaurant as well because when searching for that this place won't pop up. BUT the fish and chips is killer, very crispy and great flavor. The slaw on the side is some of the best slaw I've had. Also love all the sauces it comes with. Will def be back.

reviews.author: Ginger B.
reviews.description: This place is AWESOME!!! Absolutely one of the best restaurants I've ever eaten at! We ate there 3 times while we were in Georgetown on a business trip. Everything was great! The service was excellent! We split the Wedge Salad and it was great. I absolutely loved the Chicken Piccata Pasta!!! It was the very best I have ever had! My husband ordered the Chicken Fried Steak and he said the steak, the gravy and the mashed potatoes and green beans were all amazing! For Lunch 1 day I had the Chicken Cobb and it was SOOO good and my husband had the Prime Rib Dip and said it was delicious! We ordered a Pepperoni Pie to split one night and it was great as well. I wish there was a Hard Count restaurant  close to where we live! If we are back in Georgetown we will definitely be eating here again!

reviews.author: Chase D.
reviews.description: This place has great food, a wonderful bar, great drink selections and a lot of TVs. My only criticism here would to improve their marketing campaign and they would blow the doors off. You don't see them on social media or really anything.

reviews.author: Hannah B.
reviews.description: Food is amazing! Their outdoor set up desperately needs fans. Service was great for our large group for my birthday dinner! The hot chicken club is HUGE and delish!!!

reviews.author: Vandesha L.
reviews.description: Wow! What an amazing meal. I stumbled upon this hidden gem while in the area grabbing thing at a near by Home Depot. I was hungry and had already tried some near by restaurants. This place was not busy and the ambiance seemed nice.  My friends and I were a starving and boy did we come to the right place. We started with cooked oysters that were absolutely mouth watering. One of my friends had never had oysters so I was excited that he enjoyed them. We also got the pork belly queso, it was a bit thick but full of flavor. The chips were crispy and seasoned which helped with the thick cheese. One friend got the Buffalo chicken sandwich, the biggest juiciest chicken breast I'd ever seen. He left nothing on his plate! My other friend go the fish and chips, he does not like coleslaw but this was no ordinary slaw. The head chef explained they don't use vinegar and they do add celery seed. I was the big girl and ordered the pork chop, large portion but I ate it down to the bone. I wish I had another option besides mashed potatoes but overall it was awesome. We did order cocktails, peach martini and margaritas. Our server was knowledgeable and very pleasant. We were immediately greeted and seated. Our food was fresh and hot and the wait wasn't long at all. I can't wait to go back and try desserts.

reviews.author: Marilyn W.
reviews.description: We found this restaurant in a portion of Georgetown that we had never been in before.  We felt like we were in a different country or state... maybe Florida. And the restaurant was also a new dining experience. We ordered "regular" food including a hamburger and fish dinner.  But they were very good. The waiter was outstanding and made us feel like we got special service.  We will go there again soon.

reviews.author: Karen B.
reviews.description: All the way from Vancouver Canada! This is the best BBQ I've tried in Texas! (Yes, I've been to all of the BBQ places in Texas).  Clean restaurant, great music and the service is superb!   Thank you!

reviews.author: Brendan L.
reviews.description: Best no-line waiting bbq in Austin  Absolute goodness   Yep good stuff they want me to write more

reviews.author: Mark V.
reviews.description: My wife and I love slab, but we were extremely upset that the Burnet location decided to close 15 minutes early on a Saturday. Closing at 8pm is already a bit early for a weekend night, but shutting off the open sign at least 15 minutes early is crazy. It could have been longer, but it was off when we got there, so who knows when they did shut it down.   The new phone and order system also sucks. You can't talk to anyone, it just sent us to voicemail. Even the online now shuts off early due to toast tab not taking pickup orders when we tried to put one in on our way there.   You are not the only place in town that sells great bbq, guys. If you keep making it difficult to buy yours, people will just go elsewhere.

reviews.author: Danielle W.
reviews.description: The ribs were so Smokey and delicious! They fell right off the bone. The sides were great! Nothing was dry. The glaze on the ribs was the perfect sweet and spicy with the habanero glaze.   We are definitely going to be back.

reviews.author: Nikiba J.
reviews.description: My niece and sister spoke very highly of Slab BBQ, I'm all for some good bbq! I save calories for good food.  The first turn off for me the secret shopper was that the cashier stated he could not change $100 bill for a $55 order! Wow.  Second, as you can see in my pictures my sliced beef sandwich was drrrrry! So d@'-dry I got beef stuck In my throat from trying to wash that dry ass beef down and that was without the bread!! I felt some foul vibes when we approached the counter but I just thought I was tripping. I truly believe the meat cutter knew he sold us that dry ass sandwich as well, so 1 star jerk!

reviews.author: Bell A.
reviews.description: Slab was just okay. I wasn't wow'd by my food. I did love the restaurant set up and music. The staff was nice too.   I ordered the Chicken W.A. With a side of mac and cheese. I love baked mac and cheese and I don't believe this one was.   Overall meh for my tastebuds.

reviews.author: Kara M.
reviews.description: Great BBQ for an even greater price! I was really impressed with everything we tried, and for it all being just under $50, it was worth it. It's not your "traditional" BBQ stop - the menu is really fun and there are some pretty creative treats to try, from Texas-sized sandwiches to habanero strawberry glazed ribs. The meats were tender as could be, the flavor was incredible, and the sauces were amazing. Will definitely be visiting again!   Service: 5/5 Food: 5/5  Individual food ratings: - Habanero Strawberry Glazed ribs (5/5): sweet and spicy (but more sweet), these ribs were perfectly tender and had really great flavor! You can get them without the glaze, or get the glaze on the side. - Smoked Gouda Mac'n'cheese (4/5): pretty tasty mac, very cheesy and creamy, would be great with hot sauce or meat. - BBQ nachos w/brisket (5/5): super loaded, huge shareable portion, and great flavors! Add extra sauces on top to get saucy. - El Jefe sammie (5/5): brisket, onions, peppers, and Fritos for some crunch, this was a great sandwich and super filling! - Twice baked potato casserole (3/5): needed a kick or maybe some more salt/pepper, but was good overall with the dank white sauce on top.

reviews.author: Priscila M.
reviews.description: First time at Slab BBQ and it's already our go to bbq in the area. First, all meats are gluten free! Yay!!!! Second, their meats are delicious! I had the chicken and the brisket and both were really good , seasoned well and very moist - cooked to perfection. I couldn't finish my salad and took maybe half of it home. So, portion wise, this is also a win. My daughter had the 1/2 ribs and we were all taken by surprise on the flavor. Seriously, TRY their RIBS!!!  They have a selection of different sauces, including a strawberry one that came with the ribs. I was very skeptical at first, but it worked pretty well. However, their mustard based one is my favorite.  We can't wait to be back!

reviews.author: Rose J.
reviews.description: Finally a barbecue joint worth raving about. When you enter you are met with the smooth sounds of  music. Very chill vibe!!!   The menu pretty easy to survey and food comes out quick fresh and hot! Those are the things I love quick fresh and hot. The prices are appropriate and the sides are reasonably priced. Also the baked beans was the business. Oh, yeah the nortorious BIG was delicious! It's topped with Cole slaw and piled with brisket very tender meat!   I love this place and it was a short drive from the hotel.

reviews.author: Mandy W.
reviews.description: Staff is great, atmosphere is relaxed and fun and food came out promptly but the food was just meh. Not bad, not great but I was expecting a little more flavor. The smoked gouda mac n cheese just tasted like smoke, no cheesy texture or taste. The twice baked potato casserole was just mashed potatoes. The pulled pork was dry and flavorless you definitely have to use sauce for it.

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: Good stuff! I was very hungry in the late afternoon and heading to play many competitive games of ping pong, so I stopped here. The food was yummy. The pulled pork sandwich had very good flavor and the Mac and cheese was fabulous. They also serve beer which complements BBQ , IMHO. The service was courteous and prompt. The dining area was clean, though we opted to sit in their temporary outdoor seating area because it was a beautiful day. Check it out as an alternative fast food option.

reviews.author: Yoko C.
reviews.description: This is the Texas standard!! (4.5 star) I really wish I came here starving. We only made it here because people say it is worth trying after having brunch at somewhere else. Their ribs were awesome!! We were advised to try assorted sliders, but personally I wish I ordered even more ribs. I like the idea of using berry jam as sauce as well, something I've never done but quickly appreciated. Let me come back here to try more ribs in the near future!

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: This is an easy to find place that gives you a feel of a comfortable locals/neighborhood place. Lots of TVs and some covered outside seating as well.  We thoroughly enjoyed our meal! Our party of three started with the double meat bbq brisket nachos, then we shared 1/2 # of ribs, a Texas Tornado wrap with double brisket (absolutely LOVE their brisket) then added an extra large order of the smoked Gouda Mac and cheese, green bean casserole and finished up with a banana pudding .  Gotta say I haven't eaten such great bbq for years AND took home enough for another meal.  This is my new go-to for Austin BBQ! They have a nice selection of regular and craft beers as well.  Definitely a repeater!!

reviews.author: Brandon K.
reviews.description: I've now been here 3 times and if it wasn't for my last visit, it would probably be a 5 star but the last trip was definitely not ideal. The first two times I came here, I ordered the nachos and walked out so satisfied. It is a massive portion that includes all the toppings you could ever want.  They are truly some of my favorite nachos in all of Austin.   This most recent time, I decided to switch it up and went for the trio slider.  My buddy ordered the same thing and both of us walked out of there, not sure if we would come back.  The bread was hard, and the meat was room temp at best. We came in around 12:30 on a Saturday which I would have assumed is a pretty popular time with some of the freshest food but I was definitely wrong. It almost seemed like they were trying to get rid of food from the day before.  I will probably be back at some point but I don't think I would ever order the sliders again (which is such a bummer for a place 100% known for their sandwiches)  All that being said, the first two trips made a great impression and the workers there are all fantastic so I'm still happy to support this place.

reviews.author: Kels H.
reviews.description: Run, don't sit on this place. The food is out of this world!! Delicious, hot, fresh and fast! The staff is also knowledgeable and friendly! Very underrated. Austin has lots of great bbq, but this place hits the top of my list on all accounts.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: There were brisket nachos involved too but I only got a photo of the ribs as the nachos were halfway gone by then  they were excellent and a generous portion. The St. Louis ribs are some of the most tender I've had.  I wasn't a huge fan of the bbq sauce that came with the ribs but it's on the side and they have other sauces available as well- the one it came with was a little sweet for me. Planning on bringing my small rib aficionado this weekend after the pumpkin patch.  One complaint... the kids meal ribs says it comes with two.. TWO. Mine will be asking where the rest are if I ordered him a kids meal  they do have a great amount of meat on them but I have a 3 year old that eats like a teenager when he has ribs in front of him so these kids meals won't work for us  we will be getting a whole rack and I'll be lucky if *I* get to have two.

reviews.author: John P.
reviews.description: I got the Texas tornado and the McDowell. Two separate occasions and they were amazing. True Texas bbq. The Texas tornado was delicious and perfect for the one who isn't sure what they should get. The McDowell is the McRib on steroids, I wasn't ready. The staff  is welcoming and friendly on top of it all. 10/10. Next time I'm going to order the Chiknwa.

reviews.author: Lauren R.
reviews.description: Stopped by for the Yelp Texas Trending Machine today around 11:30 and it was clear that this plce already has a place in the heart of locals. The line was long, but luckily I was able to head to the to-go desk and place my order fairly quickly...Brisket Nachos packaged with all the ingredients separated so as not to get soggy. They easily survived the drive home to Cedar Park and were super delicious and unique! Like a chopped brisket sandwich on tortilla chips with queso. Um, yes, please.  This barbecue place has a vibe like no other. The walls and music combine hip hop with classic Texas in a way I would not have dreamed possible, but it works. Pretty trendy spot. I really appreciated the clear partitions separating tables as a covid precaution.

reviews.author: Eduardo C.
reviews.description: Food came out fast and was pretty good. I would recommend they have a person always at the bar that way people can be welcomed to eat there and get more drinks. I would come back for sure though

reviews.author: Lorri P.
reviews.description: We hadn't had any bbq since we arrived in Austin for our vacation. We found Slab on Yelp and we were impressed! The sliders, brisket nachos and chicken sandwich were all delicious. The max n cheese was good, it had a smoky flavor, like it was cooked on the grill. The potato salad didn't have any flavor but we just know not to order it, it was a side and not the star of the show like the meats. The music was great! If I lived here, I would definitely be here once a week! Great food and vibe!

reviews.author: Sarah D.
reviews.description: Owners need to claim their business on Yelp. Hop to it guys! We have been coming to Red Horn since 2015, (Parmer Location). Have been a fan ever since.  And we are loving the new Cedar Park location as well. Grab a great beer, (so many options you can't go wrong), and a taco! Tacos at Cedar Park. (Get the deli salad at the Parmer location. Its simple  but amazing!)  Who doesn't love an amazing taco! Vegan options too! Bring your pooch along and sit outside and enjoy the sunset.

reviews.author: Mariana B.
reviews.description: We came for breakfast. It's a nice and spacious place. They brew coffee and beer. We ordered breakfast tacos, chilaquiles, bowl and croissant. Tacos is good, chilaquiles are very spice, croissant is good and bowl is ok. The latter and the hot chocolate came cold. The coffee was hot is good.

reviews.author: Corey W.
reviews.description: Great locally crafted beers and coffee. I like to come here on Fridays to work remote from my remote office lol. Their tacos and chicken sandwich are worth stopping in for lunch

reviews.author: Bret B.
reviews.description: We tried this location out because we were in the area and we really love the location on 1431 and Parmer. This spot is much larger, has a bigger (and better menu) and great service. We tried the Cali burrito (cuz I'm from California and honestly looking for the perfect Cali Burrito) and it didn't disappoint. Beers were great, bartenders had good advice for certain beer tastes and overall a great experience!

reviews.author: Brian T.
reviews.description: Okay this is my favorite coffee shop in the Austin area period.  I love how big and spacious this new location is, but the coffee is WHERE IT'S AT.  Definitely come here if you're looking for the perfect date spot, study/get work done, or just to enjoy a nice morning coffee and breakfast.  We ordered a hand pour over, a Chemex, and a double espresso.  The double espresso came out first and this one definitely packed a punch - don't let the espresso size cup fool you.  If I was just here for the caffeine content, this one definitely would've done the job alone.   The hand pour over came out next and the presentation was super impressive!  They bring you the entire carafe with the dripper on top, so it's definitely a lot.  Considering this is only $4, you definitely get your money's worth!  This one was so flavorful and the fruity notes definitely stood out while drinking it.  Now the Chemex...just wow.  For $5, they bring the entire Chemex setup to your table and you pour our of it as you drink.  The fact that they trust their patrons with the Chemex really speaks volumes about how much they care about the presentation piece!  Looks aside, this coffee (I believe we got Ethiopian) tasted amazing and on-par with the pour over.  Don't let me forget the breakfast tacos.  This was such a treat.  I got the Migas breakfast taco and this one was stuffed FULL with eggs, tortilla strips, and pico.  It was delicious and filling and for $3, this one definitely hit the spot alongside the coffee.  I also bought one of their coffee beer stouts to take home...I believe it was the House United coffee milk stout.  If taking home, you either order beer in a Crowler (two pint cans) or a Growler (64 oz).  I can't wait to try their coffee IN THEIR BEER.  But most of all, can't wait to come back here every time I'm in the area!

reviews.author: Thao E.
reviews.description: OH ! High anticipated location! I've been waiting for this location to open since they announced it on their Instagram.   They are having soft openings right now. The space is airy, has high ceilings, and gorgeous.   Being the soft opening, it looks like they are training some new people but they are nice as can be!  They also have Tacomaye on site now for your taco needs. I can't wait to make this my new work spot!  Support your local businesses!

reviews.author: Kim B.
reviews.description: Come for the beer.  Skip the food.   I had high hopes for great tacos and queso to go with my beers.  Unfortunately, the $7 queso was basically Cheez Wiz with some jalapeos, and the beef fajita on my taco was all gristle and had no seasoning.  They could have at least cooked the bell peppers.  The other Red Horn location is much cozier for enjoying a beer.  I'll just go there next time.

reviews.author: Ru L.
reviews.description: The only thing this location doesn't have from the original is the coffee roaster. Other than that the beer is fresh, the coffee is hot, and the food is good. Tacos came fully filled with protein and veggies with two sides of salsa, one green, one red. Two thumbs up.

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: This new location is the bomb! Prime selection of craft beer, coffee, tea, fountain sodas too. Plenty of seating, GREAT service, and super delicious food menu -- our favorite so far are the  carne asada loaded nachos -- a must try! Perfect for sharing . The place is really open and bright. Big screen TVs with sports playing. Family friendly. We love coming here for game night, dinner and cold beers.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: This is another place when we come down for a visit we always stop at! The coffee, beer, and food are fantastic! Then there is even dessert coffee.

reviews.author: Shannon A.
reviews.description: They care about their people because they had no kitchen on Independence Day.  The beer flight is great if your fickle or just want to try all the offing's.  It's not on the menu, but it's great.  Also had a London Fog that was absolutely delightful.  Looking forward to coming back for the soft shell crab!

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Nice location. Very clean and inviting. Knowledgeable and friendly  staff. Not a beer guy but the coffees and teas are solid.  It's not on the menu board, but they DO offer beer flights.

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: Been to this location several times, for both the coffee and the beer. Both are really good. Breakfast tacos are good. The soft shell crab sandwich was also good. The space is great for either socializing with friends or getting a little work done. Staff is friendly. Yeah, this is goi g to be a regular spot for me.

reviews.author: Christy M.
reviews.description: This location is great! Nice open space and a good selection of beer. Haven't tried the food yet, but the coffee is also good.

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: Coffee review only. I've tried both locations multiple times hoping each time was a one-off. The coffee here is not good. Like really not good. Service has always been fine. Just really bad coffee.

reviews.author: Teresa M.
reviews.description: 2 stars for the new location - the beer is just as good as the original location and the food isn't bad, but there is zero character and no covered seating  This is Austin - people have dogs. I'm totally ok with sitting outside with my dog since you have a kitchen but man at least buy an awning or umbrellas or something. 4 random picnic tables thrown outside with no shade is an afterthought.

reviews.author: Eric F.
reviews.description: Great decaf coffee and tacos were awesome but be warned the bacon is thicker than normal but still good.

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: Food is average at best and the same cashier always gives me an attitude when I order for whatever reason.

reviews.author: Laura N.
reviews.description: I love the new location, closer to my home. The food and drink selection is superb. Service was fast and friendly. It's a big open room - simple but nice. The outside could probably be served better with some decor/ awnings or umbrellas. It's a good vibe inside and I'll be coming back!

reviews.author: Dan S.
reviews.description: Great coffee and amazing area to meet with friends or network on Wednesday mornings.  Stop in and support local.

reviews.author: Jane O.
reviews.description: The Blur is excellent. The food truck serves a mean fish sandwich and cole slaw. The place has plenty of parking and outdoor seating. It was a little chilly so we sat inside. Felt like we were outside with high ceilings and good air flow. Excellent acoustics so we could hear the conversation at the table. Staff was friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Christa S.
reviews.description: I've been here for a Sunday funday and more recently did the 2021 Cookies and Craft Brews at-home virtual tasting with Circle Brewing Beers and Girl Scout Cookies. The vibe at the tasting room is casual and approachable - the staff is friendly and unpretentious. For the virtual tasting I did, they had the packages ready for pickup and hosted the tasting on Zoom. It was fun even if I was tasting solo from home as there were others on the Zoom and the two who guided the tasting were informative and engaging. Here were some notes I took during the tasting:  Alibi Blonde and Shortbread - a nice blend of the maltiness and breadiness of the cookie. The beer is a blending of German Maibock style with American Blonde Ale, resulting in a rich, malty flavor with a clean, crisp finish.  Blue Texas Hefe and Caramel deLits and Peanut Butter Sandwich - this is their best-selling beer (about 2x any other) and is a traditional German Wheat beer with a touch of caramel malt and an emphasis on citrus notes. It's refreshing and definitely a Texas twist on one of my favorite types of beers.  Envy Amber and Toast-yay! - this is a new cookie this year and they paired it with the first beer they ever brewed, although it's not the first beer they released. The cinnamon toast crunch flavor of the cookie worked well with the robustness of the amber. It's an English style amber with an emphasis on dried fruit notes - they use two types of British caramel malts to contribute to the well-rounded flavor of the beer.  Ladybird American IPA and Lemonades - this was one of the pairing favorites of the crowd and I definitely liked it a lot too. It's a West Coast style IPA that is very hoppy, but not overly bitter. Solid pairing and solid beer.  Tuxedo Shirt Black IPA and Thin Mints - the hops in this beer are changed annually, so it never really has the same flavor profile year to year. I was not familiar with roasted IPA malts, but it's basically an IPA with black malt. It has a bold, roasty flavor, with a solid body. It was a smooth pairing with the Thin Mints.  Nightlight Dry Irish Stout and S'mores and Peanut Butter Patties - this beer is the CO2 version of Guinness. There is a slight bitterness to this, but it has a rich flavor with a very light body.   A few other bonus takeaways shared in the tasting conversation: * Epic Playlist is a beer that they created to interact with their fans in the market. It has a QR code on it that connects the drinker to the Circle Brewing Spotify playlist. * Devil's XX is a barrel-aged version of the beer (XX) and is sold in bottles. * They are keeping this tasting room, but also expanding and moving to a location in Elgin where they can grow their own ingredients to put in their beer on the 23-acre property.

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Came in this past weekend to celebrate the weekend with my friend at Circle Brewing.  I love their beers and have had them at bars and restaurants around town but had never been to the brewery until this past weekend.   Circle Brewing had easy parking as soon as we pulled up even on an Austin FC Saturday game day. It was pleasant to not have to figure out where to park when they have their own parking lot with plenty of space.   Easy ordering but hard decisions to make on what pitcher of beer we were wanting to try. We noticed they have Austin FC game specials that includes their Austin Anthem draft for $18 a pitcher which is a great deal! I also saw signage on the tables that indicated 1/2 pints during the Austin FC games. Double check that is right because it almost sounds too good to be true, right? I even saw a green cup special going on - ask the bartender what they have on special just to be sure.  They have a lovely and large screen set up right in the middle of their taproom to watch any games including those Austin FC games. They have a couple of tv's as well located above the bar to keep your gaze on during any game not just Austin FC.    If you are coming in the summer especially day time be sure to wear loose clothing and/or be ready to sweat. Even at the bar top with the fans going we came out of here sweaty which is typical anywhere you are during Texas summers. Just want to give you a heads up!  Huckleberry is the food truck that slings all sorts of seafood and burgers (surf and turf!) with some easy ordering from inside the brewery.  We didn't get a chance to try out their food as we ended up brewery hopping around right after we had our pitcher of Blur (hefe) at Circle.  This may be the closest brewery to the stadium (?) but if not it sure looks like it as you can see the Austin FC stadium right from their parking lot.  Excited to come back when I am headed to a game and/or in the area as Circle Brewing beers are divine!

reviews.author: Sasa S.
reviews.description: This brewery had a nice indoor-outdoor atmosphere. We were a bit divided on how we felt about the beers themselves. Some in our group loved certain beers, including some of the lighter bodied and hoppier beers. Others in our group liked the beers but didn't find any favorites from among the fight. Overall it was a nice experience - perhaps not our favorite stop on the brewery tour- but one worth going to again.

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Tasty beer with a nice quaint outside seating area. They turn on the lights when it gets dark so it's nice and intimate.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: I've come by a few times and always found it to be a good experience. The staff is friendly, the beer is consistently good and they go for styles that are much less popular from Austin breweries. They also participate in some fun events throughout the year, in particular I really enjoyed the beer/girl scout cookie pairing event and the red line brewery tour.  Highly recommend trying the Blur, its a Hefeweizen and their staple beer. I would put it up there with Live Oak's Hef as a common point of comparison. If you're around in the winter time their Doppel Blur is probably the best Hef I've ever had; Imagine if your alcoholic grandmother made banana bread in liquid form. If you're looking for something darker the Tuxedo T-shirt is a black IPA, I really liked the combination of roastiness and hoppiness. It sounds like it would clash but I found the hop flavor subtle enough to work really well.    The one negative I would have is that the interior really makes it feel like they're trying to get you to sit outside, which given the vast amount of space available in the parking lot makes sense. However I don't feel like they do a great job of utilizing it, there aren't nearly as many tables as you would think and the ones they do have aren't particularly well spaced out.  The food truck situation seems to rotate pretty frequently, I've found most of them to be misses but it's a roll of the dice depending on the day. There's also plenty of good food options in close proximity that it doesn't feel like a major negative.  Overall I think Circle makes for a good hang out spot and a change of pace from the typical Austin brewery experience.

reviews.author: Lauren A.
reviews.description: Circle Brewing's taproom is open and they have excellent beers both at the taproom and beer to go. They're known for the Circle Blur, a hazy hefeweizen, but all of their beers are good. The Austin Anthem golden ale is refreshing and "crushable" and the kolsch and IPAs are good too. They have both indoor and outdoor seating and host free pre-events for Austin FC games next door.

reviews.author: Mark K.
reviews.description: Beer is good, staff always friendly... but damn does it get hot as the third ring of hell during the summer in there. Maybe "stuffy" or "swampass humid" is more accurate, but it's uncomfy when busy. I'm from southern Texas, so I'm used to it.. but it's even hot for me. Need some big ass fans or something. But.. the cold beer does help! And the food truck outside always looks good, but I've never partook in the tasty treats.   Gonna be a go to for many (including myself) pre-FC games, just hope they're OK with me only wearing my FC boxers once I've been there for 20 and sweat through my less-than-fancy Target shorts I got for $20, so I'd have more $$ to spend on their tasty beer.

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: We were near this Brewery on a Saturday in early March, so decided to stop in and give it a try.  It just so happened it was a special beer release event and charity donation (for Pink Boots Society and Pink Velvet Collaboration IPA), so it was crowded.  We lucked into a table inside and tried a sampling of beers while we played a game and listened to a few interesting sounding bands that played (standing on the loading platform).  Because it was so crowded, it took a while to get served and the line for the single person bathroom was very long.  The beers we tried were good, and we would definitely stop back by on a day that wasn't quite so crowded.

reviews.author: Thomas M.
reviews.description: I love breweries in warehouse districts! Very friendly staff, fun vibe inside and outside. Big variety of beers - and probably the best English pub ale in Texas that isn't a big brand beer. I personally think they would gain to have a tv or two once the MLS stadium opens. Overall great experience and plan to come back. Oh yeah - super dog friendly!!!

reviews.author: Mark L.
reviews.description: Decent food trucks and nice experience but seriously can't give it more than 2 stars because of a ridiculously inefficient policy which makes you wait in the long line of people ordering their drinks to simply close your tab. 8 minutes of my life I'd love to have back. Just updated to one star. There is seriously 1 restroom here-for both men and women to share. The place is huge. Need to work out some logistics here.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Perfect day to celebrate Circle's 6th anniversary. With the Temps hovering around 90 degrees what better way to while away a Sat afternoon than having a few scrumptious craft beers, street tacos and listening to some great music.  My companions opted for their Alibi Blonde it is a German-inspired beer but it drinks pretty light but with a hint of flowery hops that gives it a good aftertaste. I opted for their Ladybird IPA that also drank surprisingly light for an IPA and was perfect for a hot early spring day. I did see a lot of folks drinking their black IPA but it was too warm a day for that, next time.  The event was top notch 15 bucks, American, got you a cool pilsner type anniversary glass and 3 beer tokens. We gave 3 tokens away at the end as we were getting full and we !had! to attend a friends crawfish party later that afternoon. Got to leave room for dem bugs and more brews!   The first band was a Go Gos inspired female band that rocked and the second band played some great 70s, 80, and 90s cover songs. Since I was wearing a Boston Sports shirt I got to meet some other Massholes which only added to the fun.   Good times, great beer, and a wonderful event!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: I was so pumped to check our Circle during a brew-crawl, but the ambiance left me feeling unimpressed.  I had my first sips of Circle after being introduced by every Texan's good friend HEB. I believe it was the hefe that reeled me in, so I was excited to go to Circle during the Red Line Brew tour (check it out online if you've never done it). I was so excited to try a few beers, but knew I could only focus my tastes on one since we were on a crawl. I went with their Cereal Keller kellerbier which I've never tried before. It was described as "unhinged" probably because this stuff is unfiltered and not clarified! I was psyched to try a grittier version of the lager. It wasn't as funky as I thought it would be, but instead felt light, simple and slightly malty/sweet. I enjoyed it. I was pretty curious about all their others like their IPA's and the Doppel Blur, but that's for next time.  The space itself is definitely reminiscent of your small-production and grassroots taproom. They had two porta-potties outside (along with a food truck), but only one restroom inside. It got pretty crazy with our crawl of beer lovers. I can't imagine the staff members sharing one restroom, especially when the brewers are in there doing their thang. Someone's bench with weights and press station was still out, and there wasn't that much open space indoors for the lot of us to all be in there, so outdoors it was! They allow dogs which is awesome and they also have wifi. Parking seemed a-plenty, but we took public transport so that's that. Their gigantic chalkboard menu is beautiful and fully rounds out their super relaxed and earthy vibes. The people here are friendly, chill and the brewery gives off a neighborly essence. It's not an instagram-hotspot like their new next door neighbor Hopsquad. And that's the beauty of it!

reviews.author: Lyndsay W.
reviews.description: Plenty of outdoor space (some indoor too) and good beer. Conveniently located right next to another spacious brewery, which makes for easy bar-hopping. I thought it was funny that the bathroom is wallpapered with 90's CD cover art. It's the little things.

reviews.author: Emily M.
reviews.description: Super friendly environment and very dog friendly!  I loved the atmosphere and the female bartender that helped us was so friendly and knowledgeable about the different beers. This is one of my favorite north Austin breweries to go to. You'll love it.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Definitely a cute space with delicious beer! I'm also a sucker for any brewery that has a food truck on property- we had some pretty bomb fish tacos :) The only downside was no AC inside?! It's too hot for that!

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: Circle Brewing was fantastic, lots of great drinks and lots of great vibes. I thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere at Circle and definitely enjoyed the great beer they had. With lots of breweries in this area, Circle Brewing is still one of the top in the area

reviews.author: Mariah F.
reviews.description: Circle brewing is definitely my favorite brewery to come to in Austin. Not only are there tons of events that are always happening there, just for fun or to support local organizations, all the employees there are so kind and really attentive. They also change/add different beer options often which is great if you're looking to maybe get your favorites and try something new. I'd highly recommend the doppel blur and although it isn't on tap, you can still get a can in a glass of you want. If you're really wanting something on tap then I'd go with the blur! I'd definitely recommend going and bringing your pup because they are very pup friendly everywhere !

reviews.author: Katie H.
reviews.description: I love Circle. Not only is the beer great, but the location and setting speak to the nostalgic part of me that's seen a few little start up breweries begin to flourish out of industrial parks, and often with their taprooms in the brewery space itself. That's what this space is--Utilitarian is too strong a word, but it's comfortable, practical, and cozy. We've enjoyed days playing games out on the picnic tables, and others indoors on the barrel tables. The staff is friendly, and there's always parking available, or you can take the light rail or easily bike from this brewery to others nearby!

reviews.author: Tom K.
reviews.description: One bartender and 50+ people in line for a beer and a hot memorial day afternoon. Way understaffed and Completely inefficient

name: Pour House Pints And Pies
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Chalin S.
reviews.description: What a cute lil place! Lots of outdoor seating!   Lots of beers and they make a good marg.   The snack - are what I'm all about here, the hummus was good, friend cheese oh lord (but wait you can't go wrong with that can you?) and the MUSHROOMS were so yummy!   Warning - the house red will give you a headache

reviews.author: Ruth S.
reviews.description: Not sure why people are giving more stars than this place deserves. If you actually read the peoples' reviews, they really meant to give less stars.   Here's why:  The pizza is just bar pizza. It's nothing special and if I'm being honest, I would have been much happier just going to Costco for pizza   Imagine your pizza covered in melted plastic that has cheese flavor. That's what's the pizza is like; bar pizza. Pizza you'd love to eat when hammered. It tasted like Red Baron.   Let's talk about the cocktails. I can't speak over every cocktail in existence but if they're anything like the margaritas... lol... don't order a cocktail. The margarita here was so bad, I'm sure my husband could make one better with margarita mix and Jose Cuervo. Gross .   I wish I could tell you that our experience here was fluffed with great service... unfortunately, that isn't the case. I understand being understaffed because of the C word, but I watched my waitress, and she was so inefficient, I was very tempted to get up and serve myself. Also, they weren't understaffed. There were plenty of servers for the lack of people that were present. Be prepared to sit for awhile staring at your feet until you can order anything. Be prepared to stay thirsty while you eat. Ask for everything you need from the start, or be prepared to not need it by the time you receive help.   Last but not least, the bathrooms. Those things are important, are they not?  they are to me. I will say, they are definitely public bathrooms. Have you ever been to a really gross gas station bathroom? Ok, then you know what these bathrooms are like. I wonder, does anyone even clean them? Oh well, we will just blame it on the C word this time around.

reviews.author: Steve B.
reviews.description: Still here.  Still serving tasty food.  A large, varied, frequently changing 35 tap wall and smart friendly beer savvy staff.   This remains a favorite neighborhood hangout and I love the food, the beer and the staff and really love the place.  Pretty sparkling clean, nice patio and if they had some heaters a patio that would be great in December,  January and February too.    The formula here, as with all the bars in this ownership group, is simple and effective: great staff, nice place, decent food, good beer and inexpensive drinks.  No wonder they have outlasted the last 5 occupants of this building!

reviews.author: Ralph S.
reviews.description: The pizza is usually delicious.  Our cocktails are reasonable.  The staff Always are Friendly and accepting!  Our pie tonight didn't meet our expectations.  We ordered the el supremo.. if was good but it was too dependent on the pepperoni and not enough of the other toppings.

reviews.author: Joel T.
reviews.description: I've been passing up some awesome food and beers for years.  Don't make the same mistake I did.  I Yelper plead with you!  I also learned two things I've been missing in pizza, too.  I've passed this place dozens of times.  It sits on the fringe of a west Austin neighborhood and several apartments/condos between them and 183.  I believe it is affiliated with a restaurant that has a place in Fort Worth, too, but I might be wrong.  What I'm sure of my first visit there was killer!  I'm planning on going back when I can eat and drink a whole day away!  They have a great outdoor area with plenty of umbrellas and we chose a table.  The server acknowledged us right away.  We QR'd the menu and by the time we'd made a choice of food our beers were on the table and cold (good pour on the Guinness, btw).    We ordered a pizza of our own:  Sausage, mushroom, green peppers and spicy marinara sauce.  Okay, first... You know how some chain pizzas you have the ingredients all coming off together leaving you with less than even a cheese pizza?  Not here.  Every thing is chopped into small pieces and spread evenly over the entire pizza.  Every bite comes with a mouthful of exactly what you ordered.  Second, put some of that marinara on a piece of canvas and I'd eat it.  The spices brought everything together.  We got wings too.  Golden Buffalo.  Perfect heat! Crispy.  Meaty. Those wings were gone so fast I was looking at other tables to see if someone had snatch a couple off our plate LOL  We were licking the hot sauce off the plate.  I'M DOUBLING THE ORDER NEXT TIME!  Great service, cool vibe, good food!  Did I get lucky or find bar food Nirvana?  I dunno.  I'm going to rock a five star and adjust as I need to, but I'm not going to deprive myself of another visit here for sure!!

reviews.author: Russell B.
reviews.description: Still absolutely wonderful after all these years! They remember our order and pay good attention to our table. Will be back soon and often.

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: Fun Neighborhood joint.  This feels like a place where you'd walk in and they'd say, "Norm!"...if that were your name and you were on an episode of Cheers.  The beer was deliciously cold served in a thick glass to keep it that way. The pizza was generously embellished with toppings, and the crust was above average. The service was timely and courteous. I really liked the outdoor patio. Part of it is covered with fans, and part was uncovered with tables with umbrellas. The only drawback is there's a lot of road noise. We sat at a table as far away from the road as possible, and it was acceptable noise-wise. When our world health situation is better, I hope to see all the tables filled with large groups of friends enjoying pints and pizzas. For now, come check it out with your close friends and/or significant other.

reviews.author: Cristian S.
reviews.description: Excellent beer ! Excellent pizza ! Very rich crust ! I loved this place! I'll be back soon !

reviews.author: Krystal M.
reviews.description: I'm a pizza fanatic! Pizza is one of the best simple yet so tasty. Went on a Friday early evening busy but service was  good and manager came out to help his servers and cleared tables. Kid friendly and pets welcomed would definitely recommended

reviews.author: Kerra S.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed this place. It was way more laid back then I expected (place is always popping outside!!) which was great, I'm not for the "pay twice what it's worth because we are fancy pants".  Everything was very reasonably priced, and freaking delicious! We tried a few of the drinks (I tried a few of the beers) and it's safe to say I left tipsy and happy! Can't wait to visit this place again and try some new pizzas and beer!

reviews.author: Andrew S.
reviews.description: Great waitress service initially. Drinks served very fast. Good pizza and tasty fried pickles. Would have been a 5 star review until the douchebag black dude in the red hat that works there ushered us out very rudely since they needed our table even though the back dining room was basically empty. Will never go back

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: I hope they open earlier again soon. I miss going there at 1 or 2 after work.   The parking lot area on the right is awful. So park in the back for you don't get hit.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: My friends like this place, but I don't see the draw. The pizza is mediocre. Fortunately tonight I discovered their sandwiches are good. I got the Pourboy, with Fries. Everyone else in our group who wanted food ended up being in a sandwich mood, so the Chicken Parm sandwich got good reviews from two of the guys. The fries were well-seasoned and looked promising, but were a little cold and soft. Other times I liked the Fried Pickle Chips, but could only eat a few pieces before they got overpowering. It's not like we'd eat that many pickles out of the jar in one sitting! I think the server mixed up my friend's beer order. The final blow to this spot is that their outdoor chairs are wildly uncomfortable. I even brought my own seat cushion the last few times I came! This time it saved my butt, but my back still hurts. I'd give Pour House a 3.5 but I'm in a generous mood so I'm rounding up.

reviews.author: Darrel R.
reviews.description: Been monitoring the website to see when this place is open, and I STILL have not seen this place close down for even a day while clearly rat infested. Clearly haven't taken any time to fix their rat problem. Will not be coming back until I see an exterminator outside.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Knowledgeable staff. Friendly staff.  Rotating taps. Great food.  What's not to like.  Comfortable patio.

reviews.author: Mickey W.
reviews.description: Visiting from Seattle and went here with my son this week.  We both ordered pizza which was excellent. Tasty crust on the pie and toppings were top notch.  Tried their "West Coast" IPA, not to hoppy but well balanced.  I'll be back!!

reviews.author: Loren B.
reviews.description: At first glance, the interior of Pour House looked a little un-maintained. But, then of course, Austin. Where everything is underground. I was excited about the local beer list, though the stout selection was a bit thin. I went with Redhorn, a coffee stout that was a little short on stoutness for me. But, the flavor was good.  We ordered three 8" pizzas to share: El Supremo, Hawaiian, and a Veggie pizza, providing plenty for two adults and two children. The pizza was quite good, as in Austin-good. I couldn't put my finger on it, but there was something unique about the flavor.    Our server was very good, personable and informative. We ate a late lunch, during which a growing number of what appeared to be regulars gathered mostly around the bar. The location is a bit secluded from the rest of Austin. But, it's near the technology district, where I was working for the day.  Parking was a little confusing because we approached the building from a side where the entrance wasn't visible. It's a private parking lot with plenty of space. Outdoor seating is available. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Karan P.
reviews.description: Pour house is a pleasant open patio brewery serving delectable pies and the best garlic bread in Austin! I prefer an afternoon visit to enjoy the sun on the patio. The garlic bread has a nice char and is brimming with heavenly garlic flavour!

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: Wow, what a comeback from Corona this place has had. I've never been happier to see the wait staff and bartenders (especially Justin) return to their jobs. They're really into sanitizing every space that has been used and I've never had a vegan pizza like The Spock. Couldn't be happier with this place's redemption. Come support them, especially at the beginning of the week!

reviews.author: Marcus R.
reviews.description: This was the first trying out this place. My guys from work and I were in training this week so we thought about trying it out. The environment was chill and not too busy during lunch time so that was a plus for us because we needed to be back for training within the hour.  Three of us ordered the Cubano and it was so tasty! I definitely enjoyed the pickles and pork amongst other fine ingredients they packed on that pizza! One of guys ordered the regular pepperoni pizza and he said he liked it a lot. The crust and dough of the pizza was cooked perfectly thoroughly.  There salads were delicious and portioned perfectly. When you arrive the parking is all in the back area pretty much, and you enter through the patio area. They have signs for you and that guide you to entrance.

name: The League Kitchen and Tavern
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Ali V.
reviews.description: In a world where work (regular or enjoyable) in the hospitality industry is hard AF to come by, this place exceeds expectations! It's truly a Cheers-esque environment where everyone feels welcome and everyone knows your name (and drink)! Marissa, Kiyani, Sophia and Aaron all make everyone feel welcomed and valued. We've lived here (6 minutes away) for 10 years and this is BY FAR the best regular crew they've ever had! Management is a revolving door, though, and there have been some great ones along with dozens of others (good and bad) who are no longer at this location or with the company. Drew, who is newish, though, is awesome and one of the best to ever grace this location's presence.  All I can say is, if you're local and haven't been but are considering stopping in - go here. If you're out of town and visiting - go here. If you're a regular - write a review. You know the folks here who make this your regular spot deserve the shout out. I, personally, feel bad it's taken me so long to give them a public shout out!  Management - you're lucky to have a team like this during this time. Treat them as the valued people that they are!  Thanks y'all!

reviews.author: Liz F.
reviews.description: I've lived in Cedar Park for years and I can't believe I've never been here! Went tonight finally to get some fare on patio since it was such a nice evening, and omg, we were blown away.  Stated with the fried pickles, I don't even care for pickles, but with the Buffalo sauce! Uhmmm yass these were amazing! Perfectly crispy, crunch of the pickle, and the zip of the sauce, it was pretty darn good!  I had the spicy passion fruit margarita, it was more sweet than spicy, but still tasty. I liked the blood orange Bellini a little better, and the house margarita was also good.   I got the coconut shrimp for dinner, again, perfectly fried, with a nice crunch. The coconut was subtle but I really enjoyed the chile sauce with it. I got a "side" of fries to go with it, the fries could have been my meal. Super generous portion, and do yourself a favor, add the truffle, Holy moly!    Our waitress was great, as long as every other member of the wait staff that touched our table. We came on the recommendation of friend and I feel I have to spread the love. This place is a must try, and I can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Kat B.
reviews.description: Great spot with a very relaxed vibe. Our server was Priscilla I believe. She was great and did an awesome job.  My husband and I both got the southern burger and we both really enjoyed it. The homemade fries were great as well. My brother in law had the dip and said it was really good also. I liked the ambiance of the restaurant as it was sort of an upscale sports bar. It was clean and the staff we encountered were all very pleasant and friendly.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Very unassuming from the outside but walk in and you find a upscale gastropub style restaurant. We came at lunch and though I was initially hesitant to bring in kids, there ended up being plenty off other families in there. The menu was upscale American. Given it was lunch time, we went with hamburgers and sandwiches. The main dishes were all really good and a decent portion (not too big, not too small). The sides we got were a bit under seasoned though. Lastly, there should really be a hamburger on the kids menu.   Overall, really enjoyed this place. Will come back for dinner to try more of the menu.

reviews.author: Mainer D.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I loved this place. It was our first time coming and we will definitely be back. The food was amazing and so was the service. If you guys are looking for a restaurant to try out I highly recommend this place. Our server name was Aaron and he was very knowledgeable on the food menu and drink menu. He was very friendly on top of his great service. Plus the manager Zach came out and greeted us with a free dessert after finding out this was our first time here. He also was very friendly and nice. Overall one of the best experiences we've had in a long time.

reviews.author: Ken D.
reviews.description: The League is part neighborhood bar, part gastro-pub and I love both parts!    The bar and dinning areas are separated.  Despite both being relatively small, there's plenty of seating.  Choose from high-tops to semi-circular booths to high-back swivel bar stools.  And they have an outdoor patio as well, but not much of a view.   The League is a great place to meet a friend for drinks, a casual date, weekend brunch, watch Sunday football, or to just to ride the bar solo.    Excellent food with new, weekly specials, including a burger-of-the-week. On Mondays they have 2-for-1 burgers for dine in - can't beat that!
