They also have cocktail specials to go along with their food specials (in addition to their menu and drink standards).  I wish they had a bigger beer wall, but the selection is serviceable.   The League is one on my regular spots and I've yet to be disappointed with their food, drinks, or service.

reviews.author: Vincent W.
reviews.description: If you are in the mood for elevated bar food in Cedar Park, this is a good choice.    Good food and good service.  Half bar half restaurant menu.  Fairly new facilities.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: The League Kitchen and Tavern does not disappoint when I'm craving elevated bar food. The burgers are excellent as are the drinks and I don't go enough. This time we ordered the Pappardelle Bolognese and the Jamaican Jerk Mahi Mahi. Probably won't get these again but they weren't bad. I just will try something else. Always great service here.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: I was so pleasantly surprised when we stopped here for a quick lunch. Friendly service and helpful staff members greeted us at the door and I loved the Prohibition era style and decor. Lots of variety on the menu. I tried the Society burger which was tasty and my husband had the club sandwich. $3 mimosas and they sent us home with a complimentary dessert- can't beat that.

reviews.author: Michael Q.
reviews.description: Came here for lunch with a few of my coworkers and it was pretty good.  Lunch was solid service was good but I think that was partially because there were only 4 tables occupied when we were there but the service was attentive.  Menu is pretty large and has breakfast items during lunch so no complaints there because I do love me some breakfast for lunch or dinner.  Overall solid place would come back if I'm in the area not making a special trip here but if I'm here I definitely would come back.

reviews.author: Carl H.
reviews.description: 7/4/21 1st visit.  Already a crowd at opening.   Waitress : Kenza - very attentive, paying attention to details. ( even asked about allergies ) There's definitely a spirit of cooperation- every employee was eager to help out.  Drinks : Bloody Mary's delicious and at $3.00 a bargain. Arron the bartender jumps in to help out in the dining area. Great guy !! Food : Pot pie (basically a biscuit with gravy with a fried egg on top - WOW filling and Delicious!! Wife had the steak salad - steak cooked exactly as she ordered it.  Mother in Law had a breakfast anytime.  All of our food was delicious!!  All and All we had a GREAT experience!! Definitely will come again.  A quality restaurant ! Absolutely nothing negative to report.  As a treat on your 1st visit - we'll show up and ask about it.  Prices were VERY REASONABLE!!

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: We have been going to The League for a couple of years now. I get my hair done around the corner so it's convenient for my husband to hang at the bar. Sometimes we eat here and sometimes not.   Upside; Bartenders are always friendly and welcoming, they have great happy hour prices on drinks and apps. Also weekly food specials.   Food can be hit or miss. Between the two of us we've had everything on the menu. Club sandwich is always as hit and so is the spinach artichoke dip. Burgers sometimes a bit dry. The salmon is usually perfectly cooked. Fish and chips over battered and greasy. Prime rib sandwich is hit or miss.  Burger of the week this visit was Frito Pie Burger. I had the garlic butter grouper, which was a huge portion, but lacked seasoning on both the fish and couscous. Garlic butter was on the side, but was just melted butter with a chopped garlic at the bottom. No other seasonings.   We will continue to come hang at the bar and eat here occasionally.

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: 5 stars for service and 2.75 stars for food. My 4 stars are on the generous side.  We dined here this afternoon. The server was very nice and took care of us. I'd give her service 5 stars.   For our food we ordered the chicken fried pork chop, the full rack of ribs, the southern burger, and the kids Mac and cheese.   Our little guy loved the Mac snd cheese. It was decent and definitely not out of a box. It didn't come with anything else but was only $5.   Hubby had the Southern burger with truffle fries ($2 up charge). The burger was solid. It could have been a slight bit juicer but it was a good burger. The "truffle" fries were not. The fries were limp and soggy and sprinkled with Parmesan but had no truffle flavor at all. Actually when you picked up a fry the cheese all fell off too. Pretty bad fries to be honest.   Older son ordered the baby back ribs and enjoyed them. They were your standard fair. Similar to what you'd find at Chili's but they cost $30 and come with a side of mashed potatoes.  I had the  chicken fried pork chop. It was very over cooked and dry and was topped with jalapeo gravy but there was no heat or jalapeo flavor at all. The gravy made the pork chop less dry though. I subbed Brussels sprouts instead of mashed potatoes ($2). They lacked seasoning or flavor. I like the taste of Brussels sprouts so I ate them but they had no other seasoning that I could detect.   The food was all fine. Not bad but at their prices I would definitely not run back.

reviews.author: Gail M.
reviews.description: Tonight I met a friend to taste their Prime and Wine deal. Half price bottles of wine and two sizes of Prime Rib. The beef was perfectly cooked, nicely seasoned and fork tender. The mushrooms cooked in a savory salty balsamic sauce were the perfect accompaniment to the prime rib. I asked for fries rather than the Yukon mashed because I know their fries are fresh and hand cut. Some people complain about soggy fries. Well, if you put them in a cardboard box to take home, they WILL steam in the box and get soggy. Duh! But ours were nice and crispy. The cut of beef was thick which I really appreciated as opposed to a wide thin-cut slice. I think it was maybe 3/4 of an inch thick? Maybe more. I'm posting a pick but I had already dug in when I remembered to take a photo. Sorry. I like The league a lot. Even the Mgr came by to ensure we were happy. Nice young man was our waiter. This was all good!

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: Overpriced bar food.  Fries were soggy. Burger needed basic salt and pepper to give it flavor. It was medium rare.

reviews.author: Kasti K.
reviews.description: This place wildly exceeded my expectations.   We are in from out of town, it's a perfect Sunday spot for lunch and to watch football. The Sunday crew in the bar was super fun, our server Aaron was really kind   Their Sunday drink special is $3 mimosa and bloody Mary's.   Their gluten free bun is the best I've had at a restaurant, it is nice and chewy and stays together.   The chicken sandwich was great, a huge chicken breast with lots of bacon and avocado. They do a "first timer" complimentary dessert of their chocolate dump cake, my husband said it was great!

reviews.author: J K.
reviews.description: I ordered the "elevated" or perhaps called "adult" grilled cheese and tomato soup. The soup was very tasty and I would order that again.  The sandwich was not an adult version and not elevated. Cold congealed cheese on what looked like white bread. No spreads or bacon jam or fig or combination of cheeses.. nothing to elevate this sandwich to justify the $13.00 price tag.  I make 'em better at home.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: This place is our most visited restaurant since moving here thirteen years ago. As a former restaurant owner / operator, I appreciate the consistency and quality of the menu offerings. The facility is always clean and tables are cleared immediately when a party leaves. They have some really good deals, like burger Monday where you buy one and get one free. They also have a mouth watering prime rib special on Thursday that we can't wait to try.  One more attraction is , if you are into science or astronomy, you might be waited on by Galileo.

reviews.author: Chantel C.
reviews.description: We WILL be back! So, tonight my little family and I discovered this hidden gem. We had no clue about this place until tonight when I was looking for a family friendly restaurant, Little did we know it's only 10 minutes away from our house that we lived at for over two years. We were greeted as soon as we came in, it looked upscale and as soon as we sat down my husband said "are you sure this is kid friendly"  it ABSOLUTELY is. The food was amazing from the appetizers, main course and dessert. The customer service here was outstanding, I've waitressed myself for many years and have been to many restaurants and have never had service like this. Sam took care of us tonight and was so accommodating to us and our 1 year sassy daughter. Zach the manager on duty was also outstanding as well, he took care of us well for it being our first time there, We left in disbelief with the service we received... thanks yall! We look forward to many more dinners here.   Plus I got a nice tote for the to go food

reviews.author: Justyn D.
reviews.description: This place is absolutely phenomenal!! From the host stand to service to manager interaction! Our server recommended so many wonderful options that were stellar...everything was incredible! We ordered drinks which were super fast, apps that came out piping hot and delicious! But the entrees .... OHHHHHHH WEEEEEEE !!! Spot ok and taste profile was out of this world!! After we created a perfect check and ordered all deserts!! The dump cake was a table favorite as well as the butter cake which was a special and then complemented it with the banana pudding!! The Mules and El Guapo Shandy were on point !! Thanks team for an incredible family dinning experience!!

reviews.author: Mattie I.
reviews.description: There is a lot of breweries in the area but Celis is one of my favorite. They are family and women owned and very receptive and kind to their customers. They have reposted my pictures on social media and allowed a close friend to film a short film there for free. The beers are unique and delicious, with lots of options on tap! They have nightly specials and events, all of which are fun! For example trivia on mondays and Thursday, and they have little long horn saloon come do chicken shit bingo once a month there as well. At one point I was going every week for the Tuesday 99c east coast oysters. Among many other specials. There has been some miscommunication in the past with showing games but the manager working at the time is always very quick to help out. For example none of the TVs had sound on when they advertised they all did, there was confusion inside but the manager was outside and apologized and immediately turned on the sound inside and changed to social media to reflect inside. I also noticed that someone had paid to play the juke box and he paused their songs and gave them a free beer for rhe inconvenience. The dog park is also very nice and spacious and the new beer patio is very well put together! I am looking forward to live music!   Unrelated to Celis itself, but Black draft pizza truck is good there but overpriced. I am excited to try the new con todo truck!

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: TLDR: Average spot for some beers  Came through on a weekend afternoon. had some drinks at the inner tap room. overall, the place was a bit meh. the beer didn't really stand out, and I am not really sure why, but the vibe of the place just seemed off. It wasn't a terrible experience, but I probably won't see myself back here in the future. Overall: 2.5/5.

reviews.author: Matthew P.
reviews.description: Solid beer, beautiful taproom, nice beertenders. I continue to not understand why they pump their music so loud. This place should be pretty chill - there's nine people here either chatting (or trying to) or working as I type - but they're blasting the music as always. It's kind of bizarre, doesn't fit the vibe, but they always do it. Thus I knocked off a star.  Look for oyster nights, a real highlight here.

reviews.author: Carly C.
reviews.description: Celis Brewery has a huge outdoor space, live music, an indoor area, very dog friendly, and I counted at least 4 food trailers. I think the food trailers consisted of pizza, tacos, German sausages, and sliders. I loved the ample seating, mixed crowd of people, and the decent variety of beers. I am pretty sure it's strictly beers and ciders here - no wine or cocktails.  This place will be great for a hot summer day and cold beer.

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Love the beer and bartenders are awesome! There's a giant fenced area for dogs to play. They also have a huge beer garden with a stage for live music and two different food trucks. Got to randomly enjoy oysters here too. Definitely a go to brewery.

reviews.author: Ken Y.
reviews.description: I recently visited Austin after quite a few years, and maaaan... has it changed.  Aside from all of the gentrification and inflation, there are some pretty positive things happening here.  Food joints and breweries are everywhere it seems!   That said, Celis is one fine brewery.  My Austinite friend and I stopped through for a few cold ones.  Great service, chill atmosphere, huge drink selection.

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: The outdoor lighting drew us to this place.  There are seats outside and inside and they serve delicious craft beer.  There are also daily specials that we want to return for, such as, oysters on the half shell for $1 each served on Tuesdays.    We brought our craft beers outside and enjoyed them immensely. The customer service you get is above and beyond! Thank you!!  They have good prices and you get what you pay for. This is a must place to try and I recommend it to anyone that loves a good dark - or light - craft beer. You will not be disappointed you came.

reviews.author: Amber H.
reviews.description: The absolute BEST that you could ask for. The food trucks, the vibe, the BREW, and the staff are genuinely elite. Cass has served us on multiple occasions and deserves all of the raises. There's zero chance to be disappointed here.

reviews.author: Jocelyne V.
reviews.description: This is officially my favorite Brewery for happy hour in North Austin. Their selection is amazing and the atmosphere is both relax and inviting.  I highly recommend the raspberry beer and the sour cherry one, I can't wait to go back and try their tropical fruits and lime!  They have a taco truck with very good braised Tacos and que so as well.

reviews.author: Sasa S.
reviews.description: We didn't like most of the beers on our flights. Perhaps we aren't the right audience, as this brewery specializes in the sweeter Belgian style beers, but we tried beers across the spectrum and although some were ok there were none we felt we'd go back for a pint of. The atmosphere was cool and medieval feeling inside though and it looks like they have tons of weekly events like trivia etc.

reviews.author: Gary H.
reviews.description: The front of house versus the back was a big contrast. Front of house was a nightmare. They were blaring music so loud - outside - that we couldn't have a conversation across the table. Every customer looked like they were only there for Instagram pictures and the perfume was so thick you could see it hanging in the air. The waitress inside is ummm... dressed to get big tips. Ahem. Then you go back to the outdoor concert area, and it's a lot of families with kids and regular people. Weird. Beer was okay, but after the cloud of perfume I was honestly too sick to drink. Maybe someday I'll come back and avoid the front entirely. Then I went to cash out and the walking cloud of perfume was in front of me in line.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Love love love the new outdoor area at Celis! This has always been a super dog friendly brewery but now there's even a dog park! Beer is always good here. I'm normally an IPA person, but found their Mexican lager to be great on a hot day. Lots of outdoor seating and a couple of TVs to catch the game. There's some food trucks on site too. Definitely turning into the new go to spot with the pups

reviews.author: Brittany L.
reviews.description: One of my all time favorite breweries. Their Raspberry beer is incredible. I stock up every-time I'm in Austin! Go check'em out and their awesome food truck outside.

reviews.author: Veronica H.
reviews.description: Great place to have a good drink and date night. Great atmosphere. I will be back! My friend love the beer.

reviews.author: Bill K.
reviews.description: Staff not wearing masks, Backdraft Pizza staff not wearing masks, patrons not wearing masks. That makes us feel safe and secure that all is now well.....  Nice space, good music with a casual atmosphere where you can even bring along man's best friend, both inside and outside.  Backdraft Pizza OK, nothing great nothing bad.... Celis Hazy; tasted like cardboard, and the Raspberry Beer, not so good.

reviews.author: Caitlin G.
reviews.description: Lots of parking Outdoor and Indoor Seating  Really appreciate Celis hosting a vegan pop-up over the weekend! We came for the food and decided to check out the brewery as well. The music inside was pretty loud, but I'm also an old lady.  It was pretty easy to find a seat indoors and out. I only wish they had a non-beer/gluten-free alcoholic option like cider or wine. Please add this to your menu in the future!

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: Super chill place with great people and two new fantastic food trucks, family run Neapolitan style pizza and delicious Hawaiian plates (shrimp is fantastic).

reviews.author: Abigail G.
reviews.description: Went to this brewery for their Tuesday's $1 oyster special, and had a great time! The brewery is easy to get to, has plenty of parking, and tucked away in a low key part of north Austin. Perfect place to stop by after work on a weekday. The oysters were outstanding, the price is awesome for east coast oysters. We also tried some of their beer, the Raspberry flavored beer is a must, absolutely loved it.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Came here to hang out with a small group on a Wednesday night. They have a big open space well suited to groups big and small. They also have events pretty regularly like weekly trivia and I saw posters for a democratic debate viewing party happening the next day.   The vibe here is very relaxed, they're dog friendly, have a couple of board games and a ping pong table. They had a food truck outside that seems to rotate fairly often. If you're up around the area and looking for a chill place to hang out after work you can't beat the vibe.   The only thing I had to give them a small knock for was the beer. I tried a flight and went mostly with the (very friendly I might add) bartenders recommendations. Outside of their standard witte they were all quite extreme versions of their respective flavors.   Their hazy ipa was super biter and lacked that usual juicy quality you'd expect from the name. The lime Berliner weisse and raspberry wheat were both missing much non fruit flavor. If you has given them to me blind I would have thought they were both sours.

reviews.author: Manasa D.
reviews.description: How and why have I not reviewed Celis!?! I'll put it down to old age.  Celis, as y'all know, is an Austin institution- steeped in history, the first craft brewer to bring Belgian beer to the craft world in ATX (I think), so y'all can rest knowing that their wheat beers are AWESOME.  The tap room is large, airy, albeit a little dimly lit. There's patio seating outside and get this- DOGS ALLOWED INSIDE AND OUT!   They also welcome kids! Actually I think everyone is welcome here. It's one of the friendlier breweries in ATX IMHO.  We've visited almost every Sunday during covid and I can say that they're taking every precaution. There's live music on the weekends from 6-9pm.  Beer wise - I like the options. If you're a sour beer connoisseur, you'll enjoy the raspberry sour. Light beer? Lo Lo Lager. Safe, easy drinking? Celis White.  I know this place has had its ups and down but as Austinites, we need to show support to our local businesses and just be cool with each other.

name: The Dig Pub
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Carlie M.
reviews.description: This has been one of our favorite local places for years now. The new owner, who previously worked here, is a real stand-up guy and has been nothing but awesome towards us. He has taken on a lot more than being an owner; he actually works his business and takes serious pride in the place. Having taken over just before the pandemic, and knowing what that did to restaurants all over, it is hard to see people leave such horrible reviews. You can tell some of the reviews might reflect the person leaving them and not the place itself. Do not let those deter you from trying this place. You will not regret it. The area outside was a great addition for the dogs and kids run around. We have favorites but like try something new from the menu when we go and have yet to be disappointed. Also, pretzels and beer cheese with beers...mmmm!!! My husband likes big beers and I like Kolsch. Want wine? They have that too. They always have something that makes us both happy and that is what keeps us going back for more. Every time we have friends or family in town, this is always on the list to take them. Help keep this local gem afloat! They deserve it! And remember, the more we go now, means the better the place will be in the future. He has plans up his sleeve but that takes revenue :) Keep it up, Dig Pub!

reviews.author: Justin S.
reviews.description: Not too much to say.  The workers are very friendly and the beer selection is okay. It's a strip mall, suburban kind of bar.   The manager told us she was the manager like 50 times so we'll never forget that she's the manager.    "I'm the manager". "So I'm the manager and I can add beer to our menu if you like". "I'm the manager, so I make decisions". "So I'm the new manager here and I can make things happen".   It was definitely a laughable but enjoyable experience. Nothing to special.  Just convenient because it's located nearby.   The guests were mostly old white people. The outdoor area is nice.  At least they have that, so you're not cooped up inside a small space with die hard Trumpers who hate everyone and everything different than them.  .

reviews.author: Ted C.
reviews.description: Evening in the suburbs and the dining options were dwindling. I was getting hungry and being out with my buddy meant that I'd have at least one more beer. My friend went through his mental list of places and came up with The Dig.   We arrived there and fortunately got there in time, it was a slow night and the kitchen was about to close so we quickly made our choices. I saw that they had Scotch Eggs and I'm a sucker for Scotch eggs, but unless you're a vegetarian/vegan what's not to like about an egg wrapped in sausage that's then deep fried?  I also ended up getting their Buffalo Chicken Sandwich because...actually why do you need a reason?  The egg was good, a little thin on the sausage side but the mustard dip added a little more savory. The sandwich had a good amount of spice but the sauce was pretty runny so it was messy but otherwise good.  They do have a lot of taps and I appreciate that they try to have a little bit of everything and focus on locals. I get that they have to strike a balance between locals who want a beer that's cold, yellow, fizzy and domestic and crazy whale chasing beer nerds that are into barrel aged, wild/lacto, hopheads but for my visit it was a little more on the tame side. I had a sour from Prairie and a local mead which was great and at the time, that was about it.

reviews.author: Jeff B.
reviews.description: Drove by here today and thought I would check it out and I liked it! I ordered a Peacemaker Beer, an ale that tasted good. The next time I want to try the Blackberry beer. The name itself is appealing. Since it was close to dinner I figured I should order food instead of going home and cooking. I got the fish and chips. You can order the 2 piece or 4. I got the 2 piece with cut fries. It was cooked good. The fish was flaky and not oily. The pubs tarter sauce was good.. the fries were very good too..   The service was very good. There was a sign to sit yourself which I did and within 1 or 2 minutes my server stopped by to get me started. She showed me the ropes and got my beer and food quickly. I was really surprised at how fast my food came out. I can say it was just under 10 minutes but I was still surprised at the promptness. There was quite a few customers but the servers were on top of it. They talked to the customers as if they were family.   The place was clean and there was good parking. The beer menu had several types of craft and IPA beers. I'm  pretty sure I will return when I have time. My total cost including the food and beer was only $14, amazing! Thank you Dig Pub for being in Cedar Park and giving up another place to get a beer and some grub in a friendly way!

reviews.author: Michael R.
reviews.description: There are lots of reasons to come in: Erick the bartender, the local beer options, the chill vibe, Erick the bartender, the buffalo chicken sandwich, Erik the bartender, and the whole staff is super cool. Never miss a chance to swing in on Tuesday or Sunday when I'm free. Welcoming, unassuming, the regulars are tons of fun, and overall a good time.

reviews.author: Nicki T.
reviews.description: The Dig Pub--new manager, new owner, now a new chef, things are really looking up, Cedar Park, Texas! The Sunday brunch is fabulous and should be famous, and the hollandaise sauce is definitely the best I've ever had. Topped off by Guinness and fried pickles, brunch was a hit. The chef hinted at more things in the works, like beer pairings and monthly specials, so we can't wait! Way to rock the craft beer, and now the food is being perfected by the chef, formerly of Snooze, Loro, and now the Dig! Awesome, mate.

reviews.author: Krista L.
reviews.description: In their left side room with 2 booths, the first booth was propped up to look like it was stable, but it collapsed when I sat down ...  my butt literally hit the floor! And I've broken my tailbone twice while playing sports. My wife and I reported this to several staff and received shrugs!! We stayed long enough to finish our beers and while we were drinking, staff propped the booth bench back together. I disassembled it twice but they kept putting it back. This place is just begging for a customer to get hurt and get a lawsuit!  If someone does, then I'm willing to testify.   I've posted photos of the bench c

reviews.author: Adrienne S.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and service. Food is typical bar/pub food but definitely a great place to grab a beer.

reviews.author: Lucky N.
reviews.description: This place is interesting. The right side of the restaurant looks pretty nice and lively and the left side of the restaurant looks like they gave up or ran out of money on decorating and just put a few tables out. They also have an outdoor area but no shade so I didn't want to sit out there unprotected, otherwise, it would have been nice because I had my dog. It was a bit busy so unfortunately had to sit on the left side (maybe everyone else there agrees the right side is better and that's why they all preferred to sit there). It didn't look or feel particularly clean and I'm a clean freak so I didn't particularly enjoy sitting there.   The service was fine; the waitress was nice. The food was pretty decent, but nothing outstanding or memorable where I feel I have to come back again. It was fresh though and I appreciate that for comfort food, it wasn't soaked in oil. I think the ambiance had already turned me off so I didn't enjoy my food as much as I would have it was clean.   They are known for their beer but I don't drink beer so take my review with a grain of salt. Clearly I'm not a dive bar kind of girl (unless it's out for drinks and bar hopping) but plenty of people are fine/really like those types of places so if you do, you'll enjoy this place. I'm not knocking this place and I would come back if friends wanted to go but I like more of an ambiance when I go out to eat.

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: Not only did the owner private message me after my last comment, he accused my wife of being in the way, while sitting at the bar top...  this place is a joke a JOKE What an ignorantly run, managed facility. Then he accused us of throwing things, If I had known this was coming I would of thrown half of my plate at the server, maybe then she would of gotten her tongue out of her boy friends mouth and actually gotten our order correct!

reviews.author: Kelsea K.
reviews.description: Good selection of various beers! Lots of tap options. Grilled cheese might have well been on the kids menu, pretty flat and boring... but my 5 year old liked it!  The adults got the Thor's Hammer and BLTA with fries and the table shared scotch eggs and pickle chips for apps. Sandwiches were straightforward and tasty and the fries were thick but crispy outside and soft inside.   Scotch eggs were better than Renaissance festival... but could have more sausage.  Pickle chips were average bar food. Overall, good meal and fair prices!

reviews.author: Rainey B.
reviews.description: So...for those who believe that The Dig is run by snotty brats, perhaps you should have some consideration for the amazing service industry folks who have gotten us through the last almost 2 years of Covid he!!. Erik, Sage, Miles, Kayla and the rest of the crew have been considerate and friendly throughout and the food quality has always been outstanding. The beer selection now is better than it has ever been (coming from an Austin beer snob who used to live on Rainey). Don't pass this place by if it is on your radar!

reviews.author: Sara J.
reviews.description: What a great evening at the Dig Pub! We took our dog and enjoyed sitting outside in the casual picnic area. Ben and Ashley provided the best service we've had in quite a long time. The food was fresh and quite tasty. Many choices for beer on tap...wine and cider, too. We will be back soon!

reviews.author: Chris R.
reviews.description: Knowledgeable staff about beer options. Friendly staff. Good food. Plenty of indoor and outdoor sitting.

reviews.author: Will S.
reviews.description: The Dig is a great local place in Cedar Park to meet friends and try out some really tasty brews, or wine if you prefer.  Lots of good seating both inside and out for  those who want a more open environment. Their pub grub is excellent, Scotch eggs to die for and some really tasty cheese offerings as well as some standard fare. The whole staff is friendly, honestly, never had a grumpy server and I really like sitting on a couch...one of the seating options depending on where in the pub you are. Check this place out, you might find that you....DIG it too.

reviews.author: Diana S.
reviews.description: Food - Acceptable Service - So-so Friendliness - Poor Chance of a return visit - Zero, mostly due to the unfriendliness of the waitress. Perhaps some training in the area of making your guests feel welcome in your establishment would help alleviate this problem.

reviews.author: Howdy B.
reviews.description: Nice place with relaxed environment. I'm not a beer drinker but I saw lots on tap. It's dog-friendly and the food is yummy. Alexander was super friendly and accommodating. We will be back!

reviews.author: Jim O.
reviews.description: The place to go in Cedar Park for a brew. Wife and I went for our anniversary night out to grab a bite and a brew. We had a blast. Service was exceptional with four different staff asking if we were good or needed anything. They were prompt and courteous and just plain nice. Food was served quickly and was delicious. Wife had the patty melt and I had the monte cristo; both were exceptional. The poutine as an appetizer is also on the to do list. We will be back.

reviews.author: Brian M.
reviews.description: We have been craving some loaded fries so we did a search and found this place. Recently they started offering delivery so we decided to order loaded fries, fried pickles, and a few beverages. The order was done fast and delivery was fast as well. Delicious food for a decent price. Support your local restaurants!

reviews.author: Steve W.
reviews.description: Very good food. Wings on Tuesday, fish and chips on Friday. Erik does a REALLY GOOD job. Good beer selection too.

reviews.author: Dr Cindy S.
reviews.description: Excellent wine selection. You will be very pleased. I am a bit of a wine snob so if you like great wine, check out this place.

reviews.author: David Z.
reviews.description: Anytime I see a place that is mistooken as just a gas station, but has gourmet burgers, draft microbrews, and full wine selection....you know I am going to check it out. This is a gastro pub, and very full selection of beer and wine, with dining area and covered patio. I will be back to check out the cheeseburgers next. Definitely an i dependent business that you wouldn't expect: stop in and check it out...on Gattis School Road.

reviews.author: Josh N.
reviews.description: I ordered the mushroom and sausage pizza for my wife and I. I ordered like thirty minutes before it told me to pick up.  When I got there, I waited an extra 15 minutes for the pizza. So 45 minutes after I ordered.  Normally that's not that bad but there was literally 5 people in the whole restaurant. 2 of them were working. That's pretty slow.    Brought it home and honestly I've had better frozen pizza.  It was real doughy and lacked a lot of flavor. Minimal sausage and the mushrooms. I bit off a piece and the cheese completely came off the pizza and there was barely any sauce holding the cheese on.  It was heavy on the dough and nothing else.   Unless they change the recipes and use more fresh ingredients, I won't be back.

reviews.author: Jeff U.
reviews.description: Called in order While I was 30 mins away   Said he needed 15   Cool no prob   Arrived and waited 20   Ok ok I'm alright   Double pepperoni was so good. I do prefer more sauce but, still good.   The pepperoni had the crunchy edges I like   Took home a piece of red velvet and Italian cream for my last    We both loved it all   Only one register so slow going but I recommend you try this out if the was gas station pub.   Serve alcohol on site and sell NUMEROUS types of beers microbrew stuff-more than I've seen most places.

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: The fries are fantastic. Worth the up charge from the chips. Unfortunately the burgers always have the potential to be amazing and are at times but more than not, they're over cooked and dry. I just picked up 3 burgers and spent $43 and they were all over cooked - again. The fries were great though.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: High Country Market and GastroPub was a great local place and my first time visiting, not my last that's for sure. There is a wide selection of beers and wines and saw people coming here just for the 6-packs of craft beers. I got the Philly cheesesteak and really enjoyed it and the fries. Go check this place out off Gattis in Round Rock.

reviews.author: Adam T.
reviews.description: Great pizza, fantastic beer selection.  Slow, rude, snarky service from the aged bar tender.    Brought in a group of four, and bar tender insulted me and my beer choice after I sampled a hazy ale, asked if he had a pale ale, and settled on a Yuengling.   He then ignored my wife when she tried to place order. The place was dead slow on a Monday night. I used to come more often, probably won't be back. There are plenty of places to grab a beer.

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: We continue to enjoy High Country Market and Gastropub for it's wonderful pizzas, craft beers on tap and casual ambiance. Our go-to pizzas are the pepperoni and the Hawaiian with pineapple and ham. We always ask for extra crispy crust and it never disappoints.  This time I got a great local craft growler that we enjoyed when we got home with the pizza.  Really hate to see our local neighborhood places struggling to stay afloat with just take out. Glad the stay at home orders are easing up.  I still ask fellow Yelpers to tip extra these days.  We'll continue to be regulars here.  Cheers!

reviews.author: Matthew M.
reviews.description: I cannot rate the food, and still may give it a shot in the future since it really does seem like my kind of place, but they wouldn't serve me.  Yelp says it closes at 10pm and the actual website seems to be hacked or given up on.   I showed up at 7:30pm they says kitchens closed, as the guy just finished putting down food in front of another customer.  I've worked food service back end. I didn't in any way want them to cook for me after closing the kitchen. It's not the cooks fault, but the front end had no explanation other than tough luck.  For a word of mouth, I'd expect a little more attention to those details and

reviews.author: Allyson L.
reviews.description: Visited for lunch today. The food was incredible, wagyu burger was delicious. The truffle rosemary ketchup is a must!  Visited during COVID and the place was clean, they're following all recommended precautions and I felt completely safe eating inside.   Will be back ASAP!

reviews.author: Jaclyn V.
reviews.description: This is food in a gas station and it taste like it. The food is not worth even a drive around the corner.  There are too many great places around to waste your time or money.  Staff is not friendly.

reviews.author: Cliff E.
reviews.description: This bar/gastro pub,always keeps great beer on tap, and the food is amazing,  I love the patty melt add bacon, on toasted rye bread.

reviews.author: Alexis B.
reviews.description: Wow pleasantly surprised by this recommendation and now I tell everyone who lives nearby about this.   High Country is a gas station..... with a bar in it, food, oh and casually 100s of different kinds of craft beer. Need I say more?   We stopped in on a Sunday to check out the selection and ended up staying for a beer and a burger.   The food: amazing and fresh. We did the $5 Sunday burger special, and might I mention the KETCHUP. I believe it's truffle ketchup, has me drooling about when I get to try it again.   The bar: great selection of beers on tap, they also have a whole selection of wine. In addition to the tap they have a variety of bottles in the fridge you can also pick from. They do Monday ALL DAY pint happy hour for $3.50, which is as cheap as they come by and local brewery tap takeovers on Thursday. Speaking my language.   The beer Togo: gosh almighty this is the place to get craft beer, but careful they aren't all cheap! They also have Pacifico in a can and a fabulous selection of commercial and domestic beer. They have fridges full of cans from breweries EVERYWHERE, not just Texas beer. They then have a whole large bottle section and more. If you like to try new brews - get here now!   If this didn't sell you ^ the people were also tremendously helpful and personable. Stop in if you are nearby and be ready to turn from skeptical to a regular. Shout out to the owners of Southern Heights (my fave brewery if you read that review) for introducing us to this place.

reviews.author: Tim C.
reviews.description: My wife loved her taco and I enjoyed my broken yolk BLT with unlimited Katz coffee from Houston.  They have an amazing selection of beers and wine.  The Katz coffee was superb and they have a selection of three different roasts to choose from, me likey!

reviews.author: Keith M.
reviews.description: Food is great, but they need to update their information. Phone number rings off the hook without an answer, and kitchen times are WAY OFF. Menu shows breakfast available at 630am, but when I went in to get food...they said their kitchen doesn't open until 11am...seems pretty counter intuitive when serving breakfast items...

reviews.author: Joseph S.
reviews.description: The "pancakes" that come with the pancake breakfast are actually closer to silver dollar pancakes, and they don't have ANYTHING to put on the toast   I asked for butter for the SINGLE thinnest piece of Texas toast I've ever seen, and they didn't have that or any jelly or cream cheese or ANY topping to put on this.  3 eggs, half a potato, two strips of bacon and a single slice of dried toast are not worth $8. Save your money and

reviews.author: Brett J.
reviews.description: What a great place for a beer and good food!!  If you haven't come here yet I highly recommend it for, if nothing else, their beer selection! They have the coolest draft beers on tap of just about any place I have been! And they do not cost a ton either!  I got the temptress mole and at 13% alcohol it was only 6$!!!! WOWZERS!  They constantly roll in and out different beers on tap and have a large cooler filled with other interesting types too... just can't go wrong!  Their wine selection is something to be cherished too... seriously... you have got to try this place!  Since the last time I was here it does seem to have slipped a bit in maintenance... light in hall way not working, icee machines down... cooler for sodas really low... and the extra TVs in eating area are off... I think we need to rally for this establishment!  For a gas station restaurant it is really so very very cool! You can't beat the selection! I don't want to see this place fold up... it truly is a coo cool coo place!

reviews.author: Sarah N.
reviews.description: I absolutely love this place. It's a hidden gem with great food, great beer, and great service!  Definitely opt for the rosemary ketchup. It's legit.  Their pizza is bomb. Their fries are great. Burgers are just okay, but I guess you can't have it all, right?  Go there - you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Raul A.
reviews.description: The best thing about high country market is that not only is it my neighborhood go to for beer and wine along with great gastro-type food.  That it follows the best Texan tradition of combining great people on both sides of the counter with that good food and drink.  A place we can enjoy the best things in life.  Good food, Good drinks and good people.

reviews.author: Penny J.
reviews.description: I'm puzzled after my last visit.  My Son ordered a glass of Cabernet Sauvignon and they said they didn't have any.  So we ordered a glass of Sauvignon Blanc and they said they didn't have that either.  My Son came and asked me what else I wanted since they didn't have either so I walked up and asked what they had.  The guy brings a bottle of Cabernet Sauvignon and said I have this. I laughed and said ok let me get a glass please. So if you specialize in wine, why not educate your bartenders on wine. There seemed to be only 3 bottles out of wine they were pouring.  Pizza was good. It was a busy Friday and everyone just seemed too busy and not customer friendly at all. I guess you have to be a regular and sit at the bar to get smiles.

reviews.author: A M.
reviews.description: Staff is always great- its a bar with munchies NOT a restaurant- pretty drinks exceptional service - clean, nice, comfy - whats not to love - just don't go expecting to eat a meal :-)

reviews.author: Cameron D.
reviews.description: Found this bar via reviews when doing an online search. Don't let the fact that it is a hotel bar fool you. Tony is an expert in making drinks. He is super cool and really everyone here is at the hotel as well. We live in the area and will come back for the famous brown sugar old fashioned and margaritas!

reviews.author: Jonathan B.
reviews.description: Come see Tony - had the brown sugar Old Fashioned. Yum!  Cool little place. Have some sweet and savory bites.

reviews.author: Joe R.
reviews.description: Was welcomed immediately. Friendly, attractive bartender. And most importantly, a good drink!

reviews.author: Edward C.
reviews.description: This is a hidden gem in Cedar Park. Tony the bartender is great. A real mixologist.  You MUST try this out.

reviews.author: Tim L.
reviews.description: We took the Austin Steam Train up to Burnet and absolutely loved it! We had both never been on a train before other than the metro and weren't sure what to expect.  The train had plenty of free snacks and we had our open table to play cards on the way up and back.  The Crew Chief even stopped by to give us some history on the different train cars which we really enjoyed.  It was a cold, rainy day but we still enjoyed the views on the way up and back and had a ton of fun exploring Burnet. We stopped by the Warehouse BBQ for lunch and also grabbed a coffee in town as well!  Well worth the trip and an overall fun experience!

reviews.author: Jessica L.
reviews.description: So I have very mixed feelings when it comes to our mini trip on this train.  I booked that groupon for the North Flyer as my kids are in love with trains so this would be a nice treat for them.  They enjoyed Santa and the hot chocolate, I didn't mind the scenery as it was pretty.  Santa, Mrs. Claus, and the story telling was only for a few minutes of the 2 hour ride.    The biggest issue is, I really thought the ride will be in motion for the most part.  I know there are stops but it really felt like we moved for 30 minutes and sat still for the rest o the trip.  It was really annoying and boring to just be sitting for most of the two hours on the train.  In fact, I believe you don't even leave the small town of where the train first left.    They should consider playing Christmas music (I saw speakers on the train) to keep people entertained if we are going to be sitting for 90% of the time.  Overall this trip didn't feel worth it for the price we paid.  2 stars~

reviews.author: Annie T.
reviews.description: My family rode the North Pole Flyer, not so much for the Santa stuff since we have no children under 10, it was more for family fun. And it was a fantastic experience. The train was actually pretty cool, I've never been in a proper train before, I mean, it was old fashioned but still just a really really cool experience. We paid for the private suite and it was worth it, we also walked throughout the train which was a bit old west feeling. My favorite part was walking between cars to see the view unencumbered by windows.   We walked through all the cars (like most people on the train did) to see what the other cars were like. The giftshop car was the nicestest with big windows and plenty of room to walk around while balancing yourself on a rocking and rolling moving train.   Some of the private rooms give you an idea of what is was really like to ride a train across country with a sleeper car, teeny tiny shower, and narrow hallways. It was such a great experience.   Not sure why people complain about the views because mine were fantastic! I mean, c'mon. We live in Texas not Denver. I know what the hill country looks like. There's no mountains but where the hills meet the sky is expansive. It was beautiful.

reviews.author: Frankie M.
reviews.description: Easy to book your tickets online. Usually depart on time. Cart sections depends on price range. Very family friendly.  You pick up tickets on a building near by (about 25 meters). You just give your name and how many in your party and you'll get your tickets. Once you get your tickets, you'll walk to where the train is located, show your tickets and they will direct you to your cart. Once you find your seat/section...relax and enjoy the ride! The view to Borne is very relaxing and enjoyable. The train does provide drinks and snacks and some alcohol. Mask as of Jan 22, 2022 is required during the train ride. Bathrooms are located throughout various train carts.

reviews.author: Cynthia V.
reviews.description: Full disclosure - I love trains, so I may be a bit biased around this experience. Having taken lots of scenic trains in Colorado/the West, I can see where some would be disappointed by the views provided on this ride - the route follows a state highway and what was probably pastures 20+ years ago is now developed as Austin sprawls outwards. The main selling point on this train is just getting to enjoy the most fun mode of transportation out there - a train! We don't often find ourselves in situations where we get to relax and enjoy a train ride, so any opportunity to do so is a winner in my book. However, there are some small improvements that could be made to the train cars/experience that I think would help overall: clean the windows both inside and out, re-upholster the seats, and add in PA voice-over announcements to give some brief history of the train line/cars instead of the volunteer attendant trying to yell it at a busy car. The time in Burnet is fine, we packed a picnic and enjoyed it at a park nearby the town square. Overall, I am glad to have done the Hill Country Flyer experience from Cedar Park to Burnet, but would say to manage expectations in terms of scenery.

reviews.author: Sophia G.
reviews.description: I liked my visit! I paid for the Cedar Park to Burnett ride. It's about 6.5 hours including a 2 hour stop in Burnett. I paid $60 per person for one of the more expensive carts the Rippling Stream one of the Adults Only lounges. And I'm glad I did. My cart had a lot of complimentary refreshments to choose from. And since we only had 10 people in my cart we pretty much had as many drinks as we wanted. I will admit we were the youngest people in our cart. So our fellow ride goers had higher expectations and were pretty disappointed with the look and feel of the train. But my boyfriend and I haven't experienced something like this before so we were excited and happy for the ride. So everything was new and great. I feel we're prepared for longer, faster train rides now. I really liked being in a cart with less people. We got to know almost everyone and we had great conversations. Daniel was absolutely amazing. His love for trains showed. And he was great to have conversations with. Great guy who answered everyone's questions and concerns.  We toured the entire train and it's nice seeing the other carts. There are definitely way more seats in the others. And they're nice too. My picture below was taken in one of the carts I toured in. (I only have videos of the one I was actually in). I will admit the city of Burnett didn't have much to see or do. I purposely brought my own food. After researching some menus I gave up on vegan options. Which is normal in small towns. It's a VERY small town. The best part was the little show the city of Burnett put on for us. The actors were great, friendly, and funny. A really great crew and was happy to watch their show. We were very tired by the time we had to get back on the train. We board at 8:15 and start the ride at 9. Because of waking up early and walking around the small town we pretty much fell asleep when the excitement died down. If you've been on a train before you might have high expectations. But if not and love new experiences and trying new things I think you'll really like this trip. I really enjoyed it. Thank you to all the volunteers for making this trip absolutely amazing.

reviews.author: Ronald W.
reviews.description: I rode this train out of austin many years ago behind the 442 on one of the short runs and had a blast, yesterday we took the long trip to Burnett and back. I was disappointed in the destination but not the ride.   The silver pine car was very clean and the seats were very comfortable, Noah who was in charge of our car was very friendly and had a good sense humor, even offered to get me a sign up sheet when I showed interest in volunteering.

reviews.author: Christina O.
reviews.description: Booked a sunset train ride for my husband and I and it was such a fun experience! We loved all the fun facts the volunteers had to share about the train cars and lifestyles of some of the riders back 100+ years. The sunset was magical and the night portion of the ride was really neat, having the moonlight illuminate the tracks in front of us. One of the cars is a dedicated gift shop/concession stand with a variety of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages to choose from. Everyone we came in contact with was so kind and made the experience that much more memorable. Overall such a great time - we would definitely book this experience again!

reviews.author: Candice D.
reviews.description: We had a great time on the Beer Train last night that was advertised as a sunset tour that was 2.5 hours long.  Note that you have about 45 mins moving time, then 40 mins stopped for the engine to be brought from the back to the front and then 45 mins back again. You don't really see much of the sunset, and you aren't moving for 2.5 hours. They also assign seats ahead of time, some of the cars were nicer and louder than others, so just depends what you're looking for. The association was responsive on social media when I had questions, staff and crew on board were all very friendly. They dont really follow any of their own posted rules about masks, no personal coolers, etc. so just something to be aware of- but I think this also varied by car. Overall we had a great time and would go again!

reviews.author: Roman H.
reviews.description: Their North Pole Flyer is like a joke. Don't waste your time and money, it is not worth it. Dirty cars, dirty seats, dirty windows with bleak scenery outside and Santa who gives a broken whistle. That is all for 2 hours trip. Even an obsessed with trains 4 years old was bored.  If you decide to go don't forget to take a mask or a respirator, it's hard to breathe inside because of dust.

reviews.author: Daniel P.
reviews.description: I'm pretty sure this is the tourism equivalent of chicken-and-waffles: another empty promise meant to separate me from my hard earned monies. Fortunately for me the plague was in top form. Was in the area looking for sustenance and 'Steam Train Association' showed on the map so I figured to pop in for a quick viddy before lunch. pulled up on a nearly empty lot, a shackled gate, and a locked door, the sign had the now common 'Closed for Plague' message which softened the blow of discovering "...that the train and rail yard are not open for public tours or photography" which meant the entirety of the museum was contained in the double-wide corner space in the strip. There's nothing inherently wrong with scenic train rides on vintage rolling stock, I've done it before and it's OK but that's just not my cup of meat. I was here for a bit of museuming but there was no museum to be had - nor postcarding nor touchable cars nor engines :-( sad face

reviews.author: Krystal S.
reviews.description: My husband and I went on the Hill Country Flyer for our anniversary weekend and we were in the "Rippling Stream" train car. The Train itself is quite impressive and was my first time on a real train not subway. The First Class Coach option was really nice and the seats were spread out along with social distancing, we felt really comfortable. My only complaint was it was VERY cold outside and though they are climate controlled, it was really cold the first half of the ride - coming back was much more comfortable. I also wished the lay over time perhaps had been 3 hours to provide a little more browsing time in Burnet. It would be cute to do music in each train car from the era the train was made. Ours was built in the late 30's so it would be a nice little touch that's simple to do! They had complimentary snacks and drinks which was a plus. Can't wait to do it again in a private suite!

reviews.author: Rebecca O.
reviews.description: Was a waste of money from Cedar Park to Burnet....was suppose to be Hill Country Flyer...saw no Hill Country...just a lot of brush blocking scenery....but not much of that either...Burnet was quaint...but will drive next time...big disappointment..

reviews.author: Allegre N.
reviews.description: This was an excellent experience. We took the train from Bertram to Burnet for one of the special events (Wedding Oaks wine trip). The staff was friendly and seemed very knowledgeable about the history of each train car. If you have a chance to walk to the very last car and look out the back, I definitely recommend taking in that view. I would have loved to take a longer trip and will look for other chances to ride.  The website is a little hard to use. We would have really liked a private cabin for our trip but didn't see how to book that on the website.   I wish the volunteer in our car would have been a little less Chatty Cathy when we weren't talking about the ride. It was a bit of a distraction from our enjoyment of the ride. Also, riding during COVID was a bit out of our comfort zone already so we were sad to see at least two volunteers wearing their masks covering only their mouth, not their mouth and nose. The website goes into great detail about precautions and that is a basic one not being taken. (That being said, they did a great job with social distancing and I felt like the train was very clean.)

reviews.author: Mike H.
reviews.description: Enjoyed my first ASTA experience today.  Here's my recap:  - Purchased a First Class Lounge ticket so I had my own room in Rippling Stream  - Train left the station on time, arrived at Burnet on time, and left for Cedar Park on time.   We were only an hour late reaching Cedar Park because a car thought it could outrun the train, but it could not.  Once the accident reporting was complete the train resumed.   - Personal note:  I am a train nerd and love riding trains, so my threshold of being annoyed on a train is higher than most.  This will affect my review below.    THE GOOD:  - clean cars, fun to walk in between them, and if you're without children, the adults only first class cars are a must - Rippling Stream and Nambe.   Otherwise with kids, I would recommend the Maurice Beckham or Eagle Cliff.    - the trip itself is smooth and the volunteers are friendly and helpful.  You can tell they enjoy being there, informing and helping others.     - Burnet has an abundance of antique shops if that's you're thing.  Also the soups at the downtown coffee shop are wonderful.     - The shootout show in Burnet, while not having a worry about winning any acting awards, is fun for the kids and has a good ending.  They could trim some of the fat from it, and make it a more concise / engaging story - there were a few too many awkward pauses.  But I applaud the folks who are likely doing this for free.  And the kids loved it.     THE NOT SO GOOD  - The scenic ride - if you're from the area this should not come as a shocker - is not that scenic.  There's a great bridge over the San Gab river but otherwise it's unremarkable trees, backyards, roads, and strip malls.    But again, none of this bothers me that much because I'm on a train relaxing.    - Burnet:  This is a sleepy, very conservative town.  One sign to deter thieves in a store said, "We got an alarm.  We got video.  We got guns.  DON'T BE DUMB."    While the downtown is a short walk from the train station, 2.5 hours here is way too much time unless you love antiques.   There isn't much else.   And as far as lunch goes, I highly recommend walking a bit farther past the first couple restaurants or else you'll have long wait times.   I went to a deli just a couple blocks away and it had no line.      - Announcements:  there are few.  Nothing along the way to alert you to landmarks or scenic opportunities (there is really just one, the bridge over the river).   But it would be nice to hear more than the pre recorded departure / arrival ones.    - The warm soft drinks:  no one wants green tea or apple juice at room temp.  There was literally an ice bucket next to these (but for scoping ice).  A second one to put these beverages on ice would go a long way.    - Lack of variety in snacks:  for a first class experience, at least more than the mini lemon cakes and mini cinnamon rolls would be nice.  Some savory, perhaps?   - chairs in the RS lounge car are what you'd find at your local dentist's waiting room.  I expected something that would at least remain comfy for 1.5 hours at a time.      OVERALL. - for the price I paid, it's 4/5 stars.  I knew the scenery wasn't going to awe, so most of my ranking is based on the train experience inside.  The quibbles above are all minor; chill the drinks, add some pretzels, get someone to donate an old leather chair or 2, and be a bit more chatty with us.    Those who really ranked their train ride low usually fall into the following categories, so please take them with a grain of salt:  - a/c sucked because it was Austin in the summer (hopefully fixable but not all that surprising) - solution is to go when it's not hot, the 60 days out of the year it's under 99 degrees.  I also think they have ironed out most of the a/c issues by now.    - Burnet was terrible, Burnet food was terrible, etc.  It's Burnet.  There's a reason it's not as well known as Fredericksburg.  You walk a bit father to get away from the crowds, you cross check their list of lunch spots they give you when you board  with a quick glance of Yelp reviews and you roll the dice.    - scenery sucked, super ghetto, etc.   Maybe because I grew up in St Louis, but using the word ghetto here is laughable at best.  It's junky, yes.  Unkempt, sure.   And truly, if you live in the region, you should know better than to expect breathtaking views.  You've driven on 183 east of 35?.  Same views.   If you're from out of town I could see valid point here since the website pushes it hard that it's scenic - but us locals know how much lipstick you can put on this pig.   So go check it out!  But go First Class if possible.  And be flexible about being home on time; like with any train, delays can happen.

reviews.author: Lori Ann L.
reviews.description: We rode the Hill Country Flyer which departs from the Cedar Park station and goes to Burnet, Texas,  where there is a two-hour layover so that passengers can disembark, do some shopping or grab some lunch or both.   Before leaving, the Burnet Gunfighters put on a show which is free to passengers, although they do accept donations.   The scenery leaves a lot to be desired, however that is not something that the Steam Train Foundation can control, they have a designated track and can not control who builds subdivisions or places gravel pits along the route.   If you are looking for a beautiful scenic ride, this probably isn't for you.  However, if you want to experience riding on a passenger train, and learning about the history of the railroads, it is a great experience.     They are very careful with social distancing and we felt completely safe riding the train.  I spoke with a couple of families that had young children and they loved it!   All in all, I would recommend it as a very enjoyable way to spend the day.

reviews.author: Peter D.
reviews.description: I rode the Sunset Express on 5-29-21 with my family, while on a trip to visit Austin. I'm from Southern California (this is important later). The scenery was certainly nice in some spots, but not enough. The sunset was awesome, but the experience wasn't that great. We paid for first class and rode aboard Eagle Cliff. Some basic drinks and snacks were provided, but the train was understaffed. No attendant for our car. One very sweet elderly volunteer was doing her best to handle two cars at once. I decided to offer to help, which she was very appreciative of. She said it was great that I wanted to help and so I did. I helped stock drinks and snacks as well as stocked ice to keep the drinks cold. Later on, a female volunteer who looked to be in her 40s came up to the counter said "Sir, you cannot be back there, what do you need?" I explained the situation, and she kind of had an attitude. I was informed in a rude tone that I had to be a member to help, and was given no thank you. Being that I live in Southern California, there's no way I could really be a member. While all this was happening, the AC in the car was doing a very poor job at keeping the car cold. It was unbearably hot in there, and everyone in the car was complaining. The excuse given was that the car is vintage and has a lot of runtime. The car was very original, and you could tell. That roughly translates to "we don't have the money or people to keep this car in tip top shape, and we don't have the money to upgrade it".  Eventually, my family was re-seated to the Rippling Stream. That was much better, but it didn't change the overall experience. Cherry on top was we were over an hour late returning to the Cedar Park station.   Not worth the money.

reviews.author: john g.
reviews.description: We also did the Xmas Polar Express train ride. Tickets were about $50 each. We also went with a friend and their kids too.   I'll give this train ride 4 stars. The kids were excited to see Santa and the ride was slow at times.   To start, one of the first things was a balloon guy. Ours was awesome. He was funny and overall entertaining. He had me laughing my @ss off.   Next came hot chocolate... it's hot chocolate.   After that was, singing Christmas Carols. They had 2 girls from McNeil high school. I felt sorry for them. They were nice, but they couldn't just get our car interested in singing.  A few of us sang, but overall it was a failure. I'm sure adult beverages if allowed/served would help the spirit. Great job to them but our car was mostly interested. It probably didn't help that they gave us a cookie just before they arrived so everyone was stuffing their face.   After that was story time, the lady reading the Story was animated and funny. Kudos to her.   She visited just before Santa.   Then Santa came. We were in one of the last cars so his visit was a bit rushed. He was nice and gave everyone a wooden train whistle.   ***********The entire operation is run by volunteers. So I'd like to thank all of them for their time!*******  This was he first time my son was not afraid of Santa:-)

reviews.author: John M.
reviews.description: This was a great little adventure from Cedar Park to Burnet Texas. Super We stayed in the Turquoise Room, which consisted of 2 tables, 8 chairs and two smaller windows. Staff was super friendly and knowledgeable...Once the train started the conductor came in to room to announce that there we several open seats in the main car...everyone got up and left leaving the wife and I in peace...Not that we are anti social, but it was peaceful to say the least...Good to catch up with each other, as we both work different hours...Truly not much to see on the way up...but it was a great ride....AC did work, not great but tolerable...I see in other reviews there were issues...You have freedom to roam Car to Car once the train gets rolling...and the train does turn around in Burnet...hard to explain, but it does...and we were able to see the other side of the tracks on the way home...Plenty to see and eat in Burnet...Our Car/cabin also came with free snacks and drinks...which is a great perk..as the snacks in the concession stand were quit expensive...The trip was worth it for us and will do it again next year with the granddaughter..

reviews.author: Liz I.
reviews.description: This review is based on my customer service experience with Zena, not the train ride itself (although I may come back and give an update!)  Zena is a lifesaver. Not literally, but she has made my train experience 2x as good. I bought a Groupon because I didn't even realize there was a train experience in Austin. After the headache of scheduling, our trip got canceled. Zena came in to save the day. She mailed me another gift certificate that expired in a year (vs the next week per my Groupon) AND she gifted us a little extra!  Sounds great, right? Unfortunately, the GC could not be redeemed online. After multiple tries of calling in (and getting a forever ring - no pick up), I was getting irritated.   I emailed Zena back asking for her advice. She wrote back in 24 hours and apologized for their phone service. She even offered to reserve me herself. After a few back-and-forth emails, she answered all my questions and got us all squared away.  Our train ride happens this weekend and I can only hope that the experience is similar to Zena's customer service.

name: Culinary Dropout
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Popped into the area looking for lunch and stumbled upon this place. Glad I did!   Loved the atmosphere with it half outside dining and inside dining. I think it's so versatile you could bring family and kids here, or turn down in the evening with a hot date for a nice dinner.   The cocktails are very good. I had the "Room Service" which is a refreshing gin cocktail.   The smoked salmon appetizer was sooooo good with the saltiness from the capers, perfected toasted ciabatta, and perfectly cooked egg. Highly recommend!   The Shaved Prime Rib sandwich was very good as well, and my son had ordered the Turkey pastrami sandwich, which was also very good!   We sat at the bar and the staff was top-notch. Friendly, attentive, intuitive and on their game!   I recommend this place for any occasion.

reviews.author: Trenesia S.
reviews.description: This was my first time visiting this place we came in town for the weekend and had brunch here at the bar   - we stayed in a nearby hotel so we simply walked however there plenty of garage and street parking available if you're not close   Went on a Sunday around 11:15am for brunch ... we always choose bar seating to avoid waits .. (there was a 5 min wait for tables not bad )  I ordered the peachy mimosa and added a tequila shot it was perfect . My boyfriend ordered the breakfast sandwich he  loved it For food I ordered the hash bowl another great choice no complaints ( it did take a while to get your food which is the only reason for my 4 star review ) but the wait worth it . Bartenders were friendly and available.

reviews.author: Braden J.
reviews.description: Culinary Dropout, more like you'll wanna Drop In...bad puns aside, easily one of the best places in the Domain to gather a group of friends and enjoy their very spacious patio. Certainly compliments the great food they have to serve as well.  Atmosphere: Very fitting of the domain and Austin, modern hipster style so very open with a nice view of the domain surroundings. Live music is played on occasion as well, which really makes for that feel of a local flavor styled joint.  Food: Having come here several times and trying most their food items, you can't really go wrong with any particular choice, just whichever suits your craving for that moment. My personal favorites though is the Fried Chicken. Most certainly worth the wait, and comes with flavorful mashed potatoes and gravy mmmhmmm. Meat is well cooked with good texture and doesn't have an overly heavy taste or feel that most deep fried foods commonly come with.  Service: Every time I've gone services has been great. Staff is friendly and can help accommodate any assistance or questions you may have.   Hungry around the domain and need a place that will leave you full with a good experience? Drop-in to Culinary Dropout. Perfect for anyone seeking a casual and enjoyable night.

reviews.author: Elisa M.
reviews.description: Joined folks for lunch and I think I went wild on the appetizers that I was full when it came time for the main dish. We ordered the Brussels, deviled eggs, and  bread, my sister ordered the kale salad with steak and my friend ordered the chicken bbq salad.   So I'll start with the bread - it's grilled and has some balsamic on it. A little salty but good. The deviled eggs came 3 to an order and I love a good deviled egg but this was "meh" at best. Seems like it needed a little more seasoning and there wasn't anything special about it. I will say I'm not usually a fan of brussel sprouts but these aren't mom's brussels. These were fried and then tossed in a sauce (Korean go-guchang) and is a little spicy but oh so good. The kale salad was a lot of small pieces of kale, the steak was tender but I can't say I'd order it again (or steal it off my sister plate). The chicken salad was good and came with a deviled egg.   Overall, it was a good lunch - we did order 4 drinks and the total came up to about $100.   We were able to sit outside on the porch under a heater which made it a great atmosphere. I will say that I saw the chips and dip and will come back to try that.

reviews.author: Chastitie A.
reviews.description: Culinary Drop Out is a good place to recommended for a hang out spot with good food and drinks. Very trendy place, and there's usually live music on the weekends. The outside patio "pre-COVID" had lots of games for guest to play. There's enough TV's to watch sports from anywhere you're sitting. I recommend ordering the fried chicken and homemade mash potatoes. I think it's their most popular dish. The dish is fried to the perfect level of crisp, and it's very juicy!  I also like their salmon!  As far as the drinks, if I'm not ordering my usual Austin Eastcider, I'm getting their jalapeo margarita! One of the best in town!   The vibes are always good here.

reviews.author: Raychel R.
reviews.description: I originally discovered CD when I used to live in Arizona. It was always THE spot to hang out on the weekends with large groups. I was happy to see CD had an Austin location!  We came on a week night and it was still pretty crowded. Wait time was about 30 minutes, so that gave us some time to walk around and do some window shopping at the Domain. Once we were seated, we put it our order right away.  Pretzels and Fondue: The softest pretzels!!! Perfect for dipping in the provolone cheese sauce. We actually got 2 rounds of these as they were that good.  El Matador: tequila, elderflower, ginger agave, and orange bitters. This is my favorite drink here. Has enough of a fruit taste without being overly sweet. And the bartender made it with a lot of love. Lol. Only 2 drinks and I was finished for the night.  Our server was really great and kept checking on us throughout the night. Fun crowd. Fun music. And a really fun time.

reviews.author: Ashley B.
reviews.description: Just tried to eat here tonight (Tuesday 2/15). Got here around 7:30pm and was told there was a 30 minute wait- no problem we waited. At 8pm on the dot we got a text our table was ready. We were seated and already knew what we wanted so the second our server came over we ordered, maybe 8:05pm. We saw tons of dishes coming out but figured with how busy it was it might be a bit. At 8:35pm someone (not our server) came over and told us "so sorry about the wait, you're up next" we waited 15 more minutes after at least 15 orders came out and finally couldn't stand it anymore and left. We wasted an hour and a half and still left hungry.   The sad part is this is not the first time we've experienced bad service here. Last time we came here with a reservation and were sat outdoors when we reserved an indoor table. 20 minutes passed and no one came to our table even though multiple servers passed us. We asked a girl who was clearing tables if there was someone who could take our order and she came back and said no one wanted to so she took our order. I guess that should've been our red flag last time not to visit again but we love the food and gave it another chance.   We've been to Culinary Dropout at several locations in Arizona and never experienced anything like this. The Austin location definitely doesn't hold the standards of the others. We won't be returning and suggest you don't either unless you have 2-3 hours to spare to wait for your food.

reviews.author: Christina F.
reviews.description: Seems like more of a young person drinking place than a good food place.   I didn't love the pretzel bread with cheese "fondue." The cheese seemed like the fake cheese you get in prepackaged containers/baseball games. The pretzels were slightly warm but were a bit dry. Would not recommend.   We both had the Turkey pastrami and didn't love or finish them. I had the French fries and they were good and friend had the side salad and said it was good.

reviews.author: Ashley G.
reviews.description: Get the butternut squash lasagna!! So amazing and melted in my mouth!! Make a reservation but great atmosphere with ping pong and corn hole.

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Originally was going to stop for a quick lunch but got ahead of ourselves when looking at the menu.   Brussel Sprouts (3/5): not crispy like I expected it to be but the flavor was solid and unique.  Salad (4/5): they made kale taste good. that's impressive!   36-hour Pork Ribs (3/5): very sauce-y and therefore, very messy. At least the flavor was decent. The ribs itself were are not very tender.   Steak Frites (3.5/5): not bad but also not great. The salad on the side was great tho.   Korean BBQ Skirt Steak (4/5): lots of flavorrrr. Better than the Steak Frites. The meats on these two dishes actually tasted the same but this one had sauce. I actually liked this main the most out of the ones that we tried!   Overall, chill spot for a nice dinner with friends. I would rate this place a 3/5 for the food but probably bump it up because of the ambiance. There's lots of space and a few games to play so the vibes probably make up for the food.

reviews.author: Sabrina S.
reviews.description: Located in the Domain, this is a hoppin' place on an evening for a weekend dinner. Bit of a wait for a table for 4, but no worries.  Eventually we were  seated and our server was super friendly.  We ordered a couple of drinks to start. I didn't care for my cocktail two to mango at all. Hardly tasted the fruit flavors of pineapple, guava, orange or the mango white claw, since it was so overpowered by the vodka. I just passed the drink onto my son. We put our order in for our meals and it took quite a bit of time for the meals to come out. We had to flag down our server to find out what was going on. She mentioned they had many orders and were backed up.  We were a bit disappointed when our meals arrived. My burger was super dry and my son's salmon dish looked like an appetizer. The portion size of the salmon was small and the amount of risotto it was sitting on sad. We left very hungry. Service was slow, food and drinks are overpriced. Not sure we'll come back.

reviews.author: Erin S.
reviews.description: We had a party of 8 at 1:30 pm on the Friday of ACL weekend. It was pretty packed, but they were able to accommodate us. Service was great!  Here's what I tried: - Evil Jungle Princess ($13): This fruity rum drink was good! - Soft Pretzels and Provolone Fondue ($13.25): The pretzel bread was good. The cheese was good. $13.25 is a lot for what it is though. - Gojuchang Brussels Sprouts ($6): It maybe came with 5-6 total brussels sprouts. It tasted good, but super not worth it. - The M.A.C. Burger ($14.50): Their take on a McDonald's Big Mac. It was good!  Fun vibes. Convenient if you're staying in the Domain.

reviews.author: Angela W.
reviews.description: Music is loud, crowd is loud, I consider this a great place for my family of 4 dining out. With two young kids, I often have to rethink my choices. Culinary dropout is great.
