Our meals included tortilla soup, shrimp chili relleno, street tacos and one of the special plates. Needless to say we waddled out... Our experiences in the past were a little inconsistent but this time they were right on point. Looked like there were enough employees to take care of the good crowd they had. It was fairly noisy though. Lots of families and groups.  Thanks Paige, keep up the good work! As I'm prone to say when it's appropriate, this is a repeater! Happy Holidays fellow Yelpers!

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: El Monumento is always a solid choice for Mexican food and drinks in Georgetown. I love the decor and the beautiful view from the patio. The queso and guacamole are delicious and I've always enjoyed the margaritas. The hours of operation are a little unusual. They open at 3 pm on Sunday and there is normally a line of people waiting to get in so I would recommend getting  reservation.

reviews.author: Trevor D.
reviews.description: We had a party of 20 show up. It was pure and utter chaos for our server Eric, but professional and never forgetful was he. I have spent two birthday parties here and these guys and gals nail it every time. I can't begin to describe how awesome and on their A game they were for us. My hat goes off to y'all, thank you for a memorable experience, we will be back.

reviews.author: Stacey U.
reviews.description: The service here is not what it used to be. We have had some unfortunate experiences with the wait staff. The food is ok, but the patios is outstanding!

reviews.author: Olivia O.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere. Food was good. Excellent service. Very busy... food was served in a timely manner. Highly recommend

reviews.author: Kyle G.
reviews.description: Excellent atmosphere- excellent food and great service. Will be back many more times! Hard to believe this place doesn't already have 5 star reviews all the way across the board!

reviews.author: Kasie M.
reviews.description: I can not believe I haven't reviewed this place yet, we used to be frequent flyers here pre covid.   My favorite part about this restaurant is the outdoor seating and ambiance. It's relaxing, quiet shaded, and you can see the water below.   The service has always been pretty good, no complaints there.   The food is very good and the drinks too, their cucumber/jalapeno margaritas are perrrrfecccct.   I agree with many of the other reviews, it's much pricier than its competitors for very comparable tasting food. Post covid, you even have to pay for chips and salsa- which is unusual at a mexican restaurant.

reviews.author: Heather L.
reviews.description: Just wanted to add another amazing experience. Took my hubby here for the first time the other night and he loved it as much as I did. The food quality was perfection and our waiter Phillip was very considerate of my need to avoid wheat and talked to the kitchen to help me decide on what to eat. Wonderful service. Wonderful food.

name: Doc B's Restaurant + Bar
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Dessert

reviews.author: Sharo R.
reviews.description: We love it here!  The very first time we went, I was like "well, it was a good chicken sandwich, but kinda expensive" and my husband was like "well, my filet mignon was amazing" and the following time I ordered the chicken lo main and it was AMAZING, that is my order every time. It is pricy, but you get way more what you pay for. The food is 10/10, the service and staff 20/10!  We've been here once a week since we arrived to Austin. We love it!

reviews.author: Liz M.
reviews.description: This was my first time ever going to Doc B's and let me just say they did not disappoint. The atmosphere is laid back. Lighting could be a little better but it sets the mood. Our waitress Graziella was amazing!!! Super friendly and just down to earth! She's gives all the good vibes. The food is to the tee. I had the Carnitas burger and it is a must, not to mention The Wedge burger. I requested a drink that wasn't on the menu and not only did they make it for me but they put their twist on it and made it better! Let's just say after my party tasted my drink we had to order a round for the table! Thanks again Josh!! The Key Lime will make you think someone's aunt is back there making it with love  and the home made Oreo Ice Cream is something to talk about. We will definitely be seeing you guys again. Btw I won't be upset if you decided to put that drink on the menu...

reviews.author: Drew T.
reviews.description: Great expensive food! They make everything from scratch so be prepared to wait. It's a fun place to bring your friends or coworkers if you aren't in a hurry and aren't afraid to spend a bunch on appetizers. The meals range from $15-$30. I've never been disappointed. The fish and chips are currently my favorite.   Some nights it can get really loud outside, so be prepared for that. It's almost always busy, so if you want to give it a try be safe and make reservations.

reviews.author: Luis G.
reviews.description: This spot is amazing!   The location is perfect, the service was great and the "food" was fantastic lol.  Reason for my quotation marks is because my gf and I came to hang with one of her friends and they wanted to have a "cake and wine" type of night so that's exactly what we did. The menu did not look disappointing so I'll definitely have to come back to try a plate.   The cheesecake I believe it was, was absolutely amazing! Definitely has a very sweet taste but I mean, if you're looking for dessert you should look no further.   We also had a couple of glasses of wine and cocktails. All fantastic. My gf ordered the fantastic beautiful and it was delicious!   If you're in the area and looking for some food or just a place to grab a couple of drinks while chit chatting, this is definitely the spot to hit up at the domain. Not loud but not too quiet, dim lighting to set the mood, and a very laid back atmosphere

reviews.author: Sunita G.
reviews.description: I came here with my coworkers one afternoon for lunch. For the table, we started off with the house made Guacamole and grilled Artichokes. The Guacamole came with sweet potato chips and I ordered the number six chicken sandwich with kale slaw for the main entree. The chicken sandwich had the right amount of cajun seasoning. The burger and sandwiches here come with french fries or slaw. I feel I definitely did good by ordering the kale slaw instead of the fries because the kale slaw was out of this world. It was very good and fresh. Yum!! Highly recommend it.   Service and ambiance was outstanding.

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Currently writing with one button of my jeans undone - Doc B's food has me full to the brim.   Not usually a big American-food person but I was curious why this place was so well-rated and wanted to try it for myself.   I asked the server to let me know what are the best things on the menu. She was very familiar with the restaurants' offerings and she killed it with her recommendations. Here's what we got:   For appetizers, Housemade Guac and Oven-roasted Wings are must-gets. The Guac is great because the chips are unique: baked sweet potato chips! I could munch on these all night. Thankfully, the Oven-Roasted Wings stole my attention as soon as it landed on my table. Best. Wings. The Chimichurri sauce is addicting!   For mains, our server mentioned that the West Coast Steak Sandwich is the best. One bite in, I wholeheartedly trusted her. It's cooked to perfection and the bed of greens helps to cut the fattiness of the meat. The Chimichurri Steak was also pretty good but the steak on the West Coast Steak Sandwich was better. The fries were well-seasoned, perfectly thin, and crispy. Oh, we also threw in a Brussel Sprouts Salad, which was needed to balance the heavy meal.   - Our server was knowledgeable about the menu (+1) - Everything came out so quickly, I think in less than 20 minutes (+1) - Our server's recommendations were spot on and the food was great (+1, +1) - Very reasonably-priced for how good this restaurant is (+1)   That's a solid 5-stars in my books. Highly recommend!  p.s. I dined at the bar to skip the wait, which was going to be 45 minutes (7:30 PM on a Wednesday night). Reservations are probably needed because of how busy the Domain gets.

reviews.author: Ronald l.
reviews.description: Place is very nice looking and food was very tasty. We ordered the 1lb angry meatball with rigatoni. First one we got was a little cold but we tasted it and was really nice taste manager took and brought us a new hot one right away.  Meatball was melt in your mouth but red pepper spicy be prepared with drinks.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Doc B's Restaurant + Bar in The Domain had good dishes. They received 4 stars because the prices were higher than I'd expect for this food. Even the apps were pricey. They have a good bar and patio with TVs for the big games. The server was clearly new to serving based on his awkward interactions with us. I ordered the Chicken Paillard (arugula, tomatoes, pickled red onion, and shaved reggiano with gold coast vinaigrette). I had to really dig for the chicken under the mound of arugula but it did have good flavors, just way too much rabbit food on top. The buttermilk fried chicken looked good so if I go back, I may have to try that.

reviews.author: Vickie H.
reviews.description: my boyfriend and I had dinner at a very busy time and did not have to wait at all. At first we choose this place because most of the other restaurants had a very long wait time. We were both glad we choose to eat here. I don't remember our servers name but so many other servers including ours were very attentive and kept checking on us. What made our experience over the top was when  the manager, josh stopped to talk to us about the restaurant(history with the restaurant), different recommendations around the area. We were very appreciative of the conversations with Josh during a busy dinner time.  I had the chicken parm. it was very flavorful and the right portion of pasta for the chicken. my boyfriend had the filet and he said it was great. the Potatoes that come with are delicious as well. I had a few to try!  We definitely will be back!

reviews.author: Alexander K.
reviews.description: Great food and staff, typical Domain parking, just plan on parking in a garage, which is very close. Pleasant environment.

reviews.author: Trevor L.
reviews.description: Pretty good experience. Decided to sit outdoors because inside was freezing. Server was pretty friendly and didn't have any problems with the food. I wouldn't call the Cajun turkey sandwich Cajun because nothing about it really tasted Cajun.    Overall, food came out hot and tasty, drinks were great (if you know what I mean), and overall good interaction with everyone.

reviews.author: Veronica R.
reviews.description: Omg, I am a picky eater and decided to step out of my zone and choose the homemade guacamole and sweet potato chips.  Absolutely Devine. So much to the point I bought sweet potatoes to try and recreate. Lol  Next was the chicken kebabs and cucumber and feta salad. Can you say I almost licked the plate!   If you have not eaten here then it's a must. I stretched my neck out for what others were ordering and it all looked so yummy. I'll be a repeat customer for sure.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Nice place, good service, but food was disappointing and pricey. $17 for guac?? Serving was big but no flavor other than avocado. Chips didn't go well with it. Had the wok bowl and wow no seasoning or flavor in the steak. The teriyaki was mildish which was nice to not be overpowering. Still just everything was not worth it and mediocre and not up to its ambiance feel.

reviews.author: Michelle W.
reviews.description: I fell in love with candied bacon. There I said it. It had the perfect kick to it.   I tried the udon noodles which were great. The server even brought extra sauce without prompting.   My friend had the Cobb salad which looked amazing. Considering she wanted to go mainly for that I'd say it must be good.   We went on a week night which went decently without too much of a crowd.

reviews.author: Andy N.
reviews.description: I came here with some friends, and they surprisingly took us in with mo wait time on a busy Friday night. The food was delicious. It was what I expected, and the service was superb. Although, the small portions with the high prices is something to note. While many of the items were a bit high, the portions were lacking. Besides pricing and portion, the food is what you expect and good.

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: One of the places we went for my wife's birthday week. She had been hearing good things and saw great reviews, we went with another friend who also has a birthday in June.  The place was very nice, you had indoor and outdoor seating, the staff wore masks. We sat inside as it was hot, there is a parking garage, the purple one, right across the street so that was nice.  Service was great and fast. We started with some drinks and candied bacon and chips and Guac. The bacon was very good, agreed on by all three of us. The water did not come with ice which I found rather weird but maybe it's not but they keep it filled.  Our friend has the Cobb salad, Shana had the Turkey Burger, and I had Chicken. They both liked theirs, my fries were really good but unless you dipped the chicken in one of the sauces they brought it was pretty dry. Good flavor but dry.  The food was good, they raved about the chips but the guac was not as great as they were hoping. Overall it was good but not as good as many review make it sound, I admit I expect more when the food it more expensive and two of the three meals being good is great but while I am glad we went, not going to be on my normal rotation of places to go on date nights.

reviews.author: Kelly L.
reviews.description: my friends and I were in the area and wanted to grab lunch. we wanted to come here because they have a dog friendly patio! huge  plus! they're also conveniently located by two parking garages and very close to many other stores in the domain.   the food was very average though in my opinion for the price we paid. the angry meatball was HUGE but tasted very unimpressive after you get through the initial outer crust that is covered in the sauce. the chimichurri steak lacked flavor and seasoning. the only good part I enjoyed was the fries.   service was a little slow but it was also sunday lunch so understandable.

reviews.author: Allen P.
reviews.description: Great place and the service was wonderful! Staff was attentive, the food was perfect and the drinks complemented it just right.

reviews.author: Dip D.
reviews.description: Been here for lunch a couple of times. Excellent service and food each time. I usually get salads but the apps looked good and the burgers were good too.

reviews.author: Josolyn N.
reviews.description: Our new favorite restaurant! The food was amazing along with the service. Josh, the manager and Tony, our waiter were great! The oven roasted wings, knife and fork cobb salad and marinated filet mignon wok out bowl were perfect. Highly recommend for a wonderful dining experience!

name: Twin Peaks Round Rock
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Best nights on Wednesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Scott T.
reviews.description: What excellent customer service this fine establishment has!   If you're looking for perfection, then order The MOZZARELLA CHEESE BITES! (hand cut mozzarella  panko breaded to order  marinara  ranch) $7.99 !   These little squares of heaven have a crunchy exterior and mild, cheesy interior. All this deliciousness is paired with your two favorite sides for dipping. Wash all this down with a Tall Dirty Blond - Ahem....  (unfiltered American Wheat Ale features a citrus aroma and flavor spiced with Indian coriander and orange peel) and a friendly smile and hug from your local talent.   I prefer the North location vs. the South spot, purely based on the cheese flavor......  Enjoy.

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: Casual atmosphere makes this place welcoming. The food and customer service keeps us coming back.   We have tried:  Triple Play - Served with guacamole, queso and salsa.  All three was great. The queso super creamy, the guacamole perfectly seasoned and the salsa was warm and not too spicy  Steak Salad - A large amount of steak lay on top of a freshly made salad - soo yummy  Beer Battered Fish and Chips - perfectly fried fish along side some seasoned French fries, cannot go wrong with this dish  Turkey Avocado Smash sandwich - Amazing sandwich and a must try  Blacked Fish tacos - There was pineapple in it which threw me off but otherwise, good tacos.  The fish was plentiful and you are served 3 large tacos with this dish along side some chips and that delicious salsa.

reviews.author: William F.
reviews.description: We went to Twin Peaks yesterday for dinner. We walked inside and immediately the hostess was very rude. We were seated within a minute which was nice. Our waitress was immediately very rude so we ended up leaving within three minutes of getting to the restaurant. We will not be returning.

reviews.author: Devin H.
reviews.description: The food was good and drinks were cold. Great environment friendly hostess chicken and steak salad were cooked great

reviews.author: Robert L.
reviews.description: Had the Billionaire Burger and it was awesome. The staff was great. Allison was our waitress and she did a good job. I'll be back soon.

reviews.author: Yusmine V.
reviews.description: Best service!!! I lost my phone the night before. Which one of the servers found it in the toilet. She was kind enough to pull it out of the toilet! where I accidentally dropped it!

reviews.author: Fahri Y.
reviews.description: It was great time spending here. Food was good, mexican mule was delicious. I wish they brought back the Mexican martini with shakers. Lily was awesome, even though she is still in training. She was super kind.

reviews.author: Courtney T.
reviews.description: Honestly not even sure why I came here. I think it was because chilis next door was way too pack. You come here to the entertainment/ servers and to drink. Don't come here if you are hungry and want good food. Our server was weak and the food was awful. Not coming back.

reviews.author: Matt W.
reviews.description: Food generally decent but unless you are a regular, staff seems to ignore customers.  Recent server  took our order then closed us out as we were getting food ( she was changing sections) and told us someone else would take care of future drink orders which I was clear I would need.  No one ever came back so we left and watched  remainder of playoff football game down the street at a restaurant that wanted our business. Young lady at front desk seemed to think it was no big deal and dismissed it at common practice.  I'm pretty sure this happened to several others in our section as well.

reviews.author: Hvnter B.
reviews.description: Been here 3 times and it's a fucking nightmare every time I come. Takes 10 minutes for a server to acknowledge you and then after she takes your order, you don't see her for 20 minutes.  I like Twin Peaks, especially the one in Odessa, but the service at this one just sucks ass.  3rd times the charm, probably won't be coming back to this one  Edit: only reason I'm giving it one extra star is because the jalapeo vinaigrette is fucking good

reviews.author: R R.
reviews.description: Great chicken wings!!! Great service....most of the gals are very sweet. (The girl at the front door (hostess) is crabby but no biggy.) the bartender is very good with staying on top of her customers needs. I do think there should be an employee bathroom because the gals have to hang out there and are in and out to maintenance their appearance, And as a customer it's not professional to go into a bathroom full of employees, whom are talking about customers, their hair and make up, their boyfriends etc. it makes me think that twin peaks doesn't value their employees enough to even provide them with a break/powder room.

reviews.author: MR M.
reviews.description: Went there last night and ordered the Texas style Philly cheesesteak it was god awful filled with peppers I picked out what little meat was in there and ask for my check and I was out of there

reviews.author: Adam B.
reviews.description: I ordered pickup and was incredibly disappointed with the portion of soup they provided (this is the Bowl, not the cup!)

reviews.author: Mike C.
reviews.description: Great experience for lunch!  This was my first time to visit Twin Peaks. Grabbing lunch while my car is getting an oil change. The food was tasty and the staff very friendly. Restaurant was also inviting and clean. Savanna was really attentive and timely.

reviews.author: Ashley R.
reviews.description: Jordan was our server, she was great! I don't feel like the servers are usually that attentive or sweet but we still go because we love the beer and nachos!

reviews.author: Shayer S.
reviews.description: Good service. Like the lodge vibe. Lots of TV's around with various sports playing. The nachos are enormous - good enough for 4 people and pretty tasty too! They have a lot of specials during the weekdays, not too much during the weekend when we went though.  Clientele is varied...ranging from dudes by themselves to buddies watching the game to confederate flag t-shirt/jacket wearing fellas.   All in all, not as trashy as I was expecting and it was an interesting experience. The food was actually pretty decent so I may take out in the future but I don't think I'll be back to eat-in anytime soon.

reviews.author: Emily K.
reviews.description: Armani was a phenomenal server. She is lively and beautiful and has great table etiquette. I cannot get over warming smile and kind words.  Alycia is such a rockstar. She's quick with her service and is so fun to make jokes with and loves to have fun while keeping it totally professional.  Christlynne and Kaylee are the BEST bartenders i've ever had. Their service is fast and quality. I don't recommend anyone else to make your drinks. Their chemistry behind the bar is unbeatable.

reviews.author: Rueben A.
reviews.description: Twin Peaks Round Rock are thieves. Look out for waitress Rebecca and manager Justin will over charge your debit card extra $100.00. Beware of these employees and make sure you check your receipt.  If you are over charge file a complaint with Federal Trade Commission for fraud. BEWARE of these thieves.

reviews.author: Diego C.
reviews.description: So I'm leaving a second review after coming here fairly regularly over a year or so period.  Im also upgrading my review to 5 stars.  This location provides consistently high quality from the food to the service, and now the environment has been upgraded!  I really enjoy the new look.  The restaurant is more open and some of the tables are cafeteria style which promotes a social atmosphere.  There are still individual tables though.  Hell I usually sit alone.  I just like seeing people having a good time.   There are some stunning as well as super nice servers here but it has pretty much always been that way since I've been coming here.    They offer a variety of food on the menu including healthy choices and a veggie burger that is just fantastic.  Best of all it won't break the bank...unless you go stupid on the tip.  P10 is down the street haha.  But the servers do seem to build rapport with repeat customers.  Overall if you haven't been here in awhile, it's worth another visit.  I suggest Friday during happy hour.  You're welcome!

reviews.author: Ronny T.
reviews.description: Took forever to be seated and then seated at a table that had to be wiped down for food residue on tabletop.   Server was helpful but overall experience could have been better.  Not sure why it is so difficult for these restaurants (includes Hooters) to keep the place somewhat clean.  Food was okay but not something i long to reorder again.

name: Aviator Pizza and Drafthouse- Parmer Lane

reviews.author: Jennifer N.
reviews.description: Such a great addition to the neighborhood! Perfect place for family night. Who doesn't love pizza. There is great outdoor seating and has a playscape for the kids. The pizza is good as well, there is a combination for someone. There is plenty of seating inside too. The lunch deals are such a good deal. The staff is friendly, we like to do the curbside orders on nights when we are too lazy to cook. It's fast and easy, plus there is so many options you don't feel like you are eating the same thing over and over even if you come here weekly.   The new COVID ordering is nice though you don't have to leave your table and you can split the check among who orders what. It is annoying for those who haven't had it set up on their phones already but otherwise it's super easy after the initial set up.

reviews.author: Kara M.
reviews.description: My fianc and I have been here 3 times now, and we enjoy our visit every time. The pizza is good, the selection of beers and ciders on tap is pretty phenomenal, the soda selection is great as well, and the vibe of the place (Parmer Lane location) is family-friendly and fun!  This time, we ordered The Lazy Goat and the Buffalo Chicken pizzas. The Lazy Goat gets a 5/5 - it was perfectly balanced, and I loved the artichokes and goat cheese with red sauce. The Buffalo Chicken was just okay, I'd give it a 3/5 - it was as expected but left you wanting something more.  In the past, we've tried the Chicken Bacon Ranch (3/5), Ground Control (4/5), and The South Austin (4/5). The focaccia bread sticks are also good!   Overall, it's a nice place to drop in after work or to get Friday night pizzas from. When the weather is nice, it's fun to sit outside - though I can't recommend the high top table chairs, as they are quite uncomfortable. We will definitely be visiting again!

reviews.author: Shauna S.
reviews.description: Just back from vacation and had zero desire to cook. And a major desire to have someone bring me food. The cheese focaccia bread was rather tasty.. the pizza was good. I especially like the unique and earthy flavor of the cheese.  The bonus was they delivered a growler which I'll check out later...(it's later and yummy Pilsner) Will I order it again!?! Probably not. But it was a solid meal nonetheless.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: I met up with a group and was definitely impressed with the spot. I loved the outdoor seating area and the playground. My little one was occupied the entire time and barely took time to eat because she didn't want to stop playing! The pizza was delicious. We shared a simple pepperoni pizza and cheese focaccia bread. I liked that the crust held up well. It wasn't too think or thin - just right! My kid finally up ate 3 pieces when she sat down from playing. If you are a parent and looking to have a cold beer and relax then this is definitely the spot for you. They have tons of beers on tap! Beer, playground and pizza - how can you not be a fan of that?!

reviews.author: Ian P.
reviews.description: Awesome job on the charcuterie board to the Aviator PizzaandDrafthouse Team! It taste as good as it looks! Highly recommend for a family night out in North Austin

reviews.author: Esther A.
reviews.description: Super family friendly with outside play area for kids.  Lines were a little confusing. I ordered the major tom, pepperoni was very crispy but the veggies were a little undercooked would've preffered them a bit more cooked.  The meat almighty was better, pepperoni was crispy and the cooked ham was very tasty (i dont usually like ham that much!) The dough was doughy, and floppy.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: Pizza dough was undercooked.   Hefty toppings  $10 for a large sized personal pan pizza  You order straight from your table via your cell phone.   Nothing special worth returning.

reviews.author: Lisa C.
reviews.description: This is the worst experience I have had in awhile with management. To begin, with follow my pics.. I ordered a major tom (supreme pizza) with EXTRA sauce thru door dash. At 7:55 within a few min I received notification it was being picked up.  I call store to inquire how is that possible if it was freshly made. The store hung up on me. So, I worked w door dash who asked me to wait for delivery to see if there is a quality issue. I did just that, only to receive a pizza that was warm but based on the cheese amount, semi chilled veggies I knew I wasn't too off base when I had my reservations about it to begin with.  I call store - ask for manager, even though I know door dash will ultimately handle. However, I just wanted to know how you can make a pizza in 5 min and say its fresh. Manager says sorry for the hang up like she's singing to a tune of a tiny violin; then tells me they don't have base pizzas sitting around (kind of like Villa in the mall that adds toppings when u order). I ask why is there so much cheese then and no sauce. Clearly cheese is added and is already rubbered up. Short answer and ultimate answer from her was another unbelivable sorry and to work with door dash.   What's sad here..Villa Pizza (mall pizza) is better than this any day. And I'm kicking myself for not going with Salvation pizza instead. Aviator down south was awesome but this Parmer Lane site is lacking customer skills and good pizza.

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: 2nd favorite pizza in Austin!  I love pizza. If I were choosing my last meal it would be a toss up between pizza and beer or filet mignon and merlot (or Shiraz). I digress...pizza...it must have a great crust-never EVER soggy, a well-balanced sauce, and just the right amount of cheese. Lastly, the maker must not skimp on the chosen toppings.  Well done, Aviator! My friend and I shared the "pizza of the day", and it was fabulous (though I don't remember the name of it). The crust had that initial crunch followed by the perfect chewiness. We each had a light beer with hints of blueberry-um...yummy!  Aviator is new to this location, and still getting established, so it was dead inside. I suspect this will be a popular lunch place for nearby companies such as Apple, Oracle, etc. There is a huge outside play area for those of you who have kiddos-great for birthday parties.  I prefer quieter places, so it misses the mark for me regarding atmosphere. You can see the pizza makers through a glass window, and the kitchen appeared clean. There are ample choices of beer and lots of great food options too. I've been twice and suspect it will be a fav of mine. Give it a try. Let me know what you think.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Great pizza, good selection of beer, staff is always friendly! Clean inside and always plenty of seating!!

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Absolutely love their pizza! Usually get it to go. I've been at other locations in Austin, and they are all good.

reviews.author: Blair V.
reviews.description: First time I ordered from here was through Door Dash and we enjoyed very bite of our order. Second visit we decided to dine in. It was crazy packed on a Friday evening but they had plenty of seating indoors and outdoors!  We ordered the Foccacio cheese sticks (basil, mozzarella and goat cheese) - a hit for us when we ordered to go previously. We also tried something different which was the Monty. We also ordered a Caesar salad- pricey for a salad in my opinion but this is a good option if you feel like you need that balanced meal!  The Monty was the least of my favorite. We have stuck to ordering the Flying Garlic Pizza after our first visit and it never disappoints. It has become a must order for us and will continue to stay that way!

reviews.author: Shaun S.
reviews.description: Great pizza. I get the thin crust bbq chicken pizza and the Hawaiian. The bbq chicken pizza is the best.

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: Great pizza with even better beer selection. We tried the garlic pizza and it was delicious. My friends got the vegan option and it looked fantastic. We will be back

reviews.author: Ken P.
reviews.description: As another reviewer said, they should change the order to list Drafthouse in front of Pizza.  This place has an AMAZING tap selection, even better than Pinthouse.  They also have a great outdoor area and sometimes they have live music.  The pizza looks amazing and the ingredients are fresh but the dough has no taste.  Pinthouse on the other hand has an amazing crust and severely limited outdoor seating.    I really hope the crust changes because the outdoor area and taps would keep me coming back.  However I can't see going here over Pinthouse.    If they nailed the dough I would absolutely chose this place

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: Today, I ordered a to-go order for pick-up so I could do yet ANOTHER lunch and learn... how much learning do I really need to do?????? I ordered two items: the caprese salad and the black olive and caprese pesto grinder.   Caprese-  Caprese salad is a simple Italian salad, made of sliced fresh  mozzarella, tomatoes, and sweet basil, seasoned with salt, olive oil, or  balsamic vinaigrette. This is a menu item that really can't be 'messed up'. It is simple and to the point. This caprese was accompanied by a side of vinaigrette.  Black Olive and caprese pesto grinder-  This item was unexpectedly good. This meatless Monday treat contained black olives, mozzarella, red onions, baby spinach, and a Roma tomato pesto base. This sandwich provided a balanced mixture of sweet (from the tomatoes and red onions) slightly sour (from the mozzarella) and earthy (from the pesto) bites. Although hearty in its contents, this sandwich was actually very light on the palate.   #supportlocal

reviews.author: Andrew C.
reviews.description: Currently writing this updated review in my car because for the 2nd time, my curbside pickup was messed up. My pickup time was 6:20 pm, and it's now 6:50 pm.  The 1st time I wrote off because I thought it was a fluke. Also, I know the staff is busy on a Saturday night and it's tough to find staffing these days during COVID. Maybe I'll try eating in store next time.   But cmon now, my wife is pissed off because I convinced her to get Aviator over another pizza shop. Well, whenever I get my order, I'll eat it in the doghouse when I get back.

reviews.author: Kasper L.
reviews.description: Yay, more pizza! I love pizza, and I feel like there's a lot of pizza places popping up in Austin over the years. So many options but I'm not sure if this will be high in my rotation of pizza places.   I do like the restaurant space. The outdoor area is nice and kid friendly with the playground. Aviator has a wide selection of beers (at least from what I could tell). I think the pizza is good but unfortunately I think there are better places for pizza. Weirdly, I think their normal pies (with red sauce) are kind of lackluster. I did enjoy their non-traditional pies. The chicken bacon ranch and the taco pizza were pretty great!

reviews.author: Natalie K.
reviews.description: On this deliciously lazy Sunday, the darling husband and I knew that pizza was just the only thing that would do. Jersey Giant Pizza, he suggested? Quick, easy, cheap, and reliably tasty. Closed on Sundays, I lamented. DeSano's, I countered? His eyes lit up, but then I remembered that, although we adore DeSano Pizzeria Napoletana to bloody distraction, we should probably try something brand-new for a little variety...and for me to review! Why not? Enter Aviator Pizza and Drafthouse!  Local? Check! Solid reviews? Check. Hubby's a helicopter pilot and trying out this place is, therefore, too hard to resist? Check. Cute pizza names? Check. Yummy pictures? Check. Let's do this!   (Note: all three are takeout 9-inch pies with no mods, except for hubby's deletion of the green peppers on his Ground Control.)  The Greek: this one was my flavor profile to an ABSOLUTE T! It reminded me a bit of Joe's Pizza at Star Pizza in Houston, but better! A riotous feta, pesto, artichoke, basil, mushroom, and kalamata olive party on a crust! Hugely flavorful! This goes on the culinary Rolodex post-haste!    The Flying Garlic: very garlicky! Shocker, right? Lol! Well, we are garlic people, so we endorse this pie whole-heartedly! The buttery crust, the garlic cloves, and the feta were just unctuous!   Ground Control (minus green peppers): Hubby liked this, but he didn't super-love it. He kept snagging pieces of the Greek and the Flying Garlic. I asked him what his least favorite part was, and he said that it really wasn't fair to judge it on such a small pie. He wants to give it one more shot with a larger pizza! His theory is that small pizzas make the fillings hard to shine. Makes sense!   As I write this, though, he's literally humming Ground Control to Major Tom as he kicks back on the couch playing Call of Duty: Cold War with a warm and happy belly, so I consider this a solid win. We'll definitely be back soon to dine in! Thanks, Aviator!

reviews.author: Cheyenne H.
reviews.description: I've passed by Aviator several times and finally decided to try it with a friend.  We came at 8pm and the place was fairly busy. Unfortunately, the ordering process itself was very confusing. You can either follow a bunch of arrows to the counter and order (with few menus available), or you can seat yourself and order through a QR code and have someone bring your food to you.  We chose to go to the counter and ordered two Bear King beers that had great flavor- we were allowed to sample before ordering which was a plus. There were 50+ beers/wines to choose from so endless options... you can opt for a flight too. We also ordered two small pizzas (BBQ Chicken and Spinach and Artichoke) that came out in ~10 minutes. The pizzas had a thicker crust and were DELICIOUS! I'd definitely order again.   There were plenty of picnic style tables inside and out, and the outdoor patio had beautiful string lights, a playground, umbrellas, and lots of open space. Parking is easy in and easy out, and the staff were friendly.  Overall, I'd recommend Aviator. Great quality pizza in North Austin.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: This is a place that has been on my bucket list for a few years and we finally tried it and will be back again. The facility is pretty cool as far as decor. Clearly, an architect was involved in the design with ample seating in dining areas, bar and outside. The staff is young and enthusiastic. Our server whose name is pm b (Kinda funny name) was particularly nice and accommodating . My wife ordered the Ruben and I got the pimento burger and both were quite satisfying. Being a former restaurant owner/operator, I appreciated our server's knowledge of the menu. They use a team system here which I love so when your food is ready, it is delivered immediately.  I have only two suggestions that could make for a better experience: 1. people working the bar; Don't throw the empty liquor bottles in the trash. The loud crash is unsetteling. 2. Management, dont let your modern attractive facility get seedy. Our seat cushions in the bar area should have been repaired long ago. This isn't a big expense. and look for other signs of wear around the interior.  Clearly, this is a popular place and we will be back.

reviews.author: Blake B.
reviews.description: Maybe I caught them on the wrong day. Maybe they caught me on the wrong day. That was a rough experience. And I don't want it to be. I live in the area and I do want this place to thrive. We are lacking in places like this. I'd like to chalk it up to staffing but I have been to dozens of restaurants in the past two years that have surely have had staffing issues and this is the first one I've written about on this medium.   The food is great, the drinks are great but I really got turned off on the service here. I just sat at the bar for a couple drinks and a small meal. The bartender was horrible. Not with the efficiency, but wow, it was all about her. I heard her say the following things to other staffers: "welcome to hell". "If he's not here, I'll walk out". Constantly criticizing the bar setup from a previous shift (which I'm sure was a result of similar staffing issues she was facing).   I asked her name and I think she said "heather" but she just mumbled that and walked away. So quickly that I knew she was just pissed at the world. While she was so obviously busy by the account of her commentary, she definitely had time to shake drinks in a mixer so loudly around the entire bar in a rhythmic fashion to get everyone to look at her. It was the "heather" show.   Couldn't handle it.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Service here was good and loved the bar area. Brunch cocktail selection was above average. The Vietnamese espresso drink and Bloody Mary were great.   Food is what knocks this down a bit. I got the biscuits and gravy which was wayyyy to much biscuit for the amount of gravy given. Getting the chicken added is a must.   The carnitas poutine was super salty. I get that both things are meant to be like that, but this was just too much. I wish there was more pickled onions and jalapeos to balance it out.   The happy hour menu and times looked pretty good, so I'd definitely return to try that out.

reviews.author: Lauren F.
reviews.description: Great place! I love how they have seasonal items on the menu and an option of outdoor seating for 21+

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: | Food |  Excellent!  I had the rainbow trout with brussels sprouts and that is some of the best trout I've had in a long while!  It was perfectly done.  The brussels spouts were tasty too.  My friend had the pastrami sandwich and she kept raving about it; the pastrami was high quality.    | Cocktails |  Again, a big win.  They were doing a bartender drink contest with several whiskey cocktails and I went for the Peach Tree.  Although petite it packs in taste and was not light on the whiskey!  | Atmosphere |  The patio is typical strip mall-ish.  It's nice that it is dog friendly.

reviews.author: Christy G.
reviews.description: First time and first time take out from Oasthouse.  Ordered Meatloaf, cheeseburger, and fish and chips with pretzel appetizer.  Initially thought a little pricey but then OMG... the quality of the entres and portions were amazing.  Definitely looking forward to dining in soon and will definitely order again.  Must have fish and chips for lovers of fish and chips.    And cheeseburger was huge win with husband and teenager.  Meatloaf was awesome but eclipsed by fish and chips and burger.

reviews.author: Nanner T.
reviews.description: My husband and I stopped by for date night. I had to force myself not to order the fish and chips because it is so good here. I needed to try something different. I had the wagyu steak and fritz. It was amazing and cooked perfectly. The fritz I could not leave alone. Our server Paige was such a delight. We weren't sure exactly what we wanted to try but she had lots of suggestions for food and drinks! She explained what was in everything and you could tell she really wanted us to enjoy everything we ordered. We ended up staying for quite a while because we were enjoying the atmosphere, service and drinks so much.

reviews.author: Tim M.
reviews.description: Superior food in a convenient location. The innovated recipes served at this beautiful restaurant, are thoughtful and rooted in just damn good flavors. Ousthouse is consistent and you will never have a bad time. Recently had their Shepards Pie. Rarely have I... fantasized... about a dish; reminisced about their unique take on a classic. My wife, who lives abroad for a time, even stated that it was made better here than by our friends across the pond. We are excited to see this business grow and adapt their dishes more. As we are a multicultural household, we would love to see more Persian Cuisine take center stage on the menu. My only critique is that the cocktails could us a refresh.

reviews.author: Michelle J.
reviews.description: We've tried this place three times and each time less impressed than the first. Food is just okay. It's too dark and cave-like in there. It's trying to be too many things but not one thing really well.

reviews.author: Andrew C.
reviews.description: Wife and I decided to try this place out for late afternoon brunch on the patio. We had the Bacon Beignets, Reuben, and Pimento Burger. We had a little difficulty finding good selections on the menu. Citrus pancakes sounded good, but they were out of them. The Bacon Beignets were the highlight, warm, freshly made and tasty. Reuben was good, with nicely salted corned beef and delicious German slaw. Pimento burger was too rich for my taste. Service was good. Overall experience was good. Would be 5 stars, but menu was not great for us. If you find things you like on the menu, then you should try it out.

reviews.author: Steve A.
reviews.description: Cocktails and dinner were great! Awesome plane to hang out on the weekend with friends!

reviews.author: Sandra B.
reviews.description: Went to brunch here with some friends. This was a great atmosphere for brunch. I have been for Dinner which is lovely as well. However, it's laid back, chill atmosphere, and modern feel makes it a great spot for almost any occasion.  The food was pretty good. I did get something i could make at home. However everything was cooked nicely apart from the bacon. It was a little bit too charred for my taste. Potatoes were tasty, eggs standard, and the rye bread tasted more like a sour dough. But still good.   Mimosas were a good deal as well!   Overall we had a great time and most likely will return again!

reviews.author: Ashley N.
reviews.description: My hubby and I came here tonight. We were originally just going for pizza and beer at Little Woodrow's but their patio was full and we had our dog with us. We were searching for some dog friendly spots and came across this gem! We sat on the front patio but when we left, we saw there was also a back patio that was a bit more lively! I also took a stroll around the inside and it has a super cool looking bar, great lighting and lots of seating. We loved our cocktails, apps and entrees. We had a Manhattan, Old Fashioned, and Pom of Your Hand and they were all delicious! We also had the shishito peppers as an app and I had their seasonal soup which was served in a nice cast iron bowl. My husband had the Shepard's Pie and was super impressed! I had the falafel burger and fries and it was super tasty and filling! Our server was very friendly and attentive and my husband thought it was great that she said "awesome blossom" since he said that's only the second person he has ever heard say that aside from me (where has he been?). Anyway, we want to come back soon and check out some more of the menu options and drinks! We highly recommend this spot that is dog, family, and happy people friendly!!!

reviews.author: Juliana S.
reviews.description: Can't believe it's been a while since someone gave this place a review.   We came here because we found some good reviews on Yelp, but have to say I was a bit apprehensive about how long it's been since the last review posted for this place.   This restaurant seems to be a family go to place where people just eat and never care to leave a review.   This place a gem! We came in for an early dinner and were surprised by how good their food and drinks are.   I wasn't really found of the butternut squash soup but we were in the mood for trying so we did it.   I do recommend this place for anyone.  Specially if you are looking for food away from Downtown like us.   Enjoy!

reviews.author: Keilon L.
reviews.description: The meal was much more attractive than it was delicious. Everything was fresh but lacked flair in the flavor department. This is the kind of place I would come to for dinner but I wouldn't bring anyone here to impress them or to treat them. I only say that because the impression of this place I got from the ambiance and the menu was that I would be in for a stellar meal. I ordered the Brie Burger believing the brie and the flavor profile would offer pizzaz but I was not razzle dazzled. It was just the feel of eating a better than average burger.  The carnitas poutine got me a little eager to taste more flavors as I had that to start.  It could have rivaled a couple of poutine offerings that I've had in Montral aka the poutine capital of the world (sorry Quebec City).  I am happy that all the greens were fresh to round out the meals well.  I felt like portions and servings were well balanced.  If I lived in the area, I'd dine here again.

reviews.author: Flora T.
reviews.description: A hidden gem! Great food, interesting drinks and friendly and attentive staff. We loved everything we ordered. Food is fresh and tasty. Good atmosphere for either friends' hangout or romantic outing. We had a great time there and will definitely recommend it! We arrived after 9 and could take advantage of their reverse happy hour. We were surprised how small our check was!

reviews.author: Carrie T.
reviews.description: Came here for brunch after church on Sunday. I must shout out Henry because his service was awesome. He was personable, friendly and efficient. His service gets 5 stars (and we made sure his tip showed it). We started with the bacon beignets which were not really like beignets. They were crispy on the outside and more like cake donuts on the inside. Only got like two pieces of bacon in the whole serving.  The food came to the table very room temperature. My father had to send his biscuits and gravy back to reheat (no one wants congealed gravy). My mom and I got the boring breakfast plate. I asked for my eggs over medium and they definitely came fried hard. Also the house cured bacon was bland and extremely dry. My Aunt's chicken cacciatore pasta tasted good and we liked the strawberry pancake we ordered for the table a lot.  Overall, service was the highlight but the brunch options are not worth a second visit.

reviews.author: William Z.
reviews.description: Stopped by last night wi5h friends. After putting in our name we sat in the bar and ordered beers while waiting for a table. We were in no hurry so we had another beer and looked over the menu.  It was obvious that Oast was short staffed and everyone was doing double duty. Thank the pandemic!  Nevertheless, tHe staff was very friendly and the service was adequate.  However our burgers were not very hot and my pretzel bun was stale. The fries were very good. In better times, this will probably be a very nice dinner option.

reviews.author: Aaron G.
reviews.description: First, this place is perfectly nice and probably worth going to again if I am back in the area but would easily be convinced to try something else.  My evening began with the Ancho Margarita.   Unlike some places this chili inspired drink isn't like drinking hot pepper juice and is delicious.    The fried cheese curds with ranch dressing were tasty but nothing particularly gourmet as a novice home cook could prepare this with the same results.     The disappointment came with the main meal.  The French fries were cold.   From our vantage point we could watch the kitchen workers.  They kept a big bowl of French fries that the kitchen leader would use to place portions on out going plates.   They rarely sitting it under a heat lamp, so they were cold and unmemorable.   This is probably the easiest and cheapest thing on the menu to prepare well.  The rest of the meal was perfectly ok, but noting that stuck out as particularly special.    The ambiance is nice, but extremely loud when there's a full house so you have to raise your voice to be heard across the table.

reviews.author: Brittany E.
reviews.description: Great spot for fish and chips for a good price! Their poutine is also very good - different than the typical but delish.

reviews.author: Devin O.
reviews.description: Man this place was crazy packed!   Friendly but definitely a TGI Friday type vibe, but they did have the ufc fights on. So everyone was cheering and at it.   So interesting night.

reviews.author: Nicole L.
reviews.description: Watched as over a dozen unmasked people were served by an unmasked server. You have to be kidding me.

reviews.author: Bill M.
reviews.description: This place is an okay spot for a beer after work.  Cheap drink specials.  You need to get a table near a fan because the AC does not work well.  Also, be warry if you ask the bar mgr dude to turn a game's sound on.  He might tell you "people like you make it hard to be a manager at a sports bar". Overall, on a scale of das to das, it's a little below das.

reviews.author: DaLila G.
reviews.description: I really like it here. Every time I go there's live music and I legally like sitting on their patio. It's super chill and always clean. Def a great spot in the neighborhood. Will continue to keep visiting

reviews.author: Rachel D.
reviews.description: Typical Lil Woodrow's - lots of beer and sports!   We were here on a Thurs night and it was busy but not crowded. I would give it 5 stars but I can't bc of all the smoking. I smelled like cigarettes when we left after about 2 hours, and no one in my party smoked. This was my first (and unfortunately last) time here, so I was unaware.   Know b4 you go: -Dogs allowed on patio -Smoking allowed -Bring your own food or order from next door   -Great waitstaff   Overall, I won't be back due to the cigs, but that's a personal preference of mine. If you don't mind smoking, this is a good bar.

reviews.author: Gilford S.
reviews.description: They claim to be a neighborhood bar but they treat the real neighbors... those who actually live and work right across the street like utter garbage.  On multiple occasions.  Done with these amateurs.  PS. The drinks are weak as can be and the bartenders are lame.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: Great local hangout always playing whatever game we want to watch. Cold beer, nice patio, decent service and, if you're hungry, Brooklyn pie company a couple doors down will deliver to your table.

reviews.author: Shannon O.
reviews.description: I love that this spot is very close...I also enjoy the openness of the joint...they also have decent beers on tap. However..if you want food, you have the option of ordering from a pizza spot a couple of doors down...meh. The biggest thing I don't like is..their mixed drinks are SO watered down!   I've tried at least 4 different ones and the ice and water is the most prominent.   So if you go? Stick to the beer or a shot.

reviews.author: Joshua K.
reviews.description: It's always a joy to come here to drink and socialize. Nothing beats beautiful women, alcohol, and excellent customer service! Except for a lack of delicious bar foods!   Although you can bring food into the restaurant, the selection around the area is a bit lackluster. Your only choices are a mediocre pizza place or Mexican cuisine. Brooklyn's pizza will probably be your go to dish if you do decide on italian. Their appetizers are not enjoyable for the value you'll be paying.   All in all, this place has a wide assortment of beverages and a nice place to unwind after a long day of work.

reviews.author: Kenneth B.
reviews.description: I like this place. But I'd like to talk to mr friends without yelling over the loud music. I'm sure the staff rocks out before patrons come in and don't think to turn it down to a reasonable level.  Bad first date spot which is not a good thing to be in the dating app era.

reviews.author: Christopher S.
reviews.description: Laid back atmosphere. Good beers/drinks. Nothing fancy, doesn't cater to one click or another. This location is new and they have it worked out fairly well. Only minor rub is that the outside patio gets direct sun, which is going to be a bit of bitch in the dead of summer, but for now it's fine. Outdoor bar, plenty of screens.  "Jukebox" (fancy MP3 player is nice). Allows you to bump something that is playing that isn't quite to your liking. Drink prices are fair for sure considering most watering holes are serving watered down and overpriced cough syrup.  This place is clean and seems well kept. The manager is almost constantly walking the place and fixing things. They went out of there way to find me an outlet to charge my phone.   Note: Pet friendly even having a water bowl for your four legged family as needed. Just please mind the leash, one guys dropped his momentarily to grab a beer and his dog tore through the kitchen/bar area, it was hilarious.

reviews.author: Albert G.
reviews.description: The best neighborhood bar in town. Upon walking in, you immediately feel like you're a part of the family. The management is beyond professional and they take time to hear opinions or just causally chat. The bar tenders are courteous and quick to serve. No matter what day it is, you will always feel like it's a Friday a night when you come here.   P.S.  I highly recommend you get in a game of cornhole! Lots of great players!

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: I LOVE this place...great beer selection and dog-friendly...the outdoor patio is shaded, has mistress, and even the bar extends outside to sit at if you don't want a table.  The staff is also a big reason I keep coming back.  I just finished my first run through the Big 50 Club (50 different drafts) and there is more on tap than just those on that list.  Pretty cool!  They don't have food, but the pizza place next door delivers to your table--a slice, whole pie, salads, fries, chips n queso, wings, chicken fingers, subs, etc...so it's not only pizza.  Outstanding!

reviews.author: Katherine S.
reviews.description: This bar is down the street from our apartment so it's our local hangout on the weekends! It can get pretty packed on Friday/Saturday nights but the staff is quick as lighting! We never have a bad time here and they host loads of events that make it feel like we are apart of a community. Love Little Woodrow's!

reviews.author: Mel B.
reviews.description: Great place to sit and have some beverages.  Spent a lazy Saturday afternoon on the patio...beautiful weather and great people.  It's also a great place to bring your doggies.  Very good beer selection...even had three sours on tap, which is hard to find AND my absolute favorite!

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: Gave bartender a 5% tip cause of bad service.  She comes outside to chastise me in front of my wife and friends because she expected more. Told her I expected better service and her response was to cut me off. Hey.. already played my tab!  Much better places to have fun in Austin anyhow.

reviews.author: Pam K.
reviews.description: Our first time visiting this venue to see our friends' band play will be our last. It's sad, too, because it doesn't seem like a bad place.  To the juvenile waitress with an attitude: you're in customer service. That means you serve customers WITHOUT the massive chip on your shoulder. If you don't like your job, find something else to do, but DON'T take your mistakes out on your customers.  The waitress got our order wrong and pitched a massive attitude when we kindly asked her to fix it - it was a DIET COKE!!! Slammed the new drink on the table and didn't speak to us the rest of our stay there.  THEN denied it all when approached by my husband, who had to escalate the situation to a manager. Horrible, horrible, horrible. Grow up.

reviews.author: Alyssa D.
reviews.description: I'm biased cos I've worked with them at Brooklyn Pie next door for over a year (they deliver to LW if you call in and the pizza is great) and currently work with LW now. Heads up, you won't be playing on your phone past your first drink. It may as well be Cheers personified. Customers and staff alike are all so friendly and hilarious, you'll get roped into ridiculous convos and debates. It's inevitable. The staff (myself included) will adopt you as our own. 15/10 would recommend.

reviews.author: Celeste R.
reviews.description: I've been to this location a total of three times now, I've tried to love it! Claims to be a neighborhood bar but they're everything short of it. Bartenders aren't too worried about giving good customer service, and their drinks are pretty lame as well. Could easily get their "cocktails" at the Bombshells down the road, with more of a kick and better attentiveness and service. The only reason I'm not leaving 1 star instead of 2 is because they don't care if you're drunk- they'll keep serving you! Lmao and the board games are a nice touch!

reviews.author: That G.
reviews.description: We love this place!! Especially the bartender, Marilyn. We came new years eve and she wasn't even working and she remembered us. Austin is a great city! We hope to move here. Thank you for a great experience!!

name: Alamo Drafthouse Cinema Lakeline
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Douglas W.
reviews.description: Movie theatre are banning large bags to stop people from being in their own food...  Good thing I have a few Twix up my sleeve!  I had a pretty eventful day but I knew that I wanted to still go catch a movie. I came to a pretty late showing and yet the service was great. Of course you always expect that the end of someone's shift that they would be low on energy but the service was fast friendly. The movie theater was clean the bathrooms are clean and there was plenty of parking.

reviews.author: Gabrielle L.
reviews.description: I've just come from the Alamo Drafthouse. I feel compelled to comment now on a couple of things that truly detract from my overall positive experience there.   First up is WHERE ARE YOU GLUTEN-FREE ITEMS?!?!? Even though you weren't top of the heap for GF fare, you offered at a few. Now, it's popcorn or candy and maybe the chips and queso. However, nothing is labeled GF. I do see many offerings labeled V. That's nice. You do offer a GF crust for pizzas. Yay. And that brings us to the second issue. Did someone complain that there wasn't any garlic in the marinara sauce? So to compensate for that the sauce is now garlic, with a touch of tomato? It's so strong! So the GF pizza crust is now a moot point since I cannot tolerate the killer garlic.  Lastly, I ordered the chicken tenders this evening, not GF, but I wanted something. What arrives are several enormous pieces of heavily breaded and heavily garlic-laced chicken. What is the deal? Remember when tenders were little strips of chicken? I gave up between trying to manage the huge chunks of "tenders" and the strong, garlicky flavor, and just ate the few fries on the plate.  I am not normally a ranter but, for the number of movies I see in a month using my Pass subscription, I am so disappointed that you are now pretty much ignoring a segment of your patrons, who only ask for options.

reviews.author: David R.
reviews.description: Following up on my last post that I was treated horribly and denied water, I called and spoke to a female manager.   I requested a refund for the bad popcorn and movie tickets.   They used my card information on my ticket purchase and charged my card without authorization  Of course I was denied a refund.   DO NOT GO TO THIS THEATER.   THERE ARE BETTER ONES, MUCH BETTER ONCE.

reviews.author: Amber W.
reviews.description: My husband and I were looking forward to our first movie date in two years due to the pandemic. We went to see Ghostbusters Afterlife the Friday night after the premiere. Everything started out fine: we placed our drink and appetizer order before the show started. Got our mozzarella sticks and they were slightly underdone. Eh whatever, not a huge deal. Our beer and Bavarian Pretzel pizza were good, no complaints. However, the service not so much. On top of the fact our waitress took forever, she accused us of smoking in the theatre. I told her there was a vape cloud that came up on the row in front of us and I never saw anyone go talk to them. So maybe make sure you're accusing the right person next time. THEN our popcorn was burnt and we still got charged for it after letting them know. We'll keep going to Moviehouse in the future.

reviews.author: Jamie B.
reviews.description: Went and saw Free Guy tonight. Great movie. My 9year old puked all over the lobby as we left  The employees were so nice about it! They didn't make me feel bad or guilty or make me clean it up. I am so very grateful for tonights Lakeline employees  At least it wasn't poop?

reviews.author: Elissa S.
reviews.description: My husband and I rented a theater for a special occasion during covid. It wasn't exactly cheap ($150 for the rental, plus tickets and food/drink separately) but we missed movie theaters so much that we sprung for it. It was definitely worth it. The Alamo crew took so many precautions before and during our stay that although I was very anxious about the rental at first, I was able to relax and enjoy the show. Like others have said, all movie theaters are surely suffering right now and we need to support Alamo so that they're here when the pandemic is over. I love this theater chain so much, it'd be devastating for me personally if they were to close.

reviews.author: Sarah K.
reviews.description: The Alamo is awesome, and we've missed it a ton during the pandemic. But now that we have our vax, we decided to risk a super special outing -- we did a Your Own Private Alamo rental to celebrate a milestone birthday in the family. Just our inner circle, all by ourselves ... with a movie! And popcorn! And freakin' amazing buffalo cauliflower! In public, having our first normal-ish outing in over a year! Seriously, it was fun, and the Alamo took good care of us.

reviews.author: Daniel W.
reviews.description: Minus one star for every dollar y'all charge for the "convenience fee"   Before paying online make sure you know about this charge!

reviews.author: Joel T.
reviews.description: I'm torn between nostalgia and the elevated level of service (and price) other theatres are offering.  This is classic Alamo.  It's like rediscovering your first car.  Fixed bar-style eating surface in front of the fixed seats, no leg rests or fully reclining seats.  The service was GREAT, albeit we were intentionally at a TERRIBLE horror movie (The Turning) that had maybe 10 people in the cinema with us.  Still, an employee could slack in that situation and they did not.    The screen and sound were good.    There was no lounge in the theater that I saw to relax and have drinks before or after the movie.    And, after many visits to other theatres, it was unusual not to have a button to press for service.  Rather, you physically put your order card up on the table for a server to see when they come by.  I was really concerned about this because I knew how bad the movie was going to be early on and drinks were part of the plan!! lol  But in retrospect, maybe having to physically check on the patrons is what made the service so attentive (I got the drinks I needed to get through the picture -- thank you, Jesus).  So, obviously I'm torn.  It is a retro experience for me having experienced my first dine-in theater at an Alamo. I would go back here again in a heartbeat.  But it is like getting in a classic car and then realizing you actually like modern bucket seats and power steering.  At the same time that classic car was less expensive and still brings a smile to your face.  I'm going to rank based on the model Alamo built and on fulfilling my memories of great service...and I'm looking forward to going back again! :)

reviews.author: Mahlet A.
reviews.description: This spot was super cute and a great date night choice. The staff was super friendly and efficient while moving around throughout the movie. The drinks were tasty and strong enough. I wish I had known that the seats were so tight together, I would have left some space between myself and the occupants next to me. Other than that it was a nice experience!

reviews.author: Amanda N.
reviews.description: Firstly, we've been coming to this location since it opened, and before that to their old spot off of Lake Creek Pkwy. Secondly, they have the nicest staff, and their food is always delicious! If there's any issue, they handle it quickly and efficiently. They're also super clean, and have been really amazing with COVID protocols. I feel comfortable going back to the movies because of Alamo Drafthouse. Thanks for always going above and beyond!

reviews.author: Matthew C.
reviews.description: My wife and I attended the Lord of the Rings: Fellowship of the Ring 3:00 p.m. showing at Lakeline Alamo on Saturday, March 27. It was our first public outing since last year before Covid-19 struck. We were excited and nervous to venture out, but trusted Alamo's protocols.  We walk into the theater and there is just one guy there, sitting a couple rows from the projector, American flag bandana for a mask sitting around his neck not covering his face, scrolling on his phone. He makes a couple calls and talks loudly, checking on his insurance apparently. He continues to do it halfway through the movie previews. My wife and I are already annoyed. Not a good start.  The movie begins and the guy behind us has been quiet for 10 minutes. Things seem to be turning for the better. That is, until a short while into the movie when he starts making comments aloud. "No!" to Gandalf leaving Frodo. "Asshole!" to Saruman betraying Gandalf. I grit my teeth and exchange glances with my wife as it continues, both of us hoping it subsides.  Nope. The loud asshole decides to keep making his commentary like it's his own personal screening. I finally have had enough of it about an hour into the film and place an order card that read "Please tell the guy behind us to stop talking! He keeps doing it!" The server comes five minutes later, takes it and nods. She does nothing.  Another 30 minutes goes by. This guy's behavior continues. He even plays a video on his phone for all to hear at one point. He's all I can focus on now, my enjoyment of the movie totally ruined. I storm out of the theater determined to get someone to kick him out.  I find a young guy with a pony tail who is clearly a server. I plea my case that this guy needs to go. He seems to take my request seriously and I return, hoping the Alamo's well-known policy of kicking out disruptors will finally be used on this guy ruining our movie.  Well, that wasn't the case. 10, then 20 minutes go by. I didn't see anyone come into the theater to handle it. The pest behind us makes comments aloud less frequently, probably because my wife yelled at him to shut up at one point. While I couldn't blame her for taking it into her own hands, I wanted the Alamo staff to do something about it like I know they should.  In retrospect, maybe it wasn't a bad idea because nothing was done to kick him out as I requested. The movie nears its end and the guy shouts again. Finally, we hear someone behind us address him, apparently letting him off with a warning. After all he had done throughout the course of the film to ruin the movie for us, it was far too little, far too late.  Amazingly, it actually worked that someone talked to him. He shut up for the 10 minutes left in the movie and didn't say anything during the cast reunion piece that followed the credits. So had the staff addressed this nuisance earlier like I wanted, perhaps this outing would have been salvagable. Mind you, I first brought it to the attention of the staff an hour into a THREE HOUR MOVIE. They finally say something to him with only 10-15 minutes left. Completely unacceptable, if you ask me.  Our server tells us shortly after one of her staff finally talked to the guy that she told a manager and that she was sorry the loud patron was like this. He seems "a little 'special,' you know what I mean?" is what she says. Whether that's true or not is frankly irrelevant. You have a policy in place that you remind patrons every single time they visit your theaters. No talking, no texting. Problem with a loud table? Raise an order card and a staff member will address it, eventually asking them to leave without a refund. Had this policy been followed as outlined, he should have been given a warning an hour into the movie and then instructed to leave without a refund 30 minutes later when I pleaded to the staff to take care of it. Case closed. The way it was handled in reality was an absolute joke and insult.  We were happy to attend this screening as our first outing. Now, after this incident, we will no longer give Alamo our business.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: This is a review for the family party movies that Alamo does.   We went to a Family Party on Sunday. This is our second time for a family party and they rock! 45 minutes before the movie they have crafts for the kids (seems like usually 3-4 stations) and then they have an interactive dance or activity at the front of the theater immediately before the movie. It makes the movie an event for the kids.   Now if I could somehow watch a movie I want to see while the kids watched their cartoon!

reviews.author: Jed B.
reviews.description: This location has stadium seating and comfortable chairs with a smart table design. The Alamo Drafthouse has an excellent beer selection and some tasty food options.. Even for a  vegetarian.  The best part of the experience for me is that people are told to turn off phones and be quiet. No one else is doing this and it is a thoughtful reminder.  Although some people don't quite get it and continue to talk, there was enough attention to keep the majority of chatter box's quite:-)

reviews.author: Tamie F.
reviews.description: I love the Alamo Drafthouse. My go to place to catch a movie. I enjoy the avocado toast and French press coffee when I come to an early movie. Later movies it's the bacon and goat cheese pizza. I appreciate the fact they have beers from local breweries available as well! Of course, who doesn't love the no talking and no texting rule!

reviews.author: Rolando N.
reviews.description: Love coming to this location in the midweek afternoons. It's usually not crowded.   Alamo does cinema the right way. Love to get there a half hour early and watch the pre-show entertainment. It's unique, nostalgic, and always funny. None of the advertisement bombardment you get at other theaters.   The food is always excellent   The 2x2 burger is my favorite and I've never been disappointed. It's a 5 star version of the Big Mac. The Colorado steak salad is also a regular favorite.   Drinks are always cold and the buttered popcorn with real butter is ridiculously delicious.   Awesome selection of adult beverages.   Love this place.

reviews.author: beep b.
reviews.description: i placed an order for food delivery, put instructions on how i wanted it, and when my food got here all of my instructions were ignored and in my opinion purposefully made wrong. i think if you're not even going to try to make something the way the person wants it, it becomes aggressive and personal. like what is the problem

reviews.author: Anna C.
reviews.description: My husband and I love coming to Alamo Drafthouse! A couple months ago, my husband and I had a bad experience, to which management was quick to reach out to us to resolve. They went above and beyond to make sure that experience was made up for. My husband and I were so happy and will continue coming to our favorite movie theater here at Lakeline.  Staff really do go beyond expectations and are always making sure you are having a good time.

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Went for Dinner and a movie 1/9/19. We were the first in line to get to our seats. It was my first time and my Wife and Sons second time. We were served pretty quickly. We loved the Pizza which was the Meat Pizza. It was hot and fresh. My wife was not a fan of the Chardonnay. My son thought his Pepperoni pizza was great and liked the Milkshake as well. We enjoyed the reserve seating. Just before the movie started we ordered some popcorn and a beer to split.   What cost them a star in my opinion was the Popcorn. It was really cold and without Salt or much Butter and taste like it was made at home. The main thing I like about the Movies is the Popcorn is always unbelievable. This was the opposite and was memorable for the worst reason. The other annoyance was the lack of under the table lighting when the bill arrived during the movie. I tried and quickly gave up so my wife finally figured out what we owed and paid in the dark. Not sure I have a fix just saying this is not good for older people with less then perfect night vision.  Definitely more to like than dislike here. We will be back.

reviews.author: Johnny B.
reviews.description: I've been wanting to come see a movie at the Alamo Drafthouse for almost a decade. Lo and behold, I am on production and me and my crew had a private screening. It was kind of a dream come true.  But I must say, the staff absolutely exceeded my expectations. Mainly Laura and Josiah, not only were they both very accommodating, but there are also very genuine.

reviews.author: Paula A.
reviews.description: First time coming to this spot ,  very friendly staff ! Came 30 mins before closing and the lady said it was fine no rush , enjoy your meal that also came out in less than 10 min !!! . Overall chill spot and the brisket was so Good . Will be back soon

reviews.author: Randy L.
reviews.description: Delicious! The brisket and the pork belly were melt-in-your-mouth meat candy, exploding with smokey flavor. Yum!  The sausage was really good too, though I prefer more of a loose sausage like you'll get in some other central Texas BBQ joints. This was more firm but really good flavor.  I requested (fresh) jalapeos and sriracha in addition to the regular garnish of pickles, onions, and bbq sauce. The veggies were thick slices and the sauces flavorful. Plus two thick slices of white bread.  It was pricey, but any BBQ in Central Texas is. The differentiator here is the Vietnamese touches in the flavors and sauces. Two people in my party had banh mi and one had the King plate and they looked delicious too. Everyone in our party gave 5 stars for flavor, portion, and service.  Other notes: Decent parking. Good indoor seating, lots more outdoor seating. BBQ joint/bar vibe indoors, with notes of Vietnamese flair. Service was attentive and food came out quick.   Go visit Smoking Beauty and have a great meal.

reviews.author: Sean D.
reviews.description: Food is pretty delicious but damn do they only give you appetizer portions. We bought two bbq plates and there was hardly any food on it and it was $20.00 for each of them. Very ilu underwhelming in that regard. Id say a bbq plate is worth $10.00.   The atmosphere is like any typical bbq joint. Service was very nice.  I wouldn't come back though since the portions are a scam.

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: I came in last Saturday with one of my Yelp peeps to get the weekend started before going to see a little bit of comedy. We ordered drinks only.  The atmosphere of this establishment has a real ATX vibe as it blends central TX spirit with traditional Vietnamese cuisine.
