The mode last Saturday night was chill and as we walked in and were given a nod by the bartender. My companion ordered  a bozzy bobba shoot and another adult libation. I ordered a spiked tea cause "baby, it's cold outside". The drinks came out quick and were done right.   This is the type of place that is solid for good eats, a good time, a date night,  or to start off an evening of disorderly conduct.  #supportlocal

reviews.author: Rello R.
reviews.description: Not bad at all. It was a nice vibe they have outdoor and indoor seating. They have an app that you order off of and pay on. They bring the food to you so you can't pay with cash. Went for lunch with the guys. The brisket was good. With the 3 meat you only get 1 slice of brisket. You get 1 jalapeo and cheese sausage. And some pork belly. I wasn't a fan of the pork belly. The sausage was good though. I can't lie. The moist in the brisket was tasty! The lean was good too. They got Mexican Coke was good too!

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: The staff always gives a warm welcome when we stop here to eat. There is outside (dogs welcomed) and inside seating.   We have been here a few times and love their food.    My favorite so far is the brisket banh mi and their potato salad. The brisket is smoked perfectly and the bread texture compliments the heartiness of the brisket well.  I love the fresh veggies they put in this!  The potato salad is hands down the best potato salad I have ever had at a restaurant. You have got to try this!!  We have ordered a few drinks in the past - they have a great Happy Hour.  You cant miss it - follow your nose to North Lamar and treat yourself.

reviews.author: Kelsi D.
reviews.description: I really wanted this to be a revolutionary experience. The concept is so cool, but their menu is a little repetitive and the food was just good. Not saying that this wasn't an awesome meal, but I really wanted it to be something to write home about. And it just wasn't.   The banh mi sandwiches were very dry but the meat was insanely tender, though   lacking a lot of flavor. The cost is a little higher but the portion sizes are large and generous.   The real show stopper here though, is the bbq sauce. It's the right mix of Asian flavors and classic bbq sweetness.   It's worth the visit to see this take on two fairly different cuisines mashed together. But don't expect to be wowed away. It doesn't scream fusion to me, it just seems like they took some of the most popular parts of each cuisine and put them separately on the plate.

reviews.author: Kimberly M.
reviews.description: This place was everything I had hoped it would be. Now I just wish there was another one in Houston!  This Texas Tower looks intimidating but just roll up your sleeves, topple that thing over, and dive right in. The jalapeo sausage has some sneaky heat. Perfectly crispy hashbrowns with beautifully salted pork belly. Loved every bite.  We also shared the pork belly and brisket banh mi's and smokin fries. Most banh mi places we are quick to grab the Sriracha and Maggie's Sauce but not this time. It didn't even cross my mind until days after.  The brisket has the most amazing flavor and so moist. Almost a shame to lose it into anything else. But a perfect addition to any menu item.  Such warm and friendly owners and staff.   Parking was easy on a Sunday afternoon.  CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK FOR MORE!!!

reviews.author: Gus H.
reviews.description: A much needed spot in the 'hood. We've been frequenting them since opening and it's only getting better. Great vibe, great food, live music, local owners. Consistent bbq (that ain't easy). What else could we ask for?!

reviews.author: Alan H.
reviews.description: They changed the garnish for their banh mi. Gone are the traditional Vietnamese pickles and garnishes. It is literally BBQ brisket with coleslaw on French bread, it just a weird combo hardly Asian Fusion anymore.

reviews.author: Carly C.
reviews.description: I have had a hankering for this place for almost a year. I had seen it on the Food or Travel network, and it looked awesome. It seems like they have some sort of little drink or food special every day. On Wednesday, it was Whiskey and Wine Wednesday, with $2 off either beverage. My friend and I sat at the bar. The co-owner was bartending, and she is super friendly. She helped us with a couple of beer choices, as well as which Bahn Mi I was going to go with. We got the Smokin' Fries, the Brisket Bahn Mi, and the Smoked Pork Belly Bahn Mi. All of the food was amazing. Even after I felt like I couldn't eat another bite, I kept snacking away on those fries. This place has a great vibe, they are trying to work on managing the temperatures of outdoor seating for customers, and they have lots of little activities, like trivia and swing night, throughout the week. I will absolutely be back for brunch; I got to get my hands on that Leaning Tower of Texas.

reviews.author: Heather A.
reviews.description: The high ratings for Smoking Beauty are well earned. Large portions of delicious, creative, well presented food; a variety of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages; the choice of indoor or outdoor seating with two separate outdoor areas, one covered and one open; varying table heights; great music played at a level to be noticeable without being intrusive, and attentive, friendly staff.  On my first of what will surely be many visits I came on a Saturday with my husband for a late lunch. There were a good number of people there including a small birthday celebration but with two outdoor areas and inside seating to choose from we were able to sit off on our own at a lovely table outside in front of the restaurant.  Having not had enough caffeine yet I was delighted by the Vietnamese drop coffee and was impressed that they accommodated my husband's order of part Coke and part carbonated water. He was clearly hungry and/or unprepared for the quantity of food and order both Bahn Mi and loaded fries. I chose the brisket hash off of the brunch menu which was so good I ate way too much of the generous serving. Several days later I am still thinking about how perfect the sweet potatoes and brussel sprouts were in particular.  I am looking forward to going back again later and trying one of their cocktails with my meal which are rumored to be too notch.

reviews.author: Yuli M.
reviews.description: First time while I was visiting Austin, atmosphere was really nice! Started off with the spinach dip which was SO DELICIOUS! Then ordered the brisket banh mi, it was a really interesting taste lol... it just tastes like a banh mi with brisket slapped inside. It was pretty decent, pretty pricey though for what it is ($12). Make sure to order the green and bbq sauce for the banh mi! It gives it a little more flavor.

reviews.author: Karen Q.
reviews.description: Smokin Beauty is a fusion restaurant that combines Vietnamese and BBQ cuisine. They have lots of indoor and outdoor seating. They even have live music on some weeknights. You order at the bar counter and take your number to the table, and they bring out your food out to you. We sat outside, but the service was slightly lacking as we had go back into the restaurant for multiple items like silverware and napkins. The meat tasted good, I would favor the pork belly over the brisket- the bread was hard and crispy for banh mi. I definitely would view them more as a BBQ joint versus Vietnamese, although they do have some interesting drinks with Viet twists. Overall, a good place to go especially if looking for late night food. They have they own private parking lot as well.

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: Came by on a Friday night to see a friend's band, the Lone Star Debonairs.  Also wanted dinner... and this is the second BBQ place I've been to in less than a week!  Smokin Beauty is in the Vietnamese area of North Austin, and is a Vietnamese/BBQ hybrid.  They're a small place but have good outdoor seating and parking, and the weather this Friday night was perfect for eating and dancing.  The food: I ordered their brisket and pork belly salad with a creamy cilantro dressing.  The brisket had nice smoke and a good bark, and the pork belly was soft without being mushy or all fat, and really lightly flavored, showing off the meat.  Fresh, crisp veggies made it perfect  They also have Banh Mi on the menu, and a Viet BBQ plate with Texas BBQ and Viet vegetables.

reviews.author: Joel M.
reviews.description: Smokin Beauty fuses Texas barbecue with Vietnamese cuisine. I popped in for the Double Fantasy Bahn Mi (brisket and pork belly). Served on a crunchy, fresh baguette, the meats were perfectly smoked and flavorful, and the pickled vegetables were crisp and colorful. If you prefer a bit of added heat, ask for jalapeos and sriracha. I also tried the slaw which was fresh and bright with Asian flavors.  There is plenty of seating outside. The decor inside is plenty nice with dark wood decor. The restaurant sports a full bar. This is such a great little neighborhood spot.

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: My postal colleague and I stopped here on Mother's Day and I cannot even begin to explain the positive energy Tao had upon arrival. I told her we always carry mail past the pits and always wanted to try it. I ordered the brisket banh mi with potato salad as well as an happy hour cocktail. My friend got a two meat plate with slaw and potato salad. The salad was incredible, we both agreed. He loved the pork belly so much!  For the price point, it was absolutely worth it! Discussing the passion Matt and Tao have for opening this business during a pandemic is inspiring nonetheless. Stop on by!

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: Smokin Beauty takes the best of both worlds by combining traditional Viet style of cooking with American BBQ to give you a fusion you didn't know you needed... until now. You can find items such as the:  - Brisket Bnh M: I enjoy the twist of smokey, fatty flavors from the brisket as well as the creamy cilantro and soy sauce that it comes with. The fries are amazing, too! $13.95 (4.5/5)  - Leaning Tower of Texas: a brunch special that is a stack of 3 hash browns, brisket, jalapeo cheddar sausage, pork belly, sambal hollandaise (sambal is like chile peppers), and bnh m veggies - this is a lot more filling than it looks, I definitely would suggest you share it. I thought it was pretty good. $23.75 (4/5)  - Pho Queso: you read that right, they take veggie pho broth and mix it in with melted cheese to give you a unique take on queso. The pro here is that it's vegetarian friendly, but the con is that the flavor is a bit faint and I wish they would use a beef pho base instead. It's still good however! $7 (3.5/5)  Overall, this is a great spot to visit if you're craving BBQ, but also want to try something different. They have an outdoor patio if you prefer to sit outside. They also have awesome customer service and the prices are good too. With that said, I give them a 4.25/5.

reviews.author: A E.
reviews.description: Place is solid for a fusion spot! Brisket bahn mi was really good and brisket fries (pictured) were worth the trip in itself for sure, by far some of the best fires ive had in a while.  Burger wasn't the greatest, since the patties seemed almost the frozen style... but i think thats just how it should be. Stick to the bbq!

reviews.author: Chris B.
reviews.description: Brisket Banh Mi, creamed spinach, and chips + pho queso were delicious! Definitely recommendand can't wait to come back

reviews.author: Anita W.
reviews.description: Ordered takeout for dinner this evening.  Process from ordering to curbside delivery of food was excellent. Arrived 7 minutes before the stated pickup time. Spaces for curbside pickup was clearly marked so it was super easy to find.  Great food and location. We got the shrimp scampi, prime rib, kids meal mac n cheese. Food was very good and quality is consistent with the many previous times I went to BJ's.  Curbside pickup was super quick and efficient. Within 10min of requesting food taken out to our car, they had a person out with food. All correct and complete.

reviews.author: Justina P.
reviews.description: I would even gift it a star at this point. My husband and both contacted corporate left a message and emailed and got no response. We have a disaster experience here. There food is good but service is terrible and attitudes of the staff aren't friendly. Needless to say if you have a party of 15 people don't come here. They don't do reservations even though when you call you they say the will save a table you will have to wait a hour then have to be seated in two separate tables because the cut servers early knowing there's a huge party coming in. Then bring out food late and to the wrong table and other tables arriving after receiving there stiff prior and all at once. Most of us received meals at the time others ordered and got dessert. Then some of are meals were over cooked/cold or missing items because they ran out with no substitutions. The server was extremely defensive and the manager walked by hearing all the chaos didn't say a word. Sadly I worked at bjs when I was young they gave standards for service you are taught. That's completely gone out of the window when corporate won't even contact you back.    Update: We received a email that someone from corporate will be reaching out around the 16th still nothing from them two weeks later!!

reviews.author: Nicholaa M.
reviews.description: Would give 0 stars if I could, but today I went to BJ's with my family and after an hour of waiting we get called to our table..  As we're waiting to be seated, a member from our party recognizes an employee from outside of work, Alexis, (1). As Alexis is preparing the table across the restaurant, a member from our group tells me how she doesn't like Alexis due to personal reasons outside of work. We ask the blonde hostess (2) to make sure she isn't our waiter, she responds and tells us Alexis is a a host so it won't be a problem. Cool.. As we continue to have our PRIVATE! conversation the blonde hostess is standing there, listening in, and shortly goes to her Alexis.... Alexis approaches us and tells us very rudely in front of the other guests.. "I'm not going to seat people who have attitudes, our customers don't have attitude, if y'all have a problem y'all can leave" then walked away...we asked to speak to her manager but before we can even get a word out she went straight towards the kitchen and ignored us.. (Blonde hostess says she can seat us immediately after creating the problem)   The manager (3) approached us, said she will handle the situation and talk to her employee..  As we're waiting for our food, eating and all, we have members of the host stand pointing at us, staring at us, clearly telling other coworkers about the situation and handling it very unprofessionally, making us feel very uncomfortable.   We finish eating and begin to walkout, as we walk out we see both hostess, manager, and hostess boyfriend(4) standing at the podium by the entrance/exit as we walk by, the boyfriend(4) says "assholes" under his breath AS THE MANAGER AND STAFF MEMBERS ARE RIGHT NEXT TO HIM! The manager was neglectful about her employees comments and continued on with her conversation. I AGAIN had to talk to the manager about her employee's behaviors and at this point I'm LIVID!! She(3) proceeds to respond by saying she will "handle the situation", shes cutting me off as I'm trying to explain why I'm upset, which causes me to get more upset and use the type of vulgar language that was used RIGHT IN FRONT OF HER upon me and my family by her employees.. she's telling us to get out, she put her hands on me to try to push me out. I responded and told her I was already leaving and not to put her hands on me. As this dispute with the manager was going on Alexis is behind the manager proceeding to run her mouth by saying "you better watch it, you better watch yourself"...  Im just shocked by how poorly and unprofessional some of these people are and how they handled this. Im in the food service, been here for 6+ years and don't see how ANY OF THISSS is tolerated in this restaurant..In the restaurant I work at, scratch that, AT ANY OTHER RESTAURANT none of this would have been acceptable behavior! But it seems from old reviews that it's a reoccurring problem that corporate doesn't care to fix

reviews.author: Daniel W.
reviews.description: I understand the bad reviews. I just called and asked if they are still serving food. Got here 15 minutes later and now get say there closed - 40 minutes before advertised. Negative stars

reviews.author: Paco P.
reviews.description: Great place to hang with your media naranja or fam. Good choice of beer and great food, cant go wrong with BJ's specially with a Stone IPA on you lol

reviews.author: JoAnna F.
reviews.description: Our waitress Nicole was very friendly and although she was busy, she made sure to come and check on us frequently. She has a beautiful personality and great customer service skills. The food was all good (like usual). We ordered some pizza, wings, and fish n chips. Oh yeah and cannot forget about the chocolate chip cookie and ice cream (yum).

reviews.author: Joel T.
reviews.description: Ive dropped in a here a few times for brew and a bite. The last time I went (July 2021) they had indoor seating on a limited scale. The tables in the bat area were closed to open seating. Though I was able to sit at the bar proper and received very quick, courteous service from the bartender and food runners. The queso is pretty good and comes in a generous portion. They have good, in house beers, the Kolch style and Red are good. They also have a good domestic and international beer selection too. You might have a little more than usual delay being seated but thats the COVID after effects...

reviews.author: Daniel B.
reviews.description: Got home with my takeout and took a few bites of my burger tasted a little off and it was literally raw. See photos below.

reviews.author: Josie J.
reviews.description: Ordered BJ's today through grub hub. My husband got deep dish ziti and at first glance it looked fine. Then he went in and there was a puddle of grease at the bottom. The pasta was so oily and tasted terrible. This is ridiculous considering the price of the dish was $16+.  I got a Buffalo pizza and it was okay.

reviews.author: Steve W.
reviews.description: I wanted to go tonight and have a drink and some appetizers. I wanted to call and make a reservation the recording directed me to an app. I installed the app and it tells me there are no restaurants near me when I live 2 1/2 miles from the nearest BJ's. I called the store to see if they would put me on the waitlist and they patently refused despite their app not working. Sorry BJ's, you don't get my money tonight!  That is shitty service!!

reviews.author: Ed L.
reviews.description: If you are going to eat at a chain restaurant in Austin, BJ's is a good choice. Food is good, sriracha Brussels sprouts are a fave. Great in house beers, especially the red.

reviews.author: Tabitha B.
reviews.description: They're short staffed right now so there was a 25 minute wait for lunch, not terrible. Once seated, our server was friendly and attentive. Food was delivered in a timely manner and was delicious! Menu seems scaled down since pandemic started, but they still have good offerings.

reviews.author: Phuong C.
reviews.description: Food was good. Service could have been better.  No straws, no checking up or refilling liquids.

reviews.author: Beverly S.
reviews.description: Never again! It's been years since I last ate at BJs and now I remember why smh. This meal was horrible, if negative stars were possible that would be my rating. Ordered the "slow roasted" tri-tip and it was the toughest cut of meat I've ever encountered so this piece must have been "rush roasted". The overall flavor of the meat would have been pretty decent if the meat were actually edible. Also ordered the fettuccine alfredo, comes with chicken and broccoli. Not bad but oddly tastes exactly like a Marie Callendar's TV dinner so at this point I'm convinced they purchased a family size dinner, warmed it, placed in their own packaging then sprinkled some Parmesan on top. Normally, I'd just take the loss but in this case I want my money back, this is just unacceptable.

reviews.author: Brooke H.
reviews.description: The calamari was amazing! Cooked perfectly! French fries were hot and crispy! Coleslaw was not good very bland. The Philly would of been better if the meat was seasoned! Lighting was very dark to read the menu. Will go back!

reviews.author: Eduardo O.
reviews.description: Used to be my preferred place to spend time with family and friends, but for long time now every visit have becoming worse. Half of the menu is always missing and the staff is constantly being replaced, what means we usually have to explain things to the attendants. I'm really sad to see the way it's moving to.

reviews.author: Evan L.
reviews.description: Went here with my family for dinner for the Thursday $15 special (Half-rack ribs or tri-tip steak + 2 sides + pizookie) around 7. It took around 30 minutes to get seated which was understandable since they were pretty understaffed. I got the house salad with blue cheese dressing and tomato bisque soup as my sides. Both were pretty tasty although nothing super special. Portion sizes were really great though and could've been enough for dinner for me without the steak. I would definitely recommend coming for the Thursday special if you're looking for a good deal!   My family only ate one of the pizookies and got the other three to go. Our server Elias was very thoughtful and packed the ice cream and the mousse in separate containers from the pizookies to prevent them from getting soggy. I appreciated Elias providing great service despite the restaurant being understaffed.

reviews.author: Nika L.
reviews.description: We like go to BJ's and love the one in Cedar park, when I saw low reviews for this one I was thinking, how this can be? Well, it was two times when we tried, and both times we had to leave because we were treated so bad, we could not beleive, starting from hostess (very rude). Horrible place.

reviews.author: Victoria B.
reviews.description: My first experience; ordered delivery through LunchDrop. Outstanding! I'm gobbling before my next class. Wonderful!

reviews.author: Lou Lou O.
reviews.description: So underwhelming. First the waitress had a "smart ass" attitude when asked about the size of portions. I did not appreciate this. The entrees were all barely warm and cool to the touch. Within a few minutes we were eating cold food. The $17 Alfredo bowl was dry and cold. The garlic knot was cold. The hamburger was tasteless despite having fried jalapeos and chipotle Mayo. The meat needed seasoning. The fries, although tasty, were cold. The tea had a strange bitterness to it. They probably need to clean out their machine. The only thing palatable were the avocado egg rolls as I love the tamarind sauce. They were piping hot. We got 2 orders for a total of 12 costing $26. We should've stopped there. In the end the manager did comp the Alfredo but for high prices and below par food and service I'd say go elsewhere. BTW we loved BJ's when we lived in McAllen (this location was epic!) so this experience was very disappointing.

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: Great experience there for lunch the other day.  Food was fast and our bombshell was ASHTYN. She did an outstanding job. Management came by to check on our table also.  Definitely a great experience and we will be back.

reviews.author: Sarah J.
reviews.description: Soooo the waitress was nice and super helpful.  The food was what I remember.. haven't been here in over a year. HOWEVER... I spent $179 overall... bought a few drinks and.... I'm pretty sure the alcoholic drinks I ordered.. were watered down. I normally can finish two margaritas and I'm pretty tipsy.  I'm disappointed in the bartender working here tonight. I feel swindle. The vibe is definitely different now. Dayum

reviews.author: Ken S.
reviews.description: Being a veteran of the armed forces this place has just a cool connection with my vibes...being able to sit down and have decor to commemorate the Armed Forces is such a treat for me. I just love an establishment that recognizes the armed forces, it has special meaning to me.   The menu is filled with military jargon which is pretty cool when you order.

reviews.author: Lakeria S.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I visited Bombshells on St. Patrick's Day evening in pursuit of having a few drinks and something good to eat. Upon arrival, the parking lot was packed so we thought that was a sign we would have a good time. The hostess told us it would be a 30-35 minute wait. We were seated in a booth after 20-30 minutes. I ordered the Pearl Harbor per the waitress's recommendation and he ordered an Old Fashion. Our drinks took a while because apparently they only had one bar back helping the bartenders. After taking a few sips of my drink, I noticed all I tasted was pineapple juice. I'm not a heavy drinker, but I do want liquor in my cocktail when I order one; it tasted like straight juice. Also, my boyfriend's drink was DISGUSTING. It tasted horribly bitter, not at all smooth and tasty like the Old Fashions he usually gets elsewhere. Regarding food, we ordered chips and queso that tasted stale and the salsa that came with it was watery AS HELL. I was so unimpressed with their menu that I didn't even order anything else. My boyfriend ordered wings and fries for us to share. By the time that came out, the waitress had brought us someone else's wings so she had to take it back and bring the correct one. Like everything else, the wings were nothing to be desired. I don't even think I ate any fries; I was just ready to leave. We barely ate the wings and didn't even take them to go. I guess they didn't have any bussers because there were so many empty, dirty tables around and people steadily coming in to be seated. The best thing Bombshells had going for it was the music. It was also a very diverse crowd: old, young, Black, white, Hispanic, gay, straight, couples, singles, friends, families, everybody. Hence the 2 stars. It's a shame because the vibe is there and the space of the place is really nice but our first impression of it left us feeling like we wasted our time and money. Therefore, we don't recommend it and won't be returning.

reviews.author: Bailey I.
reviews.description: I felt a little uncomfortable tonight as there was a girl walking around and asking people to buy cookies for $10 and when I said no thank you she suggested I make a donation instead. I'm not sure if she was family of someone working there, but it was awkward that they let her ask for money and since she never left the table we felt pressured to donate money to her with no idea who she was or if she was actually using the money for the purpose she said. Other than that, everything was great!

reviews.author: Elyssa C.
reviews.description: Service was not great :( it wasn't very busy but we were kept waiting a very long time for items even after asking a few times. The food was yummy though! The shrimp tacos were good, the accompanying sauce is great!!

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Waitress brang me the wrong beer, asked for Miller Lite and was brought Bud Lite. Proceeded to ask what our waitress recommended as an appetizer and she said she didn't recommend anything on the menu. Poor attitude, customer service was bad from the moment my waitress began interacting. Seemed like she didn't want to be there at all. Overall would not recommend this spot if you want a good environment while drinking your cold brew.

reviews.author: Angel B.
reviews.description: I see why they only have 2 1/2 stars! We walked in at 3. 3 tables and 3 at the bar. We waited 5 minutes to be seated. (Waitresses having a conversation.) We we're seated finally. Then after about 10 min with no drink order taken from us, a waitress goes to a table where a gentleman was just seated, sat down with him and started taking his order. He wa seated righ next to us. We got up to leave and let the manager know why we were leaving and she acted like she could care less. Have never tried the restaurant out and I can assure you we never will. Good luck with business. You're gonna need it with the staff you have. Sorry I can't rate the food.

reviews.author: jaimie L.
reviews.description: Ordered through doordash. Missing cheesecake.  Chicken fried steak had the breading completely separated from the steak and although the breading was good, the steak was tough!  Fries overly salty while Mac n cheese had 0 salt. Best thing was the fried hot Cheeto torpedos. Would not return or recommend.

reviews.author: Cashdoll C.
reviews.description: Would only recommend this location through the week and daytime . I went on Saturday at about 11:00 this place had about 10 girls 2 at the front talking while I'm waiting to get seated , which took (5 min) for the girls to even come back from where they were at . So I finally got to the both still not being serviced properly. I waited 30 minutes before I got up and went to the front and asked " So IS ANYBODY GOING TO SERVICE ME" ? Like why come to work if you're not going to work .  I usually come to this place every time I'm in town but tonight was my last .

reviews.author: Geraldo H.
reviews.description: It was a pretty pleasant Sunday evening for me. I got out of work after being positively complimented throughout the day, just feeling pretty damn fucking good today. I decided to take a nap, then of course decided to get food to celebrate my day. I went on to take a nice hot shower, freshened myself up, and went out for food.   Initially, I was planning on going to Cheddar's but that wait time there was way too long. We're talking 45 minutes. I haven't eaten all day by the way. You know what was close by though? Bombshells. What was the wait time? 5-10 minutes. I wondered why but I didn't question it. It's kind of like when you need to take a shit, and you're just hoping to go to a nice restroom. Anyway, I was pretty surprised.  There was a younger woman who was the waitress our table. First thing she asked was the drinks we wanted. "Three waters please." I was then asked for my card right away which was fucking weird as shit as I didn't receive any food yet, nor did I get an order placed for food. I just sat there and started to ponder a bit. We get the waters but no offering of a straw for our waters, which I also thought was odd. Not really working out the way I'd like for my first time actually dining in.   NASCAR was on for a bit on the TV monitor screen, and then it changed to Women's soccer for the Summer Series (GO USA!). We finally get an order in. I ordered the Grilled Tilapia entree with Alfredo sauce smothered on, steamed broccoli, and Spicy Mac 'n' Cheese. The thing was that the poor waitress didn't even know that there was an option to top the tilapia with Alfredo sauce and shrimp. She mistook it that I wanted to do two different dishes. I'm just like, "I can guarantee something will be wrong." I kept quiet for a bit because I was pretty annoyed.  The food comes out. No shrimp on my dish. Eh, fine. I proceeded to eat the food and it was pretty decent. I liked the Alfredo sauce a lot. The Spicy Mac 'n' Cheese was okay at best. The steamed broccoli was good. I noticed one thing the entire hour being there--I've never once was asked for a refill on my drink, nor were we properly catered to with the courtesy of asking how everything was during the feasting of the food. I'm now really annoyed and frustrated.   The more I noticed things, I observed other tables and waitresses actually having an interaction with each other. The waitress at my table could have given two fucks about my guests and I. Cold shoulder was given to us several times, with the same waitress kissing the asses of the table served behind me to patrons that came in after we did. She was also missing for extended periods of time.  Little did she know, I actually am a frequent high-tipping gentleman with a whole lot of damn money to blow. Sadly though, she dropped the ball highly. I guess it could have been the way I looked or the stereotype that I may not be worth the time to serve--who the hell knows? What I do know is that I was still nice enough to offer a 15% tip even after all of the shitty service provided. I was thinking about stiffing her but thought to myself, "I think she is new, and they've probably thrown her to the wolves." Mind you, we had to let her know that the ticket was wrong. That shouldn't be something on our end to do but we did because we knew something was already wrong to begin with. First impressions are EVERYTHING, baby.  I'll make it known that having a pretty face ain't going to cut it in a face-to-face customer service field. That has to be backed up with a great demeanor, capability, efficiency, eagerness to perform on the job, and always a solid first impression. This young lady needs to be trained more, and I think it's at the fault of the actual restaurant not properly training staff that I'm seeing all of these shit reviews about the service alone. My ass got to experience that instead of the positive side.   I'm extremely disappointed and just hope Bombshells fixes their BS quickly. This restaurant can be more than just the typical chain, especially if it was better ran with its employees. I don't fault the waitress for not knowing better because for all I know--this can be her first serving gig. However, this spot missed the mark highly. Easily, I'm a customer that can bring numerous guests with me, ordering items on tickets of several hundreds of dollars a sitting quite easily. Not going to happen now after all of the mishaps this evening. I'd rather drink bleach.  .5 stars/5 Stars: Absolute abomination. I certainly doubt that I would ever come back to this spot. I would rather serve life in prison in Angola than come back to this spot.

reviews.author: Shawn M.
reviews.description: This place is sooooo damn underwhelming it hurts.  First of all I guess they didn't get the memo that we are in a pandemic since the rent a cops weren't wearing mask or enforcing the rule to   customers coming in and out of the establishment.  They were to worried about flirting with the waitresses.  I get it..they are kind of cute but come on..do your job!  Also there were about 9 of them working last night and only three were wearing their mask correct or even at all.  The bartender had hers around her neck the whole time while breathing directly over your food...smh..very disappointing. The wings themselves were okay but nothing to go back for.  I will be going to a place that the employees know how to actually wear a damn mask.

reviews.author: Shana J.
reviews.description: This restaurant may have been the worst tasting food I've had all year. I don't know whose idea it was for the fried pickles to be spears but that's a terrible idea. Also the batter that the pickles were fried in was pretty gross. The chicken wings tasted like they were barely seasoned. Drea our server was awesome and had a lot of patience because I know the group I was with was definitely annoying. The bartender was also cool. The drinks snuck up on everyone because at first everybody thought they tasted watered down and then all of a sudden they felt it (lol). Overall we definitely would not go back it just wasn't worth it.

reviews.author: Markiesa B.
reviews.description: If I could give it zero stars I would .I'll start by saying we had to wait 5 minutes for a table remind you this was a Monday night around 950. Got seated and literally waited there for 15 minutes and still no server. I walked down to where the kitchen was, poked my head in and said hey can we get a server for our table. A girl came by afterwards and asked did she(the unknown server) come by yet we said no. Five more minutes went by and my brother had to yell at a server to come over and serve us. She was nice enough to do it considering she wasn't are Initial server. We order all our stuff drinks and food at the same time. Btw the drinks were very weak tasted like juice and syrup. I ordered the Philly cheesesteak which was nothing to brag about. My brother told the server it was my moms birthday so she offered to buy her a shot. When it was bill time my brother asked for the manager to come over to explain why we had to wait so long and to at least cut the bill down for waiting so long. She said the birthday shot was considered the "freebie" and that she talked to the server and that was it. No apology no nothing . I will never visit this place again. They didn't deserve my money or time !

reviews.author: Kerri B.
reviews.description: Good food, good service and excellent DJ's. I love to come on the days that DJ Roger works and DJ Kavika are djing. They are the best DJ's ever.

reviews.author: Bradley B.
reviews.description: Good food and service. A little pricey for a wing place, but very good. Will definitely go back.

reviews.author: Brittney H.
reviews.description: Literally had the worst experience here on Friday evening. First of all the service was terrible, it took about 30 minutes after we sat down to get someone to take our order. We had to go to the front and ask for a server because no one was attending to us. After that, it took another 15 minutes to get our drinks. After we ordered our food, that took another 30 minutes to come out and when it did come out, my food was missing. The waitress didn't say anything so I figured that they were still making it. Only after 15 more minutes passed by and the waitress finally came back did she ask where my food was to which I responded that I had no idea. She then went back to the kitchen and after about 15 more minutes, my food came out. While everyone was eating, they found that my nephews chicken was raw and we had to bring up that issue as well.   The manager ended up coming out and taking my food and my nephews food off the ticket but it was still a very terrible experience. I wouldn't recommend going here to anyone.

reviews.author: Anastasia R.
reviews.description: The service here is definitely not the best, it was very slow and yet there were so many waitress walking around talking to other staff... The food was decent and space was comfy.

reviews.author: Captain C.
reviews.description: I don't know what the problems people have with place this are. When I was there, the food was good, the help was friendly and helpful, the girls were scantily clad of course... But aside from feeling ambivalent about that soft-core strip-club feel, it was great!

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Place has lost their way. Everything about it has slipped down to poor status. Cleanliness, staff, food everything. Shame too because I used to like it.

reviews.author: Char S.
reviews.description: This is my playground. My Disney Land. My basketball court. My football field... my... my.... home away from home. Idk why but this liquor store is just much more exciting than others lol. When you can't find what you want else where this place has it. So just come here first. Their options are fun to me.

reviews.author: Brad S.
reviews.description: I've lived in the area since 2001 and have been going to Moon Dance for my adult beverages for years. If you're looking for hard liquor, take a look a their selections. If you are looking for beer or wine, go somewhere else. They used to have a good stock of specialty, quality beer and wine. For example, they used to have a good selection of micro-brewery beers, but now storied brands like Pabst Blue Ribbon seem to be the taking up most of the shelf space. The quality of wines have slid as well. My last visit there a couple days ago for Rieslings resulted in looking through a selection of less than 10 choices, all of which I was unfamiliar. The recommendations by staff resulted in two bottles ... one of which had lovely hints of chemicals and gasoline (lots of TDN; obviously a late harvest grape that had decomposition of the veins within the grape) ... and the other bottle offered notes of cat pee ... absolutely disgusting cheap, creamy crap. MD 20/20 would be a step up. I'd like to support my local business, but I'm quite done ... no more ... I'll make the trip across town to Total Wine from now on.

reviews.author: teresa t.
reviews.description: 1st I don't drink, but other members of the house do. Very clean, super nice, and always really helpful.   The only bad thing is trying to find a parking spot. They have 1 spot reserve, otherwise your on your own. With a busy heb and restaurant near it, it can be hard to find some place to park

reviews.author: Thomas M.
reviews.description: I usually shop at Spec's. I realize small liquor stores' prices are going to be higher than Spec's, but this is a little ridiculous. The exact same bottle that always costs me $17.29 at Spec's cost me $25.97 here. That's $8.68 more...over 50% higher! How much are you willing to pay for convenience? Since my office is right near a Spec's, I will continue to plan ahead and enjoy the 33% savings. If you are willing to pay the "convenience fee," I will say this store was nice inside (like a Twin Liquors) and the guy at the counter was very friendly. My only complaint is the prices, but that determines where I shop. I'm a frugal person.

reviews.author: Mindy C.
reviews.description: Excellent selection of wine and beer. This isn't a huge chain so while it may be slightly higher in price on some things, the convenience, friendly staff and knowing I'm supporting a local make it totally worth it! If they don't have it, they'll get it for you. Highly recommend

reviews.author: JJ J.
reviews.description: Overpriced. One guy who didn't know what he was doing working by himself on a busy Saturday. Said my card wouldn't go through because it didn't have a chip in it. I took my business to Twin Liquors where my card worked just fine and saved myself some money! I will never shop here again.

reviews.author: Lyra C.
reviews.description: This local wine shop offers a very nice selection of wines, including my favorite Texas wine, and Argentinian Malbecs.  Many Liquors as well. They have a nice array of special gifts, or put together your own.  Linda is there to help with your questions and she's an awesome lady to know.  Always a pleasant experience, they really get to know their clients tastes and preferences.

reviews.author: Charlie M.
reviews.description: Visited this store on Christmas eve to pick up a few drinks.  I have never in my 20 years of living in the RR area been treated so poorly.  I went in, picked up what I wanted and headed to the counter.  Once there I was questioned about a bottle of peach ciroc.  I told the guy I never touch any ciroc, but he insisted I did over and over again.  A few minutes later a few other fellas walked up to the counter and he realized he had made a mistake.  I would have been ok with this if it were not for the way the clerk presented himself and kepting insisting it was me who picked up the bottle.  I was being accused of stealing a bottle of liquor wearing shorts and a pull over sweat shirt.  Where I could of concealed the bottle is a mystery to me.  Once he realized he was wrong he made a weak apology and continued on.  I will never visit this store again!  Just unacceptable...

reviews.author: Lacey B.
reviews.description: I'm a fan of this liquor store. The staff is helpful, I can find what I'm looking for and if I can't the staff can order it special for me. The prices aren't too bad and it is conveniently located near my home and near my neighborhood HEB.

reviews.author: Mike V.
reviews.description: Super nice, and friendly staff. Conveniently located super close to home. (Almost too close) This store has a nice selection of liquor, and a decent beer selection as well. If they don't have it, they'll order it for you. They are a few bucks higher, but worth it.

reviews.author: Jamie I.
reviews.description: This place rocks! Linda and Dave are so helpful and the manager Jake, is the best. So friendly and great advice!

reviews.author: Amanda C.
reviews.description: I walked in about a minute to close. The register shuts down after 9pm so it can't sell illegally. This wonderful cashier not only helped me find exactly what I was looking for, but also ran it to the register for me so I could buy it! This place was amazing!!! I strongly recommend this to everyone!

reviews.author: Matt G.
reviews.description: Always very helpful staff.  Tasting every Friday.  Ask for any type you want and they will try to get it for you.  The one problem is they are EXTREMELY over priced compare to other business in the Round Rock area.

reviews.author: Staci S.
reviews.description: This place has the nicest people and great selections at good prices!  The made some great suggestions and have never been wrong. They make buying booze fun!

reviews.author: William D.
reviews.description: This place is hands down the best pizza spot in Austin I've been to thus far. The staff is knowledgeable, friendly, and quick/attentive. I've even had the pleasure of being served by the owners themselves. I always LOVE a good NY style pizza spot, and this is that and beyond. They have Gyros, calzones, wings, and an impressive line of draft beer.  P.S-- try the cannolis, they're bombski.  Thank you guys for being awesome!!!!! See yah soon.

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: OMG !!! We have been missing out by not coming here !!! We drove 21 miles from where we live in Liberty Hill to get here. It was worth the drive !!! The place is small, but the food is totally awesome !!! They have a great menu selection. Mrs. Texas had a Greek salad which she loved and fried ravioli which she also loved. My son had the Greek delight pizza which he loved, and I had the Mexican delight which I loved and rated it as Slap Yo Momma Good !!! We will definitely be back !!! The place was the clean and the staff was super friendly. Worthy of a bookmark and a try if you're passing through, or if you live or work nearby. I wish they would open up a location in the new strip center by the new HEB in Liberty Hill !!!

reviews.author: Ciara D.
reviews.description: First time visiting in Round Rock. Pizza was delicious, probably could be the closest to NY style in the area.  I ordered a half cheese half pepperoni and the order was messed up. So I would recommend checking before leaving with your order. Besides that great quality pizza.

reviews.author: Susan B.
reviews.description: Some of the best pizza and wings in Austin with a great combo deal. We had Meat Lovers and Parmesan bone in. Lots of choices for pizza, including a weekly special.

reviews.author: Mandy W.
reviews.description: I have ordered food a few times from here, alfredo, Caesar salad, cannolis, gyro and my husband wings and a calzone... EVERYTHING is delicious you can't go wrong with anything! I have ordered delivery through Yelp! and never had an issue when I ordered to go for curbside it had an option to text when you are there and it never came out I had to go in to grab it that has been the only issue the few times I had ordered.

reviews.author: Wallace F.
reviews.description: Yummy NY style pizza, super nice staff, my wife loved her freshly tossed salad. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: Pretty good pizza!!  I just got a couple of slices and would definitely go back. The mozzarella sticks are realllly good too!   The sauce has good flavor and it was delivered really fast. Very close to New York pizza but the crust is a little thicker! When it arrived, I was pleasantly surprised to see that it looked 10x better than the pizza in some of the other pictures. I think because my slices were jumbo, that they are a bit thinner than their other pizza (which I love)

reviews.author: Alex A.
reviews.description: This guys are my home's go to for pizza and wings. Everyone in my household is in love with their lemon pepper wings. Huge fan of their Stromboli and their calzones.

reviews.author: Joe I.
reviews.description: We ordered pizza and mozzarella sticks from Pizza delight this is a New York-style pizza place. I ordered the Italian Pizza, mozzarella cheese sticks, and the Cherry Cheese Cake. The delivery was very fast and the Pizza was still hot. The Mozzarella cheese sticks were awesome, and of course, we love the cheesecake.

reviews.author: T G.
reviews.description: I ordered two pizzas one being a taco the other being a combination. I was utterly amazed at the quality and taste and overall satisfaction of the service here.  It took 14 minutes from the time I ordered till the time it is ready even though they were very busy!  The quality of this pizza is amazing I was very very surprised they also have other items such as wings and whatnot.  I suggest if you're in the area it's a must have if you're in the mood for pizza.

reviews.author: Stephanie Y.
reviews.description: I consider myself sort of a pizza connoisseur and could eat it several times a week. I like to make homemade pizza from time to time as well and always like trying new places. I told my husband I was tired of getting pizza from the same places and wanted something new. This restaurant has almost all good reviews and they tout being voted best pizza in Round Rock. I really don't understand why. We got two kinds of pizza and two appetizers. The pizza was undercooked and you could still see the shredded cheese which was not fully melted. Flavor and quality was not great either. Definitely not legit NY style pizza. The garlic knots have no noticeable taste of garlic due to all the other herbs they put on them. Service was fine, but disappointed based on how many people think this is the best pizza. Based on reading other reviews, I am Expecting a rebuttal from the owner in 3, 2, 1....

reviews.author: JoAnn M.
reviews.description: Best place in Round Rock to get your pizza and/or wings. The food was awesome and customer service was incredible.

reviews.author: joshua r.
reviews.description: The (old) owner Eddie doesn't pay his test shifts  All the food is comes frozen (except the pizza dough)  Food safety is a joke and cross contamination is a huge issue with raw chicken wings all over a small kitchen near prep areas  The wait times are 100% guesswork from the Eddie's wife running the register  But by all means, overpay for mediocre pizza

reviews.author: Bijal P.
reviews.description: I wanted to order pizza from a different place and decided to give this place a try.  I ordered on a Friday and they were def busy cause my pizza arrived late.  Once the pizza arrived it was piping hot so hot that when we took one slice of pizza all the toppings started coming off.  So we let it cool down I love the crust I have to say it was very crunchy my kids enjoyed their pizza. The other thing I loved was the sauce yummy very fresh almost like home made.  The only thing I did not like about the philly cheese steak pizza was that it fell apart.  The pizza in general has a good amount of topping and ratio for each slice.  Overall not bad I may try something else next time but my kids pizza was good

reviews.author: Nellie J.
reviews.description: Meh.  I guess I need to give them another chance.  Went on a Monday for the first time and was hoping for a beer and some Monday special I'd heard about.  I guess they were busy and their air conditioning was out so I guess Monday specials and beer were out too.  The pizza was good, but I felt it was overpriced.  The wings were okay (not as crispy as I'd like), didn't care for the blue cheese much or warm celery/carrots.

reviews.author: Chanel M.
reviews.description: Ordered Pizza Delight via Door Dash last night. It was one of the more lengthier wait times, however, I decided to go with them to try out something new but it was delivered as estimated. I ordered a medium pizza with pepperoni and extra cheese which was great. It was delicious. The marinara, pepperoni and cheese were all fresh and tasty.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Pizza Delight is as the name describes- delightful! I love the crust of the New York-style pizza. It is just the right amount of sauce and the lunch pizza and salad is great. I'd highly recommend this place in Round Rock right by HEB Plus. The owner and team are friendly. I'll be back for this affordable and delicious pizza!!

reviews.author: Michaela M.
reviews.description: Had a major craving for some good pasta so I Ordered spaghetti with meatballs and instead of receiving actual spaghetti noodles, I received penne pasta.  the pasta had barely enough sauce to have flavor and meatballs seemed to be frozen but heated up. I do not think this dish was actually prepared fresh so that stinks.   They had a great deal for $5 off on DoorDash but most likely will not be ordering from here again unless it's pizza.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: I was looking for quick pizza takeout and this place did just that. I ordered a $20 specialty bundle that included one large pizza, one large salad, and 6 wings. For $20, I felt that was a great deal. I did feel it was a little pricey to add extra toppings on the pizza. I ordered it from my house which was about 15 minutes away and when I arrived everything was ready to go and bagged up waiting for me. A guy brought it out to my car curbside and made sure I had a mask on, which I appreciated for his health and mine. Everything was still hot when I got home and the pizza and wings were devoured quickly. I ate the chicken caesar salad the next day and it was tasty and fresh as well. Would recommend trying this local pizza shop!

reviews.author: Arlene M.
reviews.description: Food is good here. We've really  enjoyed the lemon pepper wings! Well, service here isn't consistent. One day my spouse and I walked in to dine in there and service was awesome. The polite, welcoming male told us to have a seat and they'd take our order. We came back days later(to dine in)  and the tables were dirty, it wasn't very busy btw. We sat down looked at the menu. 10 minutes pass and no one helped us AT ALL. they didn't talk to us, acknowledge us. So I went up to just order while everyone stood around. I'm not sure what the process is here ?? But they sure as heck weren't going to come to us.  Well, as I ordered I felt so uncomfortable and as if our presence was an inconvience. 2 other times during this SAME week ( separate days) i walked in to order pretty large orders for my kids final days of school. Similar service was given. No one bothers to greet you and one of the workers said he'd help us when he had a chance. Ok sure, yeah we waited. Lol no biggie I guess?   Long story short we enjoyed the food and spent a lot of money here in just one week but eh the service here convinced me not to come back. Good food, inconsistent rude staff simple as that.

reviews.author: Brian N.
reviews.description: Cider placed located nearby the breweries in northwest Austin. There is outdoor and indoor seating for all. Pets are allowed indoors as well. Inside, there are also ping pong tables . There is a coffee shop within the same building.  Next to here is a brewery that you can also get beer from. There is the Spicy Boys food truck on site for snacks while you drink. I think it's a good place to check out if you like ciders and are in the area.  The bartender the day we visited was very friendly and explained the different ciders they have on tap.

reviews.author: Khloe P.
reviews.description: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY! First of all, these people are assholes. Came here for a bachelorette party and their beer sucked! The manager was rude and I had a bug in my beer! No refund, no apologies and not a sorry member from anyone from the staff!!!! Stay away from this crap shoot!

reviews.author: Mr. S.
reviews.description: We bought a couple ciders to try. They were so god awful that my buddy secretly poured them out in the bathroom. It tasted like i was drinking a funky armpit wine. Gooooooooooooo

reviews.author: Sarah T.
reviews.description: Hate cider. I come here for the wine and ambiance. Both so funky. Also, Spokesman Coffee.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Support. Your. Local. Cideries.  I'm not even that gung ho about ciders, but a lot of my girlfriends are. I'm so glad we stopped by Fairweather. It's very laid back, intimate, and relaxing with its clean aesthetic. Down in South Atx, we have Texas Keeper (awesome cidery, very different fireflies-on-the-porch and farmside vibes), so it was nice to see a completely different cidery with literally garage-space, elevated, and hipster vibes.   We both got cider flights, and loved the diversity of selections. Their ciders are all hilariously named (Fuccboisen is my favorite...I should've ordered that). I enjoyed their Smell the Van and EZ Tea (it truly tastes like tea!). The EZ tea was so delicious. Quenches thirst, subtle, and very honey-like. Their ciders aren't sickeningly sweet, and the flights give you a great little taste of all of the ciders that you're curious about but are unsure about getting a whole pint of. Their inventory has a clean design too. Their tees are super adorable, as well as their BEVERAGES sweaters. Tempting.  Service was wonderful. Our cider taptender was a wonderful man who was very sweet, knowledgeable and welcoming. The space is small, so it's not recommended you come here with a huge group (unless you plan on taking up the entire space. They have strong wifi, serve-yourself water, and different styles of seating from regular tables to taller barstools. They have little succulents on the table along with a well-designed menu for their "specials" deals. I would usually go to 4th Tap next door, but why not do both and hit up Fairweather too?

reviews.author: Christopher R.
reviews.description: Frozen Rose "Froz" is super delicious!   Currently,  they have "PowerFade" as the frosty frozen drink! Super good, kind of like a frozen margarita. This cidery has really good drinks and hosts Austin FC watch parties. Fairweather also has partnered with Spokesman Coffee if someone in your group wants a coffee! If you're here at 11am, which would you pick? Why not both? Good vibes, good music, and a great atmosphere.  Bartenders are super friendly. I like it here! Check out 4th Tap and the pizza truck outside as well!

reviews.author: Katie G.
reviews.description: Love this cider taproom! Try the rose cider-it's perfect. Tables are spaced 6 feet apart and it's open air so very safe for Covid. Cute decor and fun, upbeat music. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: N S.
reviews.description: Accompanied my cider-loving friends as the only non cider lover and was delighted to not only see a couple of The Austin Winery staples on the menu but also a fridge full of multiple natural wines that the host warmly introduced us to, from sparkling moscato to skin contact. The pet nat was INSANE. Seriously gorgeous, open, airy space with beautiful murals that instantly put you in a good mood

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: I usually am not a fan of cider...at all! But, after some friends who are also beerdrinkers suggested this place and that it wasn't your typically overly-sweet cider (which is what I have the aversion to) suggested this place, I decided "why not?".  The vibe here is super chill and the cider-barista was super nice and everyone there chimed in when I asked about the diff ciders they were offering.   So I will say, while I am still not on the cider bandwagon (I mean beer will always be my first love), the ciders here were actually drinkable! I enjoyed that they were on the drier side so your mouth isn't annihilated by chocolate and you can actually appreciate the different flavor components of each one! I will also give them kudos for actually packing a little bit of a punch w/the abv, which you don't usually see with ciders either!  Definitely enjoyed the vibe and the concept here!

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: I was going from brewery to brewery when I noticed Fairweather Cider company and immediately knew I had to stop by and give it a try. Great ciders in a cute little shop. If you live in North Austin and are a cider enthusiast, this is a good spot to stop by on a Friday night!

reviews.author: Dean L.
reviews.description: So many good things to say. I first and foremost am not a cider guy. Came in here on a referral from a friend and was surprisingly impressed with the operation. The cider was good they had some crisp ciders that came off more like a beer if that's what you need. My favorite was the blood orange or the pear. Still a toss up between the two. Also this place has some crazy good wines. They are cheap for a much better quality compared to the ones you get in most stores. They had football running great AC for that Texas heat. Best of all they allow dogs! When I came in my novice skills when drinking wine and ciders were put aside by the owner who gave me a great understanding and tour of his selections. The staff are all super friendly too!  There are no downsides to this place. Except for the hangovers. (Mostly self inflicted) I recommend Sundays. For your visit. There is a cool little coffee shop inside too. Nervous Charlie's was serving up brunch. Soo many good combinations outside of your regular mimosa routine. Do yourself a favor. You are not too cool to break away from your traditions to try this place.  In regards to the cider snobs leaving bad reviews. They obviously didn't come here for something new. Why would you want to go somewhere that copied someone else? Boring.... wish they could get more stars.

reviews.author: Vik M.
reviews.description: First ACTUALLY dry cider I have had while in Texas. Please do yourself a favor and visit this tap room.  It all started with a long wait for barbecue and a guy wearing a cidery shirt/hat. A quick google search later I dragged my family to this tap room so I could get a cider fix (having spent five years in the PNW it is a tough itch to scratch here in TX). The bartender/coowner was extremely friendly and ready to answer all questions. He was adorable and alone was reason enough for a follow up visit.  My sister and I had a flight of their four ciders on tap. Currently:  Common: base for all other cider, ACTUALLY DRY. In lurv Tejano dreams: green chile cider, bomb af. Strong pepper aroma and beautiful subtle Chile flavor. Nelson sauvin (I think).... very strong hop flavor forward with sweet cider finish. A good balance for people seeking hop flavor while trying to expand to cider. huell melon: hop flavor is SO subtle that it almost tastes like sour fruit flavor. I LOVED this cider. I can't wait to try it again.  Opens only Fri-Sun this is definitely a stop to add to your weekend plans. There are big things coming for this cidery. I can't wait to watch them grow.  I loved this cidery and cider and definitely recommend to anyone in the area.

reviews.author: Gina M.
reviews.description: Liked how chill this place was! Huge screen for sports. Bench seats with high table and a bar. Some doggos were there and you can bring your own food in.  I think a coffee shop was attached too but it was closed at night. We got two samplers and honestly it's hard to pick a fave and the flavors were fun!   Great place to hang out and have some drinks. *went in the fall! Plan to be be back this spring since the doors will be open * fingers crossed**

reviews.author: Amber K.
reviews.description: I really love Fairweather's concept and having a new addition to Metric Row that isn't another brewery! (Love to y'all breweries, though.)  I came here the day after opening day with a few friends who love cider (I'm indifferent) to try out their brews. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised!  We each ordered a flight of their four ciders on tap. One was the Common, which is the base for all their ciders. Another was one of my favorites even though it involved a little heat from some peppers! The last two were hopped ciders, and the bartender/co-owner told us if we tried them first in different orders, we may like one over the other. He was right, both both were delightful.  I want to give a five-star review to support a new business, but my only tiny complaint would be the fruit flies. Some kept buzzing about here and there, but you can only imagine they want to get a taste of this dry cider sweetness!  If you're a beer person like me, you may have found a new hangout for your friends who don't love beer as much as you. But you'll still enjoy what Fairweather has to offer -- so much so, I ordered a 12-oz pour of my favorite hopped cider after my flight!  Good luck, guys, and congrats on your opening!

reviews.author: Emily K.
reviews.description: This cider is heavenly! If you like dry, innovative ciders (think boysenberry, blood orange + hops, cider with electrolytes) you've got to check out Fairweather. It's well-priced, and the tap room is spacious and bright. You can even take a crowler home!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Fairweather was a surprise find for me thanks to the wise owner of Sunrise Mini Mart.  That guy knows SO much about all different types of distilled liquids, I wish I had a brain that could store that much knowledge.   I digress, this review is about the awesome family who started Fairweather (super friendly and knowledgeable).  I bought their cans of Common and was blown away.  Cideries claim to have dry cider all the time, but it's not TRULY dry.  Common though was legit.  These guys are making a truly BONE DRY English style cider from apples sourced from the PNW.   It's not perfect yet, but you can taste the potential. It reminds me of Shacksbury.  The fun artwork on the can intrigued me to go check out this spot that was just a few minutes drive away.  The tasting room is TINY! Start small and dream big! Kuddos to them for turning a cold warehouse space into a fun modern hipster community watering hole.  On a Friday night, get here early to even find a spot to sit!  I arrived around 5:30pm and sat at a high table outside and had no line.  By 7pm, people were crowded elbow to elbow, with a long line.  There also is very limited parking.  Be prepared to take time to find a spot and walk.  When they state they are pet friendly they mean it. Not only was my furry friend chilling with others, we were soon joined by a parrot!  I had a great time. I had come by myself, but ended up having several great conversations with people I had never met before.  Truly this place is only months old, and has quickly become a new neighborhood hang out.  The ciders are all 6.5%.  You can enjoy a flight of 4x4OZ for $10, enjoy a glass, or enjoy a guest cider or something from Austin Winery. I love the local support for other local liquid makers. There is a wide range of ciders to choose from.  They have some fun experimental ciders that were not like anything I have tried before.  It's hard to choose just four for a flight.  They have their staples- Common, EZ TEA, and Tejano Dreams, but also some Dry Hopped Ciders, and fruit ciders. My favorites were Tejano Dreams (nice kick), Gin Bot, and Dr. Rudi.

reviews.author: Elyse Z.
reviews.description: If you like dry ciders, this place is for you. The Tejano Dreams is my favorite. They also have wine if you are not into cider.   Place is a little small. You can get a flight or by the glass. If you are usually a beer drinker or new to ciders, they will definitely let you try a few so you can find your favorite.   If you are hungry, there are usually food trucks at 4th tap and they let you bring food in. It is not officially dog friendly but sometimes they have a table outside when the garage is open.

reviews.author: Mariah F.
reviews.description: Fairwheather cider was definitely a surprise and a hidden gem. It's a very small location but it is in the burnet brewing scene, as it's located right next to 4th tap. Their cider is so amazing with fusions with sweet tea, gin, wine and different fruits, it'll definitely give you a pleasant experience you may not have been expecting. They also have so many more flavor options than what they offer in the store so id go to the cider for more options. You can also take pictures in front of the interesting wall art with the unicorn things going on.

reviews.author: Alex D.
reviews.description: Great local cider, in the "brewery area" of north Austin. They're got cute merch and you must try the jalapeo cider!

reviews.author: Angel L.
reviews.description: This taproom has a very minimalistic and industrial aesthetic that makes it a perfect place to catch up with a friend. It's quite small, but there was ample seating when I was there. Their cider is different from most of the dry ones I've had before - my favorite was the common with citrus-y flavors. The Apple flavor wasn't as strong as I was expecting (or used to with other ciders), and maybe that's just the case with a "true" dry cider. It tasted almost like a wine, which is great if you're a wine lover, I suppose!

name: Shooters Billiards and Sports Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Wednesday, Saturday

reviews.author: Mercedes J.
reviews.description: Pretty cool spot to hang out. Live music, pool, drinks. Waitress even came around to ask if we needed anything

reviews.author: Connor A.
reviews.description: Don't expect covid protections here. It's a no frills pool hall in Texas. Nobody in the establishment is wearing a mask, including the bartenders and waiters. If that's not a problem for you, then you're in for a good time.   We came in on a Tuesday night and easily found a pool table to ourselves. We opened a tab and had no trouble getting drinks without having to leave our games. The mixed drinks are nothing to write home about, but we had an excellent time drinking and playing pool. We also easily played some table shuffle board. They have computer slots/keno games to gamble with in a shady corner is that's something you're into.   The place was acceptably clean and the staff were all very friendly. Just make sure you have a VALID drivers license regardless of your age! This was place was a good time and I'll definitely be back again in the future.

reviews.author: Chase S.
reviews.description: We showed up here and we're served as soon as we sat down. 45 minutes went by and we were never seen again by the waitress. The waitress instead spent her time sitting with customers and talking instead of serving. Would avoid if possible.

reviews.author: Jip Z.
reviews.description: Came in on a Thursday, some aggressive lady with glasses and bun, answers the door with "Do y'all have ID's?" We said yea and showed ours, then she says "So then talk to this dude at the door"... I walk in and there's a table with some merchandise on it and this little man, asked if we were there for the event? I said "we didn't know there was an event" and then he said it was $25 per person... well we didn't know, we just came for a drink and some parents night out. So I said sorry and we excused ourselves and then this same lady at the front was smoking outside so I said "Sorry, we didn't know it was an event" and she snarkily says "Yeah! it's dwarf wrestling!" Like I should be ashamed of not knowing this. I feel stupid, my bad.... But maybe next time have a sign on the door! We read the entire door and no sign about this, a cover of $10-15 we would pay but we didn't want to do $25 per person, since we had not  arrived for the event. I think if you have an event, try being a bit nicer. Some people are not regulars and just want to come over and you could sell it a bit, instead of making us feel bad for not know about your poorly advertised event.  I still like this bar and I like that people can smoke in doors (although I'm not a smoker) we have enough bars we can go too and this one is for smokers, so I don't have an issue and I know what I'll smell like when I leave.

reviews.author: Kris R.
reviews.description: The music was great, the service was pretty good, I was kind of a put off and that's the reason I wrote this two star review is because of the BS of smoking indoors at this place. When I got home everything smelled like cigarettes. This is completely illegal and just downright nasty. Everybody knows secondhand cigarette smoke is really bad for you so open up a flipping window if you're gonna let people smoke. If you're too lazy to go outdoors to smoke then this place should be regulated by the health department better, this isn't your house, and no one saying you can't do something but it's just nasty and it's really bad for your health right now my throat is on fire because I've been breathing secondhand smoke I don't wanna sound like a whiner or entitled millennial but it secondhand smoke dude and it's nasty.

reviews.author: Jason L.
reviews.description: Shooters been a great home for me for 14 years, it has been like my Cheers bar, after a stressful day of work, on my way home I stop in, staff is always friendly, I love the entertainment offered, Golden Tee, pool, sweepstakes, karaoke, bands on weekends. Staff has always been good to me over the years, and have been like family, met many current friends because of Shooters. Never a cover, and probably the best drink prices of any bar.  This place has great potential, but they need to make the best of some of its best assets, especially the use that beautiful patio more for events, music, etc. You should have a solo acoustic artist out there in spring/summer/fall and promote some games on the patio, it just seems as it's used as wasted space currently, and that's a shame.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Stopped by with others for a quick pop as we were beered out from Whitestone's delicious Oktoberfest beer. Bartender was patient with us as we pondered our last cocktail of the day. Notice I said day not evening. We settled on shots (why not??!!). We all received generous pours at a reasonable price.   Shooters is a great sports bar with multiple TVS (they do have the NFL ticket). There are plenty of pool tables and games to keep you occupied. I would definitely come here to watch games but the cigarette smoke stench is too much for me, and I'm a cigar smoker. We visited for about 10 minutes and my clothes stunk of smoke. I wish they would go smokeless like their other venue on 620 or at least add some additional smoke eaters. If you are a smoker it is a 5 star joint... for others 3 makes it AOK and a fair rating.

reviews.author: Jeff D.
reviews.description: Love this bar. Great atmosphere, friendly bar tenders,  and good drink selections. Monika, Shelby, and the entire staff are the best

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: Sunday pro football here is the best! $2 zeigenbach and $1.50 cheeseburgers and hotdogs off the grill. Can't beat it! Outdoor seating and smoking inside. Great place to watch football    * they don't have the cheeseburgers and hotdogs outside any longer but still a great place to watch any game you want. Please read reviews and understand it is a smoking bar and if that will make you mad don't come

reviews.author: Paul L.
reviews.description: Shooters is the worst bar I've ever been to. Service sucks and the staff was extremely rude and all their glasses were dirty.

reviews.author: Sean G.
reviews.description: Unable to show the Texas longhorn game in the ATX is sad.  Drinks where really good and the pool tables where nice.

reviews.author: Toni G.
reviews.description: Two things about this bar. They allow smoking. Which I could have left, I know. Second, if you keep a tab open they automatically add 20% gratuity to your bill! There was only 2 of us. There's nothing posted about this. We were tipping the bartenders as we ordered. So on top of the $32 in tips we gave, we were forced to pay another $23 on our bill. They should have a notice if you plan on keeping your tab open, a gratuity is automatically added. Even for a party of 2. Ridiculous

reviews.author: Nickie B.
reviews.description: A-OK place, but be warned you WILL smell like smoke if you come here.  They offer a bar with ample seating, plenty of individual tables for seating, several pool tables, have a stage (that was empty when we visited), have an outdoor patio and an add collection of gambling machines in the back corner.  I am sure it is not real gambling, but the game players certainly looked like they were in Vegas.  Prices are reasonable.  Would not come out of my way to come here, but it is a decent dive bar.

reviews.author: Jason D.
reviews.description: Really disappointed at how this place has changed. New GM or manager or whatever has no clue on customer service and taking care of people that come in more times than others. And the waitress was rude to a friend after closing out and said "Have fun with your Slut Pants".... Whatever that means..... Really..... Keep it classy CP!!  Fast Eddie's is the place to go if you don't won't the Jerry Springer drama!!

reviews.author: Steven S.
reviews.description: It's a smelly filthy place.   Ridiculous low end pool tables I wouldn't think about playing on.  Go back in the kitchen and look for yourself how filthy it is.   The entire place smells like a wet old homeless person.

reviews.author: Jason L.
reviews.description: We went on a friday night and the place was relatively busy. Drinks were good, but the way under staffed for a friday night. The only reason I'm giving it a 4 star is for the fact that our waitress was trying soooo hard. She was running drinks, bar backing, cooking food and bartending. Also not to mention she was the only waitress there. But all in all we had a great time!

reviews.author: Young K.
reviews.description: This is nice and cool place to hang out with friends and family.. dates..cause live music and play pools..also friendly great services from bars and wait staff..i am enjoying and have a great time on my each visit...thanks for all great services to management!!!

reviews.author: Jennifer Y.
reviews.description: Great place to hang out but they have smoking and for me that is a HUGE minus because I believe that such places should keep the environment clean and focused on the pool players.

reviews.author: Manda L.
reviews.description: The bartender, an older gentleman, has been extremely rude on the 3 occasions we have visited this bar.  The bar set up is great, but with rude staff like this why would I want to come back.  Bad service lost you 4 ladies who spend a good amount and tip well....and earned you a bad review.  If your staff is so miserable they cannot give good service, maybe it's time to clean house.

reviews.author: Amgad E.
reviews.description: this place is terrible. They are racist and horrible. I came here to have a beer and for no reason the bar tender decided I was to leave. I had no problem with leaving as long as he refunded the beer I didn't even take a sip off - except he wouldn't. In fact he called d the cops and lied to them that I was disturbing the peace. I never  been more humiliated and disappointed before... this place is a total trash can for trashy racists

name: Jack and Gingers
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Roberta V.
