accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday

reviews.author: C.Rich C.
reviews.description: Just had an early dinner here. The food is always spot on very very busy today. If you're coming be sure to ask for Megatron [no kidding I checked the ticket] he gives excellent service  Prices are always reasonable and very delicious We had the garlic bread, the spring vegetables, a small salad and a salmon plate and are very full Enjoy

reviews.author: Roger H.
reviews.description: Don't eat here unless you're desperate.  Yes this is a passive aggressive review. Don't order the steak, so bland! Pizza came in a nice box but sucked. The bar is always over busy, I waited 30 minutes for my ticket, no fault of theirs. They were understaffed at the bar before the pandemic so don't tell me it's cause of post pandemic staff shortage.   The people are the best part, the people at the bar, the servers, it's just the food is so inconsistent. Sad because I used to like this place.

reviews.author: Kelly L.
reviews.description: I don't know why I haven't written a review for north italia yet. it is one of my absolute top restaurants!   the food is delicious. you can't go wrong with anything you order. my favorite pasta is the strozzapretti - the pine nuts are such a nice addition with the crunch and flavor. we got the spicy pig pizza this time but my go to is the fig pizza with prosciutto.   they don't usually take reservations for dinner time so be aware there might be a wait. we came for dinner on a monday night and there wasn't any wait at all.

reviews.author: Laurie W.
reviews.description: My husband was craving bolognese and I wanted chicken parmigiana. I've attached pictures of both. As you can see, I made the right choice! I highly recommend anything on the menu. It's a fun, chic atmosphere with excellent food and service.

reviews.author: Diana V.
reviews.description: I love north Italia for the drinks and bolognese. For sure my go to. I'm writing to absolutely roast the calamari. The calamari tasted like a fried ballsack- slightly salty but overall no flavor whatsoever. They don't even bring you marinara unless you ask. It was the worst calamari I've ever had in my life. Don't order it. Just get the bolognese LOL.

reviews.author: Suzanne S.
reviews.description: I wrote a five star review of this restaurant already. We had an excellent time and the food was amazing. I wanted to add these photos to my review, but for some reason Yelp would not let me add them to my review. Therefore, I am adding this short review so that I can share these photos with you. This restaurant was an awesome experience and service, food, atmosphere everything was great. We will try it again next time we go to Austin. I just had to add these photos to my 5 star review of this excellent restaurant! The food and service is amazing!!

reviews.author: Natalie G.
reviews.description: North Italia is such a gem.  The appetizers are amazing (see the bread with ricotta). This bread is such a wonderful portion for two...we had leftovers!   The pizza blew me away. I ordered thinking "eh, that doesn't sound good but I'll branch out" and WOW am I glad I did! The Pig was amazing. I was blown away by the meats! The sausage was incredible (this is coming from someone who HATES sausage on her pizza). The meats had so much flavor. Also, the service was incredible. The first time we came by, the wait after being seated was absolutely insane. We were so hungry! However, the waiter was so attentive to this and gave us a free dessert!   ....which leads me to how good the dessert is here! I am not a caramel fan, and this caramel ice cream was insanely good.   Please come to north italia. Trust me. It's our new fave!

reviews.author: Erica O.
reviews.description: Let me say start with how amazing the staff are! We were greeted immediately. Our waiter is a Rockstar! As busy as they were, she came and checked on us frequently.   As you can see in my pictures we ordered a lot, lol. We created our pizza. The pesto was perfect. The crust on the pizza was crispy and soft. Great flavor overall.  I ordered the squid Ink. It was great spice and delicious. Only negative was the shrimp and it needed some type of veggie. The shrimp didn't hold flavor well in the dish. I think Argentina shrimp would be a better pick for this dish rather than basic shrimp.  My little one of course with her sweet tooth ordered the glazed Italian donut french toast. It actually was really good. The wild blueberry, honey lemon ricotta, hazelnut and mint combination was actually a really good combination. This dish is super sweet so make sure you have some milk or water to drink.  My other child ordered the breakfast sandwich. She loved it. She really enjoyed the hint of spice it had in it. And my oldest child ordered the Pollo fritto and asked for over easy egg. We also ordered one too so we all could try. Let me say how they cooked the perfect cut of chicken. Normally you order chicken like this and they give you a dark meat cut thigh. Not here! It was a juicy white cut. The crust was perfect! The hash brown balls were yummmmmy! We all enjoyed those.  Overall, great atmosphere, great service, great food! We definitely will be back!

reviews.author: Tom L.
reviews.description: An amazing experience with awesome tasty food. I may not be an Italian food expert but all I tasted was freshness, bold flavors, and great tasting meats.   The charcuterie board has figs, different types of meats such as salami and prosciutto. The char bread is awesome, nice char, mix of oils, and the crunch really helps break up the saltiness from the meats. The white looking sauce is actually cheese spread, I wasn't too much of a fan but it was ok. The best part of the board was the little Italian almonds, soft and firm yet nice crispy shell.   The beef carpaccio is yummy, tasty, and just look at the dish? You eat with your eyes and the dish appeals to your vision. Must try.   The zucchini chips are additive, nice crispy, salty, chips, a bit too oily but it's what is expected, very nice house chips.  The spaghetti and meatball dish is good but I wasn't blown away, I had a better elsewhere. The spaghetti tasted a bit too Al dente, too firm, just missing flavor. I would of spun the spaghetti in olive oil, salt, and black pepper then placed the sauce on top. Sprinkling parmesan cheese helps,

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: Can't wait to do a second visit with someone special. I really enjoyed my time along with the flavors of food and kind service providers.   Happy Birthday to my wonderful son!  He loved this place.

reviews.author: Anna K.
reviews.description: I'm literally sad to give just one star to this location, my family loves this place but our experiences were pretty bad every time. First time we came, the bartenders were rude from the start for no reason at all. We got our usual drinks - Sicilian margarita and ginger blossom margarita. First one was fine but ginger was overly sweet, we asked to change the drink and the lady just refused saying that's how it should taste like. Once again, we go to north italia a lot and we never had a drink as sweet as ginger blossom at this location. Fried calamari were greasy and chicken pesto - super salty. Another time we came , it was slow - bar was pretty empty, the bartenders were ignoring us and chatting with coworkers - service was just poor. We ordered a take out once and salmon came out raw, when we asked for well done. There was wrong dressing and no utensils in the bag.  Why we keep coming back you ask? My husband loves the place, or loved actually, so we were thinking it was that one time of bad service but it just kept continuing.  So, I wouldn't recommend this location to anyone

reviews.author: Priscila M.
reviews.description: Make reservations in advance! This place is always packed and when we arrived today the waiting time was about 1h. Luckily, I had made reservations in advance. Family decided to order the zuca chips and meatballs for apps, unfortunately none of their apps are gluten free! This was just a huge let down. They loved the zuca chips and none of them enjoys zucchini...funfact. The meatball in my own daughter's word were very soft and flavorful, the cheese just makes it perfect.  For mains we had chicken parm and bolognese. You can't go wrong with bolognese, if you're in doubt if a restaurant is good just order that and you will see. They gf pasta was perfect! The sauce was amazing! Very Italian style with the some fennel flavor! The sauce was great! Not very acid and would adhere to the rotini pasta perfectly!  My girls had the chicken parm and they said it was amazing! Chicken was still moist with a perfect crispy crust with cheese perfectly melted. The pasta was also good with some white sauce. Neither of them could finish their plates which means dinner is guaranteed for the teens!

reviews.author: Delany T.
reviews.description: I have been wanting to go to North Italia for the longest! My partner and I love Italian food and have been searching for the best gnocchi, unfortunately they didn't have any. The waiter was really nice and polite and mentioned how everything is made from scratch. Although I trust her, the food was average. It tasted straight from a pasta sauce can. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't good, in exception of the bread! Would go again but just for the bread.

reviews.author: Machell P.
reviews.description: In town on business an decided to try something new. We stay in the Domain about once a month an the restaurants an vibe never disappoints. Not a bad 20 minute wait for a Thursday night. Our server was fabulous an gave us great recommendations. We had the classic board an everything was perfectly balanced with the great bottle of Cabernet we choose. Server was attentive glasses were kept full. We split the Pig pizza. Sausage was spicy an pizza was overall very good. Restrooms before our walk back to our hotel left us both grossed out an nauseous the urinal smell was just horrid we will skip that next visit. For such a nice place to eat I was a bit to shocked.

reviews.author: Kyle H.
reviews.description: Wanted an Italian dinner the first night we were in Austin. Found this place about a mile from the hotel and take a chance. Pretty busy but it was Friday night around 6-7pm. Had about a 45 minute wait however we were able to sneak into a table around the bar (first come first serve).  Wife got the chicken parmigiana. Probably the best option on the menu. Crunchy chicken with great sauce and amazing noodles on the side. She also tried the bread as an app. Very crispy and fresh.  I got the Caesar salad because I wanted something lighter. Not bad but it's a salad. Also got the meatballs. Pretty delicious.  Server was very nice and we had a great time. The domain area was very fancy with plenty of shops and stores to roam around in. Worth the visit.

reviews.author: Jackie H.
reviews.description: Great date spot. The spritz was so good! Service was amazing. Cute patio, not too long of a wait on a Thursday night.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Love this spot :) beware- it does get super crowded and sometimes, a reservation is a great idea! I've had quite a few of their dishes and I've only ever had one thing that I wasn't a huge fan of (strozzapreti). The salmon on pesto farro is amazingggg! And the Prosecco is a favorite of course.

reviews.author: Jane P.
reviews.description: I would definitely recommend this place!  10/10 did not disappoint.  I got the bolognese pasta, truffle garlic and funghi pizza!

reviews.author: Shashikala P.
reviews.description: Have been to NI long back, when that part of domain was the happening place:) Today one of my friend picked this place for brunch, I ordered cappuccino and farmer's scramble, one of my friend ordered arugula salad with prosciutto and another one squid ink mafaldine with couple of cocktails.  Cappuccino: I had asked to make it with whole milk, but still it was watery and just okay, they give it so much, asked for stevia, but they don't carry it:(  Farmers scramble: it's scrambled egg with veggies, and comes with a side of crispy potatoes and a toast. I had requested to make eggs spicy if possible, but it was super bland, other than salt, no other seasoning whatsoever, when I got my food, nothing was hot, not even warm, it was room temperature, so potatoes were not crispy, but taste was good, toast tasted good too, it would've tasted good, if it was atleast warm.  Our server was nice and helpful!!

reviews.author: Devin O.
reviews.description: While I'm not much for downtown locations. This is in a great spot!  Love the pizza!  The atmosphere os also very nice and chill for the location. Plenty of space so your not crowded up.  But beware of the windows. Or you'll have allot of people starting at you as you eat the delicious food.

reviews.author: R C.
reviews.description: MY FAVORITE restaurant in Georgetown! If you come to Georgetown please make it a point to stop in you won't be disappointed! Cocktails are amazing and they're always coming up with some new tasty concoctions!  During the holidays they had eggnog to go, and it was hands down the best eggnog I have ever had!   Everything I have eaten here is a 10 out of 10! We have tried almost everything on the menu and I've enjoyed every dish!  Our favorite appetizer is the brussel sprouts and if you want to splurge get the steak dinner.....WOW!  It could be the best steak I have ever had!  The servers go above and beyond and are always cheerful and accommodating.  The ambiance is super cool and hip from the lounge chairs, to the wall accents, they did a great job designing it! The owners of this restaurant really put in the time and dedication to come up with such a great concept and a great addition to the downtown square. I just can't say enough good things about this place!

reviews.author: Breann B.
reviews.description: I had a very strange and unpleasant experience here. I ordered the steak frites, steak cooked medium. Well a huge chunk of it was basically rare. So I didn't get to eat a lot of it. I told the waitress and showed her. She came back with a to go box with the meat I didn't like in it and told me I can take it home to cook it how I like it ????!!! What?!  I came here to pay for a service and pay for the food- and I didn't get it. Then I'm told to cook it myself? I paid full price.  The chef just so happened to ask us how our food was and I told him. He gave me a gift card to try the place again. I doubt I will after this experience.

reviews.author: Tim V.
reviews.description: The staff was very accommodating and friendly, they are dealing with staff issues (not enough) and doing a bang-up job working around this.    The deviled eggs were very good and the short ribs were a B- but still good.   The pecan chicken was really delicious  The Steak friter was ehhh good (sauces were very good) but the streak was a bit tough for me.    Overall nice place, great staff, food is ok and a bit on the small portion side fo the price in my opinion.  Location and decor 5/5 Staff 5/5 Food 3/5 -good but lacking the quality for the price

reviews.author: Stephanie D.
reviews.description: I heard good things about this place so I dragged my family here for my birthday.  Never again. I was so embarrassed because I was the one who chose to go here.  They were out of EVERYTHING. Everything we tried to order, they didn't have it.  The server told us the "head chef" was out on vacation which is why not enough food was prepped...??  My sister got a steak - UNSEASONED - when we asked why it wasn't seasoned, they said they were out of the chutney that goes on top I went with the Cesar salad - nothing but wilted lettuce  My family wanted to pay since it was my birthday, but I couldn't let them. The experience was so bad, I insisted on paying since I obviously needed to do better research.

reviews.author: Susan S.
reviews.description: Seriously!!   What you described and what you get?  Not. The price?  Heck no. Make it at home. Seriously disappointed.  Your paying for a whole bowl of chips. HEB an avocado and a half slice of bacon for a fraction of the price at home

reviews.author: Christy V C.
reviews.description: I came here with our bridesmaid party for a lunch break during dress shopping and we had the best time! We ordered a few shareables for the table, including the Cantonese Riblets, Salt and Pepper Calamari and Carne Asada Fries. All three were delicious, but my favorite was hands down the riblets. They slid right off the bone and tasted a lot more authentic than I was initially expecting. The fries were the next runner up because you can never go wrong with fries covered in queso. For lunch, I ordered the Italian Sausage Burger. I really enjoyed it and it came with more waffle fries! I thought I'd love the sausage patty, however, I think I would have enjoyed a different protein to fill it out a little more. It was worth a try though!  The service was great here and everyone was super friendly. Parking can get a little tricky, but there's plenty of spots if you're not going at peak hours. I'm excited to stop by for dinner, when they have a lot more choices! I don't mind shareables, but I felt like the lunch menu was a little limited and nothing really stuck out to me.

reviews.author: Meagan H.
reviews.description: I had been wanting to try this place as the outside looked cute and the photos on here looked nice. However, the dinner we had tonight was not good. It seemed like the place was trying to be upscale but it was more like bar food.   When I placed my order I was told they were out of that item. The menu already isn't very big for dinner entrees so one less option made it hard to pick. I ended up getting 2 appetizers to try to make a meal.  Both were covered in so much sauce it turned my stomach. My husband and kids weren't that excited about their meals either and no one finished the meal.  My son said his  stomach was hurting from all the salt on his meal.

reviews.author: Christopher D.
reviews.description: Wow, I want to give this place 5 stars, and I hope they trend up but the food is a 3 star experience - at best.  Ambiance is perfect! Less than a block off the square in downtown Georgetown with plenty of free street parking [when Georgetown starts going to valets, I'm moving.] Lots of people walking around: this is a walking little town.  The place itself has a very expansive outside deck with even a few more street side tables - with the fans and heaters I'm betting you get 9-10 months of outside seating here.  Inside the bar is not large but it is gorgeous and there are some table tops as well as lounge seating - comfy old chairs, some Victorian love seats - its really charming and inviting. You will love the ambiance.  Service was fast, friendly and professional - I dealt with three different mixologists and not a surly one in the bunch [try finding that percentage of happy people in Austin...] and the make a wonderful drink. PS: wines on tap (they're not bad) and you have GOT to try a smoked Old Fashion (try the alder wood - its delicious smokiness in a perfect drink.]  PS: At least two rooms for private parties too if you need that holiday gathering!  Why no five stars then? Sounds great! It is great if you go for friends, drinks and good times. But unless we picked the worst entries - chicken and a burger - the food is underwhelming. My neighbor to one side also said her deviled eggs were just average. To be fair, the food was not bad, but it was not good and does not compare with other places around the square.  So; for drinks and maybe an appetizer and ambiance this has got to be on your short list. Think twice about this as a dining destination though - that may not be your best option.

reviews.author: Tracy N.
reviews.description: Awesome place to grab some delicious drinks and food! They have both indoor and outdoor patio. Our food came out in a reasonable time and the food was delicious! Really great atmosphere!  Finding parking wasn't hard, but if it's a busy night I can see how parking might be hard to find. We parked on the side street.

reviews.author: Tamie F.
reviews.description: Love this place! It's got a speakeasy feel right off the square in Georgetown! They have exclusive membership options that provide you with a locker for your special stash, so you always have your favorite spirit on hand. I know this because my little bro is a member. He's got a cool locker with some great whiskey in there, and they have a great selection as well.   There is limited seating inside so all of the seating feels exclusive! It's also just a fantastic feel inside and out. The patio is big and adorable, complete with a picture wall the screams social media opp! If I lived in Georgetown, this is where I would hang out. I will definitely make it my spot when I make it over to Gtown!   All of the food we had was interesting and tasty! The pimento app was not your grandma's pimento. It was creamy and not abrasive at all. The Brussels sprouts were so good I could have eaten a couple helpings myself! The sauce is the same for the shrimp, so I was in sweet and spicy heaven! I want more right now just writing this review. The fam enjoyed the chorizo app.   I had moved on to the smoked old fashioned by then and was completely captivated! I added a video that you should check out or just go and order one. The smoke adds to the experience AND taste! Yum. They have a small, but very good, draft selection, creative cocktail menu, and the option to drink your own spirits if you're a member. I can't say enough that I love this place!  Hunter did an amazing job as our server. He was friendly, attentive, and showed his fantastic personality.

reviews.author: Jason C.
reviews.description: I've been at this place before and I have to say that their whiskey drinks are above and beyond!  I personally prefer the good old fashion but there is a drink there for everybody's taste and if you're into spicy alcoholic drinks they do some of those just right as well!  While drinking we tried out some of their deviled eggs and I was happily impressed each one of them is for a flavor and unique although the Sriracha was my favorite!  I've had dinner here before and I can say it's worth it but for our trip we just had a couple drinks and sat on the patio which if that's all you're looking to do is completely OK this is a great place to go!!

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: I was impressed with the entire evening. It's been a while since I've been to a restaurant where I loved everything I tried and had great service! It seemed like most people visiting sat out on the patio or at the bar. We were celebrating our anniversary so we made a reservation on a weeknight, but unless you want to secure a spot outside, I don't think you'd need one.   We ordered the glazed brussel sprouts app, the carne asada fries app, and the sea bass to split. Each dish was delicious for different reasons. The glaze on the brussels was addicting, the queso on the fries was delish, and the sea bass came out piping hot with a tasty chimichurri and sauted vegetables. I would recommend every dish we tried, but my favorite was by far the brussels. We topped dinner off with the blonde brownie w/ ice cream - yyyuuummmm.   For cocktails: Our waiter suggested the Love is Blind with a spash of pineapple - tricky little drink. It tasted like candy but found out halfway in that there was definitely a good amount of liquor in it! The G'old fashioned was classic and strong.   Service was top notch. I wish I remembered his name, but he was super friendly and had great recommendations.

reviews.author: Tracy R.
reviews.description: Party of 4, Carne Asada Fries were very good. Cocktails were good! Entrees- Smashed Elk Burger-  tasty but expensive for what you get. Cowboy Tenderloin( pork tenderloin ) with a bacon jam on top. Slightly overcooked, carrots slightly undercooked. Wagyu Beef Stroganoff was best item. Very tasty. Service was adequate. My biggest complaint.... The music was so loud we could hardly converse with the people at our table.

reviews.author: Rebecca L.
reviews.description: Only place in Georgetown that is a bit more like a lounge. Something different, more city like and either you'll love it or you'll wish it stays more country. Well I like it for it's modern atmosphere. We got drunken fried and all the cocktails seems good mixes just a bit more alcohol would be nice. One star knocked off because of that and the waitresses seems slightly uppity. No one extra welcoming and excited to converse with us aside from the smiling hostess.   Will still come back since I like the environment.

reviews.author: Nikkita F.
reviews.description: Very cool vibe and spot in the middle of downtown Georgetown! They have a great covered patio and the whole restaurant is very cute.   We got the following: -  Brussel sprouts - soo good, would get again! - shisito - pretty average tasting - pecan crusted chicken - very good  - steak frites - the steak was pretty bland for me but fries were delish  - my family loved the deviled eggs

reviews.author: Ramimi T.
reviews.description: I went here for the first time last week. The host asked me if I had a reservation, I did not, but they were still able to quickly get me a table. The atmosphere is very elegant, yet chill. The low light in the building added to the overall relaxed vibe. I ordered from the morning menu; there weren't as much options as I would have liked for there to be, so I just settled for the Calamari and Waffle Fries. The food came out much faster than I expected, so I am not surprised that it was a little cold. The food was delicious though... especially the sauce that came with the Calamari! The Ranch was very good and paired well with the food! The sweet tea was average, yet still good. The price is a little much for the quality/amount of the food. I plan on going back in the evening and ordering off of the evening menu.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Date night for the wife and me. Stating off, the drinks were really good. Only downside was that we were looking forward to the cocktail flight but they don't allow on Saturday night (it's a major item on the menu - should be noted if it's only during the day).   For food, everything we had was really good. The Brussels sprouts and the fries (yes fries - you could actually taste the potato) were standouts. Lost of sauces to pair with things too. The only downer was the queso - good taste but the tostadas were a bit stale and the queso itself was a bit congealed by the time it reached the table.   Will be happy to come back - a great option for something a bit more upscale in Georgetown.

reviews.author: JP N.
reviews.description: I'll start with what The Golden Rule (TGR) got right.  The service was awesome.  Our server was very efficient and personable with great attention to detail.    The food arrived quickly and was good.    The seasoning on the waffle fries was something new.  It reminded me of Old Bay, but with a hint of brown sugar?  It actually worked well.  What needs to improve - I'm glad the window looking out onto the street is gilded with the phrase "Always a Work in Progress.." (or words to this effect) since I have some suggestions/observations.  There are three areas to improve - Seating, Selection, and Atmosphere.  First, Seating - why am I sitting on a couch using a coffee table to eat?  I'm dropping nearly two bills on a meal for three people and I'm sitting on a couch using a coffee table?  Maybe if I was just there for a drink, it would be ok.  But not to actually eat a meal.  (I'm sorry about the queso which dripped on the floor. But again - it is tough to eat queso at a coffee table.)  Also, sitting by the huge glass window feels like being in a fish bowl.. People walking down the sidewalk can stop and watch you eat.  Actually, they DO stop and watch.  It happened at least twice while we were there.   It reminded me of an old "Twilight Zone" episode. In the episode, an astronaut crashes on Mars and ends up on display in a Martian zoo.  (After he crashes, the astronaut is scared at first, but the Martians are very kind to him and give him a house to stay in.  The Martians show the astronaut the house has all the conveniences and plenty of food.  When the Martians leave, the astronaut discovers the front door is locked and the window won't open.  Later, the astronaut wakes up to find the window open, with dozens of Martians staring inside the house.  The astronaut realizes he is actually the newest exhibit in a Martian zoo, not in a real house.)  There was a sign out front, "Earthling in his native habitat"  That's what this seating felt like.   Next, Selection - the beer selection is very slim.  The beer portion on the menu was (verbatim) as follows:     "Beers on Tap         Hazy IPA        Amber        Hefe        Lager  Ask your server for featured breweries..."  I asked the server about the vague beer list:  SERVER:  "And for you, sir?" ME:          "Yes, ma'am - Do y'all have Shiner?" SERVER:  "No, sir, we just have local beers." ME:          "Awesome.  What do you have from Barking Armadillo?"   SERVER:  "Nothing.  What kind of beer are you looking for?" ME:          "Something like a Shiner?" SERVER:   "We have Brooklyn Lager." ME:          "I'll just stick with water, ma'am..."  Brooklyn? Local? Similar to Shiner?  You say you have "local" beers but yet you have nothing from the local brewery just on the other side of I-35?  As far as Brooklyn - Every so often, I find a restaurant (usually around Dallas) which lists Shiner on the "Imported Beer" portion.  I guess geography - specifically Texas geography - is not their strong point.  TGR has the opposite perspective, since apparently Brooklyn is now local to Georgetown.  Finally - Atmosphere.  It is very loud.  It wants to be trendy.  I'm not sure how to fix that.   Maybe this is why I had to sit on a couch.

reviews.author: Christina G.
reviews.description: Make a resy if you can!  Happy hour with the girls and golly, I get a total cool cat, old fashioned drinkin vibe here and I absolutely love it! Just need some live jazz and we are all set! We sat out on the patio and had drinks and apps. Our waitress was attentive and friendly.  Drinks - I had the Ontono - it is a heck ontoYES from me! Next time, I am going to try the Pissed off Machete.  Apps - pimento cheese is real good, deviled eggs are real good, and those carne asada fries are off the chain good! I see myself becoming a regular once I move to Georgetown this summer :) 10/10 recommend!

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: I was so impressed by The Golden Rule. From the decor to the atmosphere to the menu and creative bar offerings - this spot definitely takes it to the next level as far as dining in Georgetown goes. Everything on the appetizer menu was delicious - loved the deviled eggs and the steak against the grain. I really wish they offered the craft cocktail flight during dinner service as it looked really fun to try. I would absolutely recommend making a reservation to make sure you get a table. The only downside was the service could have been a little better. Several items that we ordered were forgotten and our waitress was not very friendly. However, overall I really enjoyed coming here and would love to come back to try brunch. Definitely a great option if you're looking to eat somewhere on the square.

name: Hopdoddy Burger Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Sunday

reviews.author: Bryan R.
reviews.description: We have never had one bad experience.  I love the bacon jam burger and their tenders are great as well.  You need to hit this place up!   Great food!  Service is good!!

reviews.author: Hollie L.
reviews.description: Hopdoddy is excellent food! We order here fairly regularly for delivery and have not once been disappointed. I order the classic with sweet potato fries and my husband orders the chicken sandwich and truffle fries. It's delicious.   I mistakenly called this place "HopDaddy" for over a month before my husband corrected me

reviews.author: Lauren H.
reviews.description: I LOVE(d) Hopdoddy. The Beyond Llano Poblano and parmesan fries are consistently delicious and their drinks are nice and strong. However, we went there tonight and literally NOT ONE of the staff members were wearing masks?? None of the bartenders, none of the bussers, none of the kitchen staff (!) making the food?? I didn't realize this until after I ordered my drink , so I asked for the check, chugged my drink, and ran. (Still left a nice tip- I worked in the service industry for years and would never deprive someone of that.) COVID is still very present and I'm confused as to why the hell they'd have their staff work maskless. It's not safe for the staff and it's not safe for the customers. I don't even feel comfortable ordering off Uber Eats anymore knowing that no one in the kitchen is wearing a mask.  I felt like a Karen leaving a note on the check even though it was a nice note. I just don't like to complain, but this is a safety issue I'd like to be resolved ASAP, so I can continue being a customer :(

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: We have loved coming to Hopdoddys for years.  Their burgers are the best. My  favorite is the Magic Shroom burger minus the tomatoes an lettuce.  The goat cheese makes it so creamy and the sharpness of it compliments well to the perfectly cooked burger patty.  The husband likes the Ahi Tuna burger. The ahi tuna is so fresh and all those ingredients meld together for a harmonious blend in your mouth.  Every one here is so nice and helpful and the place is always clean.  Good food, great staff keeps us coming back for more.

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: A picnic table in the shade, a tuna burger and my pup... who could ask for more!  Well, yes, of course there's the margarita, truffle fries and the best service ever!  Miss Sophia was actually assisted with her therapy dog/ service dog training by the incredible staff here. Dogs are home here!  Love this gem!

reviews.author: Lucky N.
reviews.description: Went here on Friday early evening and even though it was decently busy, there was no line. I didn't know how this place worked so I grabbed a table like normal but got kicked out by someone who was assigned that table lol now I know.   Got assigned another table and the service was fast and friendly. Got the bacon jam double and the big chuck with the bbq ranch fries. The fries were cold, unfortunately, but they were pretty decent so I assume it would have been good fresh. The burgers came out fresh though. Good taste without too much sodium. Even the sodas came out perfectly carbonated, not flat like at most restaurants.   I wouldn't call this place an infamous burger joint that I have to take my friends who visit, but I do appreciate the fresh, not overly salted burgers.

reviews.author: Edgar R.
reviews.description: Love love love hoddoddys!   Their burgers are always juicy and flavorful. You have the option of regular buns, wheat buns or bun-less (they'll place the patty and toping in a salad bowl). Their sweet potato fries are probably my favorite sweet potato fries from anywhere.   Food is generally out pretty quick (I'd say within 15-20 minutes).   There isn't really a service to review since you order at the counter and someone brings your food out. If anything maybe they can have people checking in on tables?  They also have a full bar, so if you would like am adult beverage with your food you certainly can. I'd recommend their margarita. Or you can always get their milkshakes too!

reviews.author: Kristine V.
reviews.description: Came on a Monday afternoon around 6pm and there was absolutely no line. By the time it hit 6:15, people kept flowing it! I heard hopdoddy was the best burger spot in Austin, so I had to try. Plus there was a special for $5 frozen margaritas.  Ahi Tuna Burger: Thick piece of tuna with beautiful flavor. the nori chips added a nice crunch to the mix and it was very filling.  El Bandito: I'm a mixed veggie, veggie patty type of girl and this burger was incredible. I loved the beans, corn, arugula and guacamole mix. The burger did fall apart very quickly, but still recommend this veggie option.  Hot Honey and Sage Sweet Potato Fries: A little bit on the salty end, but the hot honey with little pieces of sage was so delicious. Fries had a nice crisp to it and the portion size was decent.  Overall, hopdoddy had very quick service and good portion sizes. Will come back again!

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: The chicken burger was not very good. It's basically 2 chicken strips stuffed between some buns. I didn't feel crazy about the truffle fries this time either.   The frozen strawberry lemonade was actually really strong! And delicious. But mostly strong hahah

reviews.author: Alyssa L.
reviews.description: Tried Hop Diddy for the second time. Decided to get the same order so that I could do an accurate review. I had the El Bandito Burger (made it vegan), Hot Honey and Sage fries and a Paloma cocktail.  Burger: Both times El Bandito Burger were very salty. My group's food was salty as well! So disappointing. The food was edible, but hours later and I still have the saltiness in my my mouth.  Fries: My Hot Honey and sage fries were delicious. It salty, the heat covered it.  Cocktail: Paloma was very good and the bartender (didn't get his name) was nice.  Customer Service: stop at the register for nice. This is definitely a restaurant where you get your food, sit down, and then you are forgot about. Both times a server did not come back to check on us + we had to find someone for a need. But they seems to be the concept so I get it. And when I did speak with staff they were friendly.   Overall....we like it but due to SALT are looking forward to trying the South Congress location.

reviews.author: Melanie R.
reviews.description: Pretty high-priced for their burgers. I honestly don't see anything special about them. They come off a bit dry and basic. Onions, lettuce and bread are fresh. Not a fan of the tomatoes. Beer is pretty implied so it's a good place to go and drink and eat dry burgers if you're a tourist. Otherwise, I'd pick another place. This was my third time being here in 5 years and the quality of food hasn't changed much. Pre-covid, the staff was pretty unattentive and I had called people over a couple of times. I would say they were more attentive this time than the last two but still kind of annoying to see a bunch of them in a corner when I've been ready to go.

reviews.author: Jonathan R.
reviews.description: Thoroughly impressed with the burgers and drink selection here. Hands down the best burger in Austin. Great selection of local and national craft beers. Decent happy hour specials, I really enjoyed the comically large schooner cup/mug/chalice/blunt weapon.   Minor gripe, HVAC needs more ventilation/exhaust. When I came out of the place, my clothes smelled like stale grease. Additional minor gripe, hotter fresher oil in the fryer please as our fries were a bit soggy.

reviews.author: Stepan Y.
reviews.description: Tried it three times. Their service extremely slow, the burger smells like old overcooked burnt cooking oil. Buns of my burger overcooked.

reviews.author: Larry O.
reviews.description: When we moved to Austin 9 year ago, this place was Amazing and for years never disappointed. This was the place we brought out of town guests that wanted a unique Austin burger experience and for a burger arguably one of the best anywhere.   More recently they seem to have lost what made them special. The previous time we went there, thought was just an off night - although still pretty good and I personally enjoyed their serving of Impossible Burger.   Last night - saw more changes.. impossible burger replaced by beyond burger. Maine Root and Stubborn sodas replaced by Pepsi-Cola fare. Fresh leaf lettuce replaced with flavorless shredded lettuce. The fresh, large tomatoe slices - small and nonexistent. What used to be avocado slices now guacamole spread. I'm sure all these things save them a lot of money, but now their burgers not at all worth the money they charge. Honestly, much better burgers than we had for half the price in Austin!  No one on our family who ordered a variety of their burger offerings found enjoyment in what was previously a special treat. Now - their truffle fries and fries in general, still great as they always have been. About the only good thing I can say.   We used to stand in line to get in - glad there was no line out the door last night... and line or no line, short of hearing things change back to what made Austin original Hopdoddy tops for burgers before the cheapening - last night was our last time there. And off our list for out of town visitors.   Such a shame. This has been our family's favorite burger place for close to a decade. Now reduced to over priced fast-food fare.  2/8 Short update... appreciate the reply - did send an email on 2/1, a full week ago as requested -  zero reply to it. Alrighty.

reviews.author: Erasmo G.
reviews.description: Yes I know the one on Congress is probably the one considered the "cool" one. Hear me out tho same great food, fast service, very straight forward concept and NO wait time. Went after church with a few peeps great spot for anyone ages 7-31 . I heard about it through ordering lunch from work definitely coming back

reviews.author: Harold F.
reviews.description: A little confusing on the seating/ordering protocol but the food was amazing. Very cool decor with stylish seating that's just uncomfortable enough to insure you don't linger too long.  Our food came before we got our drink order and the whole place felt a bit chaotic. The burger was worth it though.

reviews.author: Halimah M.
reviews.description: I ate there Buffalo fries and now I have food poisoning. Be careful y'all , This sucks.

reviews.author: Michelle B.
reviews.description: We were once regular customers, eating here a couple of times a month.  Today was our first visit in more than 2 years and likely to be one of my last. I recognize the service industry is struggling, but all the things I loved about Hopdoddy's is either gone or was questionable from the visit today. Turkey option gone. Under seasoned fries, soggy bun, and they forgot my sons meal. Not the same Hopdoddy's I remember fondly.

reviews.author: H H.
reviews.description: Low quality and poor service. I tried it a couple of times but was not impressed by the food or the attitude of the servers.  Maybe another branch is doing a better job, but definitely this is not a place to go

reviews.author: Chuck L.
reviews.description: Fun joint, great burger.  Due to COVID they have some odd things going on to ensure compliance with the rules, but they are making the best of this new world.  Burgers are good, beer is cold.

reviews.author: Orlando L.
reviews.description: Had a really great time, would definitely recommend. They did a great job with the event and everything went very smoothly and the price was way better than most other services.

reviews.author: Mackenzie W.
reviews.description: I rented a party bus through this company a couple weeks ago. In the beginning, Robert was extremely accommodating and friendly. And our driver, Terrell, was great. We got dropped off at COTA for a show and had a great time!  But where it turned south was at the end of the night. I texted our driver 30 minutes before we needed to be picked up (like he requested) and he said no problem. Then we left the concert and were walking to the pickup spot where I gave him a call. He said he got in an accident but would only be 20 minutes and I said that's fine. 20 minutes roll by and I gave him a call again, no answer, but texted and said it would be another 20 minutes. We ended up waiting in the cold for almost an hour and well after most people had left COTA. Multiple people in our party ended up just taking ubers because they didn't want to wait. The whole point of a bus is so you don't have to wait.  The next day, I texted Robert saying we would like a refund for the extra hour we paid for waiting that we wouldn't have used if we had been picked up on time. He said he would call to discuss but never did. I've now sent him multiple emails - mind you, being incredibly nice about it. All I asked for was an hour refunded back - not the whole thing, not even half. But still no response.  The customer service level of this company is terrible should anything go wrong. So hire them at your own risk.

reviews.author: Neesh S.
reviews.description: Apologies for this review being so incredibly late but Austin Nites was the best! We had rented a party bus on pretty short notice to take a Bachelor Party to and from Lake Travis and Robert and team were amazing.   It was also Prom weekend so the schedule was packed for them but they still took care of us and worked with our schedule.   Our boat ended up staying out on the water longer than scheduled which through our plans all over the place and Robert was there waiting on time. Given his packed schedule, the driver did have to leave without us but Robert made sure to get me in contact with another service and they sent a bus over right away.   All in all, it was an incredible experience!

reviews.author: Snl H.
reviews.description: For $700+ for four hours we would have expected a better looking bus. Multiple dents around outside of bus. The AC barely working. Missing panels inside of bus missing or duct tape together.  Another party bus parked next to the one we had and it was so obvious how terrible looking our bus looked.   Can't believe owners would let this bus represent their company. Hope they use our $700 toward getting it fixed.   Driver was pleasant.

reviews.author: Michael H.
reviews.description: Fist off I'm hyper paranoid about drinking and driving so I usually use Uber, Lyft etc to get around town when I wanna go out and when I'm probably going to have a few drinks! But how is that supposed to work when you have a huge group? I called austin nites party rentals for a few reasons 1. I love puns and 2. I'm am austinite and 3. My group was over ten people and we wanted to go out and have nothing to worry about. Great party bus, great personable driver, great experience definitely reccomend these guys!! DONT DRINK AND DRIVE!! Call someone you can trust call Austin Nites!!

reviews.author: Charli R.
reviews.description: I'm incredibly frustrated with this business.  We had spoken a couple times in the months before I decided to book and I initially felt great about potentially booking with these friendly people.  When it came time to book I called them and was told, once again, that our requested date was open and we talked out an agreement.  The owner tells me we're good to go, and that all he needed me to do now was to send him my information so that he could get a contract sent that same day.  I'd explained to him that I was booking this bus ride to and from a party boat, and that I would be booking with them that day as well.   SO, I get off the phone and send my info.  I call my party boat folks to let them know I've just confirmed my bus, and I'm ready for a boat.  I book with them based on my discussion with these guys and put down $400 to hold our reservation.  It's been two weeks since I last spoke with this company and they have ignored my calls, texts, voicemails trying to figure out why the contract hasn't come through.  Our event is next month, and at this point I've been researching new solutions, and unfortunately the new solution means I can't use the same boat company, and therefore I've lost my $400 deposit.  I did not have this money to lose, but after being ghosted by this company I guess I have to take the loss and move on.  They seem like nice people, and it takes A LOT to get on here and write a negative review, but this has caused me a lot of stress and I want to prevent this from happening to anyone else.  I hope at some point I find out a reasonable explanation and can revise this review, but not counting on it.  We'll see I guess.

reviews.author: Horacio R.
reviews.description: BOOK WITH THIS COMPANY!  Robert did a solid job taking me and a bunch of my friends to Lake Travis and back on July 4th. His price was WAY lower than other companies I called, being the ONLY one that actually sticked to his regular prices during this busy day. He arrived early and was 100% responsive to my emails and phone calls. He arrive early to pick us up and was extremely friendly and professional. He helped us carry our coolers and accommodate everything on the bus.  The bus itself is amazing. Seats are stacked in two rows facing each other, which is great for dancing and socializing, since you are actually facing half of the crowd. The sound system is also very good. I almost feel that the bus trip was even more fun that the boat.   In summary, Austin Nites Ent. is the best on price/quality, Robert and his wife are responsive, professional and friendly, and the whole experience I had with them is positive. Would highly recommend anyone to use it, and will definitely consider using them again if I ever need to.  Thank you guys!!!!!

reviews.author: Lisa K.
reviews.description: What a great experience!  Driver was super awesome, the speakers were great and the bus was clean!!!!  We will definitely use them again!

reviews.author: Jerrod G.
reviews.description: They call you and say the bus is available and ask for a deposit over the phone.  But when we asked for a contract they go dark and won't respond. Their reviews are all their friends so not sure if this is a legitimate small business or not. There is another review on Facebook similar to our situation and she confirmed to us they went dark on her too.

reviews.author: Laura M.
reviews.description: Great experience with Austin Nites! Robert and Melissa were super helpful, accommodating, on-time (actually, early) and friendly! Would definitely use again.

reviews.author: A H.
reviews.description: I have used Austin Nites for the last 5 years and Robert the owner does not disappoint. They are punctual, courteous and very reasonably priced. We have had many fun events on the Big Blue Bus (UT games, holiday and birthday parties) and Robert always comes away with new clients. I highly recommend Austin Nites for any event that requires transporting a group. The bus ride will be the best part of your event!

reviews.author: David A.
reviews.description: I was down in austin with 19 other guys and we needed transportation for the entire night.  Robert was a great communicator before we got to austin and before he picked us up.  He was 15 minutes early, and had the bus stocked with ice, etc.  The bus was really nice, and perfect for a night out on the town.  Would definitely use this service again!

reviews.author: Emily W.
reviews.description: For my daughters birthday/last school dance we booked service with Austin Nites Party Bus.  From booking the ride up until the end of the night everything went as planned.  Our driver, Jared, was professional and so great to the girls and I during the time he drove us around.  The owners, Robert and Melissa, promptly returned my calls/texts with any questions I had before the night of the booking. The fee for the evening was wonderfully priced compared to other companies I had called around and gotten quotes from.  I highly recommend Austin Nites Party Bus based on my experience with them.

reviews.author: Sybil E.
reviews.description: We rented a party bus from Robert for my brother's 30th birthday. They were one of the only companies I found that didn't increase their rates because of prom season. I called about 10 other companies looking for fun and safe travels with almost all of them being ridiculously overpriced to take advantage of the prom goers. Robert was very accommodating, professional, and had awesome rates. He called two days before the scheduled time of arrival to check in and verify everything was still good to go. He asked if there were any changes in the amount of people and offered a bigger bus just in case. Our drivers, Patrick and Joe were awesome! Patrick called me early the day of to verify everything and let me know he'd be there at 8 and then called again when they were almost to our pickup location. They arrived right on time with an awesome bus just for us. He had coolers with ice, a flat screen tv, music system, AC and even a bathroom in the back. What more could you ask for? Part of the evening was spent at Graham's Central Station in Pville. We didn't realize prior that Graham's doesn't serve food anymore and had to order pizza to the bus. Patrick gladly retrieved our pizza and brought it to us when it arrived. We all had a blast, felt safe and were taken care of. Highly recommend Austin NItes and shout out to Patty PartyWagon, if you had a Yelp page, I'd write a review for you too.

reviews.author: Ryan W.
reviews.description: WARNING: We had a tight deadline to get to Lake Travis and the bus driver was 30 minutes late.  We had to take another bus or risk missing our charter.  He verbally offered to refund my money for his tardiness and then kept my funds and would not return them.  Now I am fighting to get those funds back.  LOOK ELSEWHERE.

reviews.author: Kalena B.
reviews.description: This tour was amazing! I went with a bachelorette party and we had a lot of fun. Our tour guide was Brandon and he made sure that we were great. We got to play our own music on the ride from Austin and he picked amazing Texas barbecue for our lunch. Every winery we went to was delicious. I would highly recommend it to anyone!

reviews.author: Courtney H.
reviews.description: We had a great experience! We booked on short notice, but had a great time, and Brandon was very accommodating of our last minute trip. Come hungry on your tour because the barbecue lunch provided was spectacular! We were appreciative that Brandon was flexible with our tour schedule and ensured that we had a phenomenal time while on our tour! The tour had a nice mix of small, quaint wineries with an individualized experience, as well as more popular spots with an equally enjoyable guest experience.

reviews.author: Amir S.
reviews.description: Mark and the rest of the BJs staff tonight 3/14/22 (pie day) far exceeded my expectations. I mean wow the food and service was top notch. Food came out rather quickly which was a extra plus.   Large bjs favorite pizza Ribs and tri tip combo  House salad ranch  Tomato basil salad  Bjs Jeremiah red beer  All excellent!

reviews.author: Tangela C.
reviews.description: This was my first time at this location. I didn't realize how expensive BJ's is. Customer service is good. It wasn't busy when I went on a Friday night. I was seated quickly and my server was nice and helpful. I ordered the ribs and chicken meal along with garlic knots bread. My meal came out fairly quickly. The ribs were tender and the chicken was well seasoned. I will return because I enjoyed my food!

reviews.author: Eva W.
reviews.description: Pretty solid place. We usually just get appetizers and small plates here. My first time ordering the chicken thighs instead of wings, chose the lemon pepper sesame dry rub, and wow it was good! Super crispy on the outside and juicy inside. They were perfect!

reviews.author: Jarvis H.
reviews.description: The food is good and the atmosphere is nice. The waiters are all very helpful and patient! We had a party of 10 for a birthday and they took their time to make sure we are satisfied.

reviews.author: Alfredo F.
reviews.description: We had a bad experience today. We seat down at a booth in the bar as usual since there were two open booths but we were walked out by an employee who I did not recognized. He was  stating it requires a reservation. We are regulars and we always tip well so we felt very offended and came to chillis were they made us feel welcome. We usually dont have a problem at bjs but this was not a good experience.

reviews.author: Eric H.
reviews.description: Wow... we just went there at 1pm on a Thursday. Their bar was halfway filled and there were two groups in the dinning. They said five minutes for them to clean a table. We waited 15 and left. They didn't check in or anything. And there were about 50 open tables.   The group of three behind us was given a 40 minute wait for seating... what in the world is going on with this establishment. Disappointing. Being under staff is one thing, being non attentive and rude is another.

reviews.author: General Z.
reviews.description: God seated down right instantly Chips and Guacamole are good sweet tea came out nice environments lovely lighting not too bright just right. Customer service is nice and good helpful

reviews.author: Amber B.
reviews.description: Friendly staff on a busy night. Booked reservations through open table due to the fact that if they are at capacity the wait is usually long. Seated right away with paper menu for drinks and QR code for main menu. BJ's in general has changed some of the menu items after COVID (chicken chimichurri is no longer available, a go to) but still a lot to choose from. Pizookies is always a must get when dinning.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: You can never go wrong with a BJ's.  Stopped in here for a late lunch with some out of town guests.  We were looking for a cold beer and a good meal.  BJ's as always delivered on both.  Our waitress was very friendly and the restaurant was clean.  I had the chicken tacos, and they were very tasty.  Some of the other dishes at the table were parmesan encrusted chicken and broccoli and burgers.  The broccoli was super disappointing and had no flavor not even salt.  Overall it was  a good experience and a solid go to.

reviews.author: Lien N.
reviews.description: The service was excellent. We got seated right away and our waiter was very attentive! He got our drinks and food out fast on a Friday night. The ribeye was very juicy and tender, but the prime rib was too chewy and fatty. I highly recommend the couscous mac and cheese!

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: Okay so I came to this BJ's on the 29th of December after coming from the symphony with my little one and another party.   Act One: When we arrived, after being seated, we were greeted by our server. I ordered a glass of vino from the bar. When the vino arrived, it tasted like the glass that was poured was from a bottle that had already been corked and sitting out. While I understand that a restaurant is not a wine bar serving blends such as a 2007 Klein Constantia Vin de Constance, I do expect the mid-level glasses of Cabernet Sauvignon served to be palatable. Accordingly, I asked the wine be returned to the bartender as it tasted turned. When the waitress returned the glass to the bartender noting my comments about the glass coming from a bottle that seemed to have been opened/turned, he laughed as if I was being ridiculous.   Act Two:  Moving past this debacle, I ordered something else from the bar. My party and I also ordered nachos and mozzarella sticks.  The mozzarella sticks that were brought out to the table were COLD! The nachos were okay but clearly not traditional nachos, but that was not expected from this type of establishment.   The presentation of the check:  The turned wine was still on the check when it was presented to me. I asked that it be removed. When the waitress did come back with the revised check, it wasn't an itemized revision, thus I could not determine if the bill was indeed correct. I did not want to wait for the waitress to return again with an itemized bill as the rest of the visit here was less than stellar. Therefore, I paid the bill as it was and quickly left.

reviews.author: Cassie M.
reviews.description: All of our food was brought out at room temperature. The ingredients used were clearly not fresh. All of the veggies were past their prime. The drinks we ordered (mules) were terrible. We couldn't taste any ginger beer and we were given one wrong one. They were out of the majority of their appetizers. Lastly, it was freezing outside this day and also inside. Our poor child was shivering. We will not be returning.

reviews.author: Salim P.
reviews.description: Our family in Austin for reason known to them like this restaurant. Huge location and plenty of seats and many screens with sports on the Saturday we went.   Out of the group of 10 of us 1 was vegans and 2 vegetarian. Decent Vegetarian choices but next to nothing vegan choice and the server also not confident out the vegetarian choices which are or can be made vegan.   Did get seated properly and food did arrive fairly soon. The service attentive. The food - the vegetarian pizza and baked Ziti pasta dish were good. The Peruvian Quinoa Bowl was classified as vegetarian but could not get a clear answer if it was vegan as all the questions we asked came as negative. So the menu is not perhaps classified correctly. Even the Guacamole and Chips were not classified as vegetarian!

reviews.author: Jesse W.
reviews.description: The service here has gone way downhill lately. They constantly have a wait and yet there are only 5 or 6 tables seated in the entire place. What kind of policy is that? The servers can't possibly agree... More tables means more money, and they sure don't look busy.

reviews.author: Yordan V.
reviews.description: I've been here before, after like the 3-4 visit I noticed the change in service. Came here with my wife to enjoy a nice meal. Sat there for 20+ minutes without anyone bothering to assist. Sadly you've lost a costumer.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: I had been to a BJ's before in New York and found my experience here to be much more in line with a Cheesecake Factory type restaurant than before which was more like a sports bar. The menu here is long enough that you could stare at it for hours on end and not feel confident in your order. Most of the dishes have enormous portions, with one notable exceptions, and the desserts are over the top.   My group started with the honey sriracha Brussels sprouts and the nachos. Knowing a few pizookies were coming later, I passed on the nachos. The Brussels sprout were cooked to a nice consistency where there was slight crunch. The flavor was good, but it was much closer to buttery than honey sriracha.   For my entree I had the shrimp quinoa bowl, which was the only dish to come out where i wished the portion was a bit bigger. It ridiculously small, but it was smaller than you'd get at a fast casual bowl place for about 1.5x the price. Unfortunately it also paled in comparison to most fast casual bowl places in terms of flavor. Any bite I had that wasn't covered in the hot sauce I asked for on the side was a disappointment compared to the ones that were.   By far the best part of the meal were the pizookies. For those unfamiliar (including me before this meal) a pizookie is a warm cookie in a small deep dish pizza plate with a scoop or two of ice cream on top. It is as incredible as it sounds and they have upwards of 10 different kinds. If you're with a large group I recommend sharing a few and immediately slipping into a food coma.   Overall, nothing too special, but for 3$ pizookies on Tuesday you can't go wrong.

reviews.author: Craig C.
reviews.description: We went to lunch last week at BJs and it was great we arrived when it opened so plenty of seating. It was clean well lit and our servers were prompt friendly and helpful. We never had to ask for any. Two of us had the chicken lunch and it was great.  The perfect amount well seasoned and good presentation, I definitely recommend it.  The chicken was lemon thyme and it was wonderful I will get it again for sure. I know allot of people are apprehensive about going out to restaurants, support them even if you get it to go.

reviews.author: Brenda W.
reviews.description: Wow. So much for family friendly. We came in, took the hostess forever to ask us how many, since she had her back to the door... Told her we were 7. She went back and forth looking around. Finally came back and said she had no tables for 7 so we could wait 30 to 45 min for the nite servers to arrive.  WHAT?! NO offer to split the table, no offer to clean a table where 6 had just left. We said we'd have to go elsewhere and we were sorry, but they were losing 7 covers. Her response? YEAH, THAT'S FINE WITH ME, WHATEVER. Never looked up from her cell phone either. No wonder you need help. What you have there now doesn't qualify as help. Bad service, won't go back. Too many other places with decent front end staff that actually want the business.

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Disappointing service at this location. BJ's are a chain but are usually good at least the ones I've been to, but this one not so much. I walked-in and went to the bar area to sit myself. I sat at a table in the bar area and wasn't served. This guy working that area at completely ignored me and proceeded to serve everyone else who came in after me and sat themselves. I eventually had to get up and leave. I ended up at Yard House which had plenty of options and even a great steak. I was treated very well and promptly. I now know where to go and not go in my neighborhood in Austin. Again, who doesn't serve a customer?! I mean, I understand getting annoyed with your job but when you start denying service based on appearances maybe it's time to move on.   Maybe you'll have a better experience but be prepared to wait or even not be served.

reviews.author: Philip C.
reviews.description: So I am starting a whole new set of reviews based on TO GO services. This whole Covid19 thing has limited dining..but it should not limit quality.   I was grateful for BJs being open later than most other restaurants. However I was greatly disturbed by some of the I consistences. The most important problem I had was Frozen Chicken/super cold chicken. I ordered a chicken over rice pilaf dish, and the chicken was stone cold ( must have been ore frozen) after a long night I didn't feel like complaining since the other food was edible.  I specifically asked for no spicy items or spices on my sides , my veggies were laced with a spicy seasoning I can not identify.   The ribs were cooked well not great but he'll for this pandemic I'll take it.   I am giving this place a 3 (should be a two ) only because the person who helped me was so nice and accommodating, and everything was clean, and peaceful.   Support them but do complain if something is incorrect. I realized that as a supportive customer in a pandemic, the we shouldn't accept a lower quality of food.

name: Pluckers Wing Bar - Research
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Mari G.
reviews.description: Always great food! We love coming to pluckers. Fast service and nice environment. Love it!

reviews.author: Caitlin B.
reviews.description: Long story short if you order a to go order, even if you are in the store and order Togo at the bar, it will take almost an hour to get it out because they "prioritize in-store dining over to go orders ". I watched multiple people around me get food that they had ordered almost 30 minutes after I had sat down that could've just been my order and sent me on my way.   AND ALL OF OUR FOOD IS COLD.

reviews.author: Tom M.
reviews.description: They ALWAYS forget the ranch on to-go orders. I mean ALWAYS. Even if you pay for an extra one or larger one. Doesn't matter if it's from a delivery service or if you pick it up yourself.   It's fucking hot wings - the ranch is important.   I know you're busy, but I'd rather you just refuse my order than leave out the ranch every time.

reviews.author: Jasmine M.
reviews.description: The wait  for the food was 30 minutes I thought I was in for a treat! Eeeeeextremely disappointing   Togo workers were super sweet , but the kitchen is in the back bull Corning around .   I'm going to call tomorrow because it's too late to call to try to get a refund but that's why I'm making this post because Im that disappointed

reviews.author: Ivan C.
reviews.description: Bad management  Not even staff members to run a non so crowed restaurant.  Waiting list for a reason and still make you wait another 45 min due to poor management.

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: Great wing flavors. Service is a little slow but I'm just glad they are open.  I always get the maple chipotle and garlic parm wings with fries and I've never been disappointed

reviews.author: Raquel O.
reviews.description: I LOVE pluckers but we don't have one where I live in Abilene. Anytime I go somewhere with a Pluckers I HAVE to go and this experience was no less than what I expected! I ordered my go-to: all bone-in- 5 manganero and 5 spicy lemon pepper with spicy ranch waffle fries. DELICIOUS! Ah my mouth is watering all over again looking at the photo. Lol our server was prompt and we got our food quickly and it was fresh. This was my first time visiting this location and will be returning!

reviews.author: Paula P.
reviews.description: Long waits, ok service and ok food. Definitely not worth it anymore. Everyone is short staffed but if you have two hours to wait, you can probably go to Waco and get wings there somewhere instead of sitting around and sitting for the most alrighest of alright things

reviews.author: Axel B.
reviews.description: Not a well ran pluckers. Every time I order to go not only does it take forever but my food is always cold and stale by the time it gets to me. Won't be ordering from this location again.

reviews.author: Johnathan E.
reviews.description: We waited for 20 minutes at a table and no one came to take our order, say hello, bring waters, or even check to see if we existed.   I love the Oak Hill location - the food is great and service fantastic but this location was a bad experience. I truly can't even rate the food or the service because we had none of the first and an absence of the second.   If you cannot handle the volume of customers from being short staffed I understand, but I do not understand operating at full capacity with half staff.

reviews.author: Alberto L.
reviews.description: Waited for my food more then 1 hour, other people next to me got here before me eat and left and I still haven't had my food. Poor, poor customer service. Will never come back here again. Manager no where to be found !!

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: I love pluckers! I go there all the time, I really really really enjoy it and I love it too.

reviews.author: Deloris P.
reviews.description: I have been to every Pluckers in Austin, TX and the one in Baton Rouge, LA. My favorite wing place. My favorite place for fried pickles. I think I've tried every flavor onthe menu at some point, including fire in the hole. If your a newbie get the wing platter...20 wings and can get 4 different flavors without being charged extra. It isn't on the menu, it used to be, but hasn't been for years, but they still offer it if you ask. Another favorite is the Philly cheesesteak. I have them toss it in the sauce before adding it to my sandwich. They will do it, but only if you ask. Their loaded waffle fries are great, but I like their chips just as much, if not more. We have traveled 2 to 3 hours one way just to eat there. We enjoy it that much.

reviews.author: Nicole D.
reviews.description: Waited on their app line for 2 hours... when we finally reached next in line we waited for another hour while we watched them seat walk-ins before us. There were empty tables sitting all over the restaurant most of this time.

reviews.author: Jesus M.
reviews.description: One of the worst experiences ever. Server only came twice within a 1hr time span. And for them to drop our food as well ridiculous. 0 stars

reviews.author: Andrea B.
reviews.description: I'm giving the second star just because the server was nice and the salad was decent. Other than that, not sure if I would recommend this place. We were quoted 30 min wait for a table. We waited over an hour and when we checked with the staff, a red haired hostess sarcastically offered us to remove us from the waitlist as the solution to our problem!!  The kid at the front door kept saying he didn't know which party was next on line. Very sad. I'm the mean time I witness how some staff members wear gloves but the majority didn't (including our server). The tables did get sanitized but not the chairs that everyone's has to touch to be able to sit ... the door handles were not wiped once in the hour, we were waiting outside for our table. Food was average. Came back to my hotel room sticking to grease, yikes.

reviews.author: Edward W.
reviews.description: Pluckers has always been one of my favorites in Austin. However, if you are looking for good service, I would definitely go somewhere else. The wait times are usually very inaccurate and this time was no different, when my party and I were were quoted a 30 minutes wait that turned into an hour. However, the stars are for the food. The holy mac and fried pickles are my absolute favorite appetizers here and are must gets. Because of the temporary price increase on wings, I went with the boneless basket with my chicken go-to flavors of baker's gold (spicy) and goldrush (sweet, not spicy) and my fries tossed in spicy garlic parmesan. Food was great and was enough for me to have leftovers afterwards despite me eating quite a bit compared to the average human.

reviews.author: Ericka C.
reviews.description: I really enjoy this location, the employees are very friendly. The lady who attended us yesterday during a busy game was very nice and she got everything correct with the order and the food got out fast for how full it was. I come with friends and we never see a problem with the service or food it never disappoints. I recommend getting on the wait list if your super hungry since it's always packed.

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: Service is REALLY SLOW and food has gone down at this location! Lincoln location is so much better...

reviews.author: Serena C.
reviews.description: I want to give zero stars but That's not an option.  I caught this on video of roaches crawling from my meal, I am so disgusted I have chills going throughout my body! When I spoke to Chelsea (manager) I assumed she would take the meals off because ROACHES.  No she told me she couldn't take anything off.  Well I didn't accept that, so I spoke with Matt and he was able to accommodate.  I don't think I ever want to come back, I think Chelsea was horrible and not trained correctly. I am so upset w the service we got.  I cannot believe this just happened.

reviews.author: Travis C.
reviews.description: Total Wine is easily the best place to shop for spirits! Big variety! Great Prices! Knowledgeable staff. The works! Definitely the place I go to when I'm looking for something rare or just a browse to find something new. Never a dull moment.

reviews.author: Chantel C.
reviews.description: I do NOT recommend coming to this location, unless it's the only place that carries something you're looking for. Today 02/21/2022 at 4:40 PM, I came here because they were the only place I could find that was close to me that was carrying the new truly margarita variety pack. As soon as I walked in there was I would assume a manager because he was dressed in a white collar shirt(other employees had black shirts) He was older Hispanic male with white hair. Anyways we walked right past each other and he did not say a single word to me. Not a "Hey, hi, hello how are you doing" nothing. It literally takes five seconds to say "welcome" or anything for that matter. I've worked in customer my whole life and I'd never ever think it would be okay to ignore a PAYING customer after making eye contact. I NEVER leave reviews unless it's POSITIVE. But nope, not today JR!   And if by chance your the one who reads this I was the tatted up Hispanic girl with the pretty pink sparkly mask

reviews.author: Tiff B.
reviews.description: Ive been accosted several times by low life cashiers that seem to get a kick out of it. When I spoke to management they were adamant that their behavior was inappropriate. Everytime I go in there, there is at least a dozen workers doing nothing and then the shelves will be bare. God forbid you need something on a holiday that falls on the weekend because nothing will be stocked and 2 registers will be open with lines out the door. Meanwhile the workers leave registers unattended and stand around playing grab ass all day. Today I had the pleasure of the same rude cashier and when I asked for management I was escorted out by 2 of them insinuating that IM THE PROBLEM when I have spent more than enough money at their establishment.  I have complained several times and they dont care. I don't plan on going back anytime soon. Want some advice? Fire about half of your employees, put a quarter of em on the cashiers and make the other ones stock the damn shelves.

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: The best place to get that special grown folks drink. The request of Hennessy VSOP came back with a successful win as we patiently waited to see if the kind staff had a bottle in stock!

reviews.author: Dave B.
reviews.description: 2nd time here, 1st time during xmas rush, everybody was crazy busy then but very nice, this time looking for a certain wine and something else, employee told me where the wine was and also where i could find the other item at another store, then tracked me down to give me the other store's name, great customer service, thanks!

reviews.author: Nicole F.
reviews.description: Excellent customer service during the COVID-19 pandemic!   I've never purchased alcohol here before, but we were running critically low on supplies during the stay-at-home orders. A friend told me they had curbside at Total Wine and More. I called to confirm there was the ability to have contactless curbside pick up and the person I spoke with was very nice on the phone (even though I assume they are getting an annoying amount of calls during this time).   Placing my order online was extremely easy. The UI was intuitive and was not confusing at all. There were a few points where they reminded you not to pick up your order until you received an email (or text if you opt in) to pick up your order. I appreciated the multiple points of clarity.   Both times we have ordered (once on a Saturday and once on a Thursday), our order was ready within the hour!  Pick up was easy. All you have to do is pull up to the marked, designated spots and send a text to the number on the sign. You have to provide your spot number and name. Once they come out, just hold your ID up to the window. Then they will place your order in your trunk. Easy peasy!   Definitely give this place a try if you're looking for contactless curbside!

reviews.author: Madison B.
reviews.description: They are always fully stocked! I got exactly what I needed and staff's friendly! Clean environment and good service.   Check out my OnlyFans  https://onlyfans.com/itsmattymay

reviews.author: J B.
reviews.description: The order was to come between 6pm and 7pm and there was a big storm. I called the driver and they said they would reattempt delivery because the storm had cleared. I called the store and they said they would reattempt delivery that night with another driver.
