reviews.description: The wife and I visited Georgetown Winery for our second tasting of the day on the square. After a more upscale experience in a different tasting room on the square, it was pleasant to ease into this more relaxed space. We were promptly greeted by the hostess, who became our server, and perused the menu of wines. $10 each for a sampling of 4 wines. Nice price, and fitting to the setting which would have been appropriate for beer as well. Neither of us remembers which wines we ordered, except for my two port samplings, but neither of us was overly impressed either. My ports were good, if extremely sweet and fruity, and the wife liked 2 of hers. She was disappointed in her first choice, which was the most expensive wine on the menu as priced by the bottle.  We didn't buy a bottle, nor would we return if we ever visit Georgetown again, but the ambience and carefree environment did add to an overall relaxing day on the square.

reviews.author: Angela P.
reviews.description: I love the ambience. Had a glass of cabernet Sauvignon and walked around. The shop is quaint and the service outstanding. In addition to tasty wines, they sell fabulous trinkets. I can't remember the last time I laughed so hard!  I took photos of the towels and signs that made me laugh. Check them out. BTW, I'll be back.

reviews.author: Nicole E.
reviews.description: Nice chilled laidback spot for a spot or two to wine tasting. Room and tables to seat 1 at the bar to larger groups in the back. Lots of fun wine related plaques, signs, wine toppers, shelves full of bottles and every imaginable gift item for wine lovers. Nice indoor garden feel from the string lights lining above your head. Very rustic and cozy feel with all of the wood from wall to wall shelves to tables and chairs and floors. They serve wine in plastic cups. In the back there are olive oils to try out.

reviews.author: Julia G.
reviews.description: Georgetown Winery is an adorable little handout in the heart of Georgetown. This is a great spot for a date night, girls night, or just an afternoon with a small group of friends or family. The actual vineyard is located in Rockdale Texas- this is just a small tasting room right on the Georgetown Square.   For $10, you can taste 4 wines. My spouse also got 4 tasting, so in total- I got to sample 8 wines. My favorite was the Big Tex which is aged for 9 months in oak. A full bottle will set you back only $24. Create price for the quality.  I also love their Viognier, I love white wines- and this was so light. I would casually sip this on any warm summer day. One thing I didn't love their fruity wines. The Blueberry and Blackberry wines tasted like they used artificial flavoring. The couple next to use was absolutely loving the blackberry, so maybe it just wasn't for me. Totally fair.   They also have cheese and crackers available. I feel like any wine tasting isn't complete without a good cheese plate. Unfortunately, we had dinner plans right after, so I enjoyed my wine cheese-free.   I absolutely plan on coming back here soon for some wine + cheese.

reviews.author: Denis A.
reviews.description: Laurie and Heather were wonderful today! Even in quarantine, they managed to provide a wonderful (socially distanced) experience. We are wine club members and LOVE this place ($50 per quarter gets you 2 tastings, 6 full glasses, and 2 whole bottles of wine). The perfect spot to enjoy some quality wine and some quality time with friends and family. We always bring cards or a board game and have a blast.

reviews.author: Bonnie G.
reviews.description: Went here on day trip on our way to Austin. Stopped into the winery and the two ladies were not helpful. We had to ask all the questions about the winery and their response was short and curt. We we the only people in the winery and yet they felt as if it was an inconvenience to talk to us. Will not return. Will continue to visit  the other Georgetown in South Carolina where people are more welcoming to all.

reviews.author: Joey G.
reviews.description: We are club members, and we love going to get our wines. The peach wine is amazing. They also have a lot of very good reds. We love all the little knickknacks in the store also.

reviews.author: Littledebbie9959 N.
reviews.description: This winery is awesome! Friendly ladies, very personable, you feel like they're your friend and they are!  Prices are more than reasonable and membership even better! They observe the rules over and beyond! Owners are great! The music is wonderful!

reviews.author: Erin T.
reviews.description: The best winery for friends.  My friends and I have only been members of this winery for about a year, but this is honestly one of our favorite locations to consistently come and visit when we're all together. They have sweeter drinks and wineritas for people who aren't fond of dry wines and their wine club memberships are literally built to be shared. There is table seating inside where you can sit for hours and catch up. Laurie and Heather in particular are so sweet with their service and their recommendations. I can't think of where else I would rather spend my weekend.

reviews.author: Kristen V.
reviews.description: This is the perfect meet up spot with your girlfriends. That's not to say that I don't see plenty of men in here, too. It's a great spot for day drinking. Any day of the week. And I know from experience.   I don't bother doing the tastings here - I know exactly what I like. Their unoaked chardonnay is butter and smooth. After that I move over to their pinot noir - which isn't too sweet but not so dry that I need to carry in my own water bottle. I do not drink fruit wines but my sweet lil granny does and she swears by the pomegranate and blueberry.   You can buy gifts and chochskies here. I always like to pick up a few bottles of wine before I had home to visit family. Their wine club is probably the best you can be apart of in terms of benefits.   I would really like if they would provide bread so that we can try the olive oils. Probably smart that they don't do that or else all of us winos would use that as food. :)

reviews.author: Kimberly G.
reviews.description: My favorite winery!  I feel like family every time I walk in the door.  Chelsea and Lori give the absolute best service, and I love bringing friends in to try their wine.  Chelsea and Lori can describe every wine and recommend tastings, glass, or a bottle.  Always a fun time at Georgetown Winery!  Thank you for making my family, friends, and me feel so special.

reviews.author: Roxanne T.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a second visit during a crowded weekend event, and thoroughly enjoyed both the service and our wine-tasting. My partner liked two of the reds so much she bought a bottle of each.  This is a long narrow shop that has lots of knick-knack items displayed so we did not move around much, but it was fun to read all the funny quotes on the signs and towels and glasses, etc. The folks at the bar were helpful and friendly, and we enjoyed this visit much more than our first.

reviews.author: Becky K.
reviews.description: This review is for the tasting room in Georgetown Square. The location closes at 6 and wine tastings end at 5:30. The room is quaint with many cork decorations and tables made from wine barrels. There is a good selections of whites as well as reds. My favorite was the peach wine. Staff was knowledgeable and friendly.

reviews.author: Vincent W.
reviews.description: Fantastic tasting room with some good Texas wines.    The reds here standout!  Service is always excellent, fast and friendly.

reviews.author: Kris M.
reviews.description: Based on the other one star reviews here, I am not the only one with this experience, but the workers here are extremely rude and very pretentious. When I visited Fredericksburg, I went to multiple wineries and this was BY FAR the worst. The employees have no manners, and don't treat you well regardless of your membership status. My friends and I felt uncomfortable and judged the entire time we were there. Overall, there are much better wineries in the area with much nicer staff and better wine. Don't waste your time or money when there are other amazing options less than a mile away

reviews.author: Natalia R.
reviews.description: Covid review 12/2020 No seating for non-members and I suppose no kindness for them either. I went to the front and was rudely "greeted". We left because why would I purchase wine from someone who seems to treat me without professionalism since I'm not a member? Hmm not a way to acquire new members!

reviews.author: Holly S.
reviews.description: We did the wine tasting which was way over priced $30 for only 4 tastes. I felt ripped off. I'm from CA and Temecula wine tastings are $20-25. Go down the street within walking distance to Georgetown winery. The glasses were $8-10 with much better service.

reviews.author: Cora W.
reviews.description: Good wines. Wine club is good - we get the mixed wines. Always get a glass when we come. There's an upstairs member lounge and an outdoor patio. Small selection of food. Service is always with a smile.

reviews.author: Gary G.
reviews.description: Classy space, nice location and excellent wine.  Had the distinct pleasure of being served by waitress Jennie Tedesco while drinking an excellent red wine blend.  Jennie's ability to know exactly what we wanted before we did was truly enjoyable and her knowledge of wine and friendly professionalism made for a great Saturday outing.  Have been to both the Grape Creek Vineyards near Fredericksburg and to the Georgetown tasting room.  Each are excellent, but the Georgetown location with its wonderful staff are the reason we keep our coming back.

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: This was an amazing experience. The food was just as good as the wine !! The pizzas were amazing. The charcuterie board was to die for, meatballs were okay, and garlic hummus was a winner.

reviews.author: William B.
reviews.description: Conveniently located on the Georgetown Square, Grape Creek Vineyards tasting room is a welcoming oasis of great wines and friendly "tasting ambassadors". You know Grape Creek's wine is good: they earned almost 2 dozen medals, including three Double Golds, this year at the prestigious San Francisco Wine Competition. And their wins encompass all styles, with Double Gold wins for red, white and Port. My Tasting Ambassador, Sandy, was exceptional! As we talked, she discerned my tastes and made a couple of recommendations that turned out to be spot on. She was knowledgeable and responsive, and a delight to talk with. Having been to many tasting rooms and wineries in the Texas Hill Country as well as from the California wine regions to the New York Finger Lakes, my experience at Grape Creek exceeded my expectations. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Angela P.
reviews.description: This was the second stop during my Saturday night wine bender. I've never been here before. My friend is a wine club member and invited us to accompany her and her significant other to a tasting. We ended up enjoying a bottle! It was delicious. We sat in the reserved section on the second floor and finished the bottle and relaxed. Grape Creek has a nice selection of local wines to choose. Although the facility is small, the atmosphere is friendly and quaint.

reviews.author: Phillip H.
reviews.description: These guys are extremely rude. We all purchased memberships and wanted to enjoy our wine on the patio which was mostly empty. Since they made us split up our party of six we got two tables that were close together. Apparently management had a problem with my girlfriend and I orienting our chairs towards our friends table so we could all talk to each other and came and got in our faces to tell us we have to turn our chairs around and face forward. What is this kindergarten? The wine was alright, but definitely not good enough to justify the $40 per bottle price tag. I've found better bottles at HEB for under $20. Don't waste your time or money. There are plenty of other wineries in the area of the same quality that are more affordable and less rude

reviews.author: Erica G.
reviews.description: Grape Creek is my official go to for Georgetown vino. After signing up in Fredericksburg, I've quickly come to LOVE their red wines...particularly Bellisimo. It is absolutely delish and my go to red for my collection and for gifting to friends.   While the main building itself is somewhat small and doesnt offer the option to sit downstairs (GC....this is overdue), there is a members only room available upstaird with views of the Gtown Square.  The patio however is the reason people gravitate towards this winery. There is live music, nice fans to keep you cool in summer and heaters for the winter.  My only dislike is the changes hours...it closes at 6:30. Far too early and down the street are alternatives that stay open til 9 or later.

reviews.author: Shelley F.
reviews.description: Visited during a recent trip and was delighted.  EVE WAS AMAZING - she explained things so well on our tasting!

reviews.author: J. S.
reviews.description: Could not love this winery more. Although... standing in line when you first walk-in did seem a bit off, it was merely just a way to help usher traffic through more efficiently. Luckily, the line went quickly or this would probably be a different type of review, as someone * wink wink* who doesn't do well with lines for absolutely anything, except that one Prince concert 30 years ago.   Needless to say, we came, we tasted, we joined the wine club and now we are big fans. Especially of their Rose of Malbec. That deliciously tasting watermelon jolly rancher (without the sugar) wine has changed wine drinking for me and completely justifies the $30 price tag.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Fantastic service and wonderful atmosphere. This place does it right. It is very comfortable, the staff is welcoming and just an overall great place to spend some time and relax on the square in Georgetown. Whether in the members only room upstairs or out on the private patio, this is a very nice place.

reviews.author: Russ V.
reviews.description: Good wine, fun old/down town feels, great staff, what more do you want? We signed up for the membership cuz yum!

reviews.author: Emily M.
reviews.description: I'm really unsure what to say about this place. I've only been here a couple of times and the staff member that helped us was amazing. I decided to join the wine club because of her level of service. However, it's hard to get a hold of someone on the phone. I have a simple question to ask but no one will ever pick up the phone. When select the button to speak to the tasting room, their automated service starts all over again. Yes, I can email, but for a simple question, picking up the phone should be an easy option as well.  Also, the times on yelp versus their times on the phone are inconsistent. That needs to be updated.  Bottomline, they lack communication.  It's really annoying and frustrating. I plan on canceling my wine club membership and going elsewhere due to the experience that I've had.

reviews.author: Kenneth B.
reviews.description: This winery is smack downtown Georgetown and has a really great feel. It has a great assortment of wine that is reasonably priced. I really like this winery, with the exclusive access to seating upstairs. I love the live entertainment outside lounge area. I really like this winery! I also like how EVERY time you come to the winery, you get a complimentary glass of wine! Of course, you need a membership.  I don't live in the area so I have a trek to make to receive my complimentary glass of wine for me and a guest. However, when I am in the area you better believe I am here. I just started my membership last visit but failed to write a review after a couple of bottles. My apologies. I was informed that my three bottles qill be mailed to my residence in Harker Heights, Texas. I will be sure to post how that goes. You can cancel the membership at anytime. More to follow after I really get a chance to experience this establishment.

reviews.author: Kami S.
reviews.description: We were sharing a couple bottles on the patio (my friend is a member) when an employee (who was drinking a glass of wine herself) came out and told us extremely rudely that they were closed and we needed to get out. She started jerking things away from the table while we were still sitting there. We had previously been sitting there calmly, not being loud or offensive in any way - it felt very abrupt and extremely rude. We realized after we were booted out that closing was at 5 and this intrusion happened at 5:10, it wasn't like they were waiting on us for an hour. Even though my friend is a member we won't be coming back.

reviews.author: Joey G.
reviews.description: We bought our membership in Fredericksburg, but we live in Round Rock. When you join the club, you get two glasses a day, and we are regulars at the Georgetown square. Everyone there is very friendly. We do miss the live music in the back. But it's nice to grab our glasses and sit on the square.

reviews.author: Pamela M.
reviews.description: Grape Creek Vineyards is about 2 miles from my best friend's house in downtown Georgetown. We had so much fun there!  My sorority sisters came to Georgetown for Austin's ACL Fest and added on extra days to sightsee.   Grape Creek was a wonderful respite.  You stand in line, describe your likes to the salesperson, and taste. Then, you get wine by the glass (I think it was 10$/glass) to enjoy on their relaxing patio, and bottles to go.   My BF is a frequent member and has a card to get 2 free glasses of wine a month.   A very nice spot to relax and enjoy good wine and good conversation.   Thank you Grape Creek Vineyards!

reviews.author: Nicole W.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine was a fun experience for my husband and I. As I was reading some of the other reviews, I learned that you could make your own wine. I called ahead to see if there were any open appointments on a Friday afternoon and Jenny answered. She has a very fun, bubbly personality and told us to swing by anytime. We were able to taste several different wines before we decided what we wanted to make. We spent about 1-1.5 hours there. We look forward to designing our own wine bottle labels and returning in 6-8 weeks to bottle the wine.

reviews.author: Jen B.
reviews.description: Absolutely love this place. The owner, Jenny, is the best. She's fun, friendly, thoughtful. All the staff are wonderful.   I've made many batches of wine here. The wine making process is really fun from tasting and selecting the wine you want, to making it and, the  funnest part, bottling. You can customize your wine label and they print it for you to put on the bottles.   You can bring your own snacks and get a bottle to enjoy.   I would highly recommend everyone to try making a batch of wine at water to wine. They make great Xmas gifts too.

reviews.author: Neshia R.
reviews.description: Let's start with how cute this place is! I walked in and felt like I had been invited into someone's home the staff was extremely friendly and knowledgeable im from out of town and im so glad I made the stop here  before heading home! Ambience is nice 3 free wine tasting and the bottle prices are extremely reasonable and you can make your own wine. If you're looking for a place with a good vibe where everyone feels like family this is the place will return every time im in Austin!!

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine is best described (at least as they themselves put it) as 'Build-a-Bear for Adults'!    I visited this establishment thinking it was a simple wine tasting spot.  Actually, they also provide services as your own personal vintner and label maker, where you can taste, create, and label your own wine!  While I have yet to try this full service out, the staff was very friendly, the wine (tried the whites only) was excellent, and you can palpably feel how fun the process is.  Definitely coming back to celebrate good times with a custom-made wine!

reviews.author: Joy W.
reviews.description: Ok, but why is this place SO cute?!  I went here for a wine tasting years ago with a girlfriend and as a fun catch up, we decided to meet back here.  What a fun tradition we want to continue!  The staff here is outstanding, they have great thought, and make you feel comfortable.  We had some neighbors at a different table order food in and  thought that was hilariously brilliant!  You are definitely recommended to buy a bottle as all winery's usually do, but this spot doesn't make you feel pushed to - which makes me want to buy another bottle.  I love that this is tucked away in the city and you don't have to go to the city limits to do a wine tasting.  I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this to any and all of you!

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine is perfect for so many occasions... date night, girls night, happy hour, a pop-in for a glass of wine, or a night of wine making/bottling with friends. We were sad when the Round Rock location closed down, but found this place to be a million times better. The decor is cute and thematic, with tons of inviting spots for seating, whether you're looking for a romantic spot for two, or some couches for a larger gathering. The best part is the staff - super friendly and helpful while we try to make the tough decision of what to drink or take home. The free samples help too!   Making our own batch of wine is a yearly tradition for us. We get together with friends to start the wine (which of course involves a good time trying the different wines first), design our own labels (or get help from W2W), throw a gathering to bottle the wine, then have bottles to hand out as wedding favors, Christmas gifts, or generic gifts.   We are club members, so we stop by at least monthly for a couple glasses of wine and to pick up our bottles to enjoy at home. Whether you're joining wine club, making a batch, or just stopping in for a glass or two, Water 2 Wine is a fantastic neighborhood gem. I only wish they were in my neighborhood!

reviews.author: Alexandra M.
reviews.description: Came here with friends who decided they wanted a wine baby and we tagged along to help them taste wines. It is a very laid-back tasting room. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Prices are reasonable and tasting is free. You can even make your own wine, which is exactly what we tagged along to do and that gets you 28-30 bottles. Highly recommend this place - Cheri and Jenny are so knowledgeable and make the whole process so easy and fun!  Only downside, no Texas wines... but this isn't necessarily a con -  all their wines are made on-site with grapes from various vineyards.

reviews.author: Chris S.
reviews.description: The wine they make is so tasty. They let you have three samples so that you can find the wine you would enjoy.  When I come here I always take home a bottle.  The staff is veery knowledgeable and friendly.  They also do custom labels if you buy I case I believe.

reviews.author: Maria G.
reviews.description: What a lovely place to sip some wine and worth doing the wine club membership if you like wine in the slightest even.  The staff are awesome. They make excellent suggestions whether you know what you're looking for or not. They can get you going in the right direction.  Sulfite free wine? Is my understanding. I don't know a lot about wine, but know that's a good thing to be free of. I can say the ports and fruity wines are a good dessert. My family and friends love the other wines.

reviews.author: Natasha C.
reviews.description: I just love this place !! They are so friendly and even if you are new they treat you like family. The wine is good and the cheese platter is huge ! One of my absolute favorite places I've discovered since moving to Austin !

reviews.author: Taylor T.
reviews.description: Went in not knowing what to expect from the store front but was pleasantly surprised. Personable and knowledgeable stuff and many wines to try! Your first 3 wine tastings are free and then a dollar per tasting after that. Additionally you can make you own wine which is a unique experience!

reviews.author: Keri B.
reviews.description: If you are a young couple, or an old couple, or an odd couple, and you decide you want a wine baby, you may be a bit worried about where, when and how to do that.  It's a big step and you should have nothing but the best for your Vino Bambino, so please look no further than Water 2 Wine, and Jenny in particular.  She is the BEST midwife for your wine labor.    We just had the best experience making, bottling and labeling our wine baby.  It was smoooooth sailing and immediately made me want another :)  When you decide to make your own wine, first, you'll get to sample the wines, ALL of them if you so wish.  I spent two afternoons sampling bunches of them and all the staff were generous and enthusiastic in helping me find which wine I wanted.  Then, you make an appt for conception.  It's fairly simple  and pleasurable.  Again, you can grab a glass of wine as you work, mixing the juice and water and yeast in a giant white bucket (Carboy), churning away for about 10 minutes and then your part is done for about 6 weeks!  The rest of the staff will ensure that your baby gestates comfortably and appropriately, testing its ph and sugars until its ready to be born.  Then the magic happens.  As the parent, you'll have full creativity in naming your baby.  In which case, you can pick any 3 images you like, decide the wording and color scheme and font of the label, email all that to Jenny and she'll print out the most perfect labels.  You can then invite a bunch of friends to witness and help in the birthing.  You can bring in all kinds of snack ems and the fine ladies at Water 2 Wine will immediately ply your guests with tastings of their wine and you can buy bottles (and bottles) to facilitate in the birthing process.  Everyone in your party can try their hand at filling bottles, corking bottles, melting the lid foils, and sticking on labels.  In the end, you'll have about 30 bottles of fantastic wine ( I recommend the Gruner!) to share and take home.    They make for fantastic house warming, business, wedding, new baby, Christmas, Hanukkah, etc gifts.  In fact, if you decide last minute you'd like to adopt a wine baby for Christmas, they keep a bunch already made and ready to label for your Christmas party or gifts.    Best thing was, our friends had so much fun and it was such a new experience for all of us that we WIN again as the hostess with the mostest.  And, even though I had grand plans of using this wine at our housewarming party, I doubt it'll last another 8-10 months so we may indeed make another baby next year.    Jenny and the rest of the staff really made this so much fun and interesting with all their cool contraptions and accomodated me with the music I wanted (got to have appropriate Edith Piaf wine birthing music!) and never left a wine glass dry in my group.    So grab your partner, in life, in business, in crime, and get to makin that baby! They're the best kind of babies, they don't puke or shit or cry and instead of causing you stress, they relieve it.  And in the end you'll have the coolest collectible bottles.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: I love this place! My husband and I come regularly, and  from the minute we walk in the door, it feels like we're visiting old friends. Jenny, Dustin and Cheri are knowledgeable, friendly and so much fun. Every visit is a good visit.

reviews.author: Stacy S.
reviews.description: Jenny was fantastic! First time here and we had a great time. Wine was amazing and the service was incredible.  Between my in laws and my husband we took a a few bottles home with us. We will be back for sure and would love a Cedar Park location!

reviews.author: Robert W.
reviews.description: Love this place! Great place to stop for a glass of wine and taste a few more after a long day of work!

reviews.author: Kate F.
reviews.description: Visited Water2Wine for my birthday this past December. LOVED IT! Cute, cute tasting room with tons of puzzles and activities, plus adorable furnishings. The menu was huge and the options would suit almost every taste. You can also print out custom labels for your bottles! TONS of fun for a big group, or an intimate outing. You can also bring your own appetizers to come sit and enjoy while tasting some delicious wines.

reviews.author: Jesse D.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine has taken your normal wine drinking experience and given it a unique spin by providing you the keys to the winery and letting you become the vintner. You make your own batch of wine, create custom labels, bottle it, and best of all, taste the fruits of your labor. By having you do this work on site they are able circumvent certain regulations resulting in less sulfites and other chemicals than store bought wines.  I have been visiting Water 2 Wine for about five years and actually created a batch with my wife and we gave the custom bottles of wine away as gifts at our wedding. The gifts were a hit.   Water 2 Wine imports their grapes and juices from other vineyards. This is not uncommon for vineyards in Texas as most don't grow enough grapes, if any, to meet their own demand. When you decide to make a batch this is where you will start. You will mix the juice, and depending on the type of wine you are making will add flavors like oak.  After you make the wine it will go in the back room for fermentation where the staff will guide the wine along over the next six to eight weeks changing containers around six times.  About two months later you will come back and bottle your wine. You add your label, fill the bottle, cork it and shrink wrap foil around the top. Like a good chef test tasting food a lot of quality assurance goes on during this process. This is a perfect event to bring along a group of friends. Hopefully you end up bottling more wine than you drink.   You don't have to make wine. Water 2 Wine is also a spacious wine bar, with a large selection of wine, where you can stop in just to drink some wine. All of the wine is made on site by the employees. They don't sell food but you are welcome to bring in food to eat with your wine. There are plenty of tasting options or you can buy by the glass or bottle. The staff is very friendly and have been one of my favorite aspects of every visit.

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: Very friendly, exuberant staff.....check. Interesting concept (make your own wine!) and fun factor....sure, check. Free wine tasting (5 tastes offered).....check. Their "ready made" wines.....uh well, let's just say I do not believe you can make decent wine out of water; and from the wines I sampled it seems that's just what they are trying to do.

reviews.author: Linda M.
reviews.description: Attended a fun wine pairing class (groupon deal) -- a great time and highly recommended! I have an alcohol allergy (it's an Asian thing! ;-), so it's awesome to learn about and try some low sulfite wines. I'm not really a fan of wine (or alcoholic beverages in general) for obvious reasons, but if I were, I'd buy it all here! Enjoy!

reviews.author: Carie H.
reviews.description: The team at W2W knows their stuff. I'm only disappointed I didn't visit here earlier in life. The crew is helpful, knowledgeable and always friendly.   Whether it's a glass of vino after work, a place to gather on weekends with friends or a fun place to work remote during the week W2W has it all.   I always thought you could only make wine here and was surprised to learn it's also a wine bar and retail destination.   Stop by and challenge the team to find you the perfect glass- they won't disappoint.

reviews.author: Lauren E.
reviews.description: Clint was the best driver we could have asked for! He went out of his way to make sure everyone was having a good time throughout the entire night! The bus was fun, clean and stocked with waters, ice and cups. 10/10

reviews.author: William O.
reviews.description: Complete waste of money. To start they were over a half hour late. Then when they finally arrived the bus was dirty, falling apart and no A/C so it felt like we were in a sauna the whole time. Go somewhere else... anywhere else.

reviews.author: Whitney D.
reviews.description: Definitely recommend Austin Party Bus if you're looking for a party bus in Austin! Our group rented the 18 passenger bus for 13 people so we'd have a little extra space. Bus was on time and communication before hand was clear. Bus was clean and they had water and ice available when we got on.

reviews.author: James D.
reviews.description: We rented from these guys for a Bachelor Party and they were absolutely wonderful. It was a last-minute decision to book a bus so we ended up having two drivers, because they had to scheduled something at the last minute, and both were entirely friendly, professional and helpful. We wanted to find a bar with a mechanical bull and they helped us track one down. There communication was perfect, it was always easy to reach them and they were super flexible at the end of the night, allowing us to extend our trip for as many hours as we wanted for an hourly rate. In the end we only stayed out another hour, and they gave us the extra hour for free. Also, because it was a late booking, they offered us their 25 person bus for the 20 person bus rate.  The sound system was enough to give everyone permanent hearing loss and the dancing pole and hand holds proved to be incredibly robust and secure!  These guys are AWESOME, and I would DEFINITELY book from them again in a heartbeat.

reviews.author: Candyce W.
reviews.description: I booked this company for a surprise birthday celebration and I am so happy I did! Diana helped coordinate the stops and was patient in answering all my questions regarding planning. Kathy, the driver, was so sweet, great with communication, and being on time picking us up and dropping us off. The bus was super nice and everyone had a blast! I would recommend this company to anyone!

reviews.author: Philiph S.
reviews.description: My gf booked this bus for my birthday and we had an amazing time. The bus had great amenities and the driver was awesome! The kicker subwoofer and sound system was incredible. We had a blast and will definitely use this company again!!

reviews.author: Taylor T.
reviews.description: THESE GUYS ARE AWESOME! The bus arrived 15 minutes early and Peter answered all my questions every time I called. My bus driver was great and kept in touch with me through out the night. And, the bus was great! Good stereo system, cool lighting, and lots of ice and cups and all that good stuff. I will definitely be using these guys again for my next big event! They made my 22nd birthday a huge success (they did all of this on Halloween night!).

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: Do not book with this Bus Company. They are a scam. We booked a bus and they never showed up. They have terrible communication for THEIR mistakes! Very disappointing and terrible service. Christopher is extremely rude and unprofessional. Do not waste your money or your time. If I could give them 0 stars I would.

reviews.author: Gillian G.
reviews.description: This company WILL rip you off. Terrible costumer service and refuses to give refunds for a bus that never showed up. DO NOT USE THIS SERVICE. I would give 0 stars if I could. Just horrible.

reviews.author: Brooke D.
reviews.description: SO MUCH FUN! Our group requested a bus for a river float birthday party! Our driver was extremely nice and funny. He actually gave us his cell number to call at anytime for pickup. We were able to dance and play music as loud as we wanted! The cooler was filled with tons of water and ice. They had Vegas style lights and a dance pole. It was so much fun that I will be booking for my bachelorette party!

reviews.author: randy e.
reviews.description: Terrible communications.  I sent in a request for more info but they never contacted me.  I replied to the email requesting a Yelp review with me telling me them that they never responded to my inquiry and that they didn't want me to post a review.  Now I've received two more requests to review them, so here's their review.

reviews.author: Annessa A.
reviews.description: We took a party bus this weekend to San Marcos for a river float and I am just blown away by how great this company was! Our driver was so accommodating and great. The bus itself was roomy and nice. They also provided ice, cups and water for the bus ride. Overall - everyone in my party was extremely pleased with our trip and experience with Austin Party Bus. We will definitely be using this company again next time we are in Austin! Thanks for making our Labor Day weekend an unforgettable one!

reviews.author: Vanessa M.
reviews.description: DO NOT hire this bus company. They will rip you off. Christopher needs to learn how to run a business and he needs to learn about customer service. He took our money and left us stranded because he never showed up to pick us up. Completely unprofessional and rude!

reviews.author: Sally M.
reviews.description: I called this business to inquire about a party bus rental. When I started to ask general questions, the man on the phone (unfortunately I did not get his name), kept telling me to refer to the website. When i asked him if he could please tell me his thoughts on how long the bus was needed for, etc over the phone because it was easier for me to do as I could not look at my phone at the time, he very rudely said "I just don't understand why you can't just look this up on our website."   I do not think it is too much to ask to provide basic information over the phone, and the snarky, rude comment was completely uncalled for and one of the more unprofessional customer service experiences I have had. Needless to say, I will not be using Austin Party Bus for my transportation.

reviews.author: Tara D.
reviews.description: Booked a limo bus to take 23 people to float the Guadalupe River in New Braunfels, six hours round trip.    Bus: The rate was so much better than every other place I found that I worried the bus would be shabby.  Not so.  Bench-style limo seating, hardwood floors, good sound system, and a pole for dancing.  My birthday guests were all impressed.   Service: Our driver Mike quickly answered every question I had in the weeks leading up to the event (and I had a lot).  He gave us an excellent rate, arrived on time, and was very polite and accommodating.  We were a loud, rowdy birthday crew, but he never seemed to mind.  The first toob place we visited was sold out, so he called another and even got us a group rate!    Overall: Very happy, no complaints.  I plan a few different party buses every year, and I will be using Sixth Street Rides from now on.

reviews.author: dana p.
reviews.description: My last memory of this bus involved a loud rendition of Wilson Phillips "Hold On" while grow-ups swung around the "dance pole." Indeed, this party bus was an excellent party on wheels.

reviews.author: Ari E.
reviews.description: I haven't even used the bus yet, but I've already had an excellent experience in customer service. Mike was incredibly accommodating for me and my group! I'll update my review in a few days once we actually use the bus, but I can definitely speak on the customer service being on point.

reviews.author: Sara W.
reviews.description: We purchased a MooLaLa deal for a 5hr wine tour from Sixth Street Rides for up to 15 people.  The deal was supposed to end before we were able to get the group together but Sixth Street Rides was very accommodating on extending our deal to March (2 months after the deal was supposed to expire).  Mike handled our requests including moving the date and giving us suggestions on where to go with complete respect and professionalism.  I received a confirmation the day before as well as our driver, Chris,  called us 20 mins before our pick up time.  We had a couple hiccups (including running late - as 15 girls tend to do - as well as running late at our last winery stop) but Chris handled it with the utmost patience and ease.    Honestly I couldn't have asked for a better company to use for our wine tour.  I highly recommend Chris and Matt over at Sixth Street Rides.

reviews.author: Rachel R.
reviews.description: "I had such an amazing 21st birthday party with Austin Party Bus. It's almost a year later and my friends still talk about how much fun they had. They all want party busses for their birthdays/graduation parties. My only complaint was the A/C did not work from the get go of the ride, my birthday was in May so it was pretty hot on that 22 person bus, but no one had a stroke so it was still a good time. Just make sure you get a bus with an A/C. Other than that, no complaints about this company. Driver was on time (11:00), and took us wherever we wanted to go. We had the bus for 4 hours which was more than enough time. Spent an hour or so on the bus, got dropped off down town for 2 hours, then rode it for the last hour and dropped people off back in west campus. It was perfect!"

reviews.author: Zachary P.
reviews.description: The driver was punctual and very accommodating.  This is the first time I have ever rented a party bus but when I need one again, Austin Party Bus will be the first place I look.

reviews.author: Lisa N.
reviews.description: DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!!! We had a group of 11 people going to the wineries in Dripping Springs and Johnson City. Driver was rude from the start and then left us at the winery. Just left us stranded!!! There were no Ubers or Taxis so we had to call friends to come pick us up.  Police came and we filed a report. Stay far away from this limo service as they may leave you stranded too!!

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: Express Limo bailed me out on my mid-pandemic wedding.  I needed a last second bus to take groomsmen from Airbnb to venue in Dripping Springs.  They responded immediately and after a few texts and a call, driver was sitting at our door in an awesome party bus.   Really great experience.

reviews.author: Blair N.
reviews.description: Would give 0/5 stars if I could. The guy was rude from the second he picked us up when we asked him to help us set up the Bluetooth. He then refused to take us home from the second winery which was an hour and a half away from where we live?? He said we were drunk even though 1. We hadn't even had 2 regular sized glasses of wine total and 2. Isn't that why you hire a driver?? So you don't drink and drive? He put his finger in my mom's face so close it was basically touching her nose. When my brother tried to calmly speak to him, the driver dramatically told him to back up because he was "dangerous" and started filming. The video he took will clearly show that no one was threatening him. The other people at the winery came up to us after and could not believe how he acted and that he just left us in the middle of no where. He also called the cops on us and then drove away laughing. What if one of us had a medical condition and needed to get home to take medicine? We had to call all of our friends to see if one of our friends could pick us up since there were no ubers / Lyfts. DO NOT EVER USE THIS COMPANY!!

reviews.author: Kaet S.
reviews.description: Absolutely disappointed in this company. The driver was dismissive of us from the start, we needed help setting up the Bluetooth speakers but he was clearly trying to rush us from the moment we got in the bus. At what was supposed to be the halfway point of our trip, the driver came into the winery and told the owner we were 'running late' and they needed to rush us out. This company had over booked themselves and instead of calmly talking to us to resolve the situation, they decided that abandoning a group of people - an hour and a half away from our destination - was the best course of action. The driver had also called the police after escalating the situation himself which was both unprofessional and a waste of the officers time. To add insult to injury, the driver was laughing while he drove away without us. We were lucky enough to have friends drive out and get us, but it was a terrible end to what was supposed to a fun experience. I would not recommend this company if you expect transport to be completed both to and from your destination.

reviews.author: Deanna J.
reviews.description: I was very pleased with the service.  They were prompt and confirmed pick up details along with ice needs a couple of times before service in case any changes were needed.

reviews.author: Pegah E.
reviews.description: Drivers are always courteous and on time, the cars are gorgeous and well maintained. Our driver was mike ; he had great defensive driving skills and quick reactions when needed. My friends and I would definitely choose this Express limo company again, for business or recreation. Thank you mike.

reviews.author: Keri B.
reviews.description: Two years in a row now, me and my peeps have used this company to chauffeur us around the hill country wineries.  Beautiful idea, that.  Depending on how many people you have and what kinda of car you want, they will tote you around in a shuttle bus, a limo, or even a stretch hummer.    What is sooo cool about this company, is that they are so laid back about every event you schedule with them.  They will let you bring ungodly amounts of food and booze on the bus or limo and you can get as loud and unruly as you want, as long as you don't puke in the vehicle.  Last year  got a little rowdy and alll the girls ended up pole dancing in the shuttle bus!    We always bring party trays of sammiches, cheese n crackers, and lots of easy to drink beverages, like box wine or premade mixed drinks. We have them pick us up at my house at 10 am and they bring us back at 6.  And in that time we are usually able to visit 5 wineries.  When you call to set this up, talk to Bob.  He will visit with you on the phone for a long time, finding out where you want to go and making recommendations on new places.  He is a real sweetheart.  The drivers have always been very helpful also in recommending places and in general by putting up with our drunken behavior i.e. pulling the limo into a convenience store to pee several times in route......  One more kindness they extended to me this year.  We had reserved the airport shuttle style bus again as we had 10 people on our tour and low and behold pulling up in front of my house was the stretch hummer.  I was a little nervous about a mixup but they said not to worry, the bus had a flat that morning so we just got upgraded....now that thing was pimped out!  Blue running lights inside, nice stereo system (I bring my own cd's), and glasses and cups lining the backs of the seats.  Only problem with the hummer is it is kinda difficult to get in and out of for older people or anyone with a gimpy leg.  Only 2 back doors and a steep step down.  Gotta crab walk if you are sitting near the front.  Small regrets compared to a great day of hangin with my peeps, sampling wine and enjoying our hill country.

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: Driver tried to scam us for an extra hour.  My girlfriend and I went on a Monday and got Will as a driver of a sedan.  Everything went pretty well for the trip.  Will was polite and professional and helped us pick out wineries to go to.  We went to five wineries and my girlfriend and I were a little drunk by the end.  We had booked five hours (12pm-5pm) but knew we had gone over that by 30 minutes and were fine with that.  When the driver wanted us to pay for the extra time he said "Well, you went an hour and half over but I'll put it down as an hour and fifteen".  I called him on it and said it was only thirty minutes.  He showed me his watch and for some unknown reason his watch showed 6:30pm.  My girlfriend and I both got out our cell phones and showed him that it was in fact 5:30pm.  He then backed down and charged us for thirty minutes.  At the time, I let it pass and even tipped him quite well cause his service had been good.  Later, when I was more sober, I realized that it was extremely peculiar for his watch to be an hour *ahead*.  I am pretty certain he was actively trying to scam us for an extra hour and don't appreciate someone trying to take advantage of me when I've had some to drink.

reviews.author: Kara E.
reviews.description: Booked a hummer limo for my best friend's bachelorette party--it was fantastic!   We had a white hummer limo pick us up from the home we rented in Austin to take us to four wineries. The driver was super friendly, and even gave us more time at the end of our trip to fit in one more winery.   10 of us fit comfortably in the limo. It was a great experience, I highly recommend!!!

reviews.author: dana p.
reviews.description: Found this company on Yelp. Last Sunday, I booked their party shuttle to take 9 women on wine tours for my sister's birthday. Their pricing is dramatically better than all the other companies I researched.  When they showed up, they arrived with the stretch hummer limo - free upgrade due to an issue with the shuttle radio from the party the day before.  Drive showed up almost right on time. Our driver was nice, knowledgeable and all the part-goers were very pleased.    I highly recommend you visit the wineries n a Sunday instead of a Saturday. We visited 6 wineries and had the place to ourselves at most wineries. In contrast, when I've gone on a Saturday, the wineries were overwhelmed, which meant you received no personal service and had to wait in lines - and thus you visit less wineries. Sundays and Bluebonnet Wine Tours are the way to go.

reviews.author: A G.
reviews.description: I wanted to do a wine tour for my birthday and after reading all of these awesome reviews for Bluebonnet, I decided to give Bob a call.   He recommended the 9 passenger limo and 4 of the favorite wineries- Becker, Massina Hof, 4 points and Mendelbaum   Becker was our favorite! The guys working were so fun and the place had delicious nuts, chocolate and live music. The wine was good, too ;)  Our driver, Eric, was awesome and we got upgraded to a hummer limo for free!  Don't forget to bring lots of snacks!

reviews.author: Stacey K.
reviews.description: If you are looking to reserve transportation for a wine tour, look no further!!  I reserved a party bus for last Saturday to take some girlfriends on a wine tour to celebrate my 25th birthday.  Everything was fantastic from beginning to end!  They were at least a hundred dollars cheaper than any other place I called, and I feel like we could not have gotten better service.    When I made the reservation, I estimated that we would have around 15 girls and Bob reserved the 16 passenger bus for us.  However, a few days before the event I realized that we actually had 17 people.  I called Bob (slightly panicking that he wouldn't have a solution) and was pleasantly surprised that he offered to upgrade us to a larger bus for no additional charge!  Happy birthday to me!  Our driver (Justin or Jason... I think his name was Jason) arrived 15 minutes early and was extremely patient with us the entire time.  I mean, what other guy could put up with that many screaming, dancing, drunk 20-somethings on a long car ride??  Jason was very professional but also very personable.  He even suggested a winery (Woodrose) that was not on our original tour - and I'm so glad he did!  Woodrose was very low-key and had some great live music (it was perfect for our first stop).    We ended up only going to three wineries on our tour (we were slated to go to four) but that was completely our fault - we just spent wayyyy too much time at each stop.  All in all, this was the perfect way to celebrate my birthday!

reviews.author: Lori M.
reviews.description: I decided on Bluebonnet because of the price.  It was a mistake, the bus was late, it was dirty and I wish I would have spent the money on a better company.  Next time I will ask the venues for a recommendation.  If the venue has a problem with the transportation company it's a bad sign.

reviews.author: Laura O.
reviews.description: My friend is using Bluebonnet Limo's for her wedding next Sat. so we decided to check their availability for her bachelorette party.  They were available, super nice, and prompt.  We had a hummer limo pick us up Friday night, take us to dinner, and pick us up on West 6th at 1:30AM.  We were staying about 30 minutes away, so it was great to have a ride for all of us girls.  We decided on Sat. to call them again for another night on the town and they accomodated.   A driver picked us up in a party bus and again, the drivers were top notch.  Great price and exceptional service. I highly recommend this for all your transportation needs

reviews.author: Jo S.
reviews.description: Ordered the 4 passenger hummer and a 15 passenger stretch hummer showed up!  What an awesome surprise!!  Keith was a great driver and knew exactly which Hill Country wineries to visit.  Even though we only scheduled a 1/2 day, we did not feel rushed at all.  Becker and Grape Creek were our favorites.  Can't wait to do go on our next wine tour!

reviews.author: Tara F.
reviews.description: the one star goes for the guy that helped me on the phone. he was excellent. however the driver was horrible and when i called to complain come to find out it was the owner. i dont care if you have 1-2 people or 20 in the back of your car. when you pay for something you should get respect. not being told to get out of a limo while your gathering your things. and this was after he started texting an hour before pickup time asking if we were ready. it was obvious he was not happy we paid for pick up and drop off. but bottom line is we paid. the owner of blue bonnet limo turned our new years into a nightmare. NEVER AGAIN. im now scheduling our next limo service by asking first if they are associated with blue bonnet. HORRIBLE SERVICE! small parties beware!
